data: *16:93 God knows the sincere believers among us who deserve to be redeemed. Accordingly, He guides them, while blocking out those who choose to disbelieve.

verses.96: What  you  possess  runs  out,  but  what GOD  possesses  lasts  forever.  We will  surely  reward  those  who  steadfastly  persevere;  we  will  recompense  them  for  their  righteous works.
verses.97: Anyone  who  works  righteousness, male  or  female,  while  believing,  we will  surely  grant  them  a  happy  life  in this  world,  and  we  will  surely  pay them  their  full  recompense  (on  the Day  of  Judgment)  for  their  righteous works.
verses.98: When  you  read  the  Quran,  you  shall seek  refuge  in  GOD  from  Satan  the rejected.
verses.99: He  has  no  power  over  those  who believe and trust in their Lord.
verses.100: His  power  is  limited  to  those  who choose  him  as  their  master;  those who choose him as their god.
verses.101: When  we  substitute  one  revelation in place of another, and GOD is fully aware  of  what  He  reveals,  they  say, “You  made  this  up!”  Indeed,  most of them do not know.
verses.102: Say,  “The  Holy  Spirit  has  brought  it down  from  your  Lord,  truthfully,  to assure  those  who  believe,  and  to provide  a  beacon  and  good  news  for the submitters.”
verses.103: We  are  fully  aware  that  they  say,  “A human being is teaching him!” The tongue  of  the  source  they  hint  at  is non-Arabic,  and  this  is  a  perfect Arabic tongue.
verses.104: Surely,  those  who  do  not  believe  in GOD’s  revelations,  GOD  does  not guide  them.  They  have  incurred  a painful retribution.
verses.105: The  only  ones  who  fabricate  false doctrines  are  those  who  do  not believe  in  GOD’s  revelations;  they are the real liars.
verses.106: Those  who  disbelieve  in  GOD,  after having  acquired  faith,  and  become fully  content  with  disbelief,  have  incurred  wrath  from  GOD.  The  only ones  to  be  excused  are  those  who are  forced  to  profess  disbelief,  while their hearts are full of faith.*
verses.107: This  is  because  they  have  given priority  to  this  life  over  the  Hereafter,  and  GOD  does  not  guide  such disbelieving people.
verses.108: Those  are  the  ones  whom  GOD  has sealed  their  hearts,  and  their  hearing,  and  their  eyesight.  Consequently, they remain unaware.
verses.109: Without  a  doubt,  they  will  be  the losers in the Hereafter.
verses.110: As  for  those  who  emigrate  because of  persecution,  then  continue  to strive  and  steadfastly  persevere, your  Lord,  because  of  all  this,  is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

titles.103:
The Quran Is Not Copied
From The Bible

data: *16:98 Our salvation is attained by knowing God’s message to us, the Quran, and Satan will do his utmost to keep us from being redeemed. Hence this commandment.
*16:106 God’s wisdom decrees that if someone holds a gun to your head and orders you to declare that you disbelieve in God, you may grant him his wish. What the heart harbors is what counts.

verses.111: The day will come when every soul will serve as its own advocate, and every soul will be paid fully for whatever it had done, without the least injustice.
verses.112: GOD cites the example of a community that used to be secure and prosperous, with provisions coming to it from everywhere. But then, it turned unappreciative of GOD’s blessings.  Consequently,  GOD caused them to taste the hardships of starvation and insecurity. Such is the requital for what they did.
verses.113: A messenger had gone to them from among  them,  but  they  rejected him.  Consequently,  the  retribution struck them for their transgression.
verses.114: Therefore,  you  shall  eat  from GOD’s provisions everything that is lawful and good, and be appreciative  of  GOD’s  blessings,  if  you do worship Him alone.
verses.115: He  only  prohibits  for  you  dead animals, blood, the meat of pigs,* and food which is dedicated to other than GOD. If one is forced (to eat these), without being deliberate or malicious, then GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.116: You shall not utter lies with your own tongues stating: “This is lawful, and this is unlawful,” to fabricate lies and attribute them to GOD. Surely, those who fabricate lies and attribute them to GOD will never succeed.
verses.117: They enjoy briefly, then suffer painful retribution.
verses.118: For the Jews, we prohibited what we narrated to you previously.* It was not us who wronged them; they are the ones who wronged their own souls.
verses.119: Yet, as regards those who fall in sin out of ignorance then repent thereafter and reform, your Lord, after this is done, is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.120: Abraham was indeed an exemplary vanguard in his submission to GOD, a monotheist who never worshiped idols.
verses.121: Because he was appreciative of His Lord’s blessings, He chose him and guided him in a straight path.
verses.122: We granted him happiness in this life, and in the Hereafter he will be with the righteous.
verses.123: Then  we  inspired  you  (Muhammad) to follow the religion of Abraham,* the monotheist; he never was an idol worshiper.

data: *16:115 & 16:118 The most devastating trichinosis parasite, Trichinella spiralis, (also the pork  tapeworm  Taenia  solium)  survives  in  the  meat  of  pigs,  not  the  fat.  More  than 150,000 people are infected annually in the United States. See 6:145-146, and Appendix 16.
*16:123 This informs us that all religious practices, which came to us through Abraham, were intact at the time of Muhammad (see 22:78 and Appendix 9).

page: The Bee (Al-Nahl) 16:124-128 & The Children of Israel (Banî Israel) 17:1-8

verses.124: The Sabbath was decreed only for those who ended up  disputing  it (Jews & Christians). Your Lord is the One who will judge them on the Day of Resurrection regarding their disputes.
verses.125: You shall invite to the path of your Lord  with  wisdom  and  kind  enlightenment, and debate with them in the best possible manner. Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and He knows best who are the guided ones.
verses.126: And if you punish, you shall inflict an equivalent punishment. But if you resort to patience (instead of revenge), it would be better for the patient ones.
verses.127: You  shall  resort  to  patience—and your patience is attainable only with GOD’s help. Do not grieve over them, and do not be annoyed by their schemes.
verses.128: GOD is with those who lead a righteous life, and those who are charitable.

verses.1: Most glorified is the One who summoned  His  servant  (Muhammad) during  the  night,  from  the  Sacred Masjid  (of  Mecca)  to  the  farthest place of prostration,* whose surroundings we have blessed, in order to show him some of our signs. He is the Hearer, the Seer.
verses.2: Similarly, we gave Moses the scripture, and rendered it a beacon for the Children of Israel that: “You shall not set up any idol as a Lord and Master beside Me.”
verses.3: They  are  descendants  of  those whom we carried with Noah; he was an appreciative servant.
verses.4: We  addressed  the  Children of Israel in the scripture: “You will commit gross evil on earth, twice. You are destined to fall into great heights of arrogance.
verses.5: “When the first time comes to pass, we will send against you servants of ours who possess great might, and they will invade your homes. This is a prophecy that must come to pass.
verses.6: “Afterwards, we will give you a turn over them, and will supply you with a lot of wealth and children; we will give you the upper hand.
verses.7: “If you work righteousness, you work righteousness for your own good, but if you commit evil you do so to your own detriment. Thus, when the second time comes to pass, they will defeat you and enter the masjid, just as they did the first time. They will wipe out all the gains you had accomplished.”
verses.8: Your Lord showers you with His mercy. But if you revert to transgression, we will counter with retribution.  We  have  designated Gehenna as a final abode for the disbelievers.

data: *17:1 “The Aqsa Masjid” means “the farthest place where there is prostration,” many billions of Light Years away. This verse informs us that Muhammad, the soul, was taken to the highest Heaven to be given the Quran (2:185, 44:3, 53:1-18, &. 97:1).

verses.9: This Quran guides to the best path, and  brings  good  news  to  the  believers who lead a righteous life, that they have deserved a great  recompense.
verses.10: As for those who disbelieve in the Hereafter,  we  have  prepared  for them a painful retribution.
verses.11: The human being often prays for something that may hurt him, thinking that he is praying for something good. The human being is impatient.
verses.12: We rendered the night and the day two signs. We made the night dark, and the day lighted, that you may seek  provisions  from  your  Lord therein. This also establishes for you a timing system, and the means of calculation. We thus explain everything in detail.
verses.13: We have recorded the fate of every human being; it is tied to his neck. On the Day of Resurrection we will hand him a record that is accessible.
verses.14: Read your own record. Today, you suffice as your own reckoner.
verses.15: Whoever is guided, is guided for his own good, and whoever goes astray does so to his own detriment. No sinner will bear the sins of anyone else. We never punish without first sending a messenger.
verses.16: If we are to annihilate any community, we let the leaders commit vast corruption therein. Once they deserve retribution, we annihilate it completely.
verses.17: Many a generation have we annihilated after Noah. Your Lord is most efficient in dealing with the sins of His servants; He is fully Cognizant, Seer.
verses.18: Anyone who chooses this fleeting life as his priority, we will rush to him what we decide to give him, then we commit him to Gehenna, where he suffers forever, despised and defeated.
verses.19: As for those who choose the Hereafter as their priority, and work righteousness, while believing, their efforts will be appreciated.
verses.20: For each one of them we provide; we provide those and these from your Lord’s bounties. Your Lord’s bounties are inexhaustible.
verses.21: Note how we preferred some people above others (in this life). The differences in the Hereafter are far greater and far more significant.
verses.22: You shall not set up any other god beside GOD, lest you end up despised and disgraced.
verses.23: Your  Lord  has  decreed  that  you shall not worship except Him, and your parents shall be honored. As long as one or both of them live, you shall never say to them, “Uff” (the slightest gesture of annoyance), nor shall you shout at them; you shall treat them amicably.

titles.18:
Choose Your Priorities Carefully
This Life

data: *17:13 Your life is already recorded, as if on a video tape, from birth to death. This same record will be made accessible to us upon resurrection. See 57:22 & Appendix 14.

verses.24: And  lower  for  them  the  wings  of humility,  and  kindness,  and  say, “My  Lord,  have  mercy  on  them,  for they have raised me from infancy.”
verses.25: Your  Lord  is  fully  aware  of  your innermost  thoughts.  If  you  maintain righteousness,  He  is  Forgiver  of those who repent.
verses.26: You  shall  give  the  due  alms  to  the relatives,  the  needy,  the  poor,  and the  traveling  alien,  but  do  not  be excessive, extravagant.
verses.27: The  extravagant  are  brethren  of  the devils,  and  the  devil  is  unappreciative of his Lord.
verses.28: Even  if  you  have  to  turn  away  from them,  as  you  pursue  the  mercy  of your  Lord,  you  shall  treat  them  in the nicest manner.
verses.29: You  shall  not  keep  your  hand  stingily  tied  to  your  neck,  nor  shall  you foolishly  open  it  up,  lest  you  end  up blamed and sorry.
verses.30: For  your  Lord  increases  the  provision  for  anyone  He  chooses,  and reduces  it.  He  is  fully  Cognizant  of His creatures, Seer.
verses.31: You  shall  not  kill  your  children  due to  fear  of  poverty.  We  provide  for them,  as  well  as  for  you.  Killing  them is a gross offense.
verses.32: You  shall  not  commit  adultery;  it  is a gross sin, and an evil behavior.
verses.33: You  shall  not  kill  any  person—for GOD  has  made  life  sacred—except in  the  course  of  justice.  If  one  is killed  unjustly,  then  we  give  his  heir authority  to  enforce  justice.  Thus, he  shall  not  exceed  the  limits  in avenging  the  murder,  he  will  be helped.
verses.34: You  shall  not  touch  the  orphans’ money  except  for  their  own  good, until  they  reach  maturity.  You  shall fulfill  your  covenants,  for  a  covenant is a great responsibility.
verses.35: You  shall  give  full  measure  when you  trade,  and  weigh  equitably.  This is better and more righteous.
verses.36: You  shall  not  accept  any  information,  unless  you  verify  it  for  yourself. I  have  given  you  the  hearing,  the eyesight,  and  the  brain,  and  you  are responsible for using them.
verses.37: You  shall  not  walk  proudly  on earth—you  cannot  bore  through  the earth,  nor  can  you  be  as  tall  as  the mountains.
verses.38: All  bad  behavior  is  condemned  by your Lord.
verses.39: This  is  some  of  the  wisdom  inspired to  you  by  your  Lord.  You  shall  not set  up  another  god  beside  GOD,  lest you  end  up  in  Gehenna,  blamed  and defeated.
verses.40: Has  your  Lord  given  you  boys,  while giving  Himself  the  angels  as  daughters?!  How  could  you  utter  such  a blasphemy?
verses.41: We  have  cited  in  this  Quran  (all kinds  of  examples),  that  they  may take  heed.  But  it  only  augments their aversion.
verses.42: Say,  “If  there  were  any  other  gods beside  Him,  as  they  claim,  they would  have  tried  to  overthrow  the Possessor of the throne.”
verses.43: Be  He  glorified,  He  is  much  too exalted, far above their utterances.

verses.44: Glorifying  Him  are  the  seven  universes,  the  earth,  and  everyone  in them. There is nothing that does not glorify Him, but you do not understand their glorification. He is Clement, Forgiver.
verses.45: When you read the Quran, we place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter an invisible barrier.
verses.46: We  place  shields  around  their minds,  to  prevent  them  from  understanding  it,  and  deafness  in  their ears.  And  when  you  preach  your Lord, using the Quran alone,* they run away in aversion.
verses.47: We are fully aware of what they hear, when they listen to you, and when  they  conspire  secretly—the disbelievers say, “You are following a crazy man.”
verses.48: Note how they describe you, and how this causes them to stray off the path.
verses.49: They said, “After we turn into bones and  fragments,  we  get  resurrected anew?!”
verses.50: Say, “Even if you turn into rocks or iron.
verses.51: “Even if you turn into any kind of creation  that  you  deem  impossible.” They will then say, “Who will bring us back?” Say, “The One who created you in the first place.” They will then shake their heads and say, “When  will  that  be?”  Say,  “It  may  be closer than you think.”
verses.52: The  day  He  summons  you,  you  will respond  by  praising  Him,  and  you will  then  realize  that  you  had  lasted in this life but a short while.
verses.53: Tell  My  servants  to  treat  each  other in  the  best  possible  manner,  for  the devil will always try to drive a  wedge among  them.  Surely,  the  devil  is man’s most ardent enemy.
verses.54: Your  Lord  knows  you  best.  According  to  His  knowledge,  He  may shower  you  with  mercy,  or He  may requite you. We did not send you to be their advocate.
verses.55: Your  Lord  is  the  best  knower  of everyone  in  the  heavens  and  the earth.  In  accordance  with  this knowledge,  we  preferred  some prophets  over  others.  For  example, we gave David the Psalms.
verses.56: Say,  “Implore  whatever  idols  you have  set  up  beside  Him.”  They  have no  power  to  relieve  your  afflictions, nor can they prevent them.
verses.57: Even  the  idols  that  they  implore  are seeking  the  ways  and  means  towards their  Lord.  They  pray  for  His  mercy, and  fear  His  retribution.  Surely,  the retribution of your Lord is dreadful.
verses.58: There  is  not  a  community  that  we will  not  annihilate  before  the  Day  of Resurrection,  or  inflict  severe  retribution  upon  them.  This  is  already written down in the book.

titles.57:
The Righteous Idols
Worship God Alone

data: *17:46 The Arabic word “alone” refers to God in 7:70, 39:45, 40:12 & 40:84, and 60:4. If you add these numbers, you get 361, 19x19. But if you include 17:46, which refers to the Quran, the product is not a multiple of 19. “Alone,” therefore refers to the Quran in 17:46 (Appendix 18).

verses.59: What  stopped  us  from  sending  the miracles  is  that  the  previous  generations  have  rejected  them.  For  example,  we  showed  Thamoud  the camel,  a  profound  (miracle),  but they  transgressed  against  it.  We  sent the  miracles  only  to  instill  reverence.
verses.60: We  informed  you  that  your  Lord fully  controls  the  people,  and  we rendered  the  vision  that  we  showed you  a  test  for  the  people,  and  the tree  that  is  accursed  in  the  Quran.* We  showed  them  solid  proofs  to  instill  reverence  in  them,  but  this  only augmented their defiance.
verses.61: When  we  said  to  the  angels,  “Fall prostrate  before  Adam,”  they  fell prostrate,  except  Satan.  He  said, “Shall  I  prostrate  to  one  You  created from mud?”
verses.62: He  said,  “Since  You  have  honored him  over  me,  if  You  respite  me  till the  Day  of  Resurrection,  I  will  possess  all  his  descendants,  except  a few.”
verses.63: He  said,  “Then  go;  you  and  those who follow you will end up in Hell as  your  requital;  an  equitable  requital.
verses.64: “You  may  entice  them  with  your voice,  and  mobilize  all  your  forces and  all  your  men  against  them,  and share  in  their  money  and  children, and  promise  them.  Anything  the devil  promises  is  no  more  than  an illusion.
verses.65: “As  for  My  servants,  you  have  no power  over  them.”  Your  Lord  suffices as an advocate.
verses.66: Your  Lord  is  the  One  who  causes the  ships  to  float  on  the  ocean,*  that you  may  seek  His  bounties.  He  is Most Merciful towards you.
verses.67: If  you  are  afflicted  in  the  middle  of the  sea,  you  forget  your  idols  and sincerely  implore  Him  alone.  But  as soon  as  He  saves  you  to  the  shore, you  revert.  Indeed,  the  human  being is unappreciative.
verses.68: Have  you  guaranteed  that  He  will not  cause  the  land,  on  shore,  to  swallow  you?  Or,  that  He  will  not  send upon  you  a  tempest,  then  you  find no protector?
verses.69: Have  you  guaranteed  that  He  will not  return  you  to  the  sea  another time,  then  send  upon  you  a  storm that  drowns  you  because  of  your  disbelief?  Once  this  happens,  we  will not give you another chance.
verses.70: We  have  honored  the  children  of Adam,  and  provided  them  with rides  on  land  and  in  the  sea.  We provided  for  them  good  provisions, and  we  gave  them  greater  advantages  than  many  of  our  creatures.
verses.71: The  day  will  come  when  we  summon  every  people,  together  with their  record.  As  for  those  who  are given  a  record  of  righteousness,  they will  read  their  record  and  will  not suffer the least injustice.

titles.59:
Old Kind of Miracles
Made Obsolete

data: *17:60 Muhammad’s journey to the highest heaven to receive the Quran, as stated in 17:1 and 53:1-18, is a test because the people had to believe Muhammad on faith.
*17:66 We now learn from physics and physical chemistry that water possesses unique qualities that render it perfectly suitable for serving our various needs.

verses.72: As  for  those  who  are  blind  in  this life,  they  will  be  blind  in  the  Hereafter; even a lot worse.
verses.73: They  almost  diverted  you  from  the revelations  we  have  given  you.  They wanted  you  to  fabricate  something else,  in  order  to  consider  you  a friend.
verses.74: If  it  were  not  that  we  strengthened you,  you  almost  leaned  towards them just a little bit.
verses.75: Had  you  done  that,  we  would  have doubled  the  retribution  for  you  in this  life,  and  after  death,  and  you would  have  found  no  one  to  help  you against us.
verses.76: They  almost  banished  you  from  the land  to  get  rid  of  you,  so  they  could revert as soon as you left.
verses.77: This  has  been  consistently  the  case with  all  the  messengers  that  we  sent before  you,  and  you  will  find  that our system never changes.
verses.78: You  shall  observe  the  Contact Prayer  (Salat)  when  the  sun  declines  from  its  highest  point  at  noon, as  it  moves  towards  sunset.  You shall  also  observe  (the  recitation  of) the  Quran  at  dawn.  (Reciting)  the Quran at dawn is witnessed.
verses.79: During  the  night,  you  shall  meditate for  extra  credit,  that  your  Lord  may raise you to an honorable rank.
verses.80: And  say,  “My  Lord,  admit  me  an honorable  admittance,  and  let  me depart  an  honorable  departure,  and grant  me  from  You  a  powerful  support.”
verses.81: Proclaim,  “The  truth  has  prevailed, and  falsehood  has  vanished;  falsehood will inevitably vanish.”
verses.82: We  send  down  in  the  Quran  healing and  mercy  for  the  believers.  At  the same  time,  it  only  increases  the wickedness of the transgressors.
verses.83: When  we  bless  the  human  being,  he becomes  preoccupied  and  heedless. But  when  adversity  strikes  him,  he turns despondent.
verses.84: Say,  “Everyone  works  in  accordance  with  his  belief,  and  your  Lord knows  best  which  ones  are  guided  in the right path.”
verses.85: They  ask  you  about  the  revelation. Say,  “The  revelation  comes  from  my Lord.  The  knowledge  given  to  you  is minute.”
verses.86: If we will, we can take back what we revealed  to  you,  then you  will  find  no protector against us.
verses.87: This  is  but  mercy  from  your  Lord. His  blessings  upon  you  have  been  great.
verses.88: Say,  “If  all  the  humans  and  all  the jinns  banded  together  in  order  to produce  a  Quran  like  this,  they could  never  produce  anything  like it,  no  matter  how  much  assistance they lent one another.”
verses.89: We  have  cited  for  the  people  in  this Quran  all  kinds  of  examples,  but most  people  insist  upon  disbelieving.

verses.90: They said, “We will not believe you unless you cause a spring to gush out of the ground.
verses.91: “Or unless you own a garden of date palms and grapes, with rivers running through it.
verses.92: “Or unless you cause masses from the sky, as you claimed, to fall on us. Or unless you bring GOD and the angels before our eyes.
verses.93: “Or  unless  you  own  a  luxurious mansion, or unless you climb into the sky. Even if you do climb, we will not believe unless you bring a book that we can read.”* Say, “Glory be to my Lord. Am I any more than a human messenger?”
verses.94: What  prevented  the  people  from believing when the guidance came to them, is their saying, “Did GOD send  a  human  being  as  a  messenger?”
verses.95: Say, “If the earth were inhabited by angels, we would have sent down to them from the sky an angel messenger.”
verses.96: Say, “GOD suffices as a witness between me and you. He is fully Cognizant of His worshipers, Seer.”
verses.97: Whomever GOD guides is the truly guided  one.  And  whomever  He sends astray, you will never find for them any lords and masters beside Him. We will summon them on the Day of Resurrection forcibly; blind, dumb, and deaf. Their destination is Hell;  whenever  it  cools  down,  we will increase their fire.
verses.98: Such is their just retribution, since they rejected our revelations. They said, “After we turn into bones and fragments, do we get resurrected into a new creation?”
verses.99: Could they not see that the GOD who created the heavens and the earth, is able to create the same creations?  He  has  predetermined for them an irrevocable life span? Yet, the disbelievers insist upon disbelieving.
verses.100: Proclaim,  “If  you  possessed  my Lord’s treasures of mercy, you would have withheld them, fearing that you might exhaust them. The human being is stingy.”
verses.101: We  supported  Moses  with  nine profound miracles—ask the Children of  Israel.  When  he  went  to them, Pharaoh said to him, “I think that you, Moses, are bewitched.”
verses.102: He said, “You know full well that no one can manifest these except, obviously, the Lord of the heavens and the earth. I think that you, Pharaoh, are doomed.”
verses.103: When  he  pursued  them,  as  he chased them out of the land, we drowned him, together with those who sided with him, all of them.

data: *17:93  God’s  Messenger  of  the  Covenant,  Rashad  Khalifa,  was  thus  challenged, including the challenge to bring a new book, or bring down masses from the sky. Verse 3:81 defines the duties of God’s Messenger of the Covenant. Overwhelming proof is detailed in Appendices 2 & 26.

verses.104: And  we  said  to  the  Children  of  Israel  afterwards,  “Go  live  in  this land.  When  the  final  prophecy comes  to pass, we will  summon you all in one group.”
verses.105: Truthfully,  we  sent  it  down,  and  with the  truth  it  came  down.  We  did  not send  you  except  as  a  bearer  of  good news, as well as a warner.
verses.106: A  Quran  that  we  have  released slowly,  in  order  for  you  to  read  it  to the  people  over  a  long  period,  although we sent it down all at once.
verses.107: Proclaim,  “Believe  in  it,  or  do  not believe  in  it.”  Those  who  possess knowledge  from  the  previous  scriptures,  when  it  is  recited  to  them,  they fall down to their chins, prostrating.
verses.108: They  say,  “Glory  be  to  our  Lord. This fulfills our Lord’s prophecy.”
verses.109: They  fall  down  on  their  chins,  prostrating  and  weeping.  For  it  augments their reverence.
verses.110: Say,  “Call  Him  GOD,  or  call  Him Most  Gracious;  whichever  name you  use,  to  Him  belongs  the  best names.” You  shall  not  utter  your  Contact Prayers  (Salat)  too  loudly,  nor  secretly; use a moderate tone.
verses.111: And  proclaim:  “Praise  be  to  GOD, who  has  never  begotten  a  son,  nor does  He  have  a  partner  in  His  kingship, nor does He need any ally out of  weakness,”  and  magnify  Him constantly.

verses.3: Wherein they abide forever.
verses.4: And  to  warn  those  who  said,  “GOD has begotten a son!”
verses.5: They  possess  no  knowledge  about this,  nor  did  their  parents.  What a  blasphemy  coming  out  of  their mouths!  What  they  utter  is  a  gross lie.
verses.6: You  may  blame  yourself  on  account of  their  response  to  this  narration, and  their  disbelieving  in  it;  you  may be saddened.
verses.7: We  have  adorned  everything  on earth,  in  order  to  test  them,  and  thus distinguish  those  among  them  who work righteousness.

verses.8: Inevitably,  we  will  wipe  out  everything  on  it,  leaving  it  completely  barren.*
verses.9: Why  else  do  you  think  we  are  telling you  about  the  people  of  the  cave, and  the  numbers  connected  with them?  They  are  among  our  wondrous signs.
verses.10: When  the  youths  took  refuge  in  the cave,  they  said,  “Our  Lord,  shower us  with  Your  mercy,  and  bless  our affairs with Your guidance.”
verses.11: We  then  sealed  their  ears  in  the cave  for  a  predetermined  number  of years.
verses.12: Then  we  resurrected  them  to  see which  of  the  two  parties  could  count the duration of their stay therein.
verses.13: We  narrate  to  you  their  history, truthfully.  They  were  youths  who believed  in  their  Lord,  and  we  increased their guidance.
verses.14: We  strengthened  their  hearts  when they  stood  up  and  proclaimed:  “Our only  Lord  is  the  Lord  of  the  heavens and  the  earth.  We  will  never  worship  any  other  god  beside  Him. Otherwise, we would be far astray.
verses.15: “Here  are  our  people  setting  up gods beside Him. If only they could provide  any  proof  to  support  their stand!  Who  is  more  evil  than  the  one who  fabricates  lies  and  attributes them to GOD?
verses.16: “Since  you  wish  to  avoid  them,  and their  worshiping  of  other  than GOD,* let us take refuge in the cave. May  your  Lord  shower  you  with  His mercy  and  direct  you  to  the  right decision.”
verses.17: You  could  see  the  sun  when  it  rose coming  from  the  right  side  of  their cave,  and  when  it  set,  it  shone  on them  from  the  left,  as  they  slept  in the  hollow  thereof.  This  is  one  of GOD’s  portents.*  Whomever  GOD guides  is  the  truly  guided  one,  and whomever  He  sends  astray,  you  will not find for him a guiding teacher.
verses.18: You  would  think  that  they  were awake,  when  they  were  in  fact  asleep.  We  turned  them  to  the  right side and the left side, while their dog stretched  his  arms  in  their  midst. Had you looked at them, you would have  fled  from  them,  stricken  with terror.

data: *18:8-9 As it turns out, the history of these Christian believers, the Seven Sleepers of Ephesus, is directly connected with the end of the world as stated in 18:9 & 18:21. The role of these believers in unveiling the end of the world is detailed in Appendix 25.

*18:16-20 Ephesus is located about 200 miles south of ancient Nicene, and 30 miles south of today’s Izmir in Turkey. The dwellers of the cave were young Christians who wanted to follow the teachings of Jesus, and worship God alone. They were fleeing the persecution of neo-Christians who proclaimed a corrupted Christianity three centuries after Jesus, following the Nicene Conferences, when the Trinity doctrine was announced. In  1928,  Franz  Miltner,  an  Austrian  archeologist  discovered  the  tomb  of  the  seven sleepers of Ephesus. Their history is well documented in several encyclopedias.
*18:17 This sign, or hint, tells us that the cave was facing north.

verses.19: When  we  resurrected  them,  they asked  each  other,  “How  long  have you  been  here?”  “We  have  been here  one  day  or  part  of  the  day,” they  answered.  “Your  Lord  knows best how  long  we  stayed here, so  let us send one of us with this money to the  city.  Let  him  fetch  the  cleanest food,  and  buy  some  for  us.  Let  him keep  a  low  profile,  and  attract  no attention.
verses.20: “If  they  discover  you,  they  will  stone you,  or  force  you  to  revert  to  their religion,  then  you  can  never  succeed.”
verses.21: We  caused  them  to  be  discovered, to  let  everyone  know  that  GOD’s promise  is  true,  and  to  remove  all doubt  concerning  the  end  of  the world.*  The  people  then  disputed among  themselves  regarding  them. Some  said,  “Let  us  build  a  building around  them.”  Their  Lord  is  the best  knower  about  them.  Those  who prevailed  said,  “We  will  build  a place of worship around them.”
verses.22: Some  would  say,  “They  were  three; their  dog  being  the  fourth,”  while others  would  say,  “Five;  the  sixth being  their  dog,”  as  they  guessed. Others  said,  “Seven,”  and  the  eighth was  their  dog.  Say,  “My  Lord  is  the best  knower  of  their  number.”  Only  a  few  knew  the  correct  number.  Therefore,  do  not  argue  with  them; just  go  along  with  them.  You  need  not consult anyone about this.
verses.23: You  shall  not  say  that  you  will  do anything in the future,
verses.24: without  saying,  “GOD  willing.”*  If you forget to do this, you must immediately  remember  your  Lord  and say, “May my Lord guide me to do better next time.”
verses.25: They  stayed  in  their  cave  three  hundred years, increased by nine.*
verses.26: Say,  “GOD  is  the  best  knower  of how  long  they  stayed  there.”  He knows  all  secrets  in  the  heavens  and the  earth.  By  His  grace  you  can  see; by  His  grace  you  can  hear.  There is  none  beside  Him  as  Lord  and Master,  and  He  never  permits  any partners to share in His kingship.
verses.27: You  shall  recite  what  is  revealed  to you  of  your  Lord’s  scripture.  Nothing  shall  abrogate  His  words,  and you  shall  not  find  any  other  source beside it.
verses.28: You  shall  force  yourself  to  be  with those  who  worship  their  Lord  day and  night,  seeking  Him  alone.  Do not  turn  your  eyes  away  from  them, seeking  the  vanities  of  this  world. Nor shall you obey one whose heart we  rendered  oblivious  to  our  message;  one  who  pursues  his  own desires,  and  whose  priorities  are confused.

data: *18:21 As detailed in Appendix 25, this story helped pinpoint the end of the world.
*18:24 This important commandment gives us daily opportunities to remember God.

*18:25 The difference between 300 solar years and 300 lunar years is nine years. Thus, discovering the end of the world was predetermined by the Almighty to take place in 1980 AD (1400 AH), 300 years (309 lunar years) before the end of the world (see 72:27 & Appendix 25).

verses.29: Proclaim:  “This  is  the  truth  from your  Lord,”  then  whoever  wills  let him  believe,  and  whoever  wills  let him  disbelieve.  We  have  prepared for  the  transgressors  a  fire  that  will completely  surround  them.  When they  scream  for  help,  they  will  be given  a  liquid  like  concentrated  acid that  scalds  the  faces.  What  a  miserable  drink!  What  a  miserable  destiny!
verses.30: As  for  those  who  believe  and  lead  a righteous  life,  we  never  fail  to recompense  those  who  work  righteousness.
verses.31: They  have  deserved  gardens  of Eden  wherein  rivers  flow.  They  will be  adorned  therein  with  bracelets  of gold,  and  will  wear  clothes  of  green silk  and  velvet,  and  will  rest  on  comfortable  furnishings.  What  a  wonderful  reward;  what  a  wonderful abode!
verses.32: Cite  for  them  the  example  of  two men:  we  gave  one  of  them  two  gardens  of  grapes,  surrounded  by  date palms,  and  placed  other  crops  between them.
verses.33: Both  gardens  produced  their  crops on  time,  and  generously,  for  we caused a river to run through them.
verses.34: Once,  after  harvesting,  he  boastfully  told  his  friend:  “I  am  far  more prosperous  than  you,  and  I  command  more  respect  from  the  people.”
verses.35: When  he  entered  his  garden,  he wronged  his  soul  by  saying,  “I  do  not think that this will ever end.
verses.36: “Moreover,  I  think  this  is  it;  I  do  not think  that  the  Hour  (the  Hereafter) will ever come to pass. Even if I am returned  to  my  Lord,  I  will  (be  clever enough  to)  possess  an  even  better one over there.”
verses.37: His  friend  said  to  him,  as  he  debated  with  him,  “Have  you  disbelieved  in  the  One  who  created  you from  dust,  then  from  a  tiny  drop, then perfected you into a man?
verses.38: “As  for  me,  GOD  is  my  Lord,  and  I will  never  set  up  any  other  god  besides my Lord.
verses.39: “When  you  entered  your  garden, you  should  have  said,  This  is  what GOD  has  given  me  (Mã  Shã  Allãh). No  one  possesses  power  except GOD  (Lã  Quwwata  Ellã  Bellãh).’ You  may  see  that  I  possess  less money and less children than you.
verses.40: “My  Lord  may  grant  me  better  than your  garden.  He  may  send  a  violent storm  from  the  sky  that  wipes  out your  garden,  leaving  it  completely barren.
verses.41: “Or,  its  water  may  sink  deeper,  out of your reach.”
verses.42: Indeed,  his  crops  were  wiped  out, and  he  ended  up  sorrowful,  lamenting  what  he  had  spent  on  it  in  vain, as  his  property  lay  barren.  He  finally said,  “I  wish  I  never  set  up  my property as a god beside my Lord.”

encrypted.38: لكنا هو الله ربي ولا اشرك بربي احدا
encrypted.39: ولولا اذ دخلت جنتك قلت ما شاء الله لا قوة الا بالله ان ترن انا اقل منك مالا وولدا

data: *18:32-42 The Quran cites many examples of the different gods that people worship beside  God;  they  include  children  (7:190),  religious  leaders  and  scholars  (9:31), property (18:42), dead saints and prophets (16:20-21, 35:14, & 46:5-6), and the ego (25:43, 45:23).

verses.43: No force on earth could have helped him against GOD, nor was it possible for him to receive any help.
verses.44: That is because the only true Lord and master is GOD; He provides the best recompense, and with Him is the best destiny.
verses.45: Cite for them the example of this life as water that we send down from the sky to produce plants of the earth, then they turn into hay that is blown away by the wind. GOD is able to do all things.
verses.46: Money and children are the joys of this life, but the righteous works provide  an  eternal  recompense from your Lord, and a far better hope.
verses.47: The day will come when we wipe out the mountains, and you will see the earth barren. We will summon them all, not leaving out a single one of them.
verses.48: They will be presented before your Lord in a row. You have come to us as individuals, just as we created you initially. Indeed, this is what you claimed will never happen.
verses.49: The record will be shown, and you will see the guilty fearful of its contents. They will say, “Woe to us. How come this book leaves nothing, small or large, without counting it?” They will find everything they had done brought forth. Your Lord is never unjust towards anyone.
verses.50: We said to the angels, “Fall prostrate before Adam.” They fell prostrate, except Satan. He became a jinn, for he disobeyed the order of His Lord.* Will you choose him and his descendants as lords instead of Me, even though they are your enemies? What a miserable substitute!
verses.51: I never permitted them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth,  nor  the  creation  of  themselves. Nor do I permit the wicked to work in My kingdom.*
verses.52: The day will come when He says, “Call upon My partners, whom you claimed to be gods beside Me;” they will call on them, but they will not respond to  them.  An insurmountable barrier will separate them from each other.
verses.53: The guilty will see Hell, and will realize that they will fall into it. They will have no escape therefrom.
verses.54: We have cited in this Quran every kind of example,  but  the human being  is  the  most  argumentative creature.
verses.55: Nothing prevented the people from believing, when the guidance came to them, and from seeking the forgiveness of their Lord, except that they  demanded  to  see  the  same (kind of miracles) as the previous generations,  or  challenged  to  see the retribution beforehand.

titles.54:
Disbelievers Refuse to Accept the
Completeness of the Quran

data: *18:50 When the great feud in the heavenly society took place (38:69), all creatures became classified into angels, jinns, and humans (Appendix 7).
*18:51 God knew that Satan and his supporters (jinns and humans) were going to make the wrong decision. Hence their exclusion from witnessing the creation process.

verses.56: We  only  send  the  messengers  as simply  deliverers  of  good  news,  as well  as  warners.  Those  who  disbelieve  argue  with  falsehood  to defeat  the  truth,  and  they  take  My proofs and warnings in vain.
verses.57: Who  are  more  evil  than  those  who are  reminded  of  their  Lord’s  proofs, then  disregard  them,  without  realizing  what  they  are  doing.  Consequently,  we  place  shields  on  their hearts  to  prevent  them  from  understanding  it  (the  Quran),  and  deafness  in  their  ears.  Thus,  no  matter what  you  do  to  guide  them,  they  can never ever be guided.
verses.58: Yet,  your  Lord  is  the  Forgiver,  full of  mercy.  If  He  called  them  to  account  for  their  deeds,  He  would  annihilate  them  right  there  and  then. Instead,  He  gives  them  a  respite until  a  specific,  predetermined time; then they can never escape.
verses.59: Many  a  community  we  annihilated because  of  their  transgressions,  we designated  a  specific  time  for  their annihilation.
verses.60: Moses  said  to  his  servant,  “I  will  not rest  until  I  reach  the  point  where  the two  rivers  meet,  no  matter  how  long it takes.”
verses.61: When  they  reached  the  point  where they  met,  they  forgot  their  fish,  and it  found  its  way  back  to  the  river, sneakily.
verses.62: After  they  passed  that  point,  he  said to  his  servant,  “Let  us  have  lunch. All  this  traveling  has  thoroughly  exhausted us.”
verses.63: He  said,  “Remember  when  we  sat by  the  rock  back  there?  I  paid  no attention  to  the  fish.  It  was  the  devil who  made  me  forget  it,  and  it  found its way back to the river, strangely.”
verses.64: (Moses)  said,  “That  was  the  place we  were  looking  for.”  They  traced their steps back.
verses.65: They  found  one  of  our  servants, whom  we  blessed  with  mercy,  and bestowed  upon  him  from  our  own knowledge.
verses.66: Moses  said  to  him,  “Can  I  follow you,  that  you  may  teach  me  some  of the  knowledge  and  the  guidance  bestowed upon you?”
verses.67: He  said,  “You  cannot  stand  to  be with me.
verses.68: “How  can  you  stand  that  which  you do not comprehend?”
verses.69: He  said,  “You  will  find  me,  GOD willing,  patient.  I  will  not  disobey any command you give me.”
verses.70: He  said,  “If  you  follow  me,  then  you shall  not  ask  me  about  anything,  unless I choose to tell you about it.”
verses.71: So  they  went.  When  they  boarded  a ship, he bore a hole in it. He said, “Did you bore a hole in it to drown its  people?  You  have  committed something terrible.”
verses.72: He  said,  “Did  I  not  say  that  you cannot stand to be with me?”
verses.73: He  said,  “I  am  sorry.  Do  not  punish me  for  my  forgetfulness;  do  not  be too harsh with me.”
verses.74: So  they  went.  When  they  met  a young boy, he killed him. He said, “Why  did  you  kill  such  an  innocent soul,  who  did  not  kill  another  soul? You  have  committed  something horrendous.”

titles.60: Valuable Lessons from Moses and His Teacher

verses.75: He  said,  “Did  I  not  tell  you  that  you cannot stand to be with me?”
verses.76: He  said,  “If  I  ask  you  about  anything else,  then  do  not  keep  me  with  you. You  have  seen  enough  apologies from me.”
verses.77: So  they  went.  When  they  reached  a certain  community,  they  asked  the people for  food,  but they  refused to host them. Soon, they found a wall about to collapse, and he fixed it. He said,  “You  could  have  demanded  a wage for that!”
verses.78: He  said,  “Now  we  have  to  part  company. But I will explain to you everything you could not stand.
verses.79: “As  for  the  ship,  it  belonged  to  poor fishermen,  and  I  wanted  to  render  it defective.  There  was  a  king  coming after  them,  who  was  confiscating every ship, forcibly.
verses.80: “As  for  the  boy,  his  parents  were good  believers,  and  we  saw  that  he was  going  to  burden  them  with  his transgression and disbelief.*
verses.81: “We  willed  that  your  Lord  substitute  in  his  place  another  son;  one who  is  better  in  righteousness  and kindness.
verses.82: “As  for  the  wall,  it  belonged  to  two orphan  boys  in  the  city.  Under  it, there  was  a  treasure  that  belonged to  them.  Because  their  father  was  a righteous  man,  your  Lord  wanted them  to  grow  up  and  attain  full strength,  then  extract  their  treasure. Such is mercy from your Lord. I did none of that of my own volition. This is the  explanation  of  the  things  you could not stand.”
verses.83: They  ask  you  about  Zul-Qarnain. Say,  “I  will  narrate  to  you  some  of his history.”
verses.84: We  granted  him  authority  on  earth, and  provided  him  with  all  kinds  of means.
verses.85: Then, he pursued one way.
verses.86: When  he  reached  the  far  west,  he found  the  sun  setting  in  a  vast  ocean, and  found  people  there.  We  said, “O  Zul-Qarnain,  you  can  rule  as  you wish;  either  punish,  or  be  kind  to them.”
verses.87: He  said,  “As  for  those  who  transgress,  we  will  punish  them,  then, when  they  return  to  their  Lord,  He will  commit  them  to  more  retribution.
verses.88: “As  for  those  who  believe  and  lead a  righteous  life,  they  receive  a  good reward; we will treat them kindly.”
verses.89: Then he pursued another way.
verses.90: When  he  reached  the  far  east,  he found  the  sun  rising  on  people  who had nothing to shelter them from it.
verses.91: Naturally,  we  were  fully  aware  of everything he found out.
verses.92: He then pursued another way.
verses.93: When  he  reached  the  valley  between  two  palisades,  he  found  people  whose  language  was  barely  understandable.

data: *18:80 Adolf Hitler was a cute and seemingly innocent child. Had he died as a child, many would have grieved, and many would have even questioned God’s wisdom. We learn from these profound lessons that there is a good reason behind everything.

verses.94: They  said,  “O  Zul-Qarnain,  Gog and  Magog  are  corruptors  of  the earth.  Can  we  pay  you  to  create  a barrier between us and them?”
verses.95: He  said,  “My  Lord  has  given  me great  bounties.  If  you  cooperate with  me,  I  will  build  a  dam  between you and them.
verses.96: “Bring  to  me  masses  of  iron.”  Once he  filled  the  gap  between  the  two palisades,  he  said,  “Blow.”  Once  it was red hot, he said, “Help me pour tar on top of it.”
verses.97: Thus,  they  could  not  climb  it,  nor could they bore holes in it.
verses.98: He  said,  “This  is  mercy  from  my Lord.  When  the  prophecy  of  my Lord  comes  to  pass,  He  will  cause the  dam  to  crumble.  The  prophecy of my Lord is truth.”
verses.99: At  that  time,  we  will  let  them  invade with  one  another,  then  the  horn  will be  blown,  and  we  will  summon  them all together.
verses.100: We  will  present  Hell,  on  that  day,  to the disbelievers.
verses.101: They  are  the  ones  whose  eyes  were too veiled  to  see  My  message. Nor could they hear.
verses.102: Do  those  who  disbelieve  think  that they can get away with setting up My servants  as  gods  beside  Me?  We have  prepared  for  the  disbelievers Hell as an eternal abode.
verses.103: Say,  “Shall  I  tell  you  who  the  worst losers are?
verses.104: “They  are  the  ones  whose  works  in this  life  are  totally  astray,  but  they think that they are doing good.”
verses.105: Such  are  the  ones  who  disbelieved in  the  revelations  of  their  Lord  and in  meeting  Him.  Therefore,  their works  are  in  vain;  on  the  Day  of Resurrection, they have no weight.
verses.106: Their  just  requital  is  Hell,  in  return for  their  disbelief,  and  for  mocking My revelations and My messengers.
verses.107: As  for  those  who  believe  and  lead  a righteous  life  they  have  deserved  a blissful Paradise as their abode.
verses.108: Forever  they  abide  therein;  they  will never want any other substitute.
verses.109: Say,  “If  the  ocean  were  ink  for  the words  of  my  Lord,  the  ocean  would run  out,  before  the  words  of  my Lord  run  out,  even  if  we  double  the ink supply.”
verses.110: Say,  “I  am  no  more  than  a  human like  you,  being  inspired  that  your god is  one god.  Those who hope to meet  their  Lord  shall  work  righteousness,  and  never  worship  any other god beside his Lord.”

data: *18:94-98 One of my duties as God’s Messenger of the Covenant is to state that Gog and Magog, the final sign before the end of the world, will reappear in 2270 AD (1700 AH), just 10 years before the end. Note that Gog and Magog occur in Suras 18 and 21, precisely 17 verses before the end of each sura, representing 17 lunar centuries (72:27). (See 72:27 and Appendix 25.)

verses.1: K. H. Y. ‘A. S.* (Kãf Hã Yã ‘Ayn Sãd)
verses.2: A  narration  about  your  Lord’s mercy  towards  His  servant  Zachariah.
verses.3: He called his Lord, a secret call.
verses.4: He  said,  “My  Lord,  the  bones  have turned  brittle  in  my  body,  and  my hair  is  aflame  with  gray.  As  I  implore  You,  my  Lord,  I  never  despair.
verses.5: “I  worry  about  my  dependants  after me,  and  my  wife  has  been  sterile. Grant me, from You, an heir.
verses.6: “Let  him  be  my  heir  and  the  heir  of Jacob’s  clan,  and  make  him,  my Lord, acceptable.”
verses.7: “O  Zachariah,  we  give  you  good news;  a  boy  whose  name  shall  be John  (Yahya).  We  never  created anyone like him before.”
verses.8: He  said,  “My  Lord,  will  I  have  a  son despite  my  wife’s  sterility,  and despite my old age?”
verses.9: He  said,  “Thus  said  your  Lord:  ‘It  is easy  for  Me  to  do.  I  created  you before  that,  and  you  were  nothing.’ ”
verses.10: He said, “My Lord, give me a sign.” He  said,  “Your  sign  is  that  you  will not  speak  to  the  people  for  three consecutive nights.”
verses.11: He  came  out  to  his  family,  from  the sanctuary,  and  signaled  to  them: “Meditate (on God) day and night.”
verses.12: “O  John,  you  shall  uphold  the  scripture,  strongly.”  We  endowed  him with wisdom, even in his youth.
verses.13: And  (we  endowed  him  with)  kindness  from  us  and  purity,  for  he  was righteous.
verses.14: He  honored  his  parents,  and  was never a disobedient tyrant.
verses.15: Peace  be  upon  him  the  day  he  was born,  the  day  he  dies,  and  the  day  he is resurrected back to life.
verses.16: Mention  in  the  scripture  Mary.  She isolated  herself  from  her  family,  into an eastern location.
verses.17: While  a  barrier  separated  her  from them,  we  sent  to  her  our  Spirit.  He went  to  her  in  the  form  of  a  human being.
verses.18: She  said,  “I  seek  refuge  in  the  Most Gracious,  that  you  may  be  righteous.”
verses.19: He  said,  “I  am  the  messenger  of your Lord, to grant you a pure son.”
verses.20: She  said,  “How  can  I  have  a  son, when  no  man  has  touched  me;  I  have never been unchaste.”
verses.21: He  said,  “Thus  said  your  Lord,  ‘It  is easy  for  Me.  We  will  render  him  a sign  for  the  people,  and  mercy  from us. This is a predestined matter.’ ”

data: *19:1 This is the maximum number of Quranic Initials, because this sura deals with such crucial matters as the miraculous birth of John and the virgin birth of Jesus, and strongly condemns the gross blasphemy that considers Jesus to be a son of God. The five initials provide a powerful physical evidence to support these issues (See Appendices 1 & 22).

verses.22: When  she  bore  him,  she  isolated herself to a faraway place.
verses.23: The  birth  process  came  to  her  by  the trunk  of  a  palm  tree.  She  said,  “(I am so ashamed;) I wish I were dead before  this  happened,  and  completely forgotten.”
verses.24: (The  infant)  called  her  from  beneath  her,  saying,  “Do  not  grieve. Your  Lord  has  provided  you  with  a stream.
verses.25: “If  you  shake  the  trunk  of  this  palm tree, it will drop ripe dates for you.*
verses.26: “Eat  and  drink,  and  be  happy. When  you  see  anyone,  say,  ‘I  have made  a  vow  of  silence;  I  am  not talking today to anyone.’ ”
verses.27: She  came  to  her  family,  carrying him.  They  said,  “O  Mary,  you  have committed  something  that  is  totally unexpected.
verses.28: “O  descendant  of  Aaron,  your  father  was  not  a  bad  man,  nor  was your mother unchaste.”
verses.29: She  pointed  to  him.  They  said, “How can we talk with an infant in the crib?”
verses.30: (The  infant  spoke  and)  said,  “I  am  a servant  of  GOD.  He  has  given  me the  scripture,  and  has  appointed  me a prophet.
verses.31: “He  made  me  blessed  wherever  I go,  and  enjoined  me  to  observe the  Contact  Prayers  (Salat)  and  the obligatory  charity  (Zakat)  for  as long as I live.
verses.32: “I  am  to  honor  my  mother;  He  did not make me a disobedient rebel.
verses.33: “And  peace  be  upon  me  the  day  I was  born,  the  day  I  die,  and  the  day I get resurrected.”
verses.34: That  was  Jesus,  the  son  of  Mary, and  this  is  the  truth  of  this  matter, about which they continue to doubt.
verses.35: It  does  not  befit  GOD  that  He  begets  a  son,  be  He  glorified.  To  have anything  done,  He  simply  says  to  it, “Be,” and it is.
verses.36: He  also  proclaimed,  “GOD  is  my Lord  and  your  Lord;  you  shall  worship  Him  alone.  This  is  the  right path.”*
verses.37: The  various  parties  disputed  among themselves  (regarding  the  identity  of Jesus).  Therefore,  woe  to  those  who disbelieve  from  the  sight  of  a  terrible day.
verses.38: Wait  till  you  hear  them  and  see them  when  they  come  to  face  us. The  transgressors  on  that  day  will  be totally lost.
verses.39: Warn  them  about  the  day  of  remorse,  when  judgment  will  be  issued.  They  are  totally  oblivious;  they do not believe.
verses.40: We  are  the  ones  who  inherit  the earth  and  everyone  on  it;  to  us everyone will be returned.
verses.41: Mention  in  the  scripture  Abraham; he was a saint, a prophet.

data: *19:25 Thus, Jesus was born in late September or early October. This is when dates ripen in the Middle East to the point of falling off the tree.
*19:36 This is similar to the statement attributed to Jesus in the Gospel of John 20:17.

verses.42: He  said  to  his  father,  “O  my  father, why  do  you  worship  what  can  neither  hear,  nor  see,  nor  help  you  in any way?
verses.43: “O  my  father,  I  have  received  certain  knowledge  that  you  did  not receive.  Follow  me,  and  I  will  guide you in a straight path.
verses.44: “O  my  father,  do  not  worship  the devil.  The  devil  has  rebelled  against the Most Gracious.
verses.45: “O  my  father,  I  fear  lest  you  incur retribution  from  the  Most  Gracious, then become an ally of the devil.”
verses.46: He  said,  “Have  you  forsaken  my gods,  O  Abraham?  Unless  you  stop, I will stone you. Leave me alone.”
verses.47: He said, “Peace be upon you. I will implore  my  Lord  to  forgive  you;  He has been Most Kind to me.
verses.48: “I  will  abandon  you  and  the  gods you  worship  besides  GOD.  I  will worship  only  my  Lord.  By  imploring my Lord alone, I cannot go wrong.”
verses.49: Because  he  abandoned  them  and the  gods  they  worshiped  beside GOD,  we  granted  him  Isaac  and Jacob,  and  we  made  each  of  them  a prophet.
verses.50: We  showered  them  with  our  mercy, and  we  granted  them  an  honorable position in history.
verses.51: Mention  in  the  scripture  Moses.  He was  devoted,  and  he  was  a  messenger prophet.
verses.52: We  called  him  from  the  right  side  of Mount  Sinai.  We  brought  him  close, to confer with him.
verses.53: And  we  granted  him,  out  of  our mercy,  his  brother  Aaron  as  a prophet.
verses.54: And  mention  in  the  scripture  Ismail.  He  was  truthful  when  he  made a  promise,  and  he  was  a  messenger prophet.
verses.55: He  used  to  enjoin  his  family  to  observe  the  Contact  Prayers  (Salat) and  the  obligatory  charity  (Zakat); he was acceptable to his Lord.
verses.56: And  mention  in  the  scripture  Idrîs He was a saint, a prophet.
verses.57: We  raised  him  to  an  honorable rank.
verses.58: These  are  some  of  the  prophets whom  GOD  blessed.  They  were chosen  from  among  the  descendants  of  Adam,  and  the  descendants of  those  whom  we  carried  with  Noah,  and  the  descendants  of  Abraham  and  Israel,  and  from  among those  whom  we  guided  and  selected.  When  the  revelations  of  the Most  Gracious  are  recited  to  them, they fall prostrate, weeping.
verses.59: After  them,  He  substituted  generations  who  lost  the  Contact  Prayers (Salat),  and  pursued  their  lusts. They will suffer the consequences.
verses.60: Only  those  who  repent,  believe,  and lead  a  righteous  life  will  enter Paradise, without the least injustice.
verses.61: The  gardens  of  Eden  await  them,  as promised  by  the  Most  Gracious  for those  who  worship  Him,  even  in  privacy.  Certainly,  His  promise  must come to pass.

verses.62: They  will  not  hear  any  nonsense therein;  only  peace.  They  receive their  provisions  therein,  day  and night.
verses.63: Such  is  Paradise;  we  grant  it  to  those among  our  servants  who  are  righteous.
verses.64: We  do  not  come  down  except  by  the command  of  your  Lord.  To  Him belongs  our  past,  our  future,  and everything  between  them.  Your Lord is never forgetful.
verses.65: The  Lord  of  the  heavens  and  the earth,  and  everything  between them;  you  shall  worship  Him  and steadfastly  persevere  in  worshiping Him.  Do  you  know  of  anyone  who equals Him?
verses.66: The  human  being  asks,  “After  I  die, do I come back to life?”
verses.67: Did  the  human  being  forget  that  we created  him  already,  and  he  was nothing?
verses.68: By  your  Lord,  we  will  certainly  summon  them,  together  with  the  devils, and  will  gather  them  around  Hell, humiliated.
verses.69: Then  we  will  pick  out  from  each group  the  most  ardent  opponent  of the Most Gracious.
verses.70: We  know  full  well  those  who  are most deserving of burning therein.
verses.71: Every  single  one  of  you  must  see  it; this  is  an  irrevocable  decision  of your Lord.
verses.72: Then  we  rescue  the  righteous,  and leave  the  transgressors  in  it,  humiliated.
verses.73: When  our  revelations  are  recited  to them,  clearly,  those  who  disbelieve say  to  those  who  believe,  “Which  of us  is  more  prosperous?  Which  of  us is in the majority?”
verses.74: Many  a  generation  have  we  annihilated  before  them;  they  were  more powerful, and more prosperous.
verses.75: Say,  “Those  who  choose  to  go astray,  the  Most  Gracious  will  lead them  on,  until  they  see  what  is promised  for  them—either  the  retribution  or  the  Hour.  That  is  when they find out who really is worse off, and weaker in power.”
verses.76: GOD  augments  the  guidance  of those  who  choose  to  be  guided.  For the  good  deeds  are  eternally  rewarded  by  your  Lord,  and  bring  far better returns.
verses.77: Have  you  noted  the  one  who  rejected  our  revelations  then  said,  “I  will be given wealth and children”?!
verses.78: Has  he  seen  the  future?  Has  he taken  such  a  pledge  from  the  Most Gracious?
verses.79: Indeed,  we  will  record  what  he  utters,  then  commit  him  to  ever-increasing retribution.
verses.80: Then  we  inherit  everything  he  possessed,  and  he  comes  back  to  us  all alone.

data: *19:71 As detailed in Appendix 11, we will be resurrected prior to God’s physical arrival to our universe. That will be a temporary taste of Hell, since the absence of God is Hell. When God comes (89:22), the righteous will be rescued. See 19:72.

verses.81: They  worship  beside  GOD  other gods that may be of help to them.
verses.82: On  the  contrary;  they  will  reject their idolatry, and will be their enemies.
verses.83: Do you not see how we unleash the devils upon the disbelievers to stir them up?
verses.84: Do not be impatient; we are preparing for them some preparation.
verses.85: The day will come when we summon the righteous before the Most Gracious in a group.
verses.86: And we will herd the guilty to Hell, to be their eternal abode.
verses.87: No one will possess the power to intercede, except those who conform to the laws of the Most Gracious.
verses.88: They said, “The Most Gracious has begotten a son!”
verses.89: You have uttered a gross blasphemy.
verses.90: The heavens are about to shatter, the earth is about to tear asunder, and  the  mountains  are  about  to crumble.
verses.91: Because they claim that the Most Gracious has begotten a son.
verses.92: It is not befitting the Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
verses.93: Every single one in the heavens and the earth is a servant of the Most Gracious.
verses.94: He has encompassed them, and has counted them one by one.
verses.95: All of them will come before Him on the Day of Resurrection as individuals.
verses.96: Surely, those who believe and lead a righteous life, the Most Gracious will shower them with love.
verses.97: We  thus  made  this (Quran) elucidated in your tongue, in order to deliver good news to the righteous, and to warn with it the opponents.
verses.98: Many a generation before them we annihilated; can you perceive any of them, or hear from them any sound?

data: *20:1 The role of these Quranic initials as components of the Quran’s awesome mathematical miracle is given in detail in Appendix 1.

verses.8: GOD:  there  is  no  other  god  besides Him.  To  Him  belong  the  most beautiful names.
verses.9: Have  you  noted  the  history  of  Moses?
verses.10: When  he  saw  a  fire,  he  said  to  his family,  “Stay  here.  I  have  seen  a  fire. Maybe I can bring you some of it, or find some guidance at the fire.”
verses.11: When  he  came  to  it,  he  was  called, “O, Moses.
verses.12: “I  am  your  Lord;  remove  your  sandals.  You  are  in  the  sacred  valley, Tuwã.
verses.13: “I  have  chosen  you,  so  listen  to  what is being revealed.
verses.14: “I  am  GOD;  there  is  no  other  god beside  Me.  You  shall  worship  Me alone,  and  observe  the  Contact Prayers (Salat) to remember Me.
verses.15: “The  Hour  (end  of  the  world)  is surely  coming;  I  will  keep  it  almost hidden.  For  each  soul  must  be  paid for its works.
verses.16: “Do  not  be  diverted  therefrom  by those  who  do  not  believe  in  it— those  who  pursue  their  own  opinions—lest you fall.
verses.17: “What  is  this  in  your  right  hand, Moses?”
verses.18: He said, “This is my staff. I lean on it, herd my sheep with it, and I use it for other purposes.”
verses.19: He said, “Throw it down, Moses.”
verses.20: He  threw  it  down,  whereupon  it turned into a moving serpent.
verses.21: He  said,  “Pick  it  up;  do  not  be afraid.  We  will  return  it  to  its  original state.
verses.22: “And  hold  your  hand  under  your wing;  it  will  come  out  white  without a blemish; another proof.
verses.23: “We  thus  show  you  some  of  our great portents.
verses.24: “Go  to  Pharaoh,  for  he  has  transgressed.”
verses.25: He said, “My Lord, cool my temper.
verses.26: “And make this matter easy for me.
verses.27: “And untie a knot from my tongue.
verses.28: “So they can understand my speech.
verses.29: “And  appoint  an  assistant  for  me from my family.
verses.30: “My brother Aaron.
verses.31: “Strengthen me with him.
verses.32: “Let  him  be  my  partner  in  this  matter.
verses.33: “That we may glorify You frequently.
verses.34: “And commemorate You frequently.
verses.35: “You are Seer of us.”
verses.36: He  said,  “Your  request  is  granted, O Moses.
verses.37: “We have blessed you another time.
verses.38: “When  we  revealed  to  your  mother what we revealed.
verses.39: “Saying:  Throw  him  into  the  box, then  throw  him  into  the  river.  The river  will  throw  him  onto  the  shore, to be picked up by an enemy of Mine and an enemy of  his.’ I  showered  you with  love  from  Me,  and  I  had  you made before My watchful eye.

data: *20:15 The end of the world is given in the Quran, God’s final message (15:87).

verses.40: “Your  sister  walked  to  them  and said, ‘I can tell you about a nursing mother  who  can  take  good  care of him.’  We  thus  returned  you  to  your mother,  that  she  may  be  happy  and stop  worrying.  And when you  killed a  person,  we  saved  you  from  the grievous  consequences;  indeed  we tested  you  thoroughly.  You  stayed years  with  the  people  of  Midyan, and now you have come back in accordance with a precise plan.
verses.41: “I have made you just for Me.
verses.42: “Go  with  your  brother,  supported by  My  signs,  and  do  not  waver  in remembering Me.
verses.43: “Go  to  Pharaoh,  for  he  transgressed.
verses.44: “Speak  to  him  nicely;  he  may  take heed, or become reverent.”
verses.45: They  said,  “Our  Lord,  we  fear  lest he may attack us, or transgress.”
verses.46: He  said,  “Do  not  be  afraid,  for  I  will be with you, listening and watching.
verses.47: “Go  to  him  and  say,  ‘We  are  two messengers  from  your  Lord.  Let  the Children  of  Israel  go.  You  must refrain  from  persecuting  them.  We bring  a  sign  from  your  Lord,  and peace  is  the  lot  of  those  who  heed the guidance.
verses.48: “  ‘We  have  been  inspired  that  the retribution  will  inevitably  afflict those  who  disbelieve  and  turn away.’ ”
verses.49: He  said,  “Who  is  your  Lord,  O Moses.”
verses.50: He  said,  “Our  Lord  is  the  One  who granted  everything  its  existence, and its guidance.”
verses.51: He  said,  “What  about  the  past generations?”
verses.52: He  said,  “The  knowledge  thereof  is with  my  Lord  in  a  record.  My  Lord never errs, nor does He forget.”
verses.53: He  is  the  One  who  made  the  earth habitable  for  you,  and  paved  in  it roads  for  you.  And  He  sends  down from  the  sky  water  with  which  we produce  many  different  kinds  of plants.
verses.54: Eat  and  raise  your  livestock.  These are  sufficient  proofs  for  those  who possess intelligence.*
verses.55: From  it  we  created  you,  into  it  we return  you,  and  from  it  we  bring  you out once more.
verses.56: We  showed  him  all  our  proofs,  but he disbelieved and refused.
verses.57: He  said,  “Did  you  come  here  to  take us  out  of  our  land  with  your  magic, O Moses?
verses.58: “We  will  surely  show  you  similar magic.  Therefore,  set  an  appointment  that  neither  we,  nor  you  will violate; in a neutral place.”
verses.59: He  said,  “Your  appointed  time shall  be  the  day  of  festivities.  Let  us all meet in the forenoon.”

data: *20:54 Those who possess intelligence appreciate the fact that we are astronauts who were launched into space on this ‘Spaceship Earth.’ God provided us with renewable food, water, pets, wildlife, and livestock, as we embark on this temporary space odyssey. Compare  God’s  provisions  to  ‘Spaceship  Earth’  with  the  provisions  we  give  to  our astronauts (Appendix 7).

verses.60: Pharaoh  summoned  his  forces,  then came.
verses.61: Moses  said  to  them,  “Woe  to  you. Do  you  fabricate  lies  to  fight  GOD and  thus  incur  His  retribution? Such fabricators will surely fail.”
verses.62: They  disputed  among  themselves, as they conferred privately.
verses.63: They  said,  “These  two  are  no  more than  magicians  who  wish  to  take  you out  of  your  land  with  their  magic, and to destroy your ideal way of life.
verses.64: “Let  us  agree  upon  one  scheme  and face  them  as  a  united  front.  The winner  today  will  have  the  upper hand.”
verses.65: They  said,  “O  Moses,  either  you throw,  or  we  will  be  the  first  to throw.”
verses.66: He  said,  “You  throw.”  Whereupon, their  ropes  and  sticks  appeared  to him, because  of  their  magic,  as  if they were moving.
verses.67: Moses harbored some fear.
verses.68: We  said,  “Have  no  fear.  You  will prevail.
verses.69: “Throw  what  you  hold  in  your  right hand,  and  it  will  swallow  what  they fabricated.  What  they  fabricated  is no  more  than  the  scheming  of  a magician.  The  magician’s  work  will not succeed.”
verses.70: The  magicians  fell  prostrate,  saying, “We  believe  in  the  Lord  of  Aaron and Moses.”
verses.71: He  said,  “Did  you  believe  in  him without  my  permission?  He  must  be your  chief;  the  one  who  taught  you magic. I will surely sever your hands and  feet  on  alternate  sides.  I  will crucify  you  on  the  palm  trunks.  You will  find  out  which  of  us  can  inflict the  worst  retribution,  and  who  outlasts whom.”
verses.72: They  said,  “We  will  not  prefer  you over  the  clear  proofs  that  came  to us,  and  over  the  One  who  created us.  Therefore,  issue  whatever  judgment you wish to issue. You can only rule in this lowly life.
verses.73: “We  have  believed  in  our  Lord,  that He  may  forgive  us  our  sins,  and  the magic  that  you  forced  us  to  perform. GOD is far better and Everlasting.”
verses.74: Anyone  who  comes  to  his  Lord guilty  will  incur  Hell,  wherein  he never dies, nor stays alive.
verses.75: As  for  those  who  come  to  Him  as believers  who  had  led  a  righteous life, they attain the high ranks.
verses.76: The  gardens  of  Eden,  beneath which  rivers  flow,  will  be  their  abode forever.  Such  is  the  reward  for  those who purify themselves.
verses.77: We  inspired  Moses:  “Lead  My  servants  out,  and  strike  for  them  a  dry road  across  the  sea.  You  shall  not fear  that  you  may  get  caught,  nor shall you worry.”
verses.78: Pharaoh  pursued  them  with  his troops,  but  the  sea  overwhelmed them,  as  it  was  destined  to  overwhelm them.
verses.79: Thus,  Pharaoh  misled  his  people; he did not guide them.
verses.80: O  Children  of  Israel,  we  delivered you  from  your  enemy,  summoned you  to  the  right  side  of  Mount  Sinai, and  we  sent  down  to  you  manna  and quails.

verses.81: Eat  from  the  good  things  we  provided  for  you,  and  do  not  transgress, lest  you  incur  My  wrath.  Whoever incurs My wrath has fallen.
verses.82: I  am  surely  Forgiving  for  those  who repent,  believe,  lead  a  righteous  life, and steadfastly remain guided.
verses.83: “Why  did  you  rush  away  from  your people, O Moses?”
verses.84: He  said,  “They  are  close  behind  me. I  have  rushed  to  You  my  Lord,  that You may be pleased.”
verses.85: He  said,  “We  have  put  your  people to  the  test  after  you  left,  but  the Samarian misled them.”
verses.86: Moses  returned  to  his  people,  angry and  disappointed,  saying,  “O  my people,  did  your  Lord  not  promise you  a  good  promise?  Could  you  not wait?  Did  you  want  to  incur  wrath from  your  Lord?  Is  this  why  you broke your agreement with me?”
verses.87: They  said,  “We  did  not  break  our agreement  with  you  on  purpose.  But we  were  loaded  down  with  jewelry, and  decided  to  throw  our  loads  in. This  is  what  the  Samarian  suggested.”
verses.88: He  produced  for  them  a  sculpted calf,  complete  with  a  calf’s  sound.* They  said,  “This  is  your  god,  and  the god of Moses.” Thus, he forgot.
verses.89: Could  they  not  see  that  it  neither responded  to  them,  nor  possessed any  power  to  harm  them,  or  benefit them?
verses.90: And  Aaron  had  told  them,  “O  my people,  this  is  a  test  for  you.  Your only  Lord  is  the  Most  Gracious,  so follow  me,  and  obey  my  commands.”
verses.91: They  said,  “We  will  continue  to worship  it,  until  Moses  comes back.”
verses.92: (Moses)  said,  “O  Aaron,  what  is  it that  prevented  you,  when  you  saw them go astray,
verses.93: “from  following  my  orders?  Have you rebelled against me?”
verses.94: He  said,  “O  son  of  my  mother;  do not  pull  me  by  my  beard  and  my head.  I  was  afraid  that  you  might say,  ‘You  have  divided  the  Children of  Israel,  and  disobeyed  my  orders.’ ”
verses.95: He  said,  “What  is  the  matter  with you, O Samarian?”
verses.96: He  said,  “I  saw  what  they  could  not see.  I  grabbed  a  fistful  (of  dust)  from the  place  where  the  messenger stood,  and  used  it  (to  mix  into  the golden  calf).  This  is  what  my  mind inspired me to do.”*
verses.97: He  said,  “Then  go,  and,  throughout your  life,  do  not  even  come  close. You  have  an  appointed  time  (for your  final  judgment)  that  you  can never  evade.  Look  at  your  god  that you  used  to  worship;  we  will  burn  it and  throw  it  into  the  sea,  to  stay down there forever.”
verses.98: Your  only  god  is  GOD;  the  One beside  whom  there  is  no  other  god. His  knowledge  encompasses  all things.

data: *20:88 & 20:96 The Samarian went to the spot where God spoke to Moses, and grabbed a fistful  of  dust  upon  which  God’s  voice  had  echoed.  This  dust,  when  mixed  with  the molten gold caused the golden statue to acquire the sound of a calf.

verses.99: We  thus  narrate  to  you  some  news from  the  past  generations.  We  have revealed to you a message from us.
verses.100: Those  who  disregard  it  will  bear  a load  (of  sins)  on  the  Day  of  Resurrection.
verses.101: Eternally  they  abide  therein;  what  a miserable  load  on  the  Day  of  Resurrection!
verses.102: That  is  the  day  when  the  horn  is blown,  and  we  summon  the  guilty  on that day blue.
verses.103: Whispering  among  themselves,  they will  say,  “You  have  stayed  (in  the first life) no more than ten days!”
verses.104: We  are  fully  aware  of  their  utterances.  The  most  accurate  among  them will  say,  “You  stayed  no  more  than a day.”
verses.105: They  ask  you  about  the  mountains Say, “My Lord will wipe them out.
verses.106: “He  will  leave  them  like  a  barren, flat land.
verses.107: “Not  even  the  slightest  hill  will  you see therein, nor a dip.”
verses.108: On  that  day,  everyone  will  follow  the caller,  without  the  slightest  deviation.  All  sounds  will  be  hushed before  the  Most  Gracious;  you  will hear nothing but whispers.
verses.109: On  that  day,  intercession  will  be useless,  except  for  those  permitted by  the  Most  Gracious,  and  whose utterances conform to His will.
verses.110: He  knows  their  past  and  their  future,  while  none  encompasses  His knowledge.
verses.111: All  faces  will  submit  to  the  Living, the  Eternal,  and  those  who  are  burdened  by  their  transgressions  will fail.
verses.112: As  for  those  who  worked  righteousness,  while  believing,  they  will  have no fear of injustice or adversity.
verses.113: We  thus  revealed  it,  an  Arabic Quran,  and  we  cited  in  it  all  kinds  of prophecies,  that  they  may  be  saved, or it may cause them to take heed.
verses.114: Most  Exalted  is  GOD,  the  only true  King.  Do  not  rush  into  uttering the  Quran  before  it  is  revealed  to you,  and  say,  “My  Lord,  increase  my knowledge.”
verses.115: We  tested  Adam  in  the  past,  but  he forgot, and we found him indecisive.
verses.116: Recall  that  we  said  to  the  angels, “Fall  prostrate  before  Adam.”  They fell  prostrate,  except  Satan;  he  refused.
verses.117: We  then  said,  “O  Adam,  this  is  an enemy of you and your wife. Do not let  him  evict  you  from  Paradise,  lest you become miserable.
verses.118: “You  are  guaranteed  never  to  hunger therein, nor go unsheltered.
verses.119: “Nor  will  you  thirst  therein,  nor  suffer from any heat.”
verses.120: But  the  devil  whispered  to  him, saying,  “O  Adam,  let  me  show  you the  tree  of  eternity  and  unending kingship.”

data: *20:115 When Satan challenged God’s absolute authority (38:69), you and I did not make a firm stand against Satan. God is giving us a chance, on this earth, to redeem ourselves by denouncing Satan and upholding God’s absolute authority (Appendix 7).

verses.121: They  ate  from  it,  whereupon  their bodies  became  visible  to  them,  and they  tried  to  cover  themselves  with the  leaves  of  Paradise.  Adam  thus disobeyed his Lord, and fell.
verses.122: Subsequently,  his  Lord  chose  him, redeemed him, and guided him.
verses.123: He  said,  “Go  down  therefrom,  all of  you.  You  are  enemies  of  one another.  When  guidance  comes  to you  from  Me,  anyone  who  follows My  guidance  will  not  go  astray,  nor suffer any misery.
verses.124: “As  for  the  one  who  disregards  My message,  he  will  have  a  miserable life,  and  we  resurrect  him,  on  the Day of Resurrection, blind.”
verses.125: He  will  say,  “My  Lord,  why  did  you summon  me  blind,  when  I  used  to  be a seer?”
verses.126: He  will  say,  “Because  you  forgot  our revelations  when  they  came  to  you, you are now forgotten.”
verses.127: We  thus  requite  those  who  transgress  and  refuse  to  believe  in  the revelations  of  their  Lord.  The  retribution  in  the  Hereafter  is  far  worse and everlasting.
verses.128: Does  it  ever  occur  to  them  how many  previous  generations  we  have annihilated?  They  are  now  walking in  the  homes  of  those  before  them. These  are  signs  for  those  who  possess intelligence.
verses.129: If  it  were  not  for  your  Lord’s  predetermined  plan,  they  would  have been judged immediately.
verses.130: Therefore,  be  patient  in  the  face  of their  utterances,  and  praise  and  glorify  your  Lord  before  sunrise  and before  sunset.  And  during  the  night glorify  Him,  as  well  as  at  both  ends of the day, that you may be happy.
verses.131: And  do  not  covet  what  we  bestowed upon  any  other  people.  Such  are temporary  ornaments  of  this  life, whereby  we  put  them  to  the  test. What  your  Lord  provides  for  you  is far better, and everlasting.
verses.132: You  shall  enjoin  your  family  to  observe  the  contact  prayers  (Salat), and  steadfastly  persevere  in  doing so.  We do not ask you for any provisions;  we  are  the  ones  who  provide for  you.  The  ultimate  triumph  belongs to the righteous.
verses.133: They  said,  “If  he  could  only  show  us a  miracle  from  his  Lord!”  Did  they not  receive  sufficient  miracles  with the previous messages?
verses.134: Had  we  annihilated  them  before this,  they  would  have  said,  “Our Lord,  had  You  sent  a  messenger  to us,  we  would  have  followed  Your revelations,  and  would  have  avoided this shame and humiliation.”
verses.135: Say, “All of us are waiting, so wait; you will surely find out who are on the  correct  path,  and  who  are  truly guided.”

For the Disbelievers:
