verses.1: Fast  approaching  is  the  reckoning for  the  people,  but  they  are  oblivious, averse.
verses.2: When  a  proof  comes  to  them  from their  Lord,  that  is  new,  they  listen  to it heedlessly.
verses.3: Their  minds  are  heedless.  And  the transgressors  confer  secretly:  “Is  he not  just  a  human  being  like  you? Would you accept the  magic that is presented to you?”*
verses.4: He  said,  “My  Lord  knows  every thought  in  the  heaven  and  the  earth. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.”
verses.5: They  even  said,  “Hallucinations,” “He  made  it  up,”  and,  “He  is  a  poet. Let  him  show  us  a  miracle  like  those of the previous messengers.”
verses.6: We  never  annihilated  a  believing community  in  the  past.  Are  these people believers?
verses.7: We  did  not  send  before  you  except men  whom  we  inspired.  Ask  those who  know  the  scripture,  if  you  do not know.
verses.8: We  did  not  give  them  bodies  that did not eat, nor were they immortal.
verses.9: We  fulfilled  our  promise  to  them; we saved them together with whomever  we  willed,  and  annihilated  the transgressors.
verses.10: We  have  sent  down  to  you  a  scripture  containing  your  message.  Do you not understand?
verses.11: Many  a  community  we  terminated because  of  their  transgression,  and we  substituted  other  people  in  their place.
verses.12: When  our  requital  came  to  pass, they started to run.
verses.13: Do  not  run,  and  come  back  to  your luxuries  and  your  mansions,  for  you must be held accountable.
verses.14: They  said,  “Woe  to  us.  We  were really wicked.”
verses.15: This  continued  to  be  their  proclamation,  until  we  completely  wiped them out.
verses.16: We  did  not  create  the  heavens  and the  earth,  and  everything  between them just for amusement.
verses.17: If  we  needed  amusement,  we  could have  initiated  it  without  any  of  this, if that is what we wanted to do.
verses.18: Instead,  it  is  our  plan  to  support  the truth  against  falsehood,  in  order  to defeat  it.  Woe  to  you  for  the  utterances you utter.
verses.19: To  Him  belongs  everyone  in  the heavens  and  the  earth,  and  those  at Him  are  never  too  arrogant  to  worship Him, nor do they ever waver.
verses.20: They  glorify  night  and  day,  without ever tiring.

data: *21:3 Although the Bible (Malachi 3:1) and the Quran (3:81) prophesy the advent of God’s Messenger of the Covenant, when he did appear, supported by ‘one of the greatest miracles’ (74:30-35), he was met with heedlessness and opposition. The divine assertion that every ‘new’ proof is opposed has been proven by the Arabs’ opposition to the Quran’s miracle (Appendix 1 & 2).

verses.21: Have  they  found  gods  on  earth  who can create?
verses.22: If  there  were  in  them  (the  heavens and  the  earth)  other  gods  beside GOD,  there  would  have  been  chaos. Glory  be  to  GOD;  the  Lord  with absolute  authority.  He  is  high  above their claims.
verses.23: He  is  never  to  be  asked  about  anything  He  does,  while  all  others  are questioned.
verses.24: Have  they  found  other  gods  beside Him?  Say,  “Show  me  your  proof. This  is  the  message  to  my  generation,  consummating  all  previous messages.”  Indeed,  most  of  them  do not  recognize  the  truth;  this  is  why they are so hostile.
verses.25: We  did  not  send  any  messenger before  you  except  with  the  inspiration:  “There  is  no  god  except  Me; you shall worship Me alone.”
verses.26: Yet,  they  said,  “The  Most  Gracious has  begotten  a  son!”  Glory  be  to Him.  All  (messengers)  are  (His) honored servants.
verses.27: They  never  speak  on  their  own,  and they strictly follow His commands.
verses.28: He  knows  their  future  and  their past.  They  do  not  intercede,  except for those already accepted by Him, and  they  are  worried  about  their own necks.*
verses.29: If  any  of  them  claims  to  be  a  god beside  Him,  we  requite  him  with Hell; we thus requite the wicked.
verses.30: Do  the  unbelievers  not  realize  that the  heaven  and  the  earth  used  to  be one  solid  mass  that  we  exploded into  existence?  And  from  water  we made  all  living  things.  Would  they believe?
verses.31: And  we  placed  on  earth  stabilizers, lest  it  tumbles  with  them,  and  we placed  straight  roads  therein,  that they may be guided.
verses.32: And  we  rendered  the  sky  a  guarded ceiling.  Yet,  they  are  totally  oblivious to all the portents therein.
verses.33: And  He  is  the  One  who  created  the night  and  the  day,  and  the  sun  and the  moon;  each  floating  in  its  own orbit.
verses.34: We  never  decreed  immortality  for anyone  before  you;  should  you  die, are they immortal?
verses.35: Every  soul  will  taste  death,  after  we put  you  to  the  test  through  adversity and  prosperity,  then  to  us  you  ultimately return.
verses.36: When  those  who  disbelieve  see  you, they  ridicule  you:  “Is  this  the  one who  challenges  your  gods?”  Meanwhile,  they  remain  totally  heedless of  the  message  from  the  Most  Gracious.

encrypted.23: لا يسال عما يفعل وهم يسالون

data: *21:28 The myth of intercession is Satan’s most effective bait (see Appendix 8).
*21:30 The Big Bang Theory is now supported by the Creator’s infallible mathematical code (Appendix 1). Thus, it is no longer a theory; it is a law, a proven fact.

verses.37: The  human  being  is  impatient  by nature.  I  will  inevitably  show  you  My signs; do not be in such a hurry.
verses.38: They  challenge:  “Where  is  that (retribution), if you are truthful?”
verses.39: If  only  those  who  disbelieve  could envision  themselves  when  they  try  to ward  off  the  fire;  off  their  faces  and their  backs!  No  one  will  help  them then.
verses.40: Indeed,  it  will  come  to  them  suddenly,  and  they  will  be  utterly  stunned.  They  can  neither  avoid  it,  nor can they receive any respite.
verses.41: Messengers  before  you  have  been ridiculed,  and,  consequently,  those who  ridiculed  them  incurred  the retribution for their ridiculing.
verses.42: Say,  “Who  can  protect  you  from  the Most  Gracious  during  the  night  or during  the  day?”  Indeed,  they  are totally  oblivious  to  the  message  of their Lord.
verses.43: Do  they  have  gods  who  can  protect them  from  us?  They  cannot  even help  themselves.  Nor  can  they  accompany  one  another  when  they  are summoned to face us.
verses.44: We  have  provided  for  these  people and  their  ancestors,  up  until  an  old age.  Do  they  not  see  that  every  day on  earth  brings  them  closer  to  the end? Can they reverse this process?
verses.45: Say,  “I  am  warning  you  in  accordance  with  divine  inspiration.”  However,  the  deaf  cannot  hear  the  call, when they are warned.
verses.46: When  a  sample  of  your  Lord's  retribution  afflicts  them,  they  readily say, “We were indeed wicked.”
verses.47: We will establish the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection.  No  soul  will  suffer  the  least  injustice. Even  the  equivalent  of  a  mustard seed  will  be  accounted  for.  We  are the most efficient reckoners.
verses.48: We  gave  Moses  and  Aaron  the  Statute  Book,  a  beacon,  and  a  reminder for the righteous.
verses.49: The  ones  who  reverence  their  Lord, even  when  alone  in  their  privacy, and they worry about the Hour.
verses.50: This  too  is  a  blessed  reminder  that we sent down. Are you denying it?
verses.51: Before  that,  we  granted  Abraham his  guidance  and  understanding,  for we were fully aware of him.*
verses.52: He  said  to  his  father  and  his  people, “What  are  these  statues  to  which you are devoting yourselves?”
verses.53: They  said,  “We  found  our  parents worshiping them.”
verses.54: He  said,  “Indeed,  you  and  your parents have gone totally astray.”

data: *21:51  Was  Abraham  so  smart  as  to  discover  God,  or,  did  God  grant  him  the intelligence because He knew that he deserved to be saved? As it turns out, this whole world was created to redeem those among us who deserve redemption. When the angels suggested that all the rebels, humans and jinns, must be banished out of God’s kingdom, ‘I know what you do not know’ (2:30). At the same time, this world proves Satan’s incompetence as a god (Appendix 7).

verses.55: They  said,  “Are  you  telling  us  the truth, or are you playing?”
verses.56: He  said,  “Your  only  Lord  is  the Lord  of  the  heavens  and  the  earth, who  created  them.  This  is  the  testimony to which I bear witness.
verses.57: “I  swear  by  GOD,  I  have  a  plan  to deal  with  your  statues,  as  soon  as you leave.”
verses.58: He  broke  them  into  pieces,  except for  a  big  one,  that  they  may  refer  to it.
verses.59: They  said,  “Whoever  did  this  to  our gods is really a transgressor.”
verses.60: They  said,  “We  heard  a  youth threaten  them;  he  is  called  Abraham.”
verses.61: They  said,  “Bring  him  before  the eyes  of  all  the  people,  that  they  may bear witness.”
verses.62: They  said,  “Did  you  do  this  to  our gods, O Abraham?”
verses.63: He  said,  “It  is  that  big  one  who  did it. Go ask them, if they can speak.”
verses.64: They  were  taken  aback,  and  said  to themselves,  “Indeed,  you  are  the ones who have been transgressing.”
verses.65: Yet,  they  reverted  to  their  old  ideas: “You  know  full  well  that  these  can not speak.”
verses.66: He  said,  “Do  you  then  worship  beside GOD what possesses no power to benefit you or harm you?
verses.67: “You  have  incurred  shame  by  worshiping  idols  beside  GOD.  Do  you not understand?”
verses.68: They  said,  “Burn  him  and  support your  gods,  if  this  is  what  you  decide to do.”
verses.69: We  said,  “O  fire,  be  cool  and  safe for Abraham.”*
verses.70: Thus,  they  schemed  against  him, but we made them the losers.
verses.71: We  saved  him,  and  we  saved  Lot,  to the  land  that  we  blessed  for  all  the people.
verses.72: And  we  granted  him  Isaac  and Jacob  as  a  gift,  and  we  made  them both righteous.
verses.73: We  made  them  imams  who  guided in  accordance  with  our  commandments,  and  we  taught  them  how  to work  righteousness,  and  how  to  observe  the  Contact  Prayers  (Salat) and  the  obligatory  charity  (Zakat).* To  us,  they  were  devoted  worshipers.
verses.74: As  for  Lot,  we  granted  him  wisdom and  knowledge,  and  we  saved  him from  the  community  that  practiced abominations;  they  were  wicked and evil people.
verses.75: We  admitted  him  into  our  mercy, for he was righteous.
verses.76: And,  before  that,  Noah  called  and we  responded  to  him.  We  saved  him and  his  family  from  the  great  disaster.

data: *21:69 “Cool,” without “and safe” would have caused Abraham to freeze.
*21:73 When the Quran was revealed, all religious duties were already established through Abraham (2:128, 16:123, 22:78).

verses.77: We  supported  him  against  the  people  who  rejected  our  revelations. They  were  evil  people,  so  we  drowned them all.
verses.78: And  David  and  Solomon,  when  they once  ruled  with  regard  to  someone’s crop  that  was  destroyed  by  another’s  sheep,  we  witnessed  their judgment.
verses.79: We  granted  Solomon  the  correct understanding,  though  we  endowed both  of  them  with  wisdom  and knowledge.  We  committed  the mountains  to  serve  David  in  glorifying  (God),  as  well  as  the  birds.  This is what we did.
verses.80: And  we  taught  him  the  skill  of making  shields  to  protect  you  in war. Are you then thankful?
verses.81: For  Solomon,  we  committed  the wind  gusting  and  blowing  at  his  disposal.  He  could  direct  it  as  he  wished,  to  whatever  land  he  chose,  and we  blessed  such  land  for  him.  We are fully aware of all things.
verses.82: And  of  the  devils  there  were  those who  would  dive  for  him  (to  harvest the sea), or do whatever else he commanded  them  to  do.  We  committed them in his service.
verses.83: And  Job  implored  his  Lord:  “Adversity  has  befallen  me,  and,  of  all the  merciful  ones,  You  are  the  Most Merciful.”
verses.84: We  responded  to  him,  relieved  his adversity,  and  restored  his  family for him, even twice as much. That was  a  mercy  from  us,  and  a  reminder for the worshipers.
verses.85: Also,  Ismail,  Idrîs,  Zal-Kifl;  all  were steadfast, patient.
verses.86: We  admitted  them  into  our  mercy, for they were righteous.
verses.87: And  Zan-Noon  (Jonah,  “the  one with an ‘N’ in his name”), abandoned  his  mission  in  protest,  thinking  that  we  could  not  control  him. He  ended  up  imploring  from  the darkness  (of  the  big  fish’s  belly): “There  is  no  god  other  than  You.  Be You  glorified.  I  have  committed  a gross sin.”
verses.88: We  responded  to  him,  and  saved him  from  the  crisis;  we  thus  save  the believers.
verses.89: And  Zachariah  implored  his  Lord: “My  Lord,  do  not  keep  me  without an  heir,  though  You  are  the  best inheritor.”
verses.90: We*  responded  to  him  and  granted him  John;  we  fixed  his  wife  for  him. That  is  because  they  used  to  hasten to  work  righteousness,  and  implored us in situations of joy, as well as fear. To us, they were reverent.
verses.91: As  for  the  one  who  maintained  her virginity,  we  blew  into  her  from  our spirit,  and  thus,  we  made  her  and her  son  a  portent  for  the  whole world.
verses.92: Your  congregation  is  but  one  congregation,  and  I  alone  am  your Lord; you shall worship Me alone.

encrypted.78: وداوود وسليمان اذ يحكمان في الحرث اذ نفشت فيه غنم القوم وكنا لحكمهم شاهدين
encrypted.79: ففهمناها سليمان وكلا اتينا حكما وعلما وسخرنا مع داوود الجبال يسبحن والطير وكنا فاعلين
encrypted.80: وعلمناه صنعة لبوس لكم لتحصنكم من باسكم فهل انتم شاكرون
encrypted.81: ولسليمان الريح عاصفة تجري بامره الى الارض التي باركنا فيها وكنا بكل شيء عالمين

data: *21:90 The use of the plural tense throughout the Quran indicates participation of the angels. It is clear from 3:39 and from the Bible that the angels dealt with Zachariah extensively, as they gave him the good news about John. See Appendix 10.

verses.93: However,  they  divided  themselves into  disputing  religions.  All  of  them will come back to us (for judgment).
verses.94: As  for  those  who  work  righteousness,  while  believing,  their  work  will not go to waste; we are recording it.
verses.95: It  is  forbidden  for  any  community we had annihilated to return.
verses.96: Not  until  Gog  and  Magog  reappear,*  will  they  then  return—they will come from every direction.
verses.97: That  is  when  the  inevitable  prophecy  will  come  to  pass,  and  the  disbelievers  will  stare  in  horror:  “Woe to  us;  we  have  been  oblivious.  Indeed, we have been wicked.”
verses.98: You  and  the  idols  you  worship  besides GOD will be fuel  for Hell; this is your inevitable destiny.
verses.99: If  those  were  gods,  they  would  not have  ended  up  in  Hell.  All  its  inhabitants abide in it forever.
verses.100: They  will  sigh  and  groan  therein, and they will have no access to any news.
verses.101: As  for  those  who  deserved  our  magnificent  rewards,  they  will  be  protected from it.
verses.102: They will not hear its hissing. They will enjoy an abode where they can get everything they desire, forever.
verses.103: The  great  horror  will  not  worry them,  and  the  angels  will  receive them  joyfully:  “This  is  your  day,  that has been promised to you.”
verses.104: On  that  day,  we  will  fold  the  heaven, like the folding of a book. Just as we initiated  the  first  creation,  we  will repeat  it.  This  is  our  promise;  we will certainly carry it out.
verses.105: We  have  decreed  in  the  Psalms,  as well  as  in  other  scriptures,  that  the earth  shall  be  inherited  by  My  righteous worshipers.
verses.106: This  is  a  proclamation  for  people who are worshipers.
verses.107: We  have  sent  you  out  of  mercy  from us towards the whole world.
verses.108: Proclaim,  “I  have  been  given  divine inspiration  that  your  god  is  one  god. Will you then submit?”
verses.109: If  they  turn  away,  then  say,  “I  have warned  you  sufficiently,  and  I  have no idea how soon or late (the retribution) will come to you.
verses.110: “He  is  fully  aware  of  your  public utterances,  and  He  is  fully  aware  of everything you conceal.
verses.111: “For  all  that  I  know,  this  world  is  a test  for  you,  and  a  temporary  enjoyment.”
verses.112: Say,  “My  Lord,  Your  judgment  is the  absolute  justice.  Our  Lord  is  the Most Gracious; only His help is sought in the face of your claims.”

data: *21:96  By  the  year  2270  AD,  thanks  to  God’s  mathematical  miracle  in  the  Quran (Appendix 1), America will be the heart of Islam, and billions around the globe will have believed in the Quran (9:33, 41:53, 48:28, 61:9). Gog and Magog (allegorical names of villainous communities),  will  be the only bastions of heathenism,  and  they  will  attack the submitters. That is when the world will end (15:87, 18:94, Appendix 25). Gog and Magog are mentioned in 18:94 & 21:96, 21:17 verses before the end of each sura; this may indicate the time of their appearance.

verses.1: O people, you shall reverence your Lord, for the quaking of the Hour is something horrendous.
verses.2: The day you witness it, even a nursing mother will discard her infant, and a pregnant woman will abort her fetus. You will see the people staggering, as if they are intoxicated, even though they are not intoxicated. This is because, GOD’s retribution is so awesome.
verses.3: Among the people, there are those who  argue  about  GOD  without knowledge, and follow every rebellious devil.
verses.4: It is decreed that anyone who allies himself with him, he will mislead him and guide him to the agony of Hell.
verses.5: O people, if you have any doubt about  resurrection,  (remember  that) we created you from dust, and subsequently from a tiny drop, which turns into a hanging (embryo), then it becomes a fetus that is given life or deemed lifeless. We thus clarify things for you. We settle in the wombs whatever we will for a predetermined period.* We then bring you out as infants, then you reach maturity. While some of you die young, others live to the worst age, only to find out that no more knowledge can be attained beyond a certain limit. Also, you look at a land that  is  dead,  then  as  soon  as  we shower it with water, it vibrates with life and grows all kinds of beautiful plants.
verses.6: This proves that GOD is the Truth, and that He revives the dead, and that He is Omnipotent.
verses.7: And  that the Hour is  coming, no doubt about it, and that GOD resurrects those who are in the graves.
verses.8: Among the people there is the one who  argues  about  GOD  without knowledge,  and  without  guidance, and without an enlightening scripture.
verses.9: Arrogantly he strives to divert the people from the path of GOD. He thus incurs humiliation in this life, and we commit him on the Day of Resurrection to the agony of burning.
verses.10: This is what your hands have sent ahead for you. GOD is never unjust towards the people.
verses.11: Among the people there is the one who worships GOD conditionally. If things go his way, he is content. But if some adversity befalls him, he makes an about-face. Thus, he loses both this  life and the Hereafter. Such is the real loss.
verses.12: He idolizes beside GOD what possesses no power to harm him or benefit him; such is the real straying.

data: *22:5 The Quran’s mathematical miracle is based on the number 19. As it turns out, this number represents the Creator’s signature on His creations. Thus, you and I have 209 bones in our bodies (209=19x11). The length of pregnancy for a full term fetus is 266 days (19x14) (Langman’s Medical Embryology, T. W. Sadler, Page 88, 1985).

verses.13: He  idolizes  what  is  more  apt  to harm  him  than  benefit  him.  What  a miserable  lord!  What  a  miserable companion!
verses.14: GOD  admits  those  who  believe  and lead  a  righteous  life  into  gardens with  flowing  streams.  Everything  is in accordance with GOD’s will.
verses.15: If  anyone  thinks  that  GOD  cannot support  him  in  this  life  and  in  the Hereafter,  let  him  turn  completely to  (his  Creator  in)  heaven,  and  sever (his  dependence  on  anyone  else).  He will  then  see  that  this  plan  eliminates anything that bothers him.
verses.16: We  have  thus  revealed  clear  revelations  herein,  then  GOD  guides whomever He wills.
verses.17: Those  who  believe,  those  who  are Jewish,  the  converts,  the  Christians, the  Zoroastrians,  and  the  idol  worshipers,  GOD  is  the  One  who  will judge  among  them  on  the  Day  of Resurrection.  GOD  witnesses  all things.
verses.18: Do  you  not  realize  that  to  GOD prostrates  everyone  in  the  heavens and  the  earth,  and  the  sun,  and  the moon,  and  the  stars,  and  the  mountains,  and  the  trees,  and  the  animals, and  many  people?  Many  others among  the  people  are  committed  to doom. Whomever GOD shames, none will honor him. Everything is in accordance with GOD’s will.
verses.19: Here  are  two  parties  feuding  with regard  to  their  Lord.  As  for  those who  disbelieve,  they  will  have clothes  of  fire  tailored  for  them. Hellish  liquid  will  be  poured  on  top of their heads.
verses.20: It  will  cause  their  insides  to  melt,  as well as their skins.
verses.21: They will be confined in iron pots.
verses.22: Whenever  they  try  to  exit  such  misery,  they  will  be  forced  back  in: “Taste the agony of burning.”
verses.23: GOD  will  admit  those  who  believe and  lead  a  righteous  life  into  gardens  with  flowing  streams.  They  will be  adorned  therein  with  bracelets  of gold,  and  pearls,  and  their  garments therein will be silk.
verses.24: They  have  been  guided  to  the  good words;  they  have  been  guided  in  the path of the Most Praised.
verses.25: Surely,  those  who  disbelieve  and  repulse  others  from  the  path  of  GOD, and  from  the  Sacred  Masjid  that  we designated  for  all  the  people—be they  natives  or  visitors—and  seek  to pollute  it  and  corrupt  it,  we  will  afflict them with painful retribution.

data: *22:19-22 People who have insisted upon going to Hell will inevitably complain: ‘Had we known how bad this is, we would have behaved differently.’ They will be told that the horrors of Hell have been pointed out to them in the most graphic, though symbolic, terms.  It  should  be  noted  that  Heaven  and  Hell  are  almost  invariably  mentioned together in the Quran.

verses.26: We  appointed  Abraham  to  establish the Shrine: “You shall not idolize any other god beside Me, and purify My shrine for those who visit it, those who live near it, and those who bow and prostrate.
verses.27: “And proclaim that the people shall observe Hajj pilgrimage.* They will come to you walking or riding on various exhausted (means of transportation). They will come from the farthest locations.”
verses.28: They  may  seek  commercial  benefits,  and  they  shall  commemorate GOD’s name during the specified days for providing them with livestock. “Eat therefrom and feed the despondent and the poor.”
verses.29: They  shall  complete  their  obligations, fulfill their vows, and visit the ancient shrine.
verses.30: Those  who  reverence  the  rites  decreed by GOD have deserved a good reward at their Lord. All livestock is made lawful for your food, except for those  specifically prohibited  for you. You shall avoid the abomination of idol worship, and avoid bearing false witness.
verses.31: You  shall  maintain  your  devotion absolutely to GOD alone. Anyone who sets up any idol beside GOD is like one who fell from the sky, then gets  snatched  up  by  vultures,  or blown away by the wind into a deep ravine.
verses.32: Indeed,  those  who  reverence  the rites decreed by GOD demonstrate the righteousness of their hearts.
verses.33: The  (livestock)  provide  you  with many benefits for a period, before being donated to the ancient shrine.
verses.34: For  each  congregation  we  have decreed  rites  whereby  they  commemorate the name of GOD  for providing them with the livestock. Your god is one and the same god; you shall all submit to Him. Give good news to the obedient.
verses.35: They  are  the  ones  whose  hearts tremble  upon  mentioning  GOD, they  steadfastly  persevere  during adversity, they observe the Contact Prayers (Salat), and from our provisions to them, they give to charity.
verses.36: The animal offerings are among the rites decreed by GOD for your own good.* You shall mention GOD’s name on them while they are standing in line. Once they are offered for sacrifice, you shall eat therefrom and feed the poor and the needy. This is why we subdued them for you, that you may show your appreciation.
verses.37: Neither their meat, nor their blood reaches GOD. What reaches Him is your righteousness. He has subdued them for you, that you may show your  appreciation  by  glorifying GOD for guiding you. Give good news to the charitable.

data: *22:26-27 Abraham was the original messenger of Submission (Islam). See 22:78 and Appendix 9.
*22:36 Animal offerings from the pilgrims conserve the resources at the pilgrimage site. Note that almost 2,000,000 pilgrims converge on Mecca during pilgrimage.

verses.38: GOD  defends  those  who  believe. GOD does not love any betrayer, unappreciative.
verses.39: Permission is granted to those who are being persecuted, since injustice has befallen them, and GOD is certainly able to support them.
verses.40: They were evicted from their homes unjustly, for no reason other than saying, “Our Lord is GOD.” If it were not for GOD’s supporting of some people against others, monasteries,  churches,  synagogues,  and masjids—where  the  name  of  GOD is  commemorated  frequently— would  have  been destroyed.  Absolutely, GOD supports those who support Him. GOD is Powerful, Almighty.
verses.41: They are those who, if we appointed them as rulers on earth, they would establish the Contact Prayers (Salat)  and  the  obligatory  charity (Zakat), and  would  advocate  righteousness and forbid evil. GOD is the ultimate ruler.
verses.42: If they reject you, the people of Noah, ‘Ãd, and Thamoud have also disbelieved before them.
verses.43: Also the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot.
verses.44: And the dwellers of Midyan. Moses was also rejected. I led all those people on, then I called them to account; how (devastating) was My requital!
verses.45: Many a community have we annihilated because of their wickedness. They ended up with ruins, stilled wells, and great empty mansions.
verses.46: Did they not roam the earth, then use their minds to understand, and use their ears to hear? Indeed, the real blindness is not the blindness of the eyes, but the blindness of the hearts inside the chests.
verses.47: They challenge you to bring retribution, and GOD never fails to fulfill His prophecy. A day of your Lord is like a thousand of your years.
verses.48: Many a community in the past committed evil, and I led them on for awhile, then I punished them. To Me is the ultimate destiny.
verses.49: Say, “O people, I have been sent to you as a profound warner.”*
verses.50: Those who believe and lead a righteous life have deserved forgiveness and a generous recompense.
verses.51: As for those who strive to challenge our revelations, they incur Hell.

data: *22:49 This command is directed specifically to God’s Messenger of the Covenant. This fact, and the specific name of the messenger are mathematically coded into the Quran. See the details, together with the irrefutable proofs, in Appendices 2 and 26.

verses.52: We  did  not  send  before  you  any messenger,  nor  a  prophet,  without having  the  devil  interfere  in  his wishes.  GOD  then  nullifies  what  the devil  has  done.  GOD  perfects  His revelations.  GOD  is  Omniscient, Most Wise.*
verses.53: He  thus  sets  up  the  devil’s  scheme as  a  test  for  those  who  harbor doubts  in  their  hearts,  and  those whose  hearts  are  hardened.  The wicked  must  remain  with  the  opposition.
verses.54: Those  who  are  blessed  with  knowledge  will  recognize  the  truth  from your  Lord,  then  believe  in  it,  and their  hearts  will  readily  accept  it. Most  assuredly,  GOD  guides  the believers in the right path.
verses.55: As  for  those  who  disbelieve,  they will  continue  to  harbor  doubts  until the  Hour  comes  to  them  suddenly, or  until  the  retribution  of  a  terrible day comes to them.
verses.56: All  sovereignty  on  that  day  belongs to  GOD,  and  He  will  judge  among them.  As  for  those  who  believe  and lead  a  righteous  life,  they  have  deserved the gardens of bliss.
verses.57: While  those  who  disbelieved  and rejected  our  revelations  have  incurred a shameful retribution.
verses.58: Those  who  emigrate  for  the  sake  of GOD,  then  get  killed,  or  die,  GOD will  surely  shower  them  with  good provisions.  GOD  is  certainly  the best Provider.
verses.59: Most  assuredly,  He  will  admit  them an  admittance  that  will  please  them. GOD is Omniscient, Clement.
verses.60: It  is  decreed  that  if  one  avenges  an injustice  that  was  inflicted  upon him,  equitably,  then  is  persecuted because  of  this,  GOD  will  surely support  him.  GOD  is  Pardoner, Forgiving.
verses.61: It  is  a  fact  that  GOD  merges  the night  into  the  day,  and  merges  the day  into  the  night,  and  that  GOD  is Hearer, Seer.
verses.62: It  is  a  fact  that  GOD  is  the  Truth, while  the  setting  up  of  any  idols  beside  Him  constitutes  a  falsehood, and  that  GOD  is  the  Most  High,  the Supreme.
verses.63: Do  you  not  see  that  GOD  sends down  from  the  sky  water  that  turns the  land  green?  GOD  is  Sublime, Cognizant.
verses.64: To  Him  belongs  everything  in  the heavens  and  everything  on  earth. Absolutely, GOD is the Most Rich, Most Praiseworthy.

titles.58: Striving in the Cause of God

data: *22:52 Throughout this worldly test, Satan is allowed to present his point of view (we are born with a representative of Satan in our bodies). This allows the people to make a choice between God’s evidence and Satan’s evidence. Satan’s evidence is invariably based on lies. This system explains the fact that the devil’s agents continuously come up  with  the  most  absurd  lies,  insults  and  accusations  against  every  messenger  (see 6:33-34, 8:30, 17:76-77, 27:70).

verses.65: Do you  not  see  that  GOD  has  committed  in  your  service  everything  on earth?  The  ships  run  in  the  ocean  by His  command.  He  prevents  the heavenly  bodies  from  crashing  onto the  earth,  except  in  accordance  with His  command.  GOD  is  Most  Kind towards the people, Most Merciful.
verses.66: He  is  the  One  who  granted  you  life, then  He  puts  you  to  death,  then  He brings  you  back  to  life.  Surely,  the human being is unappreciative.
verses.67: For  each  congregation,  we  have  decreed  a  set  of  rites  that  they  must uphold.  Therefore,  they  should  not dispute  with  you.  You  shall  continue to  invite  everyone  to  your  Lord. Most  assuredly,  you  are  on  the  right path.
verses.68: If  they  argue  with  you,  then  say, “GOD  is  fully  aware  of  everything you do.”
verses.69: GOD  will  judge  among  you  on  the Day  of  Resurrection  regarding  all your disputes.
verses.70: Do  you  not  realize  that  GOD  knows everything  in  the  heavens  and  everything  on  earth?  All  this  is  recorded in a record. This is easy for GOD to do.
verses.71: Yet,  they  idolize  beside  GOD  idols wherein  He  placed  no  power,  and they  know  nothing  about  them.  The transgressors have no helper.
verses.72: When  our  revelations  are  recited  to them,  clearly,  you  recognize  wickedness  on  the  faces  of  those  who disbelieve.  They  almost  attack  those who  recite  our  revelations  to  them. Say,  “Shall  I  inform  you  of  something  much  worse?  Hell  is  promised by  GOD  for  those  who  disbelieve; what a miserable destiny.”
verses.73: O  people,  here  is  a  parable  that  you must  ponder  carefully:  the  idols  you set  up  beside  GOD  can  never  create a  fly,  even  if  they  banded  together  to do  so.  Furthermore,  if  the  fly  steals anything  from  them,  they  cannot recover  it;  weak  is  the  pursuer  and the pursued.
verses.74: They  do  not  value  GOD  as  He should  be  valued.  GOD  is  the  Most Powerful, the Almighty.
verses.75: GOD  chooses  from  among  the  angels  messengers,  as  well  as  from among  the  people.  GOD  is  Hearer, Seer.
verses.76: He  knows  their  past  and  their  future.  To  GOD  belongs  the  ultimate control of all matters.
verses.77: O  you  who  believe,  you  shall  bow, prostrate,  worship  your  Lord,  and work  righteousness,  that  you  may succeed.

verses.78: You  shall  strive  for  the  cause  of GOD  as  you  should  strive  for  His cause. He has chosen you and has placed no hardship on you in practicing  your  religion—the  religion  of your father Abraham. He is the one who named you “Submitters” originally.  Thus,  the  messenger  shall serve as a witness among you, and you shall serve as witnesses among the people. Therefore, you shall observe  the  Contact  Prayers  (Salat) and  give  the  obligatory  charity (Zakat), and hold fast to GOD; He is your Lord, the best Lord and the best Supporter.

verses.1: Successful  indeed  are  the  believers;
verses.2: who are reverent during their Contact Prayers (Salat).
verses.3: And they avoid vain talk.
verses.4: And  they  give  their  obligatory charity (Zakat).
verses.5: And they maintain their chastity.
verses.6: Only with their spouses, or those who are rightfully theirs, do they have sexual relations; they are not to be blamed.
verses.7: Those who transgress these limits are the transgressors.
verses.8: When  it  comes  to  deposits  entrusted to them, as well as any agreements they make, they are trustworthy.
verses.9: And  they  observe  their  Contact Prayers (Salat) regularly.
verses.10: Such are the inheritors.
verses.11: They will inherit Paradise, wherein they abide forever.
verses.12: We created the human being from a certain kind of mud.
verses.13: Subsequently, we reproduced him from a tiny drop, that is placed into a well protected repository.
verses.14: Then we developed the drop into a hanging (embryo), then developed the hanging (embryo) into a bitesize (fetus), then created the bitesize (fetus) into bones, then covered the  bones  with  flesh.  We  thus produce a new creature. Most blessed is GOD, the best Creator.
verses.15: Then, later on, you die.
verses.16: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be resurrected.
verses.17: We created above you seven universes in layers, and we are never unaware of a single creature in them.
verses.18: We send down from the sky water, in exact measure, then we store it in the ground. Certainly, we can let it escape.

data: *22:78 Although all messengers preached one and the same message, “Worship God alone,” Abraham was the first messenger to coin the terms “Submission” (Islam) and “Submitter” (Muslim) (2:128). What did Abraham contribute to Submission? We learn from 16:123 that all religious duties in Submission were revealed through Abraham (see Appendices 9 & 26).

verses.19: With  it,  we  produce  for  you  orchards  of  date  palms,  grapes,  all kinds of fruits, and various foods.
verses.20: Also,  a  tree  native  to  Sinai  produces oil, as well as relish for the eaters.
verses.21: And  the  livestock  should  provide you  with  a  lesson.  We  let  you  drink (milk)  from  their  bellies,  you  derive other  benefits  from  them,  and  some of them you use for food.
verses.22: On them, and on the ships, you ride.
verses.23: We  sent  Noah  to  his  people,  saying, “O  my  people,  worship  GOD.  You have  no  other  god  beside  Him. Would you not be righteous?”
verses.24: The  leaders  who  disbelieved  among his  people  said,  “This  is  no  more than  a  human  like  you,  who  wants  to gain  prominence  among  you.  Had GOD  willed,  He  could  have  sent down  angels.  We  never  heard  of anything  like  this  from  our  ancestors.
verses.25: “He is  simply a man gone crazy. Just ignore him for awhile.”
verses.26: He  said,  “My  Lord,  grant  me  victory, for they have disbelieved me.”
verses.27: We  then  inspired  him:  “Make  the watercraft*  under  our  watchful eyes,  and  in  accordance  with  our inspiration.  When  our  command comes,  and  the  atmosphere  boils up,  put  on  it  a  pair  of  every  kind  (of your  domesticated  animals),  and your family, except those condemned  to  be  doomed.  Do  not  speak  to Me  on  behalf  of  those  who  transgressed; they will be drowned.
verses.28: “Once  you  are  settled,  together  with those  who  are  with  you,  on  the watercraft,  you  shall  say,  Praise GOD  for  saving  us  from  the  evil people.’
verses.29: “And  say,  ‘My  Lord,  let  me  disembark  onto  a  blessed  location;  You are the best deliverer.’ ”
verses.30: These  should  provide  sufficient proofs  for  you.  We  will  certainly  put you to the test.
verses.31: Subsequently,  we  established  another generation after them.
verses.32: We  sent  to  them  a  messenger  from among  them,  saying,  “You  shall worship  GOD.  You  have  no  other god  beside  Him.  Would  you  not  be righteous?”
verses.33: The  leaders  among  his  people  who disbelieved  and  rejected  the  idea  of the  Hereafter—although  we  provided  for  them  generously  in  this life—said,  “This  is  no  more  than  a human  being  like  you.  He  eats  from what  you  eat,  and  drinks  as  you drink.
verses.34: “If  you  obey  a  human  being  like  you, then you are really losers.
verses.35: “Does  he  promise  you  that,  after you  die  and  turn  into  dust  and bones, you will come out again?
verses.36: “Impossible,  impossible  indeed  is what is promised to you.

data: *23:27 The story tellers have created a mockery of Noah’s history. Noah’s ark was a flat watercraft made of logs, tied together with primitive ropes (54:13), the flood was local, around the Dead Sea area, and the animals were Noah’s domesticated animals.

verses.37: “We only live this life—we live and die—and  we  will  never  be  resurrected.
verses.38: “He is just a man who fabricated lies and attributed them to GOD. We will never believe him.”
verses.39: He said, “My Lord, grant me victory, for they have disbelieved me.”
verses.40: He said, “Soon they will be sorry.”
verses.41: The  retribution  struck  them,  equitably, and thus, we turned them into ruins. The wicked people perished.
verses.42: Subsequently,  we  established  other generations after them.
verses.43: No community can advance its predetermined fate, nor delay it.
verses.44: Then  we  sent  our  messengers  in succession. Every time a messenger went to his community, they disbelieved him. Consequently, we annihilated them, one after the other, and made them history. The people who disbelieved have perished.
verses.45: Then we sent Moses and his brother Aaron with our revelations and a profound proof.
verses.46: To Pharaoh and his elders, but they turned arrogant. They were oppressive people.
verses.47: They said, “Shall we believe for two men whose people are our slaves?”
verses.48: They rejected the two, and consequently, they were annihilated.
verses.49: We gave Moses the scripture, that they may be guided.
verses.50: We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and we gave them refuge on a mesa with food and drink.
verses.51: O  you  messengers,  eat  from  the good  provisions,  and  work  righteousness. I am fully aware of everything you do.
verses.52: Such  is  your  congregation—one congregation—and  I  am  your  Lord; you shall reverence Me.
verses.53: But they tore themselves into disputing factions; each party happy with what they have.
verses.54: Therefore, just leave them in their confusion, for awhile.
verses.55: Do they think that, since we provided them with money and children,
verses.56: we must be showering them with blessings?  Indeed,  they  have  no idea.
verses.57: Surely,  those  who  are  reverently conscious of their Lord,
verses.58: And who believe in the revelations of their Lord,
verses.59: And who never set up any idols beside their Lord,
verses.60: As they give their charities, their hearts are fully reverent. For they recognize that they will be summoned before their Lord,
verses.61: They  are  eager  to  do  righteous works; they compete in doing them.
verses.62: We never burden any soul beyond its means, and we keep a record that utters the truth. No one will suffer injustice.
verses.63: Because their  minds are oblivious to this, they commit works that do not conform with this; their works are evil.

verses.64: Then,  when  we  requite  their  leaders with retribution, they complain.
verses.65: Do  not  complain  now;  you  have given up all help from us.
verses.66: My  proofs  have  been  presented  to you,  but  you  turned  back  on  your heels.
verses.67: You  were  too  arrogant  to  accept them,  and  you  defiantly  disregarded them.
verses.68: Why  do  they  not  reflect  upon  this scripture?  Do  they  not  realize  that they  have  received  something  never attained by their ancestors?
verses.69: Have  they  failed  to  recognize  their messenger?  Is  this  why  they  are  disregarding him?
verses.70: Have  they  decided  that  he  is  crazy? Indeed,  he  has  brought  the  truth  to them,  but  most  of  them  hate  the truth.
verses.71: Indeed,  if  the  truth  conformed  to their  wishes,  there  would  be  chaos in  the  heavens  and  the  earth;  everything  in  them  would  be  corrupted. We  have  given  them  their  proof,  but they are disregarding their proof.
verses.72: Are  you  asking  them  for  a  wage? Your  Lord’s  wage  is  far  better.  He is the best Provider.
verses.73: Most  assuredly,  you  are  inviting them to a straight path.
verses.74: Those  who  disbelieve  in  the  Hereafter  will  surely  deviate  from  the right path.
verses.75: Even  when  we  showered  them  with mercy, and relieved their problems, they  plunged  deeper  into  transgression, and continued to blunder.
verses.76: Even  when  we  afflicted  them  with retribution,  they  never  turned  to their Lord imploring.
verses.77: Subsequently,  when  we  requited them  with  the  severe  retribution they  had  incurred,  they  were  shocked.
verses.78: He  is  the  One  who  granted  you the  hearing,  the  eyesight,  and  the brains. Rarely are you appreciative.
verses.79: He  is  the  One  who  established  you on  earth,  and  before  Him  you  will  be summoned.
verses.80: He  is  the  One  who  controls  life  and death,  and  He  is  the  One  who  alternates  the  night  and  day.  Do  you  not understand?
verses.81: They said what their ancestors said.
verses.82: They  said,  “After  we  die  and  become  dust  and  bones,  we  get  resurrected?
verses.83: “Such  promises  were  given  to  us and  to  our  parents  in  the  past.  These are  no  more  than  tales  from  the past.”
verses.84: Say,  “To  whom  belongs  the  earth and everyone on it, if you know?”
verses.85: They  will  say,  “To  GOD.”  Say, “Why then do you not take heed?”
verses.86: Say,  “Who  is  the  Lord  of  the  seven universes;  the  Lord  of  the  great dominion?”
verses.87: They  will  say,  “GOD.”  Say,  “Why then do you not turn righteous?”

data: *23:84-89 Belief in God is valid only if one recognizes God’s qualities, such as the fact that God controls everything  (8:17).  Believers who do not know God are not really believers.  Most  believers  nullify  their  belief  by  idolizing  such  powerless  idols  as  the prophets and saints (6:106).

verses.88: Say,  “In  whose  hand  is  all  sovereignty  over  all  things,  and  He  is the  only  one  who  can  provide  help, but needs no help, if you know?”
verses.89: They  will  say,  “GOD.”  Say,  “Where did you go wrong?”
verses.90: We  have  given  them  the  truth,  while they are liars.
verses.91: GOD has never begotten a son. Nor was  there  ever  any  other  god  beside Him.  Otherwise,  each  god  would have  declared  independence  with his  creations,  and  they  would  have competed  with  each  other  for  dominance.  GOD  be  glorified;  far  above their claims.
verses.92: The  Knower  of  all  secrets  and  declarations;  be  He  exalted,  far  above having a partner.
verses.93: Say,  “My  Lord,  whether  You  show me  (the  retribution)  they  have  incurred [or not],
verses.94: “My  Lord,  let  me  not  be  one  of  the transgressing people.”
verses.95: To  show  you  (the  retribution)  we have  reserved  for  them  is  something we can easily do.
verses.96: Therefore,  counter  their  evil  works with  goodness;  we  are  fully  aware  of their claims.
verses.97: Say,  “My  Lord,  I  seek  refuge  in  You from the whispers of the devils.
verses.98: “And  I  seek  refuge  in  You,  my Lord, lest they come near me.”
verses.99: When  death  comes  to  one  of  them, he says, “My Lord, send me back.
verses.100: “I  will  then  work  righteousness  in everything  I  left.”  Not  true.  This  is  a false  claim  that  he  makes.  A  barrier will  separate  his  soul  from  this  world until resurrection.
verses.101: When  the  horn  is  blown,  no  relations  among  them  will  exist  on  that day,  nor  will  they  care  about  one another.
verses.102: As  for  those  whose  weights  are heavy, they will be the winners.
verses.103: Those  whose  weights  are  light  are the  ones  who  lost  their  souls;  they abide in Hell forever.
verses.104: Fire  will  overwhelm  their  faces,  and they last miserably therein.
verses.105: Were  not  My  revelations  recited  to you,  and  you  kept  on  rejecting them?
verses.106: They  will  say,  “Our  Lord,  our  wickedness  overwhelmed  us,  and  we were people gone astray.
verses.107: “Our  Lord,  take  us  out  of  this;  if  we return  (to  our  old  behavior),  then  we are really wicked.”
verses.108: He  will  say,  “Abide  therein,  humiliated, and do not speak to Me.
verses.109: “A  group  of  My  servants  used  to  say, ‘Our  Lord,  we  have  believed,  so  forgive  us  and  shower  us  with  mercy. Of  all  the  merciful  ones,  You  are  the Most Merciful.’
verses.110: “But  you  mocked  and  ridiculed them,  to  the  extent  that  you  forgot Me. You used to laugh at them.
verses.111: “I  have  rewarded  them  today,  in return  for  their  steadfastness,  by making them the winners.”
verses.112: He  said,  “How  long  have  you  lasted on earth? How many years?”

verses.1: A sura that we have sent down, and we have decreed as law. We have revealed in it clear revelations, that you may take heed.
verses.2: The  adulteress  and  the  adulterer you shall whip each of them a hundred lashes. Do not be swayed by pity from carrying out GOD’s law, if you  truly  believe  in  GOD  and  the Last Day. And let a group of believers witness their penalty.*
verses.3: The adulterer will end up marrying an adulteress or an idol worshiper, and the adulteress will end up marrying an adulterer or an idol worshiper.  This  is prohibited for  the believers.
verses.4: Those who  accuse married women of adultery, then fail to produce four witnesses,  you  shall  whip  them eighty lashes, and do not accept any testimony from them; they are wicked.
verses.5: If  they  repent  afterwards  and  reform, then GOD is Forgiver, Merciful.
verses.6: As for those who accuse their own spouses, without any other witnesses, then the testimony may be accepted if he swears by GOD four times that he is telling the truth.
verses.7: The  fifth  oath  shall  be  to  incur GOD’s condemnation upon him, if he was lying.
verses.8: She shall be considered innocent if she swears by GOD four times that he is a liar.
verses.9: The fifth oath shall incur GOD’s wrath upon her if he was telling the truth.
verses.10: This  is  GOD’s  grace  and  mercy towards  you.  GOD  is  Redeemer, Most Wise.

data: *24:2 Social pressure, i.e., public witnessing of the penalty, is the basic punishment (see also 5:38). The lashes shall be symbolic, not severe.

verses.11: A gang among you produced a big lie.* Do not think that it was bad for you; instead, it was good for you. Meanwhile, each one of them has earned his share of the guilt. As for the one who initiated the whole incident, he has incurred a terrible retribution.
verses.12: When you heard it, the believing men  and  the  believing  women should  have  had  better  thoughts about themselves, and should have said, “This is obviously a big lie.”
verses.13: Only  if  they  produced  four  witnesses  (you  may  believe  them).  If they fail to produce the witnesses, then they are, according to GOD, liars.
verses.14: If it were not for GOD’s grace towards you, and His mercy in this world  and  in  the  Hereafter,  you would have suffered a great retribution because of this incident.
verses.15: You  fabricated  it  with  your  own tongues, and the rest of you repeated  it  with  your  mouths  without proof. You thought it was simple, when it was, according to GOD, gross.
verses.16: When you heard it, you should have said, “We will not repeat this. Glory be to You. This is a gross falsehood.”
verses.17: GOD admonishes you that you shall never do it again, if you are believers.
verses.18: GOD  thus  explains  the  revelations for you. GOD is Omniscient, Wise.
verses.19: Those who love to see immorality spread among the believers have incurred a painful retribution in this life  and  in  the  Hereafter.  GOD knows, while you do not know.
verses.20: GOD showers you with His grace and mercy. GOD is Most Kind towards the believers, Most Merciful.
verses.21: O you who believe, do not follow the steps of Satan. Anyone who follows the steps of Satan, should know that he advocates evil and vice. If it were not for GOD’s grace towards you, and His mercy, none of you would have been purified. But GOD purifies whomever He wills. GOD is Hearer, Knower.
verses.22: Those among you who are blessed with resources and wealth shall be charitable  towards  their  relatives, the poor, and those who have immigrated for the sake of GOD. They shall treat them with kindness and tolerance; do you not love to attain GOD’s forgiveness? GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.23: Surely,  those  who  falsely  accuse married women who are pious believers have incurred condemnation in this life and in the Hereafter; they have incurred a horrendous retribution.

data: *24:11 This refers to a historical incident where the Prophet’s wife Aysha was left in the desert by mistake, and later found by a young man who helped her catch up with the Prophet’s caravan. This triggered the famous ‘Big Lie’ against Aysha.

verses.24: The  day  will  come  when  their  own tongues,  hands,  and  feet  will  bear witness to everything they had done.
verses.25: On  that  day,  GOD  will  requite  them fully  for  their  works,  and  they  will find out that GOD is the Truth.
verses.26: The  bad  women  for  the  bad  men, and  the  bad  men  for  the  bad  women, and  the  good  women  for  the  good men,  and  the  good  men  for  the  good women.  The  latter  are  innocent  of such  accusations.  They  have  attained  forgiveness  and  a  generous reward.
verses.27: O  you  who  believe,  do  not  enter homes  other  than  yours  without  permission  from  their  inhabitants,  and without  greeting  them.  This  is  better for you, that you may take heed.
verses.28: If  you  find  no  one  in  them,  do  not enter  them  until  you  obtain  permission.  If  you  are  told,  “Go  back,”  you must  go  back.  This  is  purer  for  you. GOD  is  fully  aware  of  everything you do.
verses.29: You  commit  no  error  by  entering uninhabited  homes  wherein  there  is something  that  belongs  to  you.  GOD knows  everything  you  reveal,  and everything you conceal.
verses.30: Tell  the  believing  men  that  they shall subdue their eyes (and not stare  at  the  women),  and  to  maintain their  chastity.  This  is  purer  for  them. GOD  is  fully  Cognizant  of  everything they do.
verses.31: And  tell  the  believing  women  to subdue  their  eyes,  and  maintain their  chastity.  They  shall  not  reveal any  parts  of  their  bodies,  except  that which  is  necessary.  They  shall  cover their  chests,  and  shall  not  relax  this code  in  the  presence  of  other  than their  husbands,  their  fathers,  the fathers  of  their  husbands,  their  sons, the  sons  of  their  husbands,  their brothers,  the  sons  of  their  brothers, the  sons  of  their  sisters,  other  women,  the  male  servants  or  employees whose  sexual  drive  has  been  nullified,  or  the  children  who  have  not reached  puberty.  They  shall  not strike  their  feet  when  they  walk  in order  to  shake  and  reveal  certain details  of  their  bodies.  All  of  you shall  repent  to  GOD,  O  you  believers, that you may succeed.*
verses.32: You  shall  encourage  those  of  you who  are  single  to  get  married.  They may  marry  the  righteous  among your  male  and  female  servants,  if they  are  poor.  GOD  will  enrich  them from  His  grace.  GOD  is  Bounteous, Knower.

encrypted.28: فان لم تجدوا فيها احدا فلا تدخلوها حتى يؤذن لكم وان قيل لكم ارجعوا فارجعوا هو ازكى لكم والله بما تعملون عليم

encrypted.31: وقل للمؤمنات يغضضن من ابصارهن ويحفظن فروجهن ولا يبدين زينتهن الا ما ظهر منها وليضربن بخمرهن على جيوبهن ولا يبدين زينتهن الا لبعولتهن او ابائهن او اباء بعولتهن او ابنائهن او ابناء بعولتهن او اخوانهن او بني اخوانهن او بني اخواتهن او نسائهن او ما ملكت ايمانهن او التابعين غير اولي الاربة من الرجال او الطفل الذين لم يظهروا على عورات النساء ولا يضربن بارجلهن ليعلم ما يخفين من زينتهن وتوبوا الى الله جميعا ايه المؤمنون لعلكم تفلحون

data: *24:30-31 Dressing modestly, therefore, is a trait of the believing men and women. The minimum requirements for a woman’s dress is to lengthen her garment  (33:59) and to cover her chest. Tyrannical Arab traditions have given a false impression that a woman must be covered from head to toe; such is not a Quranic or Islamic dress.

verses.33: Those  who  cannot  afford  to  get married  shall  maintain  morality until  GOD  provides  for  them  from His  grace.  Those  among  your  servants  who  wish  to  be  freed  in  order to  marry,  you  shall  grant  them  their wish,  once  you  realize  that  they  are honest.  And  give  them  from  GOD’s money  that  He  has  bestowed  upon you.  You  shall  not  force  your  girls  to commit  prostitution,  seeking  the materials  of  this  world,  if  they  wish to  be  chaste.  If  anyone  forces  them, then  GOD,  seeing  that  they  are forced, is Forgiver, Merciful.
verses.34: We  have  revealed  to  you  clarifying revelations,  and  examples  from  the past  generations,  and  an  enlightenment for the righteous.
verses.35: GOD is the light of the heavens and the  earth.  The  allegory  of  His  light is  that  of  a  concave  mirror  behind  a lamp  that  is  placed  inside  a  glass container.  The  glass  container  is like  a  bright,  pearl-like  star.  The  fuel thereof  is  supplied  from  a  blessed oil-producing  tree,  that  is  neither eastern,  nor  western.  Its  oil  is  almost self-radiating;  needs  no  fire  to  ignite it.  Light upon light.  GOD  guides to His light whoever wills (to be guided).  GOD  thus  cites  the  parables  for the people. GOD is fully aware of all things.
verses.36: (God’s  guidance  is  found)  in  houses exalted  by  GOD,  for  His  name  is commemorated therein.  Glorifying Him therein, day and night—
verses.37: People  who  are  not  distracted  by business  or  trade  from  commemorating  GOD;  they  observe  the  Contact  Prayers  (Salat),  and  give  the obligatory charity (Zakat), and they are  conscious  of  the  day  when  the minds and the eyes will be horrified.
verses.38: GOD  will  certainly  reward  them  for their  good  works,  and  will  shower them  with  His  grace.  GOD  provides for  whomever  He  wills  without  limits.
verses.39: As  for  those  who  disbelieve,  their works  are  like  a  mirage  in  the  desert. A  thirsty  person  thinks  that  it  is water.  But  when  he  reaches  it,  he finds  that  it  is  nothing,  and  he  finds GOD  there  instead,  to  requite  him fully for his works. GOD is the most efficient reckoner.
verses.40: Another  allegory  is  that  of  being  in total  darkness  in  the  midst  of  a violent  ocean,  with  waves  upon waves,  in  addition  to  thick  fog. Darkness  upon  darkness—if  he looked  at  his  own  hand,  he  could barely  see  it.  Whomever  GOD  deprives of light, will have no light.
verses.41: Do  you  not  realize  that  everyone  in the  heavens  and  the  earth  glorifies GOD, even the birds as they fly in a column?  Each  knows  its  prayer  and its  glorification.  GOD  is  fully  aware of everything they do.
verses.42: To  GOD  belongs  the  sovereignty  of the  heavens  and  the  earth,  and  to GOD is the final destiny.
verses.43: Do  you  not  realize  that  GOD  drives the  clouds,  then  gathers  them  together,  then  piles  them  on  each other,  then  you  see  the  rain  coming out  of  them?  He  sends  down  from the  sky  loads  of  snow  to  cover whomever  he  wills,  while  diverting it  from  whomever  He  wills.  The brightness  of  the  snow  almost  blinds the eyes.

encrypted.33: وليستعفف الذين لا يجدون نكاحا حتى يغنيهم الله من فضله والذين يبتغون الكتاب مما ملكت ايمانكم فكاتبوهم ان علمتم فيهم خيرا واتوهم من مال الله الذي اتاكم ولا تكرهوا فتياتكم على البغاء ان اردن تحصنا لتبتغوا عرض الحياة الدنيا ومن يكرههن فان الله من بعد اكراههن غفور رحيم

encrypted.36: في بيوت اذن الله ان ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه يسبح له فيها بالغدو والاصال

encrypted.38: ليجزيهم الله احسن ما عملوا ويزيدهم من فضله والله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب
encrypted.39: والذين كفروا اعمالهم كسراب بقيعة يحسبه الظمان ماء حتى اذا جاءه لم يجده شيئا ووجد الله عنده فوفاه حسابه والله سريع الحساب
encrypted.40: او كظلمات في بحر لجي يغشاه موج من فوقه موج من فوقه سحاب ظلمات بعضها فوق بعض اذا اخرج يده لم يكد يراها ومن لم يجعل الله له نورا فما له من نور
encrypted.41: الم تر ان الله يسبح له من في السماوات والارض والطير صافات كل قد علم صلاته وتسبيحه والله عليم بما يفعلون
encrypted.42: ولله ملك السماوات والارض والى الله المصير
encrypted.43: الم تر ان الله يزجي سحابا ثم يؤلف بينه ثم يجعله ركاما فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله وينزل من السماء من جبال فيها من برد فيصيب به من يشاء ويصرفه عن من يشاء يكاد سنا برقه يذهب بالابصار

verses.44: GOD  controls  the  night  and  day. This  should  be  a  lesson  for  those who possess eyes.
verses.45: And  GOD  created  every  living  creature  from  water.  Some  of  them  walk on  their  bellies,  some  walk  on  two legs,  and  some  walk  on  four.  GOD creates  whatever  He  wills.  GOD  is Omnipotent.
verses.46: We  have  sent  down  to  you  clarifying revelations,  then  GOD  guides  whoever wills in a straight path.
verses.47: They  say,  “We  believe  in  GOD  and in  the  messenger,  and  we  obey,”  but then  some  of  them  slide  back  afterwards. These are not believers.
verses.48: When  they  are  invited  to  GOD  and His  messenger  to  judge  among them, some of them get upset.
verses.49: However,  if  the  judgment  is  in  their favor, they readily accept it!
verses.50: Is  there  a  disease  in  their  hearts? Are  they  doubtful?  Are  they  afraid that  GOD  and  His  messenger  may treat  them  unfairly?  In  fact,  it  is  they who are unjust.
verses.51: The  only  utterance  of  the  believers, whenever  invited  to  GOD  and  His messenger  to  judge  in  their  affairs, is  to  say,  “We  hear  and  we  obey.” These are the winners.
verses.52: Those who obey GOD and His  messenger, and reverence GOD and observe  Him,  these  are  the  triumphant ones.
verses.53: They  swear  by  GOD,  solemnly,  that if  you  commanded  them  to  mobilize,  they  would  mobilize.  Say,  “Do not  swear.  Obedience  is  an  obligation.  GOD  is  fully  Cognizant  of everything you do.”
verses.54: Say,  “Obey  GOD,  and  obey  the  messenger.”  If  they  refuse,  then  he  is responsible  for  his  obligations,  and you  are  responsible  for  your  obligations.  If  you  obey  him,  you  will  be guided.  The  sole  duty  of  the  messenger is to deliver (the message).
verses.55: GOD  promises  those  among  you who  believe  and  lead  a  righteous life,  that  He  will  make  them  sovereigns  on  earth,  as  He  did  for  those before  them,  and  will  establish  for them  the  religion  He  has  chosen  for them,  and  will  substitute  peace  and security  for  them  in  place  of  fear.  All this  because  they  worship  Me  alone; they  never  set  up  any  idols  beside Me.  Those  who  disbelieve  after  this are the truly wicked.
verses.56: You  shall  observe  the  Contact Prayers  (Salat)      and      give      the obligatory  charity  (Zakat),  and  obey the  messenger,  that  you  may  attain mercy.
verses.57: Do  not  think  that  those  who  disbelieve  will  ever  get  away  with  it. Their  final  abode  is  Hell;  what  a miserable destiny.

encrypted.48: واذا دعوا الى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم اذا فريق منهم معرضون
encrypted.49: وان يكن لهم الحق ياتوا اليه مذعنين
encrypted.50: افي قلوبهم مرض ام ارتابوا ام يخافون ان يحيف الله عليهم ورسوله بل اولئك هم الظالمون
encrypted.51: انما كان قول المؤمنين اذا دعوا الى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم ان يقولوا سمعنا واطعنا واولئك هم المفلحون
encrypted.52: ومن يطع الله ورسوله ويخش الله ويتقه فاولئك هم الفائزون
encrypted.53: واقسموا بالله جهد ايمانهم لئن امرتهم ليخرجن قل لا تقسموا طاعة معروفة ان الله خبير بما تعملون
encrypted.54: قل اطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول فان تولوا فانما عليه ما حمل وعليكم ما حملتم وان تطيعوه تهتدوا وما على الرسول الا البلاغ المبين
encrypted.55: وعد الله الذين امنوا منكم وعملوا الصالحات ليستخلفنهم في الارض كما استخلف الذين من قبلهم وليمكنن لهم دينهم الذي ارتضى لهم وليبدلنهم من بعد خوفهم امنا يعبدونني لا يشركون بي شيئا ومن كفر بعد ذلك فاولئك هم الفاسقون
encrypted.56: واقيموا الصلاة واتوا الزكاة واطيعوا الرسول لعلكم ترحمون
encrypted.57: لا تحسبن الذين كفروا معجزين في الارض وماواهم النار ولبئس المصير

verses.58: O you who believe, permission must be requested by your servants and the children who have not attained puberty  (before  entering  your rooms). This is to be done in three instances—before the  Dawn Prayer, at noon when you change your clothes to rest, and after the Night Prayer. These are three private times for you. At other times, it is not wrong for you or them to mingle with one another. GOD thus clarifies  the  revelations  for  you. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.
verses.59: Once  the  children  reach  puberty, they must ask permission (before entering) like those who became adults before them have asked permission (before entering). GOD thus clarifies  His  revelations  for  you. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.
verses.60: The elderly women who do not expect to get married commit nothing wrong by relaxing their dress code, provided  they  do  not  reveal  too much of their bodies. To maintain modesty is better for them. GOD is Hearer, Knower.
verses.61: The blind is not to be blamed, the crippled is not to be blamed, nor the handicapped is to be blamed, just as you are not to be blamed for eating at your homes, or the homes of your fathers, or the homes of your mothers, or the homes of your brothers, or the homes of your sisters, or the homes of your fathers’ brothers, or the homes of your fathers’ sisters, or the homes of your mothers’ brothers, or the homes of your mothers’ sisters, or the homes that belong to you and you possess their keys, or the homes of your friends. You commit  nothing  wrong  by  eating  together or as individuals. When you enter any home, you shall greet each other a greeting from GOD that is blessed  and  good.  GOD  thus  explains the revelations for you, that you may understand.
verses.62: The  true  believers  are  those  who believe in GOD and His messenger,* and when they are with him in a community meeting, they do not leave  him  without  permission. Those who ask permission are the ones who do believe in GOD and His messenger. If they ask your permission, in order to tend to some of their affairs, you may grant permission to whomever you wish, and ask GOD to forgive them. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.63: Do not treat the messenger’s requests as you treat each others’ requests. GOD is fully aware of those among you who sneak away using flimsy  excuses.  Let  them  beware— those  who  disobey  his  orders—for  a disaster may strike them, or a severe retribution.
verses.64: Absolutely, to GOD belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. He fully knows every condition you may be in. The day you are returned to Him, He will inform them of everything they had done. GOD is fully aware of all things.

encrypted.58: يا ايها الذين امنوا ليستاذنكم الذين ملكت ايمانكم والذين لم يبلغوا الحلم منكم ثلاث مرات من قبل صلاة الفجر وحين تضعون ثيابكم من الظهيرة ومن بعد صلاة العشاء ثلاث عورات لكم ليس عليكم ولا عليهم جناح بعدهن طوافون عليكم بعضكم على بعض كذلك يبين الله لكم الايات والله عليم حكيم
encrypted.59: واذا بلغ الاطفال منكم الحلم فليستاذنوا كما استاذن الذين من قبلهم كذلك يبين الله لكم اياته والله عليم حكيم
encrypted.60: والقواعد من النساء اللاتي لا يرجون نكاحا فليس عليهن جناح ان يضعن ثيابهن غير متبرجات بزينة وان يستعففن خير لهن والله سميع عليم
encrypted.61: ليس على الاعمى حرج ولا على الاعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ولا على انفسكم ان تاكلوا من بيوتكم او بيوت ابائكم او بيوت امهاتكم او بيوت اخوانكم او بيوت اخواتكم او بيوت اعمامكم او بيوت عماتكم او بيوت اخوالكم او بيوت خالاتكم او ما ملكتم مفاتحه او صديقكم ليس عليكم جناح ان تاكلوا جميعا او اشتاتا فاذا دخلتم بيوتا فسلموا على انفسكم تحية من عند الله مباركة طيبة كذلك يبين الله لكم الايات لعلكم تعقلون

data: *24:62 This verse refers to God’s Messenger of the Covenant; by adding the gematrical value of “Rashad” (505) plus the value of “Khalifa” (725), plus the verse number (62), we get 1292, a multiple of 19 (1292 = 19x68). See Appendix 2.

verses.1: Most  blessed  is  the  One  who  revealed  the  Statute  Book  to  His  servant, so  he  can  serve  as  a  warner  to  the whole world.
verses.2: The  One  to  whom  belongs  all  sovereignty  of  the  heavens  and  the earth.  He  never  had  a  son,  nor  does He  have  any  partners  in  sovereignty. He  created  everything  in  exact measure;  He  precisely  designed  everything.*
verses.3: Yet,  they  set  up  beside  Him  gods who  do  not  create  anything—they themselves  are  created—and  who possess  no  power  to  even  harm  or benefit  themselves,  nor  do  they  possess  any  power  to  control  life,  or death, or resurrection.
verses.4: Those  who  disbelieved  said,  “This is  a  fabrication  that  he  produced, with  the  help  of  some  other  people.” They  have  uttered  a  blasphemy  and a falsehood.
verses.5: They  also  said,  “Tales  from  the  past that  he  wrote  down;  they  were  dictated to him day and night.”*
verses.6: Say,  “This  was  revealed  by  the  One who  knows  the  Secret*  in  the  heavens  and  the  earth.  He  is  Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
verses.7: And  they  said,  “How  come  this messenger  eats  the  food  and  walks in  the  markets?  If  only  an  angel could  come  down  with  him,  to  serve with him as a preacher!”
verses.8: Or,  “If  only  a  treasure  could  be  given  to  him!”  Or,  “If  only  he  could possess  an  orchard  from  which  he eats!”  The  transgressors  also  said, “You  are  following  a  bewitched man.”
verses.9: Note  how  they  called  you  all  kinds of  names,  and  how  this  led  them astray, never to find their way back.
verses.10: Most blessed is the One who can, if He  wills,  give  you  much  better  than their  demands—gardens  with  flowing streams, and many mansions.
verses.11: In  fact,  they  have  disbelieved  in  the Hour  (Day  of  Resurrection),  and  we have  prepared  for  those  who  disbelieve in the Hour a flaming Hell.

encrypted.4: وقال الذين كفروا ان هذا الا افك افتراه واعانه عليه قوم اخرون فقد جاءوا ظلما وزورا

data: *25:2 When we launch astronauts into space, we measure precisely the amount of food, water, oxygen, and other needs throughout the journey. Similarly, God has launched us into  space—on  board  spaceship  Earth—and  He  has  designed  all  kinds  of  renewable provisions  for  us  and  other  creatures,  a  perfect  design.  Think,  for  example,  of  the symbiotic relationship between us and the plants; we use the oxygen they produce in photosynthesis, while they use the carbon dioxide we produce in respiration.
*25:5 Muhammad’s contemporaries knew that he was a literate man who could read and write; he wrote God’s revelations with his own hand (see Appendix 28).

*25:6  The  Quran’s  miraculous  mathematical  code,  the  incontrovertible  answer  to  the disbelievers’ claims, remained a divinely guarded secret for 1400 years. God’s Messenger of the Covenant was destined to unveil it by God’s leave (Appendices 1, 2, & 26).

verses.12: When  it  sees  them  from  afar,  they will hear its rage and fuming.
verses.13: And  when  they  are  thrown  into  it, through  a  narrow  place,  all  shackled, they will declare their remorse.
verses.14: You  will  not  declare  just  a  single remorse,  on  that  day;  you  will  suffer through  a  great  number  of  remorses.
verses.15: Say,  “Is  this  better  or  the  eternal Paradise  that  is  promised  for  the righteous?  It  is  their  well  deserved reward; a well deserved destiny.”
verses.16: They  get  anything  they  wish  therein, forever.  This  is  your  Lord’s  irrevocable promise.
verses.17: On  the  day  when  He  summons them,  together  with  the  idols  they had set up beside GOD, He will say, “Have  you  misled  these  servants  of Mine,  or  did  they  go  astray  on  their own?”
verses.18: They  will  say,  “Be  You  glorified,  it was  not  right  for  us  to  set  up  any lords  beside  You.  But  You  allowed them  to  enjoy,  together  with  their parents.  Consequently,  they  disregarded  the  message  and  thus  became wicked people.”
verses.19: They  have  disbelieved  in  the  message  you  have  given  them,  and,  consequently, you can neither protect them  from  the  retribution  they  have incurred,  nor  can  you  help  them  in any  way.  Anyone  among  you  who commits evil, we will commit him to  severe retribution.
verses.20: We  did  not  send  any  messengers before  you  who  did  not  eat  food  and walk  in  the  markets.  We  thus  test you  by  each  other;  will  you  steadfastly persevere? Your Lord is Seer.
verses.21: Those  who  do  not  expect  to  meet  us said,  “If  only  the  angels  could  come down  to  us,  or  we  could  see  our Lord  (we  would  then  believe)!”  Indeed,  they  have  committed  a  gross arrogance,  and  have  produced  a gross blasphemy.
verses.22: The  day  they  see  the  angels,  it  will not  be  good  news  for  the  guilty;  they will  say,  “Now,  we  are  irreversibly confined.”
verses.23: We  will  look  at  all  the  works  they have  done,  and  render  them  null and void.
verses.24: The  dwellers  of  Paradise  are  far better  on  that  day;  they  will  hear better news.
verses.25: The  heaven  will  break  apart,  into masses  of  clouds,  and  the  angels  will descend in multitudes.
verses.26: All  sovereignty  on  that  day  belongs to  the  Most  Gracious.  For  the  disbelievers, it will be a difficult day.

verses.27: The  day  will  come  when  the  transgressor  will  bite  his  hands  (in  anguish)  and  say,  “Alas,  I  wish  I  had followed  the  path  with  the  messenger.
verses.28: “Alas,  woe  to  me,  I  wish  I  did  not take that person as a friend.
verses.29: “He  has  led  me  away  from  the  message  after  it  came  to  me.  Indeed,  the devil lets down his human victims.”
verses.30: The  messenger*  said,  “My  Lord, my people have deserted this Quran.”
verses.31: We  also  set  up  against  every  prophet  enemies  from  among  the  guilty. Your  Lord  suffices  as  a  guide,  a  master.
verses.32: Those  who  disbelieved  said,  “Why did  not  the  Quran  come  through him  all  at  once?”  We  have  released it  to  you  gradually,  in  order  to  fix  it in  your  memory.  We  have  recited  it in a specific sequence.
verses.33: Whatever  argument  they  come  up with,  we  provide  you  with  the  truth, and a better understanding.
verses.34: Those  who  are  forcibly  summoned to  Hell  are  in  the  worst  position; they  are  the  farthest  from  the  right path.
verses.35: We  have  given  Moses  the  scripture, and  appointed  his  brother  Aaron  to be his assistant.
verses.36: We  said,  “Go,  both  of  you,  to  the people  who  rejected  our  revelations,”  and  subsequently,  we  utterly annihilated the rejectors.
verses.37: Similarly,  when  the  people  of  Noah disbelieved  the  messengers,  we drowned  them,  and  we  set  them  up as  a  sign  for  the  people.  We  have prepared  for  the  transgressors  a painful retribution.
verses.38: Also  ‘Ãd,  Thamoud,  the  inhabitants of  Al-Russ,  and  many  generations between them.
verses.39: To  each  of  these  groups,  we  delivered  sufficient  examples,  before  we annihilated them.
verses.40: They  have  passed  by  the  community that  was  showered  with  a  miserable shower  (Sodom).  Did  they  not  see it?  The  fact  is,  they  never  believed  in resurrection.
verses.41: When  they  saw  you,  they  always ridiculed  you:  “Is  this  the  one  chosen by GOD to be a messenger?
verses.42: “He  almost  diverted  us  from  our gods,  if  it  were  not  that  we  steadfastly  persevered  with  them.”  They  will certainly  find  out,  when  they  see  the retribution,  who  are  the  real  strayers from the path.
verses.43: Have you seen the one whose god is his own ego? Will you be his advocate?

data: *25:27-30 This verse refers also to God’s Messenger of the Covenant whose name is mathematically  coded  in  the  Quran  as  “Rashad  Khalifa.”  If  you  write  down  the gematrical value of “Rashad” (505), followed by the gematrical value of “Khalifa” (725), followed by this sura number (25), followed by verses 27, 28, 29, and 30, the final number (5057252527282930) is a multiple of 19 (see Appendices 2 & 26 for details). The prophet Muhammad will also make such a statement as in 25:30 on the Day of Judgment.

verses.44: Do  you  think  that  most  of  them hear, or understand? They are just like animals; no, they are far worse.
verses.45: Have you not seen how your Lord designed the shadow? If He willed, He could have made it fixed, then we would have designed the sun accordingly.
verses.46: But we designed it to move slowly.
verses.47: He  is  the  One  who  designed  the night to be a cover, and for you to sleep and rest. And He made the day a resurrection.
verses.48: He is the One who sends the winds with good omens of His mercy, and we send down from the sky pure water.
verses.49: With it, we revive dead lands and provide  drink  for  our  creations— multitudes of animals and humans.
verses.50: We have distributed it among them in exact measure, that they may take heed. But most people insist upon disbelieving.
verses.51: If we willed, we could have sent to every community a warner.
verses.52: Therefore, do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with this, a great striving.
verses.53: He is the One who merges the two seas;  one  is  fresh  and  palatable, while the other is salty and undrinkable. And He separated them with a formidable,  inviolable  barrier  (evaporation).
verses.54: He is the One  who created  from water a human being, then made him reproduce through marriage and mating. Your Lord is Omnipotent.
verses.55: Yet, they still set up beside GOD idols that cannot benefit them, nor harm them. Indeed, the disbeliever is an enemy of his Lord.
verses.56: We  have sent you (Rashad) as  a deliverer of good news, as well as a warner.
verses.57: Say, “I do not ask you for any money. All I seek is to help you find the right path to your Lord, if this is what you choose.”
verses.58: You shall put your trust in the One who  is  Alive—the  One  who  never dies—and  praise  Him  and  glorify Him. He is fully Cognizant of His creatures’ sins.
verses.59: He  is  the  One  who  created  the heavens and the earth, and everything between them, in six days, then assumed  all  authority.  The  Most Gracious; ask about Him those who are well founded in knowledge.
verses.60: When they are told, “Fall prostrate before the Most  Gracious,” they say, “What is the Most Gracious? Shall we prostrate before what you advocate?” Thus, it only augments their aversion.
verses.61: Most blessed is the One who placed constellations in the sky, and placed in it a lamp, and a shining moon.
verses.62: He  is  the  One  who  designed  the night and the day to alternate: a sufficient proof for those who wish to take heed, or to be appreciative.

encrypted.44: ام تحسب ان اكثرهم يسمعون او يعقلون ان هم الا كالانعام بل هم اضل سبيلا
encrypted.45: الم تر الى ربك كيف مد الظل ولو شاء لجعله ساكنا ثم جعلنا الشمس عليه دليلا
encrypted.46: ثم قبضناه الينا قبضا يسيرا
encrypted.47: وهو الذي جعل لكم الليل لباسا والنوم سباتا وجعل النهار نشورا
encrypted.48: وهو الذي ارسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته وانزلنا من السماء ماء طهورا
encrypted.49: لنحيي به بلدة ميتا ونسقيه مما خلقنا انعاما واناسي كثيرا
encrypted.50: ولقد صرفناه بينهم ليذكروا فابى اكثر الناس الا كفورا
encrypted.51: ولو شئنا لبعثنا في كل قرية نذيرا
encrypted.52: فلا تطع الكافرين وجاهدهم به جهادا كبيرا
