encrypted.54: وهو الذي خلق من الماء بشرا فجعله نسبا وصهرا وكان ربك قديرا
encrypted.55: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعهم ولا يضرهم وكان الكافر على ربه ظهيرا
encrypted.56: وما ارسلناك الا مبشرا ونذيرا
encrypted.57: قل ما اسالكم عليه من اجر الا من شاء ان يتخذ الى ربه سبيلا
encrypted.58: وتوكل على الحي الذي لا يموت وسبح بحمده وكفى به بذنوب عباده خبيرا
encrypted.59: الذي خلق السماوات والارض وما بينهما في ستة ايام ثم استوى على العرش الرحمن فاسال به خبيرا
encrypted.60: واذا قيل لهم اسجدوا للرحمن قالوا وما الرحمن انسجد لما تامرنا وزادهم نفورا
encrypted.61: تبارك الذي جعل في السماء بروجا وجعل فيها سراجا وقمرا منيرا
encrypted.62: وهو الذي جعل الليل والنهار خلفة لمن اراد ان يذكر او اراد شكورا

data: *25:56 The gematrical value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230), plus the sura and verse number (25 + 56) give a total of 1230 + 25 + 56 = 1311 = 19x69.

verses.63: The worshipers of the Most Gracious are those who tread the earth gently, and when the ignorant speak to them, they only utter peace.
verses.64: In the privacy of the night, they meditate on their Lord, and fall prostrate.
verses.65: And they say, “Our Lord, spare us the agony of Hell; its retribution is horrendous.
verses.66: “It is the worst abode; the worst destiny.”
verses.67: When they give they are neither extravagant nor stingy; they give in moderation.
verses.68: They  never  implore  beside  GOD any  other  god,  nor  do  they  kill  anyone—for  GOD  has  made  life  sacred—except  in  the  course  of  justice.  Nor  do  they  commit  adultery. Those  who  commit  these  offenses will have to pay.
verses.69: Retribution is doubled for them on the Day of Resurrection, and they abide therein humiliated.
verses.70: Exempted  are  those  who  repent, believe, and lead a righteous life. GOD  transforms  their  sins  into credits. GOD is Forgiver,  Most Merciful.
verses.71: Those who repent and lead a righteous life, GOD redeems them; a complete redemption.
verses.72: They  do  not  bear  false  witness. When they encounter vain talk, they ignore it.
verses.73: When reminded of their Lord’s revelations, they never react to them as if they were deaf and blind.
verses.74: And they say, “Our Lord, let our spouses and children be a source of joy for us, and keep us in the fore front of the righteous.”
verses.75: These  are  the  ones  who  attain Paradise in return for their steadfastness; they are received therein with joyous greetings and peace.
verses.76: Eternally they abide therein; what a beautiful destiny; what a beautiful abode.
verses.77: Say, “You attain value at my Lord only through your worship. But if you disbelieve, you incur the inevitable consequences.”

encrypted.63: وعباد الرحمن الذين يمشون على الارض هونا واذا خاطبهم الجاهلون قالوا سلاما
encrypted.64: والذين يبيتون لربهم سجدا وقياما
encrypted.65: والذين يقولون ربنا اصرف عنا عذاب جهنم ان عذابها كان غراما
encrypted.66: انها ساءت مستقرا ومقاما
encrypted.67: والذين اذا انفقوا لم يسرفوا ولم يقتروا وكان بين ذلك قواما
encrypted.68: والذين لا يدعون مع الله الها اخر ولا يقتلون النفس التي حرم الله الا بالحق ولا يزنون ومن يفعل ذلك يلق اثاما
encrypted.69: يضاعف له العذاب يوم القيامة ويخلد فيه مهانا
encrypted.70: الا من تاب وامن وعمل عملا صالحا فاولئك يبدل الله سيئاتهم حسنات وكان الله غفورا رحيما
encrypted.71: ومن تاب وعمل صالحا فانه يتوب الى الله متابا
encrypted.72: والذين لا يشهدون الزور واذا مروا باللغو مروا كراما
encrypted.73: والذين اذا ذكروا بايات ربهم لم يخروا عليها صما وعميانا
encrypted.74: والذين يقولون ربنا هب لنا من ازواجنا وذرياتنا قرة اعين واجعلنا للمتقين اماما
encrypted.75: اولئك يجزون الغرفة بما صبروا ويلقون فيها تحية وسلاما
encrypted.76: خالدين فيها حسنت مستقرا ومقاما
encrypted.77: قل ما يعبا بكم ربي لولا دعاؤكم فقد كذبتم فسوف يكون لزاما

verses.1: T.S.M.*
verses.2: These (letters) constitute proofs of this clarifying scripture.
verses.3: You may blame yourself that they are not believers.

titles.1:
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sura 26: The Poets
(Al-Shu‘arã’)
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

encrypted.3: لعلك باخع نفسك الا يكونوا مؤمنين

data: *26:1 See Appendix 1 for the significance of these previously mysterious letters.

verses.4: If we will, we can send from the sky a sign that forces their necks to bow.
verses.5: Whenever  a  reminder  from  the Most  Gracious  comes  to  them,  that is new, they turn away in aversion.
verses.6: Since  they  disbelieved,  they  have  incurred  the  consequences  of  their heedlessness.
verses.7: Have  they  not  seen  the  earth,  and how  many  kinds  of  beautiful  plants we have grown thereon?
verses.8: This  should  be  a  sufficient  proof  for them,  but  most  of  them  are  not believers.
verses.9: Most  assuredly,  your  Lord  is  the Almighty, Most Merciful.
verses.10: Recall  that  your  Lord  called  Moses: “Go to the transgressing people.
verses.11: “Pharaoh’s  people;  perhaps  they reform.”
verses.12: He  said,  “My  Lord,  I  fear  lest  they disbelieve me.
verses.13: “I  may  lose  my  temper.  My  tongue gets  tied;  send  for  my  brother  Aaron.
verses.14: “Also,  they  consider  me  a  fugitive;  I fear lest they kill me.”
verses.15: He said, “No, (they will  not).  Go with My proofs. We will be with you, listening.
verses.16: “Go  to  Pharaoh  and  say,  ‘We  are messengers  from  the  Lord  of  the universe.
verses.17: “‘Let the Children of Israel go.’”
verses.18: He  said,  “Did  we  not  raise  you  from infancy,  and  you  spent  many  years with us?
verses.19: “Then  you  committed  the  crime that  you  committed,  and  you  were ungrateful.”
verses.20: He  said,  “Indeed,  I  did  it  when  I  was astray.
verses.21: “Then  I  fled,  when  I  feared  you,  and my  Lord  endowed  me  with  wisdom and  made  me  one  of  the  messengers.
verses.22: “You  are  boasting  that  you  did  me a  favor,  while  enslaving  the  Children of Israel!”
verses.23: Pharaoh  said,  “What  is  the  Lord  of the universe?”
verses.24: He  said,  “The  Lord  of  the  heavens and  the  earth,  and  everything  between  them.  You  should  be  certain about this.”
verses.25: He  said  to  those  around  him,  “Did you hear this?”
verses.26: He  said,  “Your  Lord  and  the  Lord of your ancestors.”
verses.27: He  said,  “Your  messenger  who  is sent to you is crazy.”
verses.28: He  said,  “The  Lord  of  the  east  and the  west,  and  everything  between them, if you understand.”
verses.29: He  said,  “If  you  accept  any  god, other  than  me,  I  will  throw  you  in  the prison.”
verses.30: He  said,  “What  if  I  show  you  something profound?”
verses.31: He  said,  “Then  produce  it,  if  you  are truthful.”
verses.32: He  then  threw  his  staff,  whereupon it became a profound snake.

encrypted.28: قال رب المشرق والمغرب وما بينهما ان كنتم تعقلون

verses.33: And  he  took  out  his  hand,  and  it  was white to the beholders.
verses.34: He  said  to  the  elders  around  him, “This is an experienced magician.
verses.35: “He  wants  to  take  you  out  of  your land,  with  his  magic.  What  do  you suggest?”
verses.36: They  said,  “Respite  him  and  his brother,  and  send  summoners  to every town.
verses.37: “Let  them  summon  every  experienced magician.”
verses.38: The  magicians  were  gathered  at  the appointed  time,  on  the  appointed day.
verses.39: The  people  were  told:  “Come  one and all; let us gather together here.
verses.40: “Maybe  we  will  follow  the  magicians, if they are the winners.”
verses.41: When  the  magicians  came,  they  said to  Pharaoh,  “Do  we  get  paid,  if  we are the winners?”
verses.42: He  said,  “Yes  indeed;  you  will  even be close to me.”
verses.43: Moses  said  to  them  “Throw  what you are going to throw.”
verses.44: They  threw  their  ropes  and  sticks, and  said,  “By  Pharaoh’s  majesty,  we will be the victors.”
verses.45: Moses  threw  his  staff,  whereupon  it swallowed what they fabricated.
verses.46: The magicians fell prostrate.
verses.47: They  said,  “We  believe  in  the  Lord of the universe.
verses.48: “The Lord of Moses and Aaron.”
verses.49: He  said,  “Did  you  believe  with  him before I give you permission? He must  be  your  teacher,  who  taught you  magic. You  will  surely  find  out. I  will  cut  your  hands  and  feet  on alternate  sides.  I  will  crucify  you all.”
verses.50: They  said,  “This  will  not  change  our decision; to our Lord we will return.
verses.51: “We  hope  that  our  Lord  will  forgive us  our  sins,  especially  that  we  are  the first believers.”
verses.52: We  inspired  Moses:  “Travel  with My servants; you will be pursued.”
verses.53: Pharaoh sent to the cities callers.
verses.54: (Proclaiming,) “This is a small gang.
verses.55: “They are now opposing us.
verses.56: “Let us all beware of them.”
verses.57: Consequently,  we  deprived  them  of gardens and springs.
verses.58: And  treasures  and  an  honorable position.
verses.59: Then  we  made  it  an  inheritance  for the Children of Israel.
verses.60: They  pursued  them  towards  the east.
verses.61: When  both  parties  saw  each  other, Moses’  people  said,  “We  will  be caught.”
verses.62: He said, “No way. My Lord is with me; He will guide me.”
verses.63: We  then  inspired  Moses:  “Strike the  sea  with  your  staff,”  whereupon it  parted.  Each  part  was  like  a  great hill.
verses.64: We then delivered them all.
verses.65: We  thus  saved  Moses  and  all  those who were with him.
verses.66: And we drowned the others.

verses.67: This  should  be  a  sufficient  proof, but most people are not believers.
verses.68: Most  assuredly,  your  Lord  is  the Almighty, Most Merciful.
verses.69: Narrate to them Abraham’s history.
verses.70: He  said  to  his  father  and  his  people, “What is this you are worshiping?”
verses.71: They  said,  “We  worship  statues;  we are totally devoted to them.”
verses.72: He  said,  “Can  they  hear  you  when you implore?
verses.73: “Can  they  benefit  you,  or  harm you?”
verses.74: They  said,  “No;  but  we  found  our parents doing this.”
verses.75: He  said,  “Do  you  see  these  idols that you worship.
verses.76: “You and your ancestors.
verses.77: “I  am  against  them,  for  I  am  devoted only to the Lord of the universe.
verses.78: “The  One  who  created  me,  and guided me.
verses.79: “The  One  who  feeds  me  and  waters me.
verses.80: “And when I get sick, He heals me.
verses.81: “The  One  who  puts  me  to  death, then brings me back to life.
verses.82: “The  One  who  hopefully  will  forgive  my  sins  on  the  Day  of  Judgment.
verses.83: “My  Lord,  grant  me  wisdom,  and include me with the righteous.
verses.84: “Let  the  example  I  set  for  the  future generations be a good one.
verses.85: “Make  me  one  of  the  inheritors  of the blissful Paradise.
verses.86: “And  forgive  my  father,  for  he  has gone astray.
verses.87: “And  do  not  forsake  me  on  the  Day of Resurrection.”
verses.88: That  is  the  day  when  neither  money, nor children, can help.
verses.89: Only  those  who  come  to  GOD  with their whole heart (will be saved).
verses.90: Paradise  will  be  presented  to  the righteous.
verses.91: Hell will be set up for the strayers.
verses.92: They  will  be  asked,  “Where  are  the idols you had worshiped
verses.93: “beside  GOD?  Can  they  help  you now? Can they help themselves?”
verses.94: They  will  be  thrown  therein,  together with the strayers.
verses.95: And all of Satan’s soldiers.
verses.96: They will say as they feud therein,
verses.97: “By GOD, we were far astray.
verses.98: “How  could  we  set  you  up  to  rank with the Lord of the universe?
verses.102: “If  only  we  could  get  another chance, we would then believe.”
verses.103: This should be a good lesson. But most people are not believers.
verses.104: Your  Lord  is  the  Almighty,  Most Merciful.
verses.105: The  people  of  Noah  disbelieved  the messengers.
verses.106: Their  brother  Noah  said  to  them, “Would you not be righteous?
verses.107: “I am an honest messenger to you.

verses.108: “You  shall  reverence  GOD  and obey me.
verses.109: “I do not ask you for any wage. My wage  comes  from  the  Lord  of  the universe.
verses.110: “You  shall  reverence  GOD  and obey me.”
verses.111: They  said,  “How  can  we  believe with  you,  when  the  worst  among  us have followed you?”
verses.112: He  said,  “How  do  I  know  what  they did?
verses.113: “Their  judgment  rests  only  with  my Lord, if you could perceive.
verses.115: “I  am  no  more  than  a  clarifying warner.”
verses.116: They  said,  “Unless  you  refrain,  O Noah, you will be stoned.”
verses.117: He  said,  “My  Lord,  my  people  have disbelieved me.
verses.118: “Grant  me  victory  against  them,  and deliver  me  and  my  company  of  believers.”
verses.119: We  delivered  him  and  those  who accompanied him in the loaded ark.
verses.121: This  should  be  a  lesson,  but  most people are not believers.
verses.122: Most  assuredly,  your  Lord  is  the Almighty, Most Merciful.
verses.124: Their  brother  Hûd  said  to  them, “Would you not be righteous?
verses.125: “I am an honest messenger to you.
verses.126: “You  shall  reverence  GOD,  and obey me.
verses.127: “I  do  not  ask  you  for  any  wage;  my wage  comes  from  the  Lord  of  the universe.
verses.128: “You  build  on  every  hill  a  mansion for vanity’s sake.
verses.129: “You  set  up  buildings  as  if  you  last forever.
verses.130: “And  when  you  strike,  you  strike mercilessly.
verses.131: “You  shall  reverence  GOD  and obey me.
verses.132: “Reverence  the  One  who  provided you with all the things you know.
verses.133: “He  provided  you  with  livestock and children.
verses.135: “I  fear  for  you  the  retribution  of  an awesome day.”
verses.136: They  said,  “It  is  the  same  whether you preach, or not preach.
verses.137: “That  affliction  was  limited  to  our ancestors.
verses.139: They  thus  disbelieved  and,  consequently,  we  annihilated  them.  This should  be  a  lesson,  but  most  people are not believers.
verses.140: Most  assuredly,  your  Lord  is  the Almighty, Most Merciful.

data: *26:210 A false messenger is a messenger of Satan, for he is the fabricator of the most horrendous lie. Such a messenger can never denounce idolatry, or preach the worship of God ALONE.

*26:214-223 These verses refer to God’s Messenger of the Covenant: the sum of the gematrical  value  of  “Rashad  Khalifa”  (1230),  plus  the  verse  number  (214)  is 1230 + 214 = 1444 = 19x76 = 19x19x4, and the sum of the verse numbers from 214 through 223 is 2185 = 19x115 (Appendix 1).
*27:1 See Appendix 1 for the meaning of these Quranic initials.

verses.6: Surely, you are receiving the Quran from a Most Wise, Omniscient.
verses.7: Recall that Moses said to his family, “I see a fire; let me bring you news therefrom, or a torch to warm you.”
verses.8: When he came to it, he was called: “Blessed is the One (who is speaking from)  within the  fire, and those around it.” Glory be to GOD, Lord of the universe.
verses.9: “O Moses, this is Me, GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.10: “Throw down your staff.” When he saw it moving like a demon, he turned around and fled. “O Moses, do not be afraid. My messengers shall not fear.
verses.11: “Except those who commit a transgression, then substitute righteousness after sinning; I am Forgiving, Most Merciful.
verses.12: “Put your hand in your pocket; it will come out white, without a blemish. These are among nine miracles to Pharaoh and his people, for they are wicked people.”
verses.13: When our miracles were presented to them, clear and profound, they said, “This is obviously magic.”
verses.14: They rejected them and were utterly convinced of their wrong ways, due to their arrogance. Note the consequences for the evildoers.
verses.15: We endowed  David and  Solomon with knowledge, and they said, “Praise GOD for blessing us more than  many  of  His  believing  servants.”
verses.16: Solomon was David’s heir. He said, “O people, we have been endowed with understanding the language of the birds, and all kinds of things have been bestowed upon us. This is indeed a real blessing.”
verses.17: Mobilized in the service of Solomon were his obedient soldiers of jinns and humans, as well as the birds; all at his disposal.
verses.18: When they approached the valley of the ants, one ant said, “O you ants, go into your homes, lest you get crushed by Solomon and his soldiers, without perceiving.”*
verses.19: He smiled and laughed at her statement,* and said, “My Lord, direct me to be appreciative of the blessings You have bestowed upon me and  my  parents,  and  to  do  the righteous works that please You. Admit me by Your mercy into the company  of  Your  righteous  servants.”
verses.20: He inspected the birds, and noted: “Why do I not see the hoopoe? Why is he missing?
verses.21: “I  will  punish  him  severely  or sacrifice him, unless he gives me a good excuse.”
verses.22: He did not wait for long. (The hoopoe) said, “I have news that you do not have. I have brought to you from Sheba, some important information.

data: *27:18-19 The more unusual the events in a given sura, the stronger the mathematical evidence  supporting  them.  This  helps  assure  us  that  such  strange  phenomena  are indicative of God’s power. This sura’s initials, T.S., constitute a complex part of the mathematical miracles related to the Quranic initials. The unusual birth and miracles of Jesus are in Sura 19, which is prefixed with five Quranic Initials. See Appendix 1 for the details.

verses.23: “I found a woman ruling them, who is blessed with everything, and possesses a tremendous palace.
verses.24: “I found her and her people prostrating before the sun, instead of GOD. The devil has adorned their works in their eyes, and has repulsed them from the path; consequently, they are not guided.”
verses.25: They should have been prostrating before GOD, the One who manifests all the mysteries in the heavens and the earth, and the One who knows everything you conceal and everything you declare.
verses.26: GOD: there is no other god beside Him; the Lord with the great dominion.
verses.27: (Solomon) said, “We will see if you told the truth, or if you are a liar.
verses.28: “Take this letter from me, give it to them,  then  watch  for  their  response.”
verses.29: She said, “O my advisers, I have received an honorable letter.
verses.30: “It is from Solomon, and it is, ‘In the name of GOD, Most Gracious, Most Merciful.’*
verses.31: “Proclaiming: ‘Do not be arrogant; come to me as submitters.’ ”
verses.32: She said, “O my advisers, counsel me in this matter. I am not deciding anything until you advise me.”
verses.33: They said, “We possess the power, we possess the fighting skills, and the ultimate command is in your hand. You decide what to do.”
verses.34: She said, “The kings corrupt any land they invade, and subjugate its dignified people. This is what they usually do.
verses.35: “I am sending a gift to them; let us see what the messengers come back with.”
verses.36: When the hoopoe returned to Solomon  (he  told  him  the  news),  and he  responded  (to  Sheba’s  people): “Are you giving me money? What GOD has given me is far better than what He has given you. You are the ones to rejoice in such gifts.”
verses.37: (To  the  hoopoe,  he  said,)  “Go  back to them (and let them know that) we will come to them with forces they cannot imagine. We will evict them, humiliated and debased.”
verses.38: He said, “O you elders, which of you can bring me her mansion, before they arrive here as submitters?”
verses.39: One afrit from the jinns said, “I can bring it to you before you stand up. I am powerful enough to do this.”
verses.40: The one who possessed knowledge from the book said, “I can bring it to you in the blink of your eye.” When he saw it settled in front of him, he said, “This is a blessing from my Lord, whereby He tests me, to show whether I am appreciative or unappreciative. Whoever is appreciative is appreciative for his own good, and if one turns unappreciative, then my Lord is in no need for him, Most Honorable.”

data: *27:30 The ‘Basmalah’ included in this verse compensates for the ‘Basmalah’ that is  missing  from  Sura  9,  19  suras  earlier.  This  restores  the  total  occurrence  of ‘Basmalah’  to 114, 19x6. See Appendix 29 for details of a vast and profound miracle attached to this ‘Basmalah.’

verses.41: He  said,  “Remodel  her  mansion  for her. Let us see if  she will be guided, or continue with the misguided.”

verses.43: She  had  been  diverted  by  worshiping  idols  instead  of  GOD;  she  belonged to disbelieving people.
verses.44: She  was  told,  “Go  inside  the  palace.”  When  she  saw  its  interior,  she thought  it  was  a  pool  of  water,  and she  (pulled  up  her  dress,)  exposing her  legs. verses.47: They  said,  “We  consider  you  a  bad omen  for  us,  you  and  those  who joined  you.”  He  said,  “Your  omen  is fully  controlled  by  GOD.  Indeed, you are deviant people.”
verses.48: There  were  nine  gangsters  in  the city  who  were  wicked,  and  never  did anything good.
verses.49: They  said,  “Let  us  swear  by  GOD that we kill him and his people, then tell  his  tribe,  ‘We  know  nothing about their death. We are truthful.’ ”
verses.50: They  plotted  and  schemed,  but  we also  plotted  and  schemed,  while they did not perceive.
verses.51: Note  the  consequences  of  their plotting;  we  annihilated  them  and all their people.
verses.52: Here  are  their  homes  utterly  ruined,  because  of  their  transgression. This  should  be  a  lesson  for  people who know.
verses.53: We  save  those  who  believe  and  lead a righteous life.
verses.54: Lot  said  to  his  people,  “How  could you  commit  such  an  abomination, publicly, while you see?
verses.55: “You  practice  sex  with  the  men, lustfully,  instead  of  the  women.  Indeed, you are ignorant people.”
verses.56: The  only  response  from  his  people was  their  saying,  “Banish  Lot’s  family  from  your  town;  they  are  people who wish to be pure.”
verses.57: Consequently,  we  saved  him  and  his family,  except  his  wife;  we  counted her among the doomed.
verses.58: We  showered  them  with  a  certain shower.  It  was  a  miserable  shower upon people who had been warned.
verses.59: Say,  “Praise  be  to  GOD  and  peace be  upon  His  servants  whom  He chose.  Is  GOD  better,  or  the  idols some people set up?”

titles.59:
Make No Distinction Among
God’s Messengers

verses.60: Who is the One who created the heavens and the earth? Who is the One who sends down to you from the sky water, whereby we produce gardens  full  of  beauty—you  could not possibly manufacture its trees? Is it another god with GOD? Indeed, they are people who have deviated.
verses.61: Who is the One who made the earth habitable,  caused  rivers  to  run through it, placed on it mountains, and created a barrier between the two waters? Is it another god with GOD? Indeed, most of them do not know.
verses.62: Who is the One who rescues those who  become  desperate  and  call upon Him, relieves adversity, and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is it another god with GOD? Rarely do you take heed.
verses.63: Who is the One who guides you in the darkness of land and sea? Who is the One who sends the winds with good news, signaling His mercy? Is it another god with GOD? Most exalted is GOD, above having any partner.
verses.64: Who is the One who initiates the creation, then repeats it? Who is the One who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? Is it another god with GOD? Say, “Show me your proof, if you are truthful.”
verses.65: Say, “No one in the heavens and the earth knows the future except GOD. They do not even perceive how or when they will be resurrected.”
verses.66: In fact, their knowledge concerning the Hereafter is confused. In fact, they harbor doubts about it. In fact, they are totally heedless thereof.
verses.67: Those who disbelieved said, “After we turn into dust, and also our parents, do we get brought out?
verses.68: “We  have  been  given  the  same promise in the past. These are nothing but tales from the past.”
verses.69: Say, “Roam the earth and note the consequences for the guilty.”
verses.70: Do not grieve over them, and do not be annoyed by their scheming.
verses.71: They say, “When will that promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
verses.72: Say,  “You  are  already  suffering some of the retribution you challenge.”
verses.73: Your Lord is full of grace towards the people, but most of them are unappreciative.
verses.74: Your Lord fully knows what their chests hide, and what they declare.
verses.75: There is nothing in the heavens and the earth that is hidden (from God); everything is in a profound record.
verses.76: This Quran settles many issues for the Children of Israel; issues that they are still disputing.
verses.77: And most assuredly, it is a guide and mercy for the believers.
verses.78: Your Lord is the One who judges among them in accordance with His rules. He is the Almighty, the Omniscient.

encrypted.62: امن يجيب المضطر اذا دعاه ويكشف السوء ويجعلكم خلفاء الارض االه مع الله قليلا ما تذكرون
encrypted.63: امن يهديكم في ظلمات البر والبحر ومن يرسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته االه مع الله تعالى الله عما يشركون

encrypted.67: وقال الذين كفروا ااذا كنا ترابا واباؤنا ائنا لمخرجون
encrypted.68: لقد وعدنا هذا نحن واباؤنا من قبل ان هذا الا اساطير الاولين

encrypted.70: ولا تحزن عليهم ولا تكن في ضيق مما يمكرون

encrypted.74: وان ربك ليعلم ما تكن صدورهم وما يعلنون

verses.79: Therefore,  put  your  trust  in  GOD; you are following the manifest truth.
verses.80: You  cannot  make  the  dead,  nor  the deaf, hear the call, if they turn away.
verses.81: Nor  can  you  guide  the  blind  out  of their  straying.  The  only  ones  who will  hear  you  are  those  who  believe in  our  revelations,  and  decide  to  be submitters.
verses.82: At  the  right  time,  we  will  produce for  them  a  creature,  made  of  earthly materials,  declaring  that  the  people are  not  certain  about  our  revelations.
verses.83: The  day  will  come  when  we  summon  from  every  community  some  of those  who  did  not  believe  in  our proofs, forcibly.
verses.84: When  they  arrive,  He  will  say,  “You have  rejected  My  revelations,  before  acquiring  knowledge  about them. Is this not what you did?”
verses.85: They  will  incur  the  requital  for  their wickedness; they will say nothing.
verses.86: Have  they  not  seen  that  we  made the  night  for  their  rest,  and  the  day lighted?  These  should  be  sufficient proofs for people who believe.
verses.87: On  the  day  when  the  horn  is  blown, everyone  in  the  heavens  and  the earth  will  be  horrified,  except  those chosen by GOD. All will come before Him, forcibly.
verses.88: When  you  look  at  the  mountains, you  think  that  they  are  standing  still. But  they  are  moving,  like  the  clouds. Such  is  the  manufacture  of  GOD, who  perfected  everything.  He  is fully  Cognizant  of  everything  you do.
verses.89: Those  who  bring  good  works  (in their  records)  will  receive  far  better rewards,  and  they  will  be  perfectly secure from the horrors of that day.
verses.90: As  for  those  who  bring  evil  works, they will be forced into Hell. Do you not get requited for what you did?
verses.91: I  am  simply  commanded  to  worship the  Lord  of  this  town—He  has  made it  a  safe  sanctuary—and  He  possesses  all  things.  I  am  commanded  to  be a submitter.
verses.92: And  to  recite  the  Quran.  Whoever is guided is guided for his own good, and if they go astray, then say, “I am simply a warner.”
verses.93: And  say,  “Praise  be  to  GOD;  He  will show  you  His  proofs,  until  you recognize them. Your Lord is never unaware of anything you do.”

Sura 28: History

data: *27:82 (2 + 7 + 8 + 2 = 19) The computer was required to unveil the Quran’s mathematical  miracle,  and  it  proved  that  most  people  have discarded  God’s message  (see Appendices 1 & 19).
*28:1 See Appendix 1 for details of the Quran’s miraculous mathematical code, and the meaning or significance of these Quranic Initials.

verses.2: These  (letters)  constitute  proofs  of this profound book.
verses.3: We  recite  to  you  herein  some  history  of  Moses  and  Pharaoh,  truthfully,  for  the  benefit  of  people  who believe.
verses.4: Pharaoh  turned  into  a  tyrant  on earth,  and  discriminated  against some  people.  He  persecuted  a  helpless  group  of  them,  slaughtering their  sons,  while  sparing  their daughters. He was indeed wicked.
verses.5: We  willed  to  compensate  those  who were  oppressed  on  earth,  and  to turn  them  into  leaders,  and  make them the inheritors.
verses.6: And  to  establish  them  on  earth,  and to  give  Pharaoh,  Hamaan,  and  their troops a taste of their own medicine.
verses.7: We  inspired  Moses’  mother: “Nurse  him,  and  when  you  fear  for his  life,  throw  him  into  the  river without  fear  or  grief.  We  will  return him  to  you,  and  will  make  him  one of the messengers.”
verses.8: Pharaoh’s  family  picked  him  up, only to have him lead the opposition and to be a source of grief for them. That  is  because  Pharaoh,  Hamaan, and their troops were transgressors.
verses.9: Pharaoh’s  wife  said,  “This  can  be  a joyous  find  for  me  and  you.  Do  not kill  him,  for  he  may  be  of  some benefit  for  us,  or  we  may  adopt  him to be our son.” They had no idea.
verses.10: The  mind  of  Moses’  mother  was growing  so  anxious  that  she  almost gave  away  his  identity.  But  we strengthened  her  heart,  to  make  her  a believer.
verses.11: She  said  to  his  sister,  “Trace  his path.”  She  watched  him  from  afar, while they did not perceive.
verses.12: We  forbade  him  from  accepting  all the  nursing  mothers.  (His  sister) then  said,  “I  can  show  you  a  family that  can  raise  him  for  you,  and  take good care of him.”
verses.13: Thus,  we  restored  him  to  his  mother,  in  order  to  please  her,  remove her  worries,  and  to  let  her  know  that GOD’s  promise  is  the  truth.  However, most of them do not know.
verses.14: When  he  reached  maturity  and strength,  we  endowed  him  with  wisdom  and  knowledge.  We  thus  reward the righteous.
verses.15: Once  he  entered  the  city  unexpectedly,  without  being  recognized  by the  people.  He  found  two  men  fighting;  one  was  (a  Hebrew)  from  his people,  and  the  other  was  (an  Egyptian)  from  his  enemies.  The  one from  his  people  called  on  him  for help  against  his  enemy.  Moses punched  him,  killing  him.  He  said, “This is the work of the devil; he is a real  enemy,  and  a  profound  misleader.”
verses.16: He  said,  “My  Lord,  I  have  wronged my  soul.  Please  forgive  me,”  and  He forgave  him.  He  is  the  Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.17: He  said,  “My  Lord,  in  return  for Your  blessings  upon  me,  I  will  never be a supporter of the guilty ones.”
verses.18: In  the  morning,  he  was  in  the  city, afraid  and  watchful.  The  one  who sought  his  help  yesterday,  asked  for his  help  again.  Moses  said  to  him, “You are really a troublemaker.”

titles.12: The Infant Returned to His Mother

encrypted.3: نتلو عليك من نبا موسى وفرعون بالحق لقوم يؤمنون
encrypted.4: ان فرعون علا في الارض وجعل اهلها شيعا يستضعف طائفة منهم يذبح ابناءهم ويستحيي نساءهم انه كان من المفسدين
encrypted.5: ونريد ان نمن على الذين استضعفوا في الارض ونجعلهم ائمة ونجعلهم الوارثين
encrypted.6: ونمكن لهم في الارض ونري فرعون وهامان وجنودهما منهم ما كانوا يحذرون
encrypted.7: واوحينا الى ام موسى ان ارضعيه فاذا خفت عليه فالقيه في اليم ولا تخافي ولا تحزني انا رادوه اليك وجاعلوه من المرسلين
encrypted.8: فالتقطه ال فرعون ليكون لهم عدوا وحزنا ان فرعون وهامان وجنودهما كانوا خاطئين
encrypted.9: وقالت امرات فرعون قرت عين لي ولك لا تقتلوه عسى ان ينفعنا او نتخذه ولدا وهم لا يشعرون
encrypted.10: واصبح فؤاد ام موسى فارغا ان كادت لتبدي به لولا ان ربطنا على قلبها لتكون من المؤمنين
encrypted.11: وقالت لاخته قصيه فبصرت به عن جنب وهم لا يشعرون
encrypted.12: وحرمنا عليه المراضع من قبل فقالت هل ادلكم على اهل بيت يكفلونه لكم وهم له ناصحون
encrypted.13: فرددناه الى امه كي تقر عينها ولا تحزن ولتعلم ان وعد الله حق ولكن اكثرهم لا يعلمون
encrypted.14: ولما بلغ اشده واستوى اتيناه حكما وعلما وكذلك نجزي المحسنين
encrypted.15: ودخل المدينة على حين غفلة من اهلها فوجد فيها رجلين يقتتلان هذا من شيعته وهذا من عدوه فاستغاثه الذي من شيعته على الذي من عدوه فوكزه موسى فقضى عليه قال هذا من عمل الشيطان انه عدو مضل مبين
encrypted.16: قال رب اني ظلمت نفسي فاغفر لي فغفر له انه هو الغفور الرحيم
encrypted.17: قال رب بما انعمت علي فلن اكون ظهيرا للمجرمين
encrypted.18: فاصبح في المدينة خائفا يترقب فاذا الذي استنصره بالامس يستصرخه قال له موسى انك لغوي مبين

verses.19: Before  he  attempted  to  strike  their common  enemy,  he  said,  “O  Moses, do you want to kill me, as you killed the  other  man  yesterday?  Obviously,  you  wish  to  be  a  tyrant  on  earth; you do not wish to be righteous.”
verses.20: A  man  came  running  from  the  other side  of  the  city,  saying,  “O  Moses, the  people  are  plotting  to  kill  you. You  better  leave  immediately.  I  am giving you good advice.”
verses.21: He  fled  the  city,  afraid  and  watchful.  He  said,  “My  Lord,  save  me from the oppressive people.”
verses.22: As  he  traveled  towards  Midyan,  he said,  “May  my  Lord  guide  me  in  the right path.”
verses.23: When  he  reached  Midyan’s  water, he  found  a  crowd  of  people  watering,  and  noticed  two  women  waiting on  the  side.  He  said,  “What  is  it  that you  need?”  They  said,  “We  are  not able  to  water,  until  the  crowd  disperses,  and  our  father  is  an  old man.”
verses.24: He  watered  for  them,  then  turned to  the  shade,  saying,  “My  Lord, whatever  provision  you  send  to  me, I am in dire need for it.”
verses.25: Soon,  one  of  the  two  women  approached  him,  shyly,  and  said,  “My father  invites  you  to  pay  you  for watering  for  us.”  When  he  met  him, and  told  him  his  story,  he  said, “Have  no  fear.  You  have  been  saved from the oppressive people.”
verses.26: One  of  the  two  women  said,  “O  my father,  hire  him.  He  is  the  best  one to hire, for he is strong and honest.”
verses.27: He  said,  “I  wish  to  offer  one  of  my two  daughters  for  you  to  marry,  in return  for  working  for  me  for  eight pilgrimages;  if  you  make  them  ten,  it will  be  voluntary  on  your  part.  I  do not  wish  to  make  this  matter  too difficult  for  you.  You  will  find  me, GOD willing, righteous.”
verses.28: He  said,  “It  is  an  agreement  between  me  and  you.  Whichever  period I fulfill, you will not be averse to either  one.  GOD  is  the  guarantor  of what we said.”
verses.29: When  he  had  fulfilled  his  obligation,  he  traveled  with  his  family (towards  Egypt),  He  saw  from  the slope  of  Mount  Sinai  a  fire.  He  said to  his  family,  “Stay  here.  I  have  seen a  fire.  Maybe  I  can  bring  to  you news,  or  a  portion  of  the  fire  to warm you.”
verses.30: When  he  reached  it,  he  was  called from  the  edge  of  the  right  side  of  the valley,  in  the  blessed  spot  where  the burning  bush  was  located:  “O  Moses,  this  is  Me.  GOD;  Lord  of  the universe.”
verses.31: “Throw  down  your  staff.”  When  he saw  it  moving  like  a  demon,  he turned  around  and  fled.  “O  Moses, come  back;  do  not  be  afraid.  You are perfectly safe.
verses.32: “Put  your  hand  into  your  pocket;  it will  come  out  white  without  a  blemish.  Fold  your  wings  and  settle  down from  your  fear.  These  are  two proofs  from  your  Lord,  to  be  shown to  Pharaoh  and  his  elders;  they  have been wicked people.”
verses.33: He  said,  “My  Lord,  I  killed  one  of them, and I fear lest they kill me.

verses.34: “Also,  my  brother  Aaron  is  more eloquent  than  I.  Send  him  with  me as  a  helper  to  confirm  and  strengthen  me.  I  fear  lest  they  disbelieve me.”
verses.35: He  said,  “We  will  strengthen  you with  your  brother,  and  we  will  provide  you  both  with  manifest  authority.  Thus,  they  will  not  be  able  to touch  either  one  of  you.  With  our miracles,  the  two  of  you,  together with those who follow you, will be the victors.”
verses.36: When  Moses  went  to  them  with  our proofs,  clear  and  profound,  they said,  “This  is  fabricated  magic.  We have  never  heard  of  this  from  our ancient ancestors.”
verses.37: Moses  said,  “My  Lord  knows  best who  brought  the  guidance  from Him,  and  who  will  be  the  ultimate victors.  Surely,  the  transgressors never succeed.”
verses.38: Pharaoh  said,  “O  you  elders,  I  have not known of any god for you other than  me.  Therefore,  fire  the  adobe, O  Hamaan,  in  order  to  build  a  tower, that I may take a look at the god of Moses. I am sure that he is a liar.”
verses.39: Thus,  he  and  his  troops  continued to commit arrogance on earth, without  any  right,  and  thought  that  they would not be returned to us.
verses.40: Consequently,  we  punished  him and  his  troops,  by  throwing  them into  the  sea.  Note  the  consequences for the transgressors.
verses.41: We  made  them  imams  who  led  their people  to  Hell.  Furthermore,  on  the Day  of  Resurrection,  they  will  have no help.
verses.42: They  incurred  in  this  life  condemnation,  and  on  the  Day  of  Resurrection they will be despised.
verses.43: We  gave  Moses  the  scripture— after  having  annihilated  the  previous  generations,  and  after  setting the  examples  through  them—to provide  enlightenment  for  the  people,  and  guidance,  and  mercy,  that they may take heed.
verses.44: You  were  not  present  on  the  slope of  the  western  mount,  when  we  issued  the  command  to  Moses;  you were not a witness.*
verses.45: But  we  established  many  generations,  and,  because  of  the  length  of time,  (they  deviated).  Nor  were  you among  the  people  of  Midyan,  reciting  our  revelations  to  them.  But  we did send messengers.

titles.44: Addressing God’s Messenger of the Covenant

data: *28:43 The Torah is the collection of all the scriptures revealed to all the prophets of Israel, including the book of Moses. The Quran consistently states that Moses was given a  book,  or  “the  Statute  Book.”  Nowhere  in  the  Quran  do  we  see  that  Moses  was given “the Torah.” Today’s Old Testament, therefore, is the Torah (see 3:50, 5:46).

*28:44  The  name  of  this  messenger  is  confirmed  mathematically:  by  placing  the gematrical  value  of  “Rashad  Khalifa”  (1230)  next  to  the  verse  number  (44),  we  get 123044 = 19x6476.

verses.46: Nor were you on the slope of Mount Sinai when we called (Moses). But it is mercy from your Lord, (towards the people,) in order to warn people who received no warner before you, that they may take heed.
verses.47: Thus, they cannot say, when a disaster strikes them as a consequence of their own deeds, “Our Lord, had You sent a messenger to us, we would have followed Your revelations, and would have been believers.”
verses.48: Now that the truth has come to them from us, they said, “If only we could be given what was given to Moses!” Did they not disbelieve in what was given to Moses in the past? They said, “Both (scriptures) are works of magic  that  copied  one  another.” They also said, “We are disbelievers in both of them.”
verses.49: Say,  “Then  produce  a  scripture from  GOD  with  better  guidance than the two, so I can follow it, if you are truthful.”
verses.50: If they fail to respond to you, then know that they follow only their own opinions. Who is farther astray than those who follow their own opinions, without guidance from GOD? GOD does not guide such wicked people.
verses.51: We have delivered the message to them, that they may take heed.
verses.52: Those whom we blessed with  the previous scriptures will believe in this.
verses.53: When it is recited to them, they will say, “We believe in it. This is the truth from our Lord. Even before we heard of it, we were submitters.”
verses.54: To these we grant twice the reward, because they steadfastly persevere. They counter evil works with good works, and from our provisions to them, they give.
verses.55: When they come across vain talk, they disregard it and say, “We are responsible for our deeds, and you are  responsible  for  your  deeds. Peace be upon you. We do not wish to behave like the ignorant ones.”
verses.56: You cannot guide the ones you love  GOD is the only One who guides in accordance with His will, and in accordance with His knowledge of those who deserve the guidance.
verses.57: They said, “If we follow your guidance, we will suffer persecution.” Did we not establish for them a Sacred Sanctuary, to which all kinds of fruits are offered, as a provision from us? Indeed, most of them do not know.
verses.58: Many a community we annihilated for  turning unappreciative  of  their lives. Consequently, here are their homes,  nothing  but  uninhabited ruins after them, except a few. We were the inheritors.
verses.59: For your Lord never annihilates any community without sending a messenger in the midst thereof, to recite our revelations to them. We never annihilate any community, unless its people are wicked.

verses.60: Everything that is given to you is only the material of this life, and its vanity. What is with GOD is far better, and everlasting. Do you not understand?
verses.61: Is one whom we promised a good promise that will surely come to pass, equal to one whom we provide with the temporary materials of this life, then suffers eternal doom on the Day of Resurrection?
verses.62: The day will come when He calls upon  them,  saying,  “Where  are those idols you had set up beside Me?”
verses.63: Those who  incurred  the  judgment will say, “Our Lord, these are the ones we misled; we misled them only because we ourselves had gone astray. We now devote ourselves totally to You. They were not really worshiping us.”
verses.64: It will be said, “Call upon your idols (to help you).” They will call upon them,  but  they  will  not  respond. They will suffer the retribution, and wish that they were guided!
verses.65: On that day, He will ask everyone, “How did you respond to the messengers?”
verses.66: They will be so stunned by the facts on that day, they will be speechless.
verses.67: As for those who repent, believe, and lead a righteous life, they will end up with the winners.
verses.68: Your Lord is the One who creates whatever He wills, and chooses; no one else does any choosing. Glory be to GOD, the Most Exalted. He is far above needing partners.
verses.69: Your  Lord  knows  the  innermost thoughts hidden in their chests, as well as everything they declare.
verses.70: He is the one GOD; there is no other god beside Him. To Him belongs all praise  in  this  first  life,  and  in  the Hereafter.  All  judgment  belongs with Him, and to Him you will be returned.
verses.71: Say, “What if GOD made the night perpetual, until the Day of Resurrection?  Which  god,  other  than GOD, can provide you with light? Do you not hear?”
verses.72: Say, “What if GOD made the daylight perpetual, until the Day of Resurrection?  Which  god,  other than GOD, can provide you with a night for  your rest? Do you not see?”
verses.73: It is mercy from Him that He created for you the night and the day in order to rest (during the night), then seek His provisions (during the day), that you may be appreciative.
verses.74: The day will come when He asks them, “Where are the idols you had fabricated to rank with Me?”
verses.75: We will select from every community a witness, then say, “Present your proof.” They will realize then that all truth belongs with GOD, while the idols they had fabricated will abandon them.

verses.76: Qãroon (the slave driver) was one of Moses’ people who betrayed them and oppressed them. We gave him so  many  treasures  that  the  keys thereof were almost too heavy for the strongest band. His people said to him, “Do not be so arrogant; GOD does not love those who are arrogant.
verses.77: “Use the provisions bestowed upon you by GOD to seek the abode of the Hereafter,  without  neglecting  your share in this world. Be charitable, as GOD has been charitable towards you. Do not keep on corrupting the earth. GOD does not love the corruptors.”
verses.78: He said, “I attained all this because of my own cleverness.” Did he not realize that GOD had annihilated before him  generations  that were much stronger than he, and greater in number? The (annihilated) transgressors were not asked about their crimes.
verses.79: One day, he came out to his people in full splendor. Those who preferred this worldly life said, “Oh, we wish that we possess what Qãroon has attained. Indeed, he is very fortunate.”
verses.80: As for those who were blessed with knowledge, they said, “Woe to you, GOD’s recompense is far better for those who believe and lead a righteous life.” None attains this except the steadfast.
verses.81: We then caused the earth to swallow him and his mansion. No army could  have  helped  him  against GOD; he was not destined to be a winner.
verses.82: Those who were envious of him the day before said, “Now we realize that GOD is the One who provides for  whomever  He  chooses  from among His servants, and withholds. If it were not for GOD’s grace towards us, He could have caused the earth to swallow us too. We now realize  that  the  disbelievers  never succeed.”
verses.83: We reserve the abode of the Hereafter for those who do not seek exaltation  on  earth,  nor  corruption. The ultimate victory belongs to the righteous.
verses.84: Whoever  works  righteousness  receives a far better reward. As for those who commit sins, the retribution for their sins is precisely equivalent to their works.
verses.85: Surely,  the  One  who  decreed  the Quran for you will summon you to a predetermined  appointment.  Say, “My Lord is fully aware of those who uphold the guidance, and those who have gone astray.”
verses.86: You  never  expected  this  scripture to come your way; but this is a mercy from  your  Lord.  Therefore,  you shall not side with the disbelievers.
verses.87: Nor  shall  you  be  diverted  from GOD’s revelations, after they have come to you, and invite the others to your Lord. And do not ever fall into idol worship.
verses.88: You shall not worship beside GOD any other god. There is no other god beside Him. Everything perishes except His presence. To Him belongs all sovereignty, and to Him you will be returned.

verses.1: A.L.M.*
verses.2: Do the people think that they will be left to say, “We believe,” without being put to the test?
verses.3: We have tested those before them, for GOD must distinguish those who are truthful, and He must expose the liars.
verses.4: Do  those  who  commit  sins  think that they can ever fool us? Wrong indeed is their judgment.
verses.5: Anyone  hoping  to  meet  GOD, (should  know  that)  such  a  meeting with GOD will most assuredly come to pass. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.
verses.6: Those who strive, strive for their own good. GOD is in no need of anyone.
verses.7: Those who believe and lead a righteous life, we will certainly remit their sins, and will certainly reward them generously for their righteous works.
verses.8: We enjoined the human being to honor his parents. But if they try to force you to set up idols beside Me, do not obey them. To Me is your ultimate return, then I will inform you of everything you had done.
verses.9: Those who believe and lead a righteous  life,  we  will  certainly  admit them with the righteous.
verses.10: Among the people there are those who say, “We believe in GOD,” but as soon as they suffer any hardship because of GOD, they equate the people’s  persecution  with  GOD’s retribution. But if blessings from your Lord come your way, they say, “We were with you.” Is GOD not fully aware of the people’s innermost thoughts?
verses.11: GOD will most certainly distinguish those who believe, and He will most certainly expose the hypocrites.
verses.12: Those who disbelieved said to those who believed, “If you follow our way, we will be responsible for your sins.” Not true; they cannot bear any of their sins. They are liars.
verses.13: In fact, they will carry their own sins, in addition to loads of other people’s sins for which they were responsible. Most certainly, they will be asked on the Day of Resurrection about their false claims.
verses.14: We sent Noah to his people, and he stayed  with  them  one  thousand years, less fifty.* Subsequently, they incurred the flood because of their transgressions.

data: *29:1 See Appendix 1 for details of the Quran’s mathematical composition, and the meaning of these previously mysterious Quranic Initials.

*29:14 Since the Quran’s miracle is mathematical, the numbers especially constitute an important part of the 19-based code. Thus, the numbers mentioned in the Quran add up to 162146, or 19x8534 (see Appendix 1 for the details).

verses.15: We saved him and those who accompanied him in the ark, and we set it up as a lesson for all the people.
verses.16: Abraham said to his people, “You shall worship GOD, and reverence Him. This is better for you, if you only knew.
verses.17:
“What you worship instead of GOD are powerless idols; you have invented a lie.”

God: The Only Source of Provisions
The idols you worship beside GOD do  not  possess  any  provisions  for you. Therefore, you shall seek provisions only from GOD. You shall worship Him alone, and be appreciative of Him; to Him is your ultimate return.
verses.18: If  you  disbelieve,  generations  before you have also disbelieved. The sole function of the messenger is to deliver (the message).
verses.19: Have they not seen how GOD initiates the creation, then repeats it? This is easy for GOD to do.
verses.20: Say, “Roam the earth and find out the origin of life.”* For GOD will thus  initiate  the  creation  in  the Hereafter. GOD is Omnipotent.
verses.21: He condemns to retribution whomever He wills, and showers His mercy upon whomever He wills. Ultimately, to Him you will be turned over.
verses.22: None of you can escape from these facts, on earth or in the heaven, and you have none beside GOD as a Lord and Master.
verses.23: Those  who  disbelieve  in  GOD’s revelations,  and  in  meeting  Him, have  despaired  from  My  mercy. They have incurred a painful retribution.
verses.24: The only response from his people was their saying, “Kill him, or burn him.” But GOD saved him from the fire. This should provide lessons for people who believe.
verses.25: He said, “You worship beside GOD powerless idols due to peer pressure, just to preserve some friendship among you in this worldly life. But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will disown one another, and curse one another. Your destiny is Hell, wherein you cannot help one another.”
verses.26: Lot believed with him and said, “I am emigrating to my Lord. He is the Almighty, the Most Wise.”
verses.27: We granted him Isaac and Jacob, we  assigned  to  his  descendants prophethood and the scriptures, we endowed him with his due recompense in this life, and in the Hereafter  he  will  surely be with  the righteous.
verses.28: Lot said to his people, “You commit such an abomination, no one in the world has ever done it before you.
verses.29: “You practice sex with the men, you commit highway robbery, and you allow  all  kinds  of  vice  in  your society.” The only response from his people was to say, “Bring to us GOD’s retribution, if you are truthful.”

data: *29:19-20 We learn from the Quran that evolution is a divinely guided process. See Appendix 31 for the details.

verses.30: He said, “My Lord, grant me victory over these wicked people.”
verses.31: When  our  messengers  went  to Abraham  with  good  news  (about Isaac’s birth), they also said, “We are on our way to annihilate the people of that town (Sodom). For its people have been wicked.”
verses.32: He said, “But Lot is living there They said, “We are fully aware of everyone who lives in it. We will of course save him and his family, except his wife; she is doomed.”
verses.33: When  our  messengers  arrived  at Lot’s place, they were mistreated, and he was embarrassed by their presence. But they said, “Have no fear, and do not worry. We will save you and your family, except your wife; she is doomed.
verses.34: “We will pour upon the people of this town a disaster from the sky, as a consequence of their wickedness.”
verses.35: We left standing some of their ruins, to serve as a profound lesson for people who understand.
verses.36: To  Midyan  we  sent  their  brother Shu‘aib. He said, “O my people, you shall worship GOD and seek the Last Day, and do not roam the earth corruptingly.”
verses.37: They  disbelieved  him  and,  consequently, the earthquake annihilated them; they were left dead in their homes by morning.
verses.38: Similarly, ‘Ãd and Thamoud (were annihilated). This is made manifest to you through their ruins. The devil had adorned their works in their eyes, and had diverted them from the path, even though they had eyes.
verses.39: Also  Qãroon,  Pharaoh,  and  Hãmãn; Moses went to them with clear signs. But they continued to commit tyranny  on  earth.  Consequently, they could not evade (the retribution).
verses.40: All those disbelievers were doomed as a consequence of their sins. Some of them we annihilated by violent winds, some were annihilated by the quake, some we caused the earth to swallow,  and  some  we  drowned. GOD is not the One who wronged them; it is they who wronged their own souls.
verses.41: The allegory of those who accept other masters beside GOD is that of the spider and her home; the flimsiest of all homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.
verses.42: GOD knows full well that whatever they worship beside Him are really nothing.  He is the Almighty, the Most Wise.
verses.43: We  cite  these  examples  for  the people, and none appreciate them except the knowledgeable.
verses.44: GOD created the heavens and the earth,  truthfully.  This  provides  a sufficient proof for the believers.

data: *29:41-43 It takes a knowledgeable person to know that the Black Widow spider kills her mate. The use of the feminine reference to the spider in 29:41 is thus significant. This is in addition to the fact that the spider web is physically very flimsy.

verses.45: You  shall  recite  what  is  revealed  to you  of  the  scripture,  and  observe  the Contact  Prayers  (Salat),  for  the Contact  Prayers  prohibit  evil  and vice.  But  the  remembrance  of  GOD (through  Salat)  is  the  most  important  objective.*  GOD  knows  everything you do.
verses.46: Do  not  argue  with  the  people  of  the scripture  (Jews,  Christians,  &  Muslims)  except  in  the  nicest  possible manner—unless they transgress— and  say,  “We  believe  in  what  was revealed  to  us  and  in  what  was revealed  to  you,  and  our  god  and your  god  is  one  and  the  same;  to Him we are submitters.”
verses.47: We  have  revealed  to  you  this  scripture,  and  those  whom  we  blessed with  the  previous  scripture  will believe  in  it.  Also,  some  of  your people  will  believe  in  it.  Indeed, those  who  disregard  our  revelations are the real disbelievers.
verses.48: You  did  not  read  the  previous  scriptures,  nor  did  you  write  them  with your  hand.  In  that  case,  the  rejectors would  have  had  reason  to  harbor doubts.
verses.49: In  fact,  these  revelations  are  clear  in the  chests  of  those  who  possess knowledge.  Only  the  wicked  will disregard our revelations.
verses.50: They  said,  “If  only  miracles*  could come  down  to  him  from  his  Lord!” Say,  “All  miracles  come  only  from GOD;  I  am  no  more  than  a  manifest warner.”
verses.51: Is  it  not  enough  of  a  miracle*  that we sent down to you this book, being recited  to  them?  This  is  indeed  a mercy  and  a  reminder  for  people who believe.
verses.52: Say,  “GOD  suffices  as  a  witness  between  me  and  you.  He  knows  everything  in  the  heavens  and  the  earth. Surely,  those  who  believe  in  falsehood  and  disbelieve  in  GOD  are  the real losers.”
verses.53: They  challenge  you  to  bring  the retribution!  If  it  were  not  for  a predetermined  appointment, the retribution  would  have  come  to them  immediately.*  Certainly,  it  will come  to  them  suddenly,  when  they least expect it.
verses.54: They  challenge  you  to  bring  retribution!  Hell  already  surrounds  the  disbelievers.

data: *29:45 Your god is whatever occupies your mind most of the time (see 20:14 & Appendix 27).

*29:48-51  It  was  the  will  of  the  Most  Wise  to  separate  the  Quran  from  its  awesome mathematical miracle by 1400 years. Seeing how the Muslims en masse have idolized Muhammad, it is obvious that if the Quran’s mathematical miracle were also revealed through Muhammad, many people would have worshiped him as God incarnate. As it is, God willed that the great miracle of the Quran (74:30-35) shall await the computer age, and to have it revealed through His Messenger of the Covenant (see Appendices 1, 2, & 26).

*29:53 Anyone who dies before the age of 40 goes to Heaven, and not everyone deserves this.  People  sometimes  lament  the  slowness  of  justice  when  a  vicious  criminal  is  not executed promptly. God knows who deserves Heaven (see 46:15 and Appendix 32).

verses.55: The day will come when the retribution  overwhelms  them,  from  above them  and  from  beneath  their  feet; He will say, “Taste the consequences of your works.”
verses.56: O  My  servants  who  believed,  My earth is spacious, so worship Me.
verses.57: Every soul will taste death, then to us you will be ultimately returned.
verses.58: Those  who  believe  and  lead  a righteous life, we will surely settle them  in  Paradise,  with  mansions and flowing streams. Eternally they abide  therein.  What  a  beautiful reward for the workers.
verses.59: They  are  the  ones  who  steadfastly persevere, and trust in their Lord.
verses.60: Many a creature that does not carry its provision, GOD provides for it, as well as for you. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.
verses.61: If you ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth, and put the sun and the moon in your service,” they will say, “GOD.” Why then did they deviate?
verses.62: GOD is the One who increases the provision for whomever He chooses from  among  His  creatures,  and withholds it. GOD is fully aware of all things.
verses.63: If you ask them, “Who sends down from the sky water, to revive dead land,”  they  will  say,  “GOD.”  Say, “Praise GOD.” Most of them do not understand.
verses.64: This  worldly  life  is no more than vanity and play, while the abode of the Hereafter is the real life, if they only knew.
verses.65: When they ride on a ship, they implore GOD, devoting their prayers to Him. But as soon as He saves them to the shore, they revert to idolatry.
verses.66: Let them disbelieve in what we have given them, and let them enjoy temporarily; they will surely find out.
verses.67: Have they not seen that we have established a Sacred Sanctuary that we made secure, while all around them the people are in constant danger? Would they still believe in falsehood, and reject GOD’s blessings?
verses.68: Who  is  more  evil  than  one  who fabricates lies and attributes them to GOD, or rejects the truth when it comes to him? Is Hell not a just retribution for the disbelievers?
verses.69: As for those who strive in our cause, we will surely guide them in our paths. Most assuredly, GOD is with the pious.

titles.56: Immigrate in the Cause of God

verses.3: In the nearest land. After their defeat, they will rise again and win.

titles.1:
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sura 30: Romans
(Al-Room) 
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

encrypted.3: في ادنى الارض وهم من بعد غلبهم سيغلبون

data: *30:1 See Appendix 1 for the detailed explanation of these previously mysterious initials.

verses.4: Within several  years.  Such is GOD’s decision,  both  in  the  first  prophecy, and  the  second.  On  that  day,  the believers shall rejoice
verses.5: in  GOD’s  victory.  He  grants  victory to whomever He wills. He is the Almighty, Most Merciful.
verses.6: Such  is  GOD’s  promise—and  GOD never  breaks  His  promise—but most people do not know.
verses.7: They  care  only  about  things  of  this world that are visible to them, while being  totally  oblivious  to  the  Hereafter.
verses.8: Why  do  they  not  reflect  on  themselves?  GOD  did  not  create  the heav-ens  and  the  earth,  and  everything  between  them,  except  for  a specific  purpose,  and  for  a  specific life  span.  However,  most  people, with  regard  to  meeting  their  Lord, are disbe-lievers.
verses.9: Have  they  not  roamed  the  earth  and noted  the  consequences  for  those who  preceded  them?  They  used  to be  more  powerful,  more  prosperous,  and  more  productive  on earth.  Their  messengers  went  to them  with  clear  signs.  Consequently,  GOD  was  not  the  One  who wronged  them,  they  are  the  ones who wronged their own souls.
verses.10: The  consequences  for  those  who committed  evil  had  to  be  evil.  That is  because  they  rejected  GOD’s revelations, and ridiculed them.
verses.11: GOD  is  the  One  who  initiates  the creation  and  repeats  it.  Ultimately, you will be returned to Him.
verses.12: On  the  Day  when  the  Hour  comes to pass, the guilty will be shocked.
verses.13: Their  idols  will  have  no  power  to intercede  on  their  behalf;  on  the contrary,  they  will  disown  their idols.
verses.14: On  the  day  when  the  Hour  comes  to pass, they will part company.
verses.15: As  for  those  who  believe  and  lead  a righteous  life,  they  will  be  in  Paradise, rejoicing.
verses.16: As  for  those  who  disbelieve,  and reject  our  revelations  and  the  meeting  of  the  Hereafter,  they  will  last  in the retribution forever.
verses.17: Therefore,  you  shall  glorify  GOD when  you  retire  at  night,  and  when you rise in the morning.
verses.18: All  praise  is  due  to  Him  in  the heavens  and  the  earth,  throughout the evening, as  well  as  in the  middle of your day.
verses.19: He  produces  the  live  from  the  dead, and  produces  the  dead  from  the live,  and  He  revives  the  land  after  it had  died;  you  are  similarly  resurrected.
verses.20: Among  His  proofs  is  that  He  created  you  from  dust,  then  you  became reproducing humans.
verses.21: Among  His  proofs  is  that  He  created  for  you  spouses  from  among yourselves,  in  order  to  have  tranquility  and  contentment  with  each other,  and  He  placed  in  your  hearts love  and  care  towards  your  spouses. In  this,  there  are  sufficient  proofs for people who think.

encrypted.4: في بضع سنين لله الامر من قبل ومن بعد ويومئذ يفرح المؤمنون
encrypted.5: بنصر الله ينصر من يشاء وهو العزيز الرحيم
encrypted.6: وعد الله لا يخلف الله وعده ولكن اكثر الناس لا يعلمون
encrypted.7: يعلمون ظاهرا من الحياة الدنيا وهم عن الاخرة هم غافلون
encrypted.8: اولم يتفكروا في انفسهم ما خلق الله السماوات والارض وما بينهما الا بالحق واجل مسمى وان كثيرا من الناس بلقاء ربهم لكافرون
encrypted.9: اولم يسيروا في الارض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم كانوا اشد منهم قوة واثاروا الارض وعمروها اكثر مما عمروها وجاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا انفسهم يظلمون
encrypted.10: ثم كان عاقبة الذين اساءوا السواى ان كذبوا بايات الله وكانوا بها يستهزئون
encrypted.11: الله يبدا الخلق ثم يعيده ثم اليه ترجعون
encrypted.12: ويوم تقوم الساعة يبلس المجرمون
encrypted.13: ولم يكن لهم من شركائهم شفعاء وكانوا بشركائهم كافرين
encrypted.14: ويوم تقوم الساعة يومئذ يتفرقون
encrypted.15: فاما الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات فهم في روضة يحبرون
encrypted.16: واما الذين كفروا وكذبوا باياتنا ولقاء الاخرة فاولئك في العذاب محضرون
encrypted.17: فسبحان الله حين تمسون وحين تصبحون
encrypted.18: وله الحمد في السماوات والارض وعشيا وحين تظهرون
encrypted.19: يخرج الحي من الميت ويخرج الميت من الحي ويحيي الارض بعد موتها وكذلك تخرجون
encrypted.20: ومن اياته ان خلقكم من تراب ثم اذا انتم بشر تنتشرون
encrypted.21: ومن اياته ان خلق لكم من انفسكم ازواجا لتسكنوا اليها وجعل بينكم مودة ورحمة ان في ذلك لايات لقوم يتفكرون

verses.22: Among  His  proofs  are  the  creation of  the  heavens  and  the  earth,  and  the variations  in  your  languages  and your  colors.  In  these,  there  are  signs for the knowledgeable.
verses.23: Among  His  proofs  is  your  sleeping during  the  night  or  the  day,  and  your working  in  pursuit  of  His  provisions. In  this,  there  are  sufficient  proofs for people who can hear.
verses.24: Among  His  proofs  is  that  He  shows you  the  lightning  as  a  source  of  fear, as well as hope, then He sends down from  the  sky  water  to  revive  a  land that  has  been  dead.  In  these,  there are  sufficient  proofs  for  people  who understand.
verses.25: Among  His  proofs  is  that  the heaven  and  the  earth  are  standing  at His  disposal.  Finally,  when  He  calls you  out  of  the  earth,  one  call,  you will immediately come out.
verses.26: To  Him  belongs  everyone  in  the heavens  and  the  earth;  all  are  subservient to Him.
verses.27: And  He  is  the  One  who  initiates  the creation,  then  repeats  it;  this  is  even easier  for  Him.  To  Him  belongs  the most  sublime  similitude,  in  the heavens  and  the  earth,  and  He  is  the Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.28: He  cites  for  you  herein  an  example from  among  yourselves:  Do  you ever  elevate  your  servants  or  subordinates to the level where they rival you,  and  to  the  point  that  you  pay them  as  much  allegiance  as  is  being paid  to  you?  We  thus  explain  the revelations  for  people  who  understand.
verses.29: Indeed,  the  transgressors  have  followed  their  own  opinions,  without knowledge.  Who  then  can  guide those  who  have  been  sent  astray  by GOD? No one can ever help them.
verses.30: Therefore,  you  shall  devote  yourself to  the  religion  of  strict  monotheism. Such  is  the  natural  instinct  placed into  the  people  by  GOD.  Such  creation of GOD will never change. This is  the  perfect  religion,  but  most people do not know.
verses.31: You  shall  submit  to  Him,  reverence Him,  observe  the  Contact  Prayers (Salat),  and—whatever  you  do—do not ever fall into idol worship.
verses.32: (Do  not  fall  in  idol  worship,)  like those  who  divide  their  religion  into sects;  each  party  rejoicing  with  what they have.
verses.33: When  adversity  afflicts  the  people, they  turn  to  their  Lord,  totally devoting  themselves  to  Him.  But then,  as  soon  as  He  showers  them with  mercy,  some  of  them  revert  to idol worship.
verses.34: Let  them  be  unappreciative  of  what we  have  given  them.  Enjoy  temporarily; you will surely find out.

encrypted.22: ومن اياته خلق السماوات والارض واختلاف السنتكم والوانكم ان في ذلك لايات للعالمين
encrypted.23: ومن اياته منامكم بالليل والنهار وابتغاؤكم من فضله ان في ذلك لايات لقوم يسمعون
encrypted.24: ومن اياته يريكم البرق خوفا وطمعا وينزل من السماء ماء فيحيي به الارض بعد موتها ان في ذلك لايات لقوم يعقلون

encrypted.33: واذا مس الناس ضر دعوا ربهم منيبين اليه ثم اذا اذاقهم منه رحمة اذا فريق منهم بربهم يشركون
encrypted.34: ليكفروا بما اتيناهم فتمتعوا فسوف تعلمون

data: *30:30 Recognizing God ALONE as our Lord and Master is a natural instinct. We are born into this world with such an instinct. See 7:172-173 and Appendix 7.

*30:33 A common example is the classified advertisements we note in the newspapers, placed  by  people  thanking  St.  Jude  for  healing  them.  Before  undergoing  surgery,  they sincerely implore God to heal them. But as soon as the surgery succeeds, they thank St.Jude!!!

verses.35: Have  we  given  them  authorization that justifies their idolatry?
verses.36: When  we  bestow  mercy  upon  the people,  they  rejoice  therein.  But when adversity befalls them, as a consequence  of  their  own  works, they become despondent.
verses.37: Do they not realize that GOD increases the provision for whomever He  wills,  or  reduces  it?  These should be  lessons  for people who believe.
verses.38: Therefore, you shall give the relatives their rightful share (of charity), as well as the poor, and the traveling alien. This is better for those who sincerely seek GOD’s pleasure; they are the winners.
verses.39: The  usury  that  is  practiced  to  increase some people’s wealth, does not gain anything at GOD. But if you give to charity, seeking GOD’s pleasure,  these  are  the  ones  who receive their reward manifold.
verses.40: GOD is the One who created you He is the One who provides for you. He is the One who puts you to death. He is the One who resurrects you. Can any of your idols do any of these things? Be He glorified. He is much too exalted to have any partners.
verses.41: Disasters  have  spread  throughout the land and sea, because of what the people have committed. He thus lets them taste the consequences of some of their works, that they may return (to the right works).
verses.42: Say,  “Roam  the  earth  and  note the consequences for those before you.” Most of them were idol worshipers.
verses.43: Therefore, you shall devote yourself completely  to  this  perfect  religion, before a day comes which is made inevitable by GOD. On that day, they will be shocked.
verses.44: Whoever  disbelieves,  disbelieves  to the detriment of his own soul, while those who lead a righteous life, do so to strengthen and develop their own souls.
verses.45: For He will generously recompense those who believe and lead a righteous life from His bounties. He does not love the disbelievers.
verses.46: Among His proofs is that He sends the winds with good omen, to shower you with His mercy, and to allow the ships to run in the sea in accordance with His rules, and for you to seek  His  bounties  (through  commerce), that you may be appreciative.
verses.47: We  have  sent  messengers  before you to their people, with profound signs.  Subsequently,  we  punished those who transgressed. It is our duty that we grant victory to the believers.
verses.48: GOD  is  the  One  who  sends  the winds, to stir up clouds, to be spread throughout  the  sky  in  accordance with His will. He then piles the clouds up, then you see the rain coming down therefrom.  When it falls on whomever He chooses from among His servants, they rejoice.
verses.49: Before  it  fell  on  them,  they  had resorted to despair.

encrypted.49: وان كانوا من قبل ان ينزل عليهم من قبله لمبلسين

verses.50: You  shall  appreciate  GOD’s  continuous mercy, and how He revives the land that has been dead. He will just as certainly resurrect the dead.He is Omnipotent.
verses.51: Had we sent upon them instead a yellow sandstorm, they would have continued to disbelieve.
verses.52: You cannot make the dead, nor the deaf, hear the call, once they turn away.
verses.53: Nor can you guide the blind out of their  straying.  You  can  only  be heard by those who believe in our revelations, and decide to become submitters.
verses.54: GOD is the One who created you weak, then granted  you  after  the weakness  strength,  then  substituted after the strength weakness and gray hair. He creates whatever He wills. He is the Omniscient, the Omnipotent.
verses.55: On the day when the Hour comes to pass, the guilty will swear that they lasted (in this world) only one hour. That is how wrong they were.
verses.56: Those who are blessed with knowledge and faith will say, “You have lasted, according to GOD’s decree, until the Day of Resurrection. Now, this is the Day of Resurrection, but you failed to recognize it.”
verses.57: Therefore, no apology, on that day, will  benefit  the  transgressors,  nor will they be excused.
verses.58: Thus, we have cited for the people in this Quran all kinds of examples. Yet, no matter what kind of proof you present to the disbelievers, they say, “You are falsifiers.”
verses.59: GOD thus seals the hearts of those who do not know.
verses.60: Therefore,  you  shall  steadfastly persevere—for  GOD’s  promise  is the  truth—and  do  not  be  intimidated by those who have not attained certainty.

encrypted.50: فانظر الى اثار رحمت الله كيف يحيي الارض بعد موتها ان ذلك لمحيي الموتى وهو على كل شيء قدير
encrypted.51: ولئن ارسلنا ريحا فراوه مصفرا لظلوا من بعده يكفرون
encrypted.52: فانك لا تسمع الموتى ولا تسمع الصم الدعاء اذا ولوا مدبرين
encrypted.53: وما انت بهاد العمي عن ضلالتهم ان تسمع الا من يؤمن باياتنا فهم مسلمون
encrypted.54: الله الذي خلقكم من ضعف ثم جعل من بعد ضعف قوة ثم جعل من بعد قوة ضعفا وشيبة يخلق ما يشاء وهو العليم القدير
encrypted.55: ويوم تقوم الساعة يقسم المجرمون ما لبثوا غير ساعة كذلك كانوا يؤفكون
encrypted.56: وقال الذين اوتوا العلم والايمان لقد لبثتم في كتاب الله الى يوم البعث فهذا يوم البعث ولكنكم كنتم لا تعلمون
encrypted.57: فيومئذ لا ينفع الذين ظلموا معذرتهم ولا هم يستعتبون
encrypted.58: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القران من كل مثل ولئن جئتهم باية ليقولن الذين كفروا ان انتم الا مبطلون
encrypted.59: كذلك يطبع الله على قلوب الذين لا يعلمون
encrypted.60: فاصبر ان وعد الله حق ولا يستخفنك الذين لا يوقنون

verses.1: A.L.M.*
verses.2: These (letters) constitute proofs of this book of wisdom.
verses.3: A beacon and a mercy for the righteous.
verses.4: Who  observe  the  Contact  Prayers (Salat), give the obligatory charity (Zakat), and as regards the Hereafter, they are absolutely certain.
verses.5: They  are  following  the  guidance from their Lord, and they are the winners.
verses.6: Among the people, there are those who uphold baseless Hadith, and thus divert others from the path of GOD without knowledge, and take it in vain. These have incurred a shameful retribution.
verses.7: And when our revelations are recited to the one of them, he turns away in arrogance as if he never heard them, as if his ears are deaf. Promise him a painful retribution.

Sura 31: Luqmãn
(Luqmãn)
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

encrypted.5: اولئك على هدى من ربهم واولئك هم المفلحون

data: *31:1 See Appendix 1 for the important role of these initials.

verses.8: Surely,  those  who  believe  and  lead a  righteous  life  have  deserved  the gardens of bliss.
verses.9: Eternally  they  abide  therein.  This  is the truthful promise of GOD. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.10: He  created  the  heavens  without  pillars  that  you  can  see.  He  established on  earth  stabilizers  (mountains)  lest it  tumbles  with  you,  and  He  spread on  it  all  kinds  of  creatures.  We  send down  from  the  sky  water  to  grow  all kinds of beautiful plants.
verses.11: Such  is  the  creation  of  GOD;  show me  what  the idols you  set  up  beside Him  have  created.  Indeed,  the transgressors are far astray.
verses.12: We  have  endowed  Luqmãn  with wisdom:  “You  shall  be  appreciative of  GOD.”  Whoever  is  appreciative is  appreciative  for  his  own  good.  As for  those  who  turn  unappreciative, GOD is in no need, Praiseworthy.
verses.13: Recall  that  Luqmãn  said  to  his  son, as  he  enlightened  him,  “O  my  son, do not set up any idols beside GOD; idolatry is a gross injustice.”*
verses.14: We  enjoined  the  human  being  to honor  his  parents.  His  mother  bore him,  and  the  load  got  heavier  and heavier.  It  takes  two  years  (of  intensive  care)  until  weaning.  You  shall be  appreciative  of  Me,  and  of  your parents.  To  Me  is  the  ultimate  destiny.
verses.15: If  they  try  to  force  you  to  set  up any idols beside Me, do not obey them. But  continue  to  treat  them  amicably in this world. You shall follow only the  path  of  those  who  have  submitted  to  Me.  Ultimately,  you  all return to Me, then I will inform you of  everything you have done.
verses.16: “O  my  son,  know  that  even  something  as  tiny  as  a  mustard  seed,  deep inside  a  rock,  be it  in the heavens or the earth, GOD will bring it. GOD is Sublime, Cognizant.
verses.17: “O  my  son,  you  shall  observe  the Contact  Prayers  (Salat).  You  shall advocate  righteousness  and  forbid evil,  and  remain  steadfast  in  the  face of  adversity.  These  are  the  most honorable traits.
verses.18: “You  shall  not  treat  the  people  with arrogance,  nor  shall  you  roam  the earth  proudly.  GOD  does  not  like the arrogant showoffs.
verses.19: “Walk  humbly  and  lower  your voice—the  ugliest  voice  is  the  donkey's voice.”
verses.20: Do you not see that GOD has committed  in  your  service  everything  in the  heavens  and  the  earth,  and  has showered  you  with  His  blessings— obvious  and  hidden?  Yet,  some people  argue  about  GOD  without knowledge,  without  guidance,  and without the enlightening scripture.
verses.21: When  they  are  told,  “Follow  these revelations  of  GOD,”  they  say,  “No, we  follow  only  what  we  found  our parents  doing.”  What  if  the  devil  is leading them to the agony of Hell?

titles.21:
Following the Parents Blindly:
A Common Tragedy
