data: *31:13 How will you feel if you take care of a child, give him the best education, and prepare him for life, only to see him thank someone else? Thus is idolatry; injustice.

verses.22: Those  who  submit  completely  to GOD, while leading a righteous life, have  gotten  hold  of  the  strongest bond. For GOD is in full control of all things.
verses.23: As for those who disbelieve, do not be saddened by their disbelief. To us is their ultimate return, then we will inform them of everything they had done. GOD is fully aware of the innermost thoughts.
verses.24: We let them enjoy temporarily, then commit them to severe retribution.
verses.25: If you ask them, “Who created the heavens  and  the  earth,”  they  will say,  “GOD.”  Say,  “Praise  be  to GOD.”  Yet,  most  of  them  do  not know.
verses.26: To GOD belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. GOD is the Most Rich, Most Praiseworthy.
verses.27: If all the trees on earth were made into  pens,  and  the  ocean  supplied the ink, augmented by  seven  more oceans,  the  words  of  GOD  would not run out. GOD is Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.28: The creation and resurrection of all of  you  is  the  same  as  that  of  one person. GOD is Hearer, Seer.
verses.29: Do you not realize that GOD merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and that He has committed the sun and the moon in your service, each running in  its  orbit  for  a  specific  life  span, and that GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do?
verses.30: This proves that GOD is the truth, while  any  idol  they  set  up  beside Him is falsehood, and that GOD is the Most High, Most Great.
verses.31: Do you not see that the ships roam the sea, carrying GOD’s provisions, to  show  you  some  of  His  proofs? Indeed,  these  should  be  sufficient proofs  for  everyone  who  is  steadfast, appreciative.
verses.32: When violent waves surround them, they implore GOD, sincerely devoting their prayers to Him alone. But as  soon  as  He  saves  them  to  the shore,  some  of  them  revert.  None discards  our  revelations  except those  who  are  betrayers,  unappreciative.
verses.33: O people, you shall reverence your Lord, and fear a day when a father cannot  help  his  own  child,  nor  a child can help his father. Certainly, GOD's promise is truth. Therefore, do not be distracted by this life; do not  be  distracted  from  GOD  by mere illusions.
verses.34: With GOD is the knowledge regarding  the  Hour  (end  of  the  world).*  He is the One who sends down the rain, and  He  knows  the  contents  of  the womb. No soul knows what will happen  to  it  tomorrow,  and  no  one knows in which land he or she will die. GOD is Omniscient, Cognizant.

data: *31:34 God reveals His knowledge whenever He wills. We learn from this verse that we may be able to predict the rain, and the gender of the fetus. But we can never know the time or place of death. In accordance with 72:27, God has revealed the end of the world through  His  Messenger  of  the  Covenant.  See  15:87,  20:15,  and  Appendix  25  for  the details.

verses.1: A.L.M.*
verses.2: The  book  is,  without  a  doubt,  a revelation  from  the  Lord  of  the universe.
verses.3: They  said,  “He  fabricated  it.”  Indeed,  this  is  the  truth  from  your Lord,  to  warn  people  who  never received  a  warner  before  you,  that they may be guided.
verses.4: GOD  is  the  One  who  created  the heavens  and  the  earth,  and  everything  between  them  in  six  days,  then assumed  all  authority.  You  have none  beside  Him  as  Lord,  nor  do you  have  an  intercessor.  Would  you not take heed?
verses.5: All  matters  are  controlled  by  Him from  the  heaven  to  the  earth.  To Him,  the  day  is  equivalent  to  one thousand of your years.
verses.6: Knower  of  all  secrets  and  declarations; the Almighty, Most Merciful.
verses.7: He  is  the  One  who  perfected  everything He created, and started the creation of the human from clay.
verses.8: Then  He  continued  his  reproduction through a certain lowly liquid.
verses.9: He  shaped  him  and  blew  into  him from  His  spirit.  And  He  gave  you the  hearing,  the  eyesight,  and  the brains; rarely are you thankful.
verses.10: They  wonder,  “After  we  vanish  into the  earth,  do  we  get  created  anew?” Thus,  as  regards  meeting  their Lord, they are disbelievers.
verses.11: Say,  “You  will  be  put  to  death  by the  angel  in  whose  charge  you  are placed,  then  to  your  Lord  you  will be returned.”
verses.12: If only you could see the guilty when they  bow  down  their  heads  before their  Lord:  “Our  Lord,  now  we  have seen  and  we  have  heard.  Send  us back  and  we  will  be  righteous.  Now we have attained certainty.”*
verses.13: Had  we  willed,  we  could  have  given every  soul  its  guidance,  but  it  is  already  predetermined  that  I  will  fill Hell  with  jinns  and  humans,  all  together.*
verses.14: Taste  the  consequences  of  your  forgetting  this  day;  now  we  forget  you. You  have  incurred  eternal  retribution in return for your own works.

data: *32:1 The meaning of these letters is given in the next verse: “This book is, without a doubt, a revelation from the Lord of the universe.” See Appendix 1 for the details.
*32:12 If sent back, they would commit the same transgressions. See Footnote 6:28.

*32:13 The majority of humans “insist” upon going to Hell, by choosing to ignore God’s invitations to redeem them. God will not put a single person in Hell. Those who fail to redeem themselves by denouncing idolatry and devoting themselves to God ALONE, and fail to develop their souls through the practices prescribed by our Creator, will have to run to Hell on their own volition. They will be too weak to stand the physical presence of God’s energy.

verses.15: The only people who truly believe in our revelations are those who fall prostrate upon hearing them. They glorify and praise their Lord, without any arrogance.
verses.16: Their  sides  readily  forsake  their beds, in order to worship their Lord, out of reverence and hope, and from our provisions to them, they give.
verses.17: You have no idea how much joy and happiness are waiting for you as a reward for your (righteous) works.
verses.18: Is one who is a believer the same as one who is wicked? They are not equal.
verses.19: As for those who believe and lead a righteous life, they have deserved the eternal Paradise. Such is their abode, in return for their works.
verses.20: As for the wicked, their destiny is Hell. Every time they try to leave it, they will be forced back. They will be told, “Taste the agony of Hell which you used to disbelieve in.”
verses.21: We let them taste the smaller retribution (of this world), before they incur the greater retribution (of the Hereafter), that they may (take a hint and) reform.
verses.22: Who is more evil than one who is reminded of these revelations of his Lord, then insists upon disregarding them? We will certainly punish the guilty.
verses.23: We have given Moses the scripture —do  not  harbor  any  doubt  about meeting  Him—and  we  made  it  a guide for the Children of Israel.
verses.24: We  appointed  from  among  them imams who guided in accordance with our commandments, because they steadfastly persevered and attained  certainty  about  our  revelations.
verses.25: Your Lord is the One who will judge them on the Day of Resurrection, regarding everything they disputed.
verses.26: Does  it  ever  occur  to  them  how many  generations  we  have  annihilated before them? They now live and walk in their ancestors’ homes. This  should  provide  sufficient proofs. Do they not hear?
verses.27: Do they not realize that we drive the water to barren lands, and produce with it crops to feed their livestock, as well as themselves? Do they not see?
verses.28: They challenge: “Where is that victory, if you are truthful?”
verses.29: Say, “The day such a victory comes, believing will not benefit those who did not believe before that, nor will they be given another chance.”
verses.30: Therefore,  disregard  them  and wait, they too are waiting.

verses.1: O you prophet, you shall reverence GOD and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.
verses.2: Follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you all do.
verses.3: And put your trust in GOD. GOD suffices as an advocate.

verses.4: GOD  did  not  give  any  man  two hearts  in  his  chest.  Nor  did  He  turn your  wives  whom  you  estrange  (according  to  your  custom)  into  your mothers.*  Nor  did  He  turn  your adopted  children  into  genetic  offspring.  All  these  are  mere  utterances  that  you  have  invented.  GOD speaks  the  truth,  and  He  guides  in the (right) path.
verses.5: You  shall  give  your  adopted  children  names  that  preserve  their  relationship  to  their  genetic  parents. This  is  more  equitable  in  the  sight  of GOD.  If  you  do  not  know  their parents,  then,  as  your  brethren  in religion,  you  shall  treat  them  as members  of  your  family.  You  do  not commit  a  sin  if  you  make  a  mistake in  this  respect;  you  are  responsible for  your  purposeful  intentions. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.6: The  prophet  is  closer  to  the  believers  than  they  are  to  each  other,  and his  wives  are  like  mothers  to  them. The  relatives  ought  to  take  care  of one  another  in  accordance  with GOD’s  scripture.  Thus,  the  believers  shall  take  care  of  their  relatives who  immigrate  to  them,  provided they  have  taken  care  of  their  own families  first.  These  are  commandments of this scripture.
verses.7: Recall  that  we  took  from  the  prophets  their  covenant,  including  you (O  Muhammad),  Noah,  Abraham, Moses,  and  Jesus  the  son  of  Mary. We  took  from  them  a  solemn pledge.*
verses.8: Subsequently,  He  will  surely  question  the  truthful  about  their  truthfulness,  and  has  prepared  for  the disbelievers  (in  this  Quranic  fact)  a painful retribution.
verses.9: O  you  who  believe,  remember GOD’s blessing  upon  you;  when  soldiers  attacked  you,  we  sent  upon them  violent  wind  and  invisible  soldiers. GOD is  Seer  of everything you do.
verses.10: When  they  came  from  above  you, and  from  beneath  you,  your  eyes were  terrified,  your  hearts  ran  out  of patience,  and  you  harbored  unbefitting thoughts about GOD.
verses.11: That  is  when  the  believers  were truly  tested;  they  were  severely shaken up.
verses.12: The  hypocrites  and  those  with doubts  in  their  hearts  said,  “What GOD  and  His  messenger  promised us was no more than an illusion!”

data: *33:4 It was a custom in Arabia to estrange the wife by declaring that she was like the husband’s mother. Such an unfair practice is abrogated herein.

*33:7 The covenant is detailed in 3:81. God took a covenant from the prophets that they shall  support  His  Messenger  of  the  Covenant  who  would  come  after  Muhammad  to purify and unify their messages. The Covenant was made before the earth’s creation, and was fulfilled in Mecca Zul-Hijja 3, 1391 (Dec. 21, 1971). The sum of the Islamic month (12),  plus  the  day  (3),  plus  the  year  (1391)  gives  1406,  19x74  Overwhelming  proof identifying God’s Messenger of the Covenant as Rashad Khalifa is provided throughout the Quran (Appendices 2 & 26).

verses.13: A group of them said, “O people of Yathrib, you cannot attain victory; go back.” Others made up excuses to the prophet: “Our homes are vulnerable,” when they were not vulnerable. They just wanted to flee.
verses.14: Had the enemy invaded and asked them to join, they would have joined the enemy without hesitation.
verses.15: They had pledged to GOD in the past that they would not turn around and flee; making a pledge with GOD involves a great responsibility.
verses.16: Say, “If you flee, you can never flee from death or from being killed. No matter what happens, you only live a short while longer.”
verses.17: Say, “Who would protect you from GOD if He willed any adversity, or willed any blessing for you?” They can never find, beside GOD, any other Lord and Master.
verses.18: GOD is fully aware of the hinderers among you, and those who say to their comrades, “Let us all stay behind.” Rarely do they mobilize for defense.
verses.19: Also, they are too stingy when dealing with you. If anything threatens the community, you see their eyes rolling with fear, as if death had already come to them. Once the crisis is over, they whip you with sharp tongues. They are too stingy with their  wealth.  These  are  not  believers, and, consequently, GOD has nullified their works. This is easy for GOD to do.
verses.20: They thought that the parties might come back. In that case, they would wish that they were lost in the desert, asking about your news from afar. Had the parties attacked you while they were with you, they would rarely support you.
verses.21: The messenger of GOD has set up a good example for those among you who seek GOD and the Last Day, and constantly think about GOD.
verses.22: When  the  true  believers  saw  the parties (ready to attack), they said, “This is what GOD and His messenger have promised us, and GOD and  His  messenger  are  truthful.” This  (dangerous  situation)  only strengthened  their  faith  and  augmented their submission.
verses.23: Among  the  believers  there  are people who fulfill their pledges with GOD. Some of them died, while others stand ready, never wavering.
verses.24: GOD will surely recompense the truthful for their truthfulness, and will punish the hypocrites, if He so wills, or redeem them. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.25: GOD  repulsed  those  who  disbelieved with their rage, and they left empty-handed. GOD thus spared the believers any fighting. GOD is Powerful, Almighty.

data: *33:21 Satan took this verse out of context, and relied on the people’s idolization of the prophet  Muhammad  to  innovate  a  whole  set  of  unauthorized  and  unreasonable regulations called “Sunna of the Prophet.” This created a totally different religion (see 42:21 and Appendix 18).

verses.26: He  also  brought  down  their  allies among  the  people  of  the  scripture from  their  secure  positions,  and threw  terror  into  their  hearts.  Some of  them  you  killed,  and  some  you took captive.
verses.27: He  made  you  inherit  their  land, their  homes,  their  money,  and  lands you  had  never  stepped  on.  GOD  is in full control of all things.
verses.28: O  prophet,  say  to  your  wives,  “If  you are  seeking  this  life  and  its  vanities, then  let  me  compensate  you  and allow you to go amicably.
verses.29: “But  if  you  are  seeking  GOD  and His  messenger,  and  the  abode  of  the Hereafter,  then  GOD  has  prepared for  the  righteous  among  you  a  great recompense.”
verses.30: O  wives of the prophet, if any of you commits  a  gross  sin,  the  retribution will  be  doubled  for  her.  This  is  easy for GOD to do.
verses.31: Any one of you who obeys GOD and His  messenger,  and  leads  a  righteous  life,  we  will  grant  her  double the  recompense,  and  we  have  prepared for her a generous provision.
verses.32: O  wives  of  the  prophet,  you  are  not the  same  as  any  other  women,  if  you observe  righteousness.  (You  have  a greater  responsibility.)  Therefore, you  shall  not  speak  too  softly,  lest those  with  disease  in  their  hearts may  get  the  wrong  ideas;  you  shall speak only righteousness.
verses.33: You  shall  settle  down  in  your homes,  and  do  not  mingle  with  the people  excessively,  like  you  used  to do  in  the  old  days  of  ignorance.  You shall  observe  the  Contact  Prayers (Salat),  and  give  the  obligatory charity  (Zakat),  and  obey  GOD  and His  messenger.  GOD  wishes  to  remove  all  unholiness  from  you,  O  you who  live  around  the  Sacred  Shrine, and to purify you completely.
verses.34: Remember  what  is  being  recited  in your  homes  of  GOD’s  revelations and  the  wisdom  inherent  therein. GOD is Sublime, Cognizant.
verses.35: The  submitting  men,  the  submitting women,  the  believing  men,  the believing  women,  the  obedient  men, the  obedient  women,  the  truthful men,  the  truthful  women,  the  steadfast  men,  the  steadfast  women,  the reverent  men,  the  reverent  women, the  charitable  men,  the  charitable women,  the  fasting  men,  the  fasting women,  the  chaste  men,  the  chaste women,  and  the  men  who  commemorate  GOD  frequently,  and  the commemorating  women;  GOD  has prepared  for  them  forgiveness  and a great recompense.
verses.36: No  believing  man  or  believing  woman,  if  GOD  and  His  messenger  issue any  command,  has  any  choice  regarding  that  command.  Anyone who  disobeys  GOD  and  His  messenger has gone far astray.

verses.40: Muhammad  was  not  the  father  of any  man  among  you.  He  was  a  messenger  of  GOD  and  the  final  prophet. GOD is fully aware of all things.

data: *33:40 Despite this clear definition of Muhammad, most Muslims insist that he was the last prophet and also the last messenger. This is a tragic human trait as we see in 40:34. Those who readily believe God realize that God sends His purifying and consolidating Messenger of the Covenant after the final prophet Muhammad (3:81, 33:7).
*33:41-42  Your  god  is  whatever  occupies  your  thoughts  most  of  the  time.  Hence  the commandment to commemorate God and glorify Him day and night. See Appendix 27.

verses.50: O  prophet,  we  made  lawful  for  you your  wives  to  whom  you  have  paid their  due  dowry,  or  what  you  already have,  as  granted  to  you  by  GOD. Also  lawful  for  you  in  marriage  are the  daughters  of  your  father’s  brothers,  the  daughters  of  your  father’s sisters,  the  daughters  of  your  mother’s  brothers,  the  daughters  of  your mother’s  sisters,  who  have  emigrated  with  you.  Also,  if  a  believing woman  gave  herself  to  the  prophet—by  forfeiting  the  dowry—the prophet  may  marry  her  without  a dowry,  if  he  so  wishes.  However,  her forfeiting  of  the  dowry  applies  only to  the  prophet,  and  not  to  the  other believers.  We  have  already  decreed their  rights  in  regard  to  their spouses  or  what  they  already  have. This  is  to  spare  you  any  embarrassment.  GOD  is  Forgiver,  Most  Merciful.
verses.51: You  may  gently  shun  any  one  of them,  and  you  may  bring  closer  to you  any  one  of  them.  If  you  reconcile with  any  one  you  had  estranged,  you commit  no  error.  In  this  way,  they will  be  pleased,  will  have  no  grief, and  will  be  content  with  what  you equitably  offer  to  all  of  them.  GOD knows  what  is  in  your  hearts.  GOD is Omniscient, Clement.
verses.52: Beyond  the  categories  described  to you,  you  are  enjoined  from  marrying any other  women, nor  can  you  substitute  a  new  wife  (from  the  prohibited  categories),  no  matter  how much  you  admire  their  beauty.  You must  be  content  with  those  already made  lawful  to  you.  GOD  is  watchful over all things.
verses.53: O  you  who  believe,  do  not  enter  the prophet’s  homes  unless  you  are given  permission  to  eat,  nor  shall you  force  such  an  invitation  in  any manner.  If  you  are  invited,  you  may enter.  When  you  finish  eating,  you shall  leave;  do  not  engage  him  in lengthy  conversations.  This  used  to hurt  the  prophet,  and  he  was  too  shy to  tell  you.  But GOD  does  not  shy away  from  the  truth.  If  you  have  to ask  his  wives  for  something,  ask them  from  behind  a  barrier.  This  is purer  for  your  hearts  and  their hearts.  You  are  not  to  hurt  the  messenger of GOD. You shall not  marry his  wives  after  him,  for  this  would  be a gross offense in the sight of GOD.*
verses.54: Whether  you  declare  anything,  or hide  it,  GOD  is  fully  aware  of  all things.
verses.55: The  women  may  relax  (their  dress code)  around  their  fathers,  their sons,  their  brothers,  the  sons  of  their brothers,  the  sons  of  their  sisters, the  other  women,  and  their  (female) servants.  They  shall  reverence GOD. GOD witnesses all things.

data: *33:53 We are enjoined in 4:22 from marrying women who were previously married to our  fathers.  Nor  can  the  father  marry  the  divorced wife  of  his  son  (4:23).  This  divine commandment  preserves  our  respect  for  our  fathers  and  their  most  private  affairs. Similarly, the prophet was a father figure to the believers of his time. For the good of those believers, God enjoined them from marrying women who were previously married to the  prophet.  Marriage  is  a  sacred  and  very  private  relationship,  and  the  prophet’s private life was better kept private.

verses.56: GOD  and  His  angels  help  and  support  the  prophet.  O  you  who  believe,  you  shall  help  and  support him,  and  regard  him  as  he  should  be regarded.*
verses.57: Surely,  those  who  oppose  GOD  and His  messenger,  GOD  afflicts  them with  a  curse  in  this  life,  and  in  the Hereafter;  He  has  prepared  for them a shameful retribution.
verses.58: Those  who  persecute  the  believing men  and  the  believing  women,  who did  not  do  anything  wrong,  have committed  not  only  a  falsehood,  but also a gross sin.
verses.59: O  prophet,  tell  your  wives,  your daughters,  and  the  wives  of  the believers  that  they  shall  lengthen their  garments.  Thus,  they  will  be recognized  (as  righteous  women) and  avoid  being  insulted.  GOD  is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.60: Unless  the  hypocrites,  and  those with  disease  in  their  hearts,  and  the vicious  liars  of  the  city  refrain  (from persecuting you), we will surely grant you  the  upper  hand,  then  they  will be  forced  to  leave  within  a  short while.
verses.61: They  have  incurred  condemnation wherever  they  go;  (unless they stop attacking  you,)  they  may  be  taken and killed.
verses.62: This  is  GOD’s  eternal  system,  and you  will  find  that GOD’s  system  is unchangeable.
verses.63: The  people  ask  you  about  the  Hour (end  of  the  world).  Say,  “The  knowledge  thereof  is  only  with  GOD.  For all  that  you  know,  the  Hour  may  be close.”
verses.64: GOD  has  condemned  the  disbelievers,  and  has  prepared  for  them Hell.
verses.65: Eternally  they  abide  therein.  They will find no lord, nor a supporter.
verses.66: The  day  they  are  thrown  into  Hell, they  will  say,  “Oh,  we  wish  we obeyed  GOD,  and  obeyed  the  messenger.”
verses.67: They  will  also  say,  “Our  Lord,  we have  obeyed  our  masters  and  leaders, but they led us astray.
verses.68: “Our  Lord,  give  them  double  the retribution,  and  curse  them  a  tremendous curse.”
verses.69: O  you  who  believe,  do  not  be  like those  who  hurt  Moses,  then  GOD absolved  him  of  what  they  said.  He was, in the sight of GOD, honorable.
verses.70: O  you  who  believe,  reverence  GOD and  utter  only  the  correct  utterances.

The Followers

data: *33:56 The word “prophet” (Nabi) consistently refers to Muhammad only when he was alive.  Satan  used  this  verse  to  entice  the  Muslims  into  commemorating  Muhammad, constantly, instead of commemorating God as enjoined in 33:41-42.

*33:63 Less than a century ago, only God possessed knowledge about television and space  satellites,  for  example.  He  revealed  this  knowledge  at  the  predetermined  time. Similarly, God has revealed the time appointed for the end of this world (Appendix 25).

verses.71: He  will  then  fix  your  works,  and forgive  your  sins.  Those  who  obey GOD  and  His  messenger  have  triumphed a great triumph.
verses.72: We  have  offered  the  responsibility (freedom  of  choice)  to  the  heavens and  the  earth,  and  the  mountains, but  they  refused  to  bear  it,  and  were afraid  of  it.  But  the  human  being accepted  it;  he  was  transgressing, ignorant.*
verses.73: For  GOD  will  inevitably  punish  the hypocrite  men  and  the  hypocrite women,  and  the  idol  worshiping men  and  the  idol  worshiping  women.  GOD  redeems  the  believing  men and  the  believing  women.  GOD  is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

encrypted.73: ليعذب الله المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات ويتوب الله على المؤمنين والمؤمنات وكان الله غفورا رحيما

verses.1: Praise  be  to  GOD—to  whom  belongs  everything  in  the  heavens  and the  earth;  all  praise  is  also  due  to Him  in  the  Hereafter.  He  is  the Most Wise, the Cognizant.
verses.2: He  knows  everything  that  goes  into the  earth,  and  everything  that  comes out  of  it,  and  everything  that  comes down  from  the  sky,  and  everything that  climbs  into  it.  He  is  the  Most Merciful, the Forgiving.
verses.3: Those  who  disbelieve  have  said, “The Hour will never come to pass!” Say,  “Absolutely—by  my  Lord—it will  most  certainly  come  to  you.  He is  the  Knower  of  the  future.  Not even  the  equivalent  of  an  atom’s weight  is  hidden  from  Him,  be  it  in the  heavens  or  the  earth.  Not  even smaller  than  that,  or  larger  (is  hidden). All are in a profound record.”
verses.4: Most  certainly,  He  will  reward those  who  believe  and  lead  a  righteous  life.  These  have  deserved  forgiveness and a generous provision.
verses.5: As  for  those  who  constantly  challenge  our  revelations,  they  have  incurred  a  retribution  of  painful  humiliation.
verses.6: It  is  evident  to  those  who  are  blessed  with  knowledge  that  this  revelation  from  your  Lord  to  you  is  the truth,  and  that  it  guides  to  the  path of  the  Almighty,  the  Most  Praiseworthy.
verses.7: Those  who  disbelieve  have  said, “Let  us  show  you  a  man  who  tells you  that  after  you  are  torn  apart  you will be created anew.
verses.8: “Either  he  fabricated  lies  about GOD,  or  he  is  crazy.”  Indeed,  those who  disbelieve  in  the  Hereafter have  incurred  the  worst  retribution; they have gone far astray.
verses.9: Have  they  not  seen  all  the  things  in front  of  them  and  behind  them,  in the  heaven  and  the  earth?  If  we willed,  we  could  have  caused  the earth  to  swallow  them,  or  caused masses  to  fall  on  them  from  the  sky. This should be a sufficient proof for every obedient servant.

encrypted.1: الحمد لله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الارض وله الحمد في الاخرة وهو الحكيم الخبير
encrypted.2: يعلم ما يلج في الارض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السماء وما يعرج فيها وهو الرحيم الغفور
encrypted.3: وقال الذين كفروا لا تاتينا الساعة قل بلى وربي لتاتينكم عالم الغيب لا يعزب عنه مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الارض ولا اصغر من ذلك ولا اكبر الا في كتاب مبين
encrypted.4: ليجزي الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات اولئك لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم
encrypted.5: والذين سعوا في اياتنا معاجزين اولئك لهم عذاب من رجز اليم
encrypted.6: ويرى الذين اوتوا العلم الذي انزل اليك من ربك هو الحق ويهدي الى صراط العزيز الحميد
encrypted.7: وقال الذين كفروا هل ندلكم على رجل ينبئكم اذا مزقتم كل ممزق انكم لفي خلق جديد
encrypted.8: افترى على الله كذبا ام به جنة بل الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة في العذاب والضلال البعيد
encrypted.9: افلم يروا الى ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم من السماء والارض ان نشا نخسف بهم الارض او نسقط عليهم كسفا من السماء ان في ذلك لاية لكل عبد منيب

data: *33:72 The animals, trees, stars, etc. took advantage of this most gracious offer. See Appendix 7.

verses.10: We  endowed  David  with  blessings from  us:  “O  mountains,  submit  with him,  and  you  too,  O  birds.”  We  softened the iron for him.
verses.11: “You  may  make  shields  that  fit  perfectly,  and  work  righteousness. Whatever  you  do,  I  am  Seer  thereof.”
verses.12: To  Solomon  we  committed  the  wind at  his  disposal,  traveling  one  month coming  and  one  month  going.  And we caused a spring of oil to gush out for  him.  Also,  the  jinns  worked  for him, by his Lord’s leave. Any one of them  who  disregarded  our  commands,  we  subjected  him  to  a  severe retribution.
verses.13: They  made  for  him  anything  he wanted—niches, statues,  deep pools,  and  heavy  cooking  pots.  O family  of  David,  work  (righteousness)  to  show  your  appreciation. Only  a  few  of  My  servants  are  appreciative.
verses.14: When  the  appointed  time  for  his death came, they had no clue that he had died. It was not until one of the animals  tried  to  eat  his  staff,  and  he fell  down,  that  the  jinns  realized  that he  was  dead.  They  thus  realized  that if  they  really  knew  the  unseen,  they would  have  stopped  working  so hard as soon as he died.
verses.15: Sheba’s  homeland  used  to  be  a  marvel,  with  two  gardens  on  the  right and  the  left.  Eat  from  your  Lord’s provisions, and be appreciative of Him—good  land,  and  a  forgiving Lord.
verses.16: They  turned  away  and,  consequently,  we  poured  upon  them  a  disastrous  flood,  and  we  substituted their  two  gardens  into  two  gardens of  bad  tasting  fruits,  thorny  plants, and a skimpy harvest.
verses.17: We  thus  requited  them  for  their  disbelief.  Do  we  not  requite  only  the disbelievers?
verses.18: We  placed  between  them  and  the communities  that  we  blessed  other oases,  and  we  secured  the  journey between  them:  “Travel  therein  days and nights in complete security.”
verses.19: But  they  (turned  unappreciative and)  challenged:  “Our  Lord,  we  do not  care  if  You  increase  the  distance of  our  journeys  (without  any  stations).”  They  thus  wronged  their own  souls.  Consequently,  we  made them  history,  and  scattered  them into  small  communities  throughout the  land.  This  should  provide  lessons  for  those  who  are  steadfast, appreciative.
verses.20: Satan  found  them  readily  fulfilling his  expectations.  They  followed him, except a few believers.
verses.21: He  never  had  any  power  over  them. But  we  thus  distinguish  those  who believe  in  the  Hereafter  from  those who  are  doubtful  about  it.*  Your Lord is in full control of all things.

data: *34:21 The criteria that inform us whether we believe in the Hereafter or not are in 6:113, 17:45, & 39:45. These three criteria bring out our true convictions, regardless of our oral statements.

verses.22: Say,  “Implore  the  idols  you  have  set up  beside  GOD.  They  do  not  possess as much as a single atom in the heavens,  or  the  earth.  They  possess no  partnership  therein,  nor  does  He permit them to be His assistants.”
verses.23: Intercession  with  Him  will  be  in vain,  unless  it  coincides  with  His will.  When  their  minds  are  finally settled  down,  and  they  ask,  “What did  your  Lord  say,”  they  will  say, “The  truth.”  He  is  the  Most  High, the Most Great.
verses.24: Say,  “Who  provides  for  you,  from the  heavens  and  the  earth?”  Say, “GOD,”  and  “Either  we  or  you  are guided, or have gone far astray.”
verses.25: Say,  “You  are  not  responsible  for our  crimes,  nor  are  we  responsible for what you do.”
verses.26: Say,  “Our  Lord  will  gather  us  all together  before  Him,  then  He  will judge  between  us  equitably.  He  is the Judge, the Omniscient.”
verses.27: Say, “Show me the idols you have set up  as  partners  with  Him!”  Say,  “No; He  is  the  one  GOD,  the  Almighty, Most Wise.”
verses.28: We  have  sent  you  (O  Rashad)*  to all  the  people,  a  bearer  of  good news,  as  well  as  a  warner,  but  most people do not know.
verses.29: They  challenge,  “When  will  this promise  come  to  pass,  if  you  are truthful?”
verses.30: Say,  “You  have  a  specific  time,  on  a specific  day,  that  you  cannot  delay by one hour, nor advance.”
verses.31: Those  who  disbelieve  have  said, “We  will  not  believe  in  this  Quran, nor  in  the  previous  scriptures.”  If you  could  only  envision  these  transgressors  when  they  stand  before their  Lord!  They  will  argue  with  one another  back  and  forth.  The  followers  will  tell  their  leaders,  “If  it were  not  for  you,  we  would  have been believers.”
verses.32: The  leaders  will  say  to  those  who followed  them,  “Are  we  the  ones who  diverted  you  from  the  guidance after  it  came  to  you?  No;  it  is  you who were wicked.”
verses.33: The  followers  will  say  to  their leaders,  “It  was  you  who  schemed night  and  day,  then  commanded  us to  be  unappreciative  of  GOD,  and  to set  up  idols  to  rank  with  Him.”  They will  be  ridden  with  remorse,  when they  see  the  retribution,  for  we  will place  shackles  around  the  necks  of those  who  disbelieved.  Are  they  not justly requited for what they did?
verses.34: Every  time  we  sent  a  warner  to  a community,  the  leaders  of  that  community  said,  “We  reject  the  message you are sent with.”

encrypted.22: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دون الله لا يملكون مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الارض وما لهم فيهما من شرك وما له منهم من ظهير
encrypted.23: ولا تنفع الشفاعة عنده الا لمن اذن له حتى اذا فزع عن قلوبهم قالوا ماذا قال ربكم قالوا الحق وهو العلي الكبير
encrypted.24: قل من يرزقكم من السماوات والارض قل الله وانا او اياكم لعلى هدى او في ضلال مبين
encrypted.25: قل لا تسالون عما اجرمنا ولا نسال عما تعملون
encrypted.26: قل يجمع بيننا ربنا ثم يفتح بيننا بالحق وهو الفتاح العليم
encrypted.27: قل اروني الذين الحقتم به شركاء كلا بل هو الله العزيز الحكيم
encrypted.28: وما ارسلناك الا كافة للناس بشيرا ونذيرا ولكن اكثر الناس لا يعلمون
encrypted.29: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين
encrypted.30: قل لكم ميعاد يوم لا تستاخرون عنه ساعة ولا تستقدمون
encrypted.31: وقال الذين كفروا لن نؤمن بهذا القران ولا بالذي بين يديه ولو ترى اذ الظالمون موقوفون عند ربهم يرجع بعضهم الى بعض القول يقول الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا لولا انتم لكنا مؤمنين
encrypted.32: قال الذين استكبروا للذين استضعفوا انحن صددناكم عن الهدى بعد اذ جاءكم بل كنتم مجرمين
encrypted.33: وقال الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا بل مكر الليل والنهار اذ تامروننا ان نكفر بالله ونجعل له اندادا واسروا الندامة لما راوا العذاب وجعلنا الاغلال في اعناق الذين كفروا هل يجزون الا ما كانوا يعملون
encrypted.34: وما ارسلنا في قرية من نذير الا قال مترفوها انا بما ارسلتم به كافرون

data: *34:28 As detailed in Appendix 2, the name of this messenger is mathematically coded into  the  Quran  as  “Rashad  Khalifa.”  By  adding  the  numerical  value  of  the  name “Rashad” (505), plus the numerical value of the name “Khalifa” (725), plus the number of the sura (34), plus the number of the verse (28), we obtain a total that conforms with the  Quran’s  19-based  mathematical  miracle,  which  was  unveiled  through  Rashad Khalifa. (505 + 725 + 34 + 28= 1292 = 19x68). More information is given in 5:19 and its footnote.

verses.35: They  also  said,  “We  are  more powerful,  with  more  money  and children,  and  we  will  not  be  punished.”
verses.36: Say,  “My  Lord  is  the  One  who  controls  all  provisions;  He  grants  the provisions  to  whomever  He  wills,  or reduces  them,  but  most  people  do not know.”
verses.37: It  is  not  your  money  or  your  children that  bring  you  closer  to  us.  Only those  who  believe  and  lead  a  righteous  life  will  receive  the  reward  for their  works,  multiplied  manifold.  In the  abode  of  Paradise  they  will  live in perfect peace.
verses.38: As  for  those  who  consistently  challenge  our  revelations,  they  will abide in retribution.
verses.39: Say,  “My  Lord  is  the  One  who  controls  all  provisions;  He  increases  the provisions  for  whomever  He  chooses  from  among  His  servants,  or  reduces  them.  Anything  you  spend  (in the  cause  of  God),  He  will  reward you for it; He is the Best Provider.”
verses.40: On  the  day  when  He  summons  them all,  He  will  say  to  the  angels,  “Did these people worship you?”
verses.41: They  will  answer,  “Be  You  glorified.  You  are  our  Lord  and  Master, not them. Instead, they were worshiping  the  jinns;  most  of  them  were believers therein.”
verses.42: On  that  day,  you  possess  no  power to  help  or  harm  one  another,  and  we will  say  to  the  transgressors,  “Taste the  retribution  of  the  Hell  that  you used to deny.”
verses.43: When  our  proofs  were  recited  to them,  perfectly  clear,  they  said, “This  is  simply  a  man  who  wants  to divert  you  from  the  way  your  parents  are  worshiping.”  They  also said,  “These  are  fabricated  lies.” Those  who  disbelieved  also  said about  the  truth  that  came  to  them, “This is obviously magic.”
verses.44: We  did  not  give  them  any  other books  to  study,  nor  did  we  send  to them before you another warner.
verses.45: Those  before  them  disbelieved,  and even  though  they  did  not  see  onetenth* of (the miracle) we have given to  this  generation,  when  they  disbelieved  My  messengers,  how  severe was My retribution!
verses.46: Say,  “I  ask  you  to  do  one  thing: Devote  yourselves  to  GOD,  in  pairs or  as  individuals,  then  reflect.  Your friend (Rashad) is  not crazy.  He  is  a manifest  warner  to  you,  just  before the advent of a terrible retribution.”

data: *34:43 By adding the gematrical value of “Rashad” (505), plus the value of “Khalifa” (725), plus this verse number (43), we get 505 + 725 + 43= 1273 = 19x67. See Appendices 1 & 2.

*34:45 The great miracles given to Moses and Jesus were limited in time and place; they were witnessed by a few people who happened to exist in that place at that time. But the mathematical miracle of the Quran is perpetual (see 74:30-35 & Appendix 1).
*34:46 By placing the gematrical value of “Rashad” (505) next to the value of “Khalifa” (725),  then  the  sura  number  (34),  and  the  verse  number  (46),  we  get  5057253446= 19x266171234.

verses.47: Say, “I do not ask you for any wage; you can keep it. My wage comes only from GOD. He witnesses all things.”
verses.48: Say, “My Lord causes the truth to prevail. He is the Knower of all secrets.”
verses.49: Say,  “The  truth  has  come;  while falsehood can neither initiate anything, nor repeat it.”
verses.50: Say, “If I go astray, I go astray because of my own shortcomings. And if I am guided, it is because of my Lord’s inspiration.  He is Hearer, Near.”
verses.51: If you could only see them when the great terror strikes them; they cannot escape then, and they will be taken away forcibly.
verses.52: They will then say, “We now believe in it,” but it will be far too late.
verses.53: They have rejected it in the past; they have decided instead to uphold conjecture and guesswork.*
verses.54: Consequently, they were deprived of everything they longed for. This is the same fate as their counterparts in the previous generations. They harbored too many doubts.

verses.1: Praise be to GOD, Initiator of the heavens  and  the  earth,  and  appointer of the angels to be messengers  with  wings—two,  three,  and four (wings). He increases the creation  as  He  wills.  GOD  is  Omnipotent.
verses.2: When  GOD  showers  the  people with mercy, no force can stop it. And if He withholds it, no force, other than He, can send it. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.3: O people, remember GOD’s blessings upon you. Is there any creator other than GOD who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? There is no other god beside Him. How could you deviate?
verses.4: If they disbelieve you, messengers before you have been disbelieved. GOD is in control of all things.
verses.5: O people, GOD’s promise is the truth; therefore, do not be distracted by this lowly life. Do not be diverted from GOD by mere illusions.
verses.6: The  devil  is  your  enemy,  so  treat him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be the dwellers of Hell.
verses.7: Those  who  disbelieve  have  incurred a severe retribution, and those who believe  and  lead  a  righteous  life have  deserved  forgiveness  and  a great recompense.
verses.8: Note  the  one  whose  evil  work  is adorned in his eyes, until he thinks that it is righteous. GOD thus sends astray whoever wills (to go astray), and He guides whoever wills (to be guided). Therefore,  do  not  grieve over them. GOD is fully aware of everything they do.

encrypted.4: وان يكذبوك فقد كذبت رسل من قبلك والى الله ترجع الامور

encrypted.7: الذين كفروا لهم عذاب شديد والذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة واجر كبير

data: *34:53 People of all religions tend to forsake the word of God and uphold the words of men. The Jews and the Muslims uphold the Mishnah (Hadith) and Gemarrah (Sunna), while the Christians uphold a trinity invented by the Nicene Conference, 325 years after Jesus.

verses.9: GOD  is  the  One  who  sends  the winds  to  stir  up  clouds,  then  we drive  them  towards  barren  lands, and  revive  such  lands  after  they were dead.  Thus is the resurrection.
verses.10: Anyone  seeking  dignity  should know that to GOD belongs all dignity.  To  Him  ascends  the  good words, and He exalts the righteous works. As for those who scheme evil works, they incur severe retribution; the scheming of such people is destined to fail.
verses.11: GOD created you from dust, then from a tiny drop, then He causes you to reproduce through your spouses. No female becomes pregnant, nor gives birth, without His knowledge. No one survives for a long life, and no one’s life is snapped short, except in accordance with a pre-existing record. This is easy for GOD.
verses.12: The two seas are not the same; one is fresh and delicious, while the other is salty and undrinkable. From each of them you eat tender meat, and extract jewelry to wear. And you see the ships sailing through them, seeking His provisions, that you may be appreciative.
verses.13: He merges the night into the day, and merges the day into the night. He has committed the sun and the moon to run for a predetermined period of time. Such is GOD your Lord; to Him belongs all kingship. Any idols you set up beside Him do not possess as much as a seed’s shell.
verses.14: If you call on them, they cannot hear you. Even if they hear you, they cannot respond to you. On the Day of Resurrection, they will disown you. None can inform you like the Most Cognizant.
verses.15: O people, you are the ones who need GOD, while GOD is in no need of anyone, the Most Praiseworthy.
verses.16: If He wills, He can get rid of you and substitute a new creation.
verses.17: This is not too difficult for GOD.
verses.18: No soul can carry the sins of another soul. If a soul that is loaded with sins implores another to bear part of its load, no other soul can carry any part of it, even if they were related. The only people to heed your warnings are those who reverence their Lord, even when alone in their privacy, and observe the Contact Prayers (Salat). Whoever purifies his soul, does so for his own good. To GOD is the final destiny.

encrypted.10: من كان يريد العزة فلله العزة جميعا اليه يصعد الكلم الطيب والعمل الصالح يرفعه والذين يمكرون السيئات لهم عذاب شديد ومكر اولئك هو يبور
encrypted.11: والله خلقكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم جعلكم ازواجا وما تحمل من انثى ولا تضع الا بعلمه وما يعمر من معمر ولا ينقص من عمره الا في كتاب ان ذلك على الله يسير
encrypted.12: وما يستوي البحران هذا عذب فرات سائغ شرابه وهذا ملح اجاج ومن كل تاكلون لحما طريا وتستخرجون حلية تلبسونها وترى الفلك فيه مواخر لتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون
encrypted.13: يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري لاجل مسمى ذلكم الله ربكم له الملك والذين تدعون من دونه ما يملكون من قطمير
encrypted.14: ان تدعوهم لا يسمعوا دعاءكم ولو سمعوا ما استجابوا لكم ويوم القيامة يكفرون بشرككم ولا ينبئك مثل خبير
encrypted.15: يا ايها الناس انتم الفقراء الى الله والله هو الغني الحميد
encrypted.16: ان يشا يذهبكم ويات بخلق جديد

encrypted.18: ولا تزر وازرة وزر اخرى وان تدع مثقلة الى حملها لا يحمل منه شيء ولو كان ذا قربى انما تنذر الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب واقاموا الصلاة ومن تزكى فانما يتزكى لنفسه والى الله المصير

data: *35:12-13 When we send our astronauts into space, we provide them with their minimum  needs  of  food,  water,  and  oxygen.  When  we  sided  with  Satan’s  blasphemy billions of years ago (Appendix 7), God launched us into space aboard the spaceship Earth. But God has supplied our spaceship with awesome renewable systems that provide a great variety of fresh foods, water, oxygen, and even the reproduction of us astronauts.
*35:14 People idolize Jesus, Mary, Muhammad, Ali, and/or the saints; such idols are dead, unaware, and utterly powerless. Even when they were alive, they were powerless.

verses.19: The  blind  and  the  seer  are  not equal.
verses.20: Nor are the darkness and the light.
verses.21: Nor  are  the  coolness  of  the  shade and the heat of the sun.
verses.22: Nor  are  the  living  and  the  dead; GOD  causes  whomever  He  wills  to hear.  You  cannot  make  hearers  out of those in the graves.
verses.23: You are no more than a warner.
verses.24: We  have  sent  you*  with  the  truth,  a bearer  of  good  news,  as  well  as  a warner.  Every  community  must  receive a warner.
verses.25: If  they  disbelieve  you,  those  before them  have  also  disbelieved.  Their messengers  went  to  them  with  clear proofs,  and  the  Psalms,  and  the  enlightening scriptures.
verses.26: Subsequently,  I  punished  those  who disbelieved;  how  terrible  was  My retribution!
verses.27: Do  you  not  realize  that  GOD  sends down  from  the  sky  water,  whereby we  produce  fruits  of  various  colors? Even  the  mountains  have  different colors;  the  peaks  are  white,  or  red, or  some  other  color.  And  the  ravens are black.
verses.28: Also,  the  people,  the  animals,  and the  livestock  come  in  various  colors. This  is  why  the  people  who  truly reverence  GOD  are  those  who  are knowledgeable.  GOD  is  Almighty, Forgiving.
verses.29: Surely,  those  who  recite  the  book  of GOD,  observe  the  Contact  Prayers (Salat),  and  from  our  provisions  to them  they  spend—secretly  and  publicly—are  engaged  in  an  investment that never loses.
verses.30: He  will  recompense  them  generously,  and  will  multiply  His  blessings  upon  them.  He  is  Forgiving, Appreciative.
verses.31: What  we  revealed  to  you  in  this scripture  is  the  truth,  consummating all  previous  scriptures.  GOD  is  fully Cognizant of His servants, Seer.
verses.32: We  passed  the  scripture  from  generation  to  generation,  and  we  allowed  whomever  we  chose  from  among our  servants  to  receive  it.  Subsequently,  some  of  them  wronged their  souls,  others  upheld  it  only part  of  the  time,  while  others  were eager  to  work  righteousness  in  accordance  with  GOD’s  will;  this  is  the greatest triumph.
verses.33: They  will  enter  the  gardens  of  Eden, where  they  will  be  adorned  with bracelets  of  gold  and  pearls,  and their  garments  in  it  will  be  made  of silk.
verses.34: They  will  say,  “Praise  GOD  for  removing  all  our  worries.  Our  Lord  is Forgiving, Appreciative.
verses.35: “He  has  admitted  us  into  the  abode of  eternal  bliss,  out  of  His  grace. Never do we get bored herein, never do we get tired.”

data: *35:24 The gematrical value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230), plus the verse number (24) give us a total that is a multiple of 19 (1230 + 24 = 1254 = 19x66).

verses.36: As  for  those  who  disbelieve,  they have  incurred  the  fire  of  Hell,  where they  are  never  finished  by  death,  nor is  the  retribution  ever  commuted  for them.  We  thus  requite  the  unappreciative.
verses.37: They  will  scream  therein,  “Our Lord,  if  you  get  us  out  of  here,  we will  work  righteousness,  instead  of the  works  we  used  to  do.”  Did  we not  give  you  a  life-long  chance,  with continuous  reminders  for  those  who would  take  heed?  Did  you  not  receive  the  warner?  Therefore,  taste (the  consequences).  The  transgressors will have no one to help them.
verses.38: GOD  is  the  Knower  of  the  future  of the  heavens  and  the  earth.  He  is  the Knower of all innermost thoughts.
verses.39: He  is  the  One  who  made  you  inheritors  of  the  earth.  Subsequently, whoever  chooses  to  disbelieve  does so  to  his  own  detriment.  The  disbelief  of  the  disbelievers  only  augments  their  Lord’s  abhorrence  towards  them.  The  disbelief  of  the  disbelievers  plunges  them  deeper  into loss.
verses.40: Say,  “Consider  the  idols  you  have set  up  beside  GOD;  show  me  what on  earth  have  they  created.”  Do they  own  any  partnership  in  the heavens?  Have  we  given  them  a book  wherein  there  is  no  doubt?  Indeed,  what  the  transgressors  promise  one  another  is  no  more  than  an illusion.
verses.41: GOD  is  the  One  who  holds  the heavens  and  the  earth,  lest  they vanish. If anyone else is to hold them,  they  will  most  certainly  vanish. He is Clement, Forgiving.
verses.42: They  swore  by  GOD  solemnly  that if  a  warner  went  to  them,  they  would be  better  guided  than  a  certain  congregation!  However,  now  that  the warner  did  come  to  them,  this  only plunged them deeper into aversion.
verses.43: They  resorted  to  arrogance  on earth,  and  evil  scheming,  and  the evil  schemes  only  backfire  on  those who  scheme  them.  Should  they  then expect  anything  but  the  fate  of  those who  did  the  same  things  in  the  past? You will find that GOD’s system is never  changeable;  you  will  find  that GOD’s system is immutable.
verses.44: Have  they  not  roamed  the  earth  and noted  the  consequences  for  those who  preceded  them?  They  were even  stronger  than  they.  Nothing can  be  hidden  from  GOD  in  the heavens,  nor  on  earth.  He  is  Omniscient, Omnipotent.
verses.45: If  GOD  punished  the  people  for their  sins,  He  would  not  leave  a single  creature  on  earth.  But  He respites  them  for  a  predetermined interim.  Once  their  interim  is  fulfilled, then GOD is Seer of His servants.

encrypted.37: وهم يصطرخون فيها ربنا اخرجنا نعمل صالحا غير الذي كنا نعمل اولم نعمركم ما يتذكر فيه من تذكر وجاءكم النذير فذوقوا فما للظالمين من نصير

encrypted.39: هو الذي جعلكم خلائف في الارض فمن كفر فعليه كفره ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم عند ربهم الا مقتا ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم الا خسارا
encrypted.40: قل ارايتم شركاءكم الذين تدعون من دون الله اروني ماذا خلقوا من الارض ام لهم شرك في السماوات ام اتيناهم كتابا فهم على بينت منه بل ان يعد الظالمون بعضهم بعضا الا غرورا

titles.1:
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sura 36: Y. S.
(Yã Sîn)
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

data: *36:1 See Appendix 1 for the detailed explanation of these initials.

verses.3: Most  assuredly,  you  (Rashad)  are one of the messengers.*
verses.4: On a straight path.
verses.5: This  revelation  is  from  the  Almighty, Most Merciful.
verses.6: To  warn  people  whose  parents were  never  warned,  and  therefore, they are unaware.
verses.7: It  has  been  predetermined  that most of them do not believe.
verses.8: For  we  place  around  their  necks shackles,  up  to  their  chins.  Consequently,  they  become  locked  in  their disbelief.
verses.9: And  we  place  a  barrier  in  front  of them,  and  a  barrier  behind  them, and  thus,  we  veil  them;  they  cannot see.
verses.10: It  is  the  same  whether  you  warn them or not, they cannot believe.*
verses.11: You  will  be  heeded  only  by  those who  uphold  this  message,  and  reverence  the  Most  Gracious—even when  alone  in  their  privacy.  Give them  good  news  of  forgiveness  and a generous recompense.
verses.12: We  will  certainly  revive  the  dead, and  we  have  recorded  everything they have done in this life, as well as the  consequences  that  continue after  their  death.  Everything  we have counted in a profound record.
verses.13: Cite  for  them  the  example  of  people in  a  community  that  received  the messengers.
verses.14: When  we  sent  to  them  two  (messengers),  they  disbelieved  them.  We then  supported  them  by  a  third. They  said,  “We  are  (God’s)  messengers to you.”
verses.15: They  said,  “You  are  no  more  than human  beings  like  us.  The  Most Gracious  did  not  send  down  anything. You are liars.”
verses.16: They  said,  “Our  Lord  knows  that  we have been sent to you.
verses.17: “Our  sole  mission  is  to  deliver  the message.”
verses.18: They  said,  “We  consider  you  bad omens.  Unless  you  refrain,  we  will surely  stone  you,  or  afflict  you  with painful retribution.”
verses.19: They  said,  “Your  omen  depends  on your  response,  now  that  you  have been  reminded.  Indeed,  you  are transgressing people.”
verses.20: A  man  came  from  the  other  end  of the  city,  saying,  “O  my  people,  follow the messengers.
verses.21: “Follow  those  who  do  not  ask  you for any wage, and are guided.
verses.22: “Why  should  I  not  worship  the  One who  initiated  me,  and  to  Him  is  your ultimate return?
verses.23: “Shall  I  set  up  beside  Him  gods?  If the  Most  Gracious  willed  any  harm for  me,  their  intercession  cannot help  me  one  bit,  nor  can  they  rescue me.
verses.24: “In  that  case,  I  would  be  totally astray.

titles.13: Rejecting The Messengers: A Tragic Human Trait*

data: *36:3 See Appendices 2 & 26 for the irrefutable physical evidence.
*36:10 Everyone is already stamped as a believer or a disbeliever. See Appendix 14.
*36:13-27 God’s messengers have proof, advocate God alone, and do not ask for money.

verses.25: “I  have  believed  in  your  Lord; please listen to me.”
verses.26: (At  the  time  of  his  death)  he  was told,  “Enter  Paradise.”  He  said, “Oh, I wish my people knew.
verses.27: “That  my  Lord  has  forgiven  me,  and made me honorable.”
verses.28: We  did  not  send  down  upon  his people,  after  him,  soldiers  from  the sky;  we  did  not  need  to  send  them down.
verses.29: All  it  took  was  one  blow,  whereupon they were stilled.
verses.30: How  sorry  is  the  people’s  condition! Every  time  a  messenger  went  to them, they always ridiculed him.
verses.31: Did  they  not  see  how  many  generations  we  annihilated  before  them, and how they never return to them?
verses.32: Every  one  of  them  will  be  summoned before us.
verses.33: One  sign  for  them  is  the  dead  land: we  revive  it  and  produce  from  it grains for their food.
verses.34: We  grow  in  it  gardens  of  date  palms, and  grapes,  and  we  cause  springs  to gush out therein.
verses.35: This  is  to  provide  them  with  fruits, and to let them manufacture with their  own  hands  whatever  they need. Would they be thankful?
verses.36: Glory  be  to  the  One  who  created  all kinds  of  plants  from  the  earth,  as well  as  themselves,  and  other  creations that they do not even know.
verses.37: Another  sign  for  them  is  the  night: we  remove  the  daylight  therefrom, whereupon they are in darkness.
verses.38: The  sun  sets  into  a  specific  location, according  to  the  design  of  the  Almighty, the Omniscient.
verses.39: The  moon  we  designed  to  appear  in stages,  until  it  becomes  like  an  old curved sheath.
verses.40: The  sun  is  never  to  catch  up  with  the moon—the  night  and  the  day  never deviate—each  of  them  is  floating  in its own orbit.
verses.41: Another  sign  for  them  is  that  we carried  their  ancestors  on  the  loaded ark.
verses.42: Then  created  the  same  for  them  to ride in.
verses.43: If  we  willed,  we  could  have  drowned them,  so  that  their  screaming  would not  be  heard,  nor  could  they  be saved.
verses.44: Instead,  we  shower  them  with  mercy, and let them enjoy for awhile.
verses.45: Yet,  when  they  are  told,  “Learn from  your  past,  to  work  righteousness  for  your  future,  that  you  may attain mercy,”

titles.26: The Righteous Go Straight to Paradise*

Ridiculing The Messengers:

data: *36:26 The righteous do not really die; they simply move on to the same Paradise where Adam & Eve lived. They join the prophets, saints and martyrs in an active and utopian life (see Appendix 17).
*36:30 If the messenger presents solid proof of messengership, advocates the worship of God alone, and does not ask us for money, why should we not believe?  (See Appendix 2.)

verses.46: No  matter  what  kind  of  proof  is given to them from their Lord, they consistently disregard it.
verses.47: When  they  are  told,  “Give  from GOD’s provisions to you,” those who disbelieve say to those who believe, “Why should we give to those whom GOD could feed, if He so willed? You are really far astray.”
verses.48: They  also  challenge,  “When  will that promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
verses.49: All they see will be one blow that overwhelms them, while they dispute.
verses.50: They will  not  even  have  time  to make a will, nor will they be able to return to their people.
verses.51: The horn will be blown, whereupon they will rise from the grave and go to their Lord.
verses.52: They will say, “Woe to us. Who resurrected us from our death? This is what the Most Gracious has promised. The messengers were right.”
verses.53: All it will take is one blow, whereupon they are summoned before us.
verses.54: On that day, no soul will be wronged in the least. You will be paid precisely for whatever you did.
verses.55: The dwellers of Paradise will be, on that day, happily busy.
verses.56: They abide with their  spouses in beautiful  shade,  enjoying  comfortable furnishings.
verses.57: They will have fruits therein; they will have anything they wish.
verses.58: Greetings  of  peace  from  a  Most Merciful Lord.
verses.59: As for you, O guilty ones, you will be set aside.
verses.60: Did  I  not  covenant  with  you,  O Children of Adam, that you shall not worship the devil? That he is your most ardent enemy?
verses.61: And  that  you  shall  worship  Me alone? This is the right path.
verses.62: He has misled multitudes of you. Did you not possess any understanding?
verses.63: This is the Hell that was promised for you.
verses.64: Today you will burn in it, as a consequence of your disbelief.
verses.65: On  that  day  we  will  seal  their mouths; their hands and feet will bear witness to everything they had done.
verses.66: If we will, we can veil their eyes and, consequently, when they seek the path, they will not see.
verses.67: If we will, we can freeze them in place; thus, they can neither move forward, nor go back.
verses.68: Whomever we permit to live for a long time, we revert him to weakness. Do they not understand?
verses.69: What we taught him (the messenger) was not poetry, nor is he (a poet). This is but a formidable proof,* and a profound Quran.

titles.60: The Devil is the Other Alternative

data: *36:69 The word “Zikr” refers frequently to the Quran’s great mathematical code, which is certainly not literary, nor poetry. Please check out 38:1,38:8; 15:6,15:9; 16:44; 21:2,21:24; 26:5; & 36:11.

verses.70: To preach to those who are alive, and to expose the disbelievers.
verses.71: Have they not seen that we created for them, with our own hands, livestock that they own?
verses.72: And we subdued them for them; some they ride, and some they eat.
verses.73: They derive other benefits from them, as well as drinks. Would they not be appreciative?
verses.74: They set up beside GOD other gods, perhaps they can be of help to them!
verses.75: On the contrary, they cannot help them; they end up serving them as devoted soldiers.
verses.76: Therefore, do not be saddened by their utterances. We are fully aware of  everything  they  conceal  and everything they declare.
verses.77: Does the human being not see that we created him from a tiny drop, then he turns into an ardent enemy?
verses.78: He  raises  a  question  to  us—while forgetting  his  initial  creation— “Who can resurrect the bones after they had rotted?”
verses.79: Say, “The One who initiated them in the first place will resurrect them. He is fully aware of every creation.”
verses.80: He is the One who creates for you, from the green trees, fuel which you burn for light.
verses.81: Is not the One who created the heavens and the earth able to recreate the same? Yes indeed; He is the Creator, the Omniscient.
verses.82: All He needs to do to carry out any command is say to it, “Be,” and it is.
verses.83: Therefore, glory be to the One in whose hand is the sovereignty over all things, and to Him you will be returned.*

data: *36:83 It is noteworthy that the gematrical value of “Rashad” (505), plus the gematrical value of “Khalifa” (725), plus the sura number (36), plus the number of verses (83), produces a total that is a multiple of 19 (505 + 725 + 36 + 83 = 1349=19x71). Also, Sura 36 is number 19 among the 29 initialed suras.
*37:5 Every heavenly body rises on the planet earth, and sets. Every rise is called “east.”
*37:6 We live in the innermost and smallest universe. The jinns are confined to this universe.

verses.9: They  have  been  condemned;  they have incurred an eternal retribution.
verses.10: If any of them ventures to charge the outer  limits,  he  gets  struck  with  a fierce projectile.
verses.11: Ask  them,  “Are  they  more  difficult to  create,  or  the  other  creations?” We created them from wet mud.
verses.12: While you are awed, they mock.
verses.13: When reminded, they take no heed.
verses.14: When  they  see  proof,  they  ridicule it.
verses.15: They say, “This is obviously magic!
verses.16: “After  we  die  and  become  dust  and bones, do we get resurrected?
verses.17: “Even our ancient ancestors?”
verses.18: Say,  “Yes,  you  will  be  forcibly  summoned.”
verses.19: All  it  takes  is  one  nudge,  whereupon they (stand up) looking.
verses.20: They  will  say,  “Woe  to  us;  this  is  the Day of Judgment.”
verses.21: This  is  the  day  of  decision  that  you used to disbelieve in.
verses.22: Summon  the  transgressors,  and their  spouses,  and  the  idols  they worshiped
verses.23: beside  GOD,  and  guide  them  to  the path of Hell.
verses.24: Stop them, and ask them:
verses.25: “Why  do  you  not  help  one  another?”
verses.26: They  will  be,  on  that  day,  totally submitting.
verses.27: They  will  come  to  each  other,  questioning and blaming one another.
verses.28: They will say  (to their leaders), “You used  to  come  to  us  from  the  right side.”
verses.29: They  will  respond,  “It  is  you  who were not believers.
verses.30: “We  never  had  any  power  over  you; it is you who were wicked.
verses.31: “We  justly  incurred  our  Lord’s judgment; now we have to suffer.
verses.32: “We  misled  you,  only  because  we were astray.”

verses.46: Clear  and  delicious  for  the  drinkers.
verses.47: Never  polluted,  and  never  exhausted.

verses.53: “  ‘After  we  die  and  turn  into  dust and  bones,  do  we  get  called  to  account?’ ”

verses.58: “(Do you still believe) that we die,

verses.60: Such is the greatest triumph.
verses.61: This  is  what  every  worker  should work for.
verses.62: Is  this  a  better  destiny,  or  the  tree  of bitterness?
verses.63: We  have  rendered  it  a  punishment for the transgressors.
verses.64: It  is  a  tree  that  grows  in  the  heart  of Hell.

verses.68: Then they will return to Hell.
verses.69: They found their parents astray.
verses.70: And  they  blindly  followed  in  their footsteps.
verses.71: Most  of  the  previous  generations have strayed in the same manner.
verses.72: We have sent to them warners.
verses.73: Note  the  consequences  for  those who have been warned.
verses.74: Only  GOD’s  servants  who  are  absolutely  devoted  to  Him  alone  (are saved).
verses.75: Thus,  Noah  called  upon  us,  and  we were the best responders.
verses.76: We  saved  him  and  his  family  from the great disaster.
verses.77: We  made  his  companions  the  survivors.
verses.78: And  we  preserved  his  history  for subsequent generations.
verses.79: Peace  be  upon  Noah  among  the peoples.

data: *37:55 People who make it to Heaven will be able to visit their relatives and friends in Hell, without adverse consequences. In the Hereafter, anyone can move downward, but not upward beyond a certain limit. The limit is decided by one’s degree of growth and development (Appendix 5).

data: *38:1 This Initial (Saad) occurs in suras 7, 19, & 38 a total of 152 times, 19x8 (Appendix 1).
**38:1 The word “Zikr” is made distinct from the Quran and clearly points at the Quran’s miraculous mathematical code. See 15:6, 15:9; 16:44; 21:2, 21:24; 26:5; & 36:11, 36:69.

verses.4: They  wondered  that  a  warner should  come  to  them,  from  among them.  The  disbelievers  said,  “A magician; a liar.
verses.5: “Did  he  make  the  gods  into  one god? This is really strange.”
verses.6: The  leaders  announced,  “Go  and steadfastly  persevere  in  worshiping your gods. This is what is desired.
verses.7: “We  never  heard  of  this  from  the religion of our fathers. This is a lie.
verses.8: “Why  did  the  proof  come  down  to him,  instead  of  us?”  Indeed,  they  are doubtful  of  My  proof.  Indeed,  they have not yet tasted My retribution.
verses.9: Do  they  own  the  treasures  of  mercy of  your  Lord,  the  Almighty,  the Grantor.
verses.10: Do  they  possess  the  sovereignty  of the  heavens  and  the  earth,  and everything  between  them?  Let  them help themselves.
verses.11: Instead,  whatever  forces  they  can muster—even  if  all  their  parties banded together—will be defeated.
verses.12: Disbelieving  before  them  were  the people  of  Noah,  ‘Ãd,  and  the  mighty Pharaoh.
verses.13: Also,  Thamoud,  the  people  of  Lot, the  dwellers  of  the  Woods  (of Midyan); those were the opponents.
verses.14: Each  of  them  disbelieved  the  messengers  and  thus,  My  retribution was inevitable.
verses.15: These  people  can  expect  a  single blow,  from  which  they  never  recover.
verses.16: They  challenged:  “Our  Lord,  why do  you  not  rush  the  retribution  for us, before the Day of Reckoning.”
verses.17: Be  patient  in  the  face  of  their  utterances,  and  remember  our  servant David,  the  resourceful;  he  was  obedient.
verses.18: We  committed  the  mountains  in  his service,  glorifying  with  him  night and day.
verses.19: Also  the  birds  were  committed  to serve him; all were obedient to him.
verses.20: We  strengthened  his  kingship,  and endowed  him  with  wisdom  and good logic.
verses.21: Have  you  received  news  of  the  feuding  men  who  sneaked  into  his  sanctuary?
verses.22: When  they  entered  his  room,  he  was startled.  They  said,  “Have  no  fear. We  are  feuding  with  one  another, and  we  are  seeking  your  fair  judgment.  Do  not  wrong  us,  and  guide  us in the right path.
verses.23: “This  brother  of  mine  owns  ninety nine*  sheep,  while  I  own  one  sheep. He  wants  to  mix  my  sheep  with  his, and continues to pressure me.”

data: *38:23 This is the only place where the number 99 occurs. Thirty different numbers are mentioned in the Quran, and their total comes to 162146, 19x8534. See Appendix 1.

verses.24: He said, “He is being unfair to you by asking to combine your sheep with his. Most people who combine their properties treat each other unfairly, except those who believe and work righteousness, and these are so few.” Afterwards, David wondered if he made the right judgment. He thought that we were testing him. He then implored his Lord for forgiveness, bowed down, and repented.*
verses.25: We forgave him in this matter. We have granted him a position of honor with us, and a beautiful abode.
verses.26: O David, we have made you a ruler on earth. Therefore, you shall judge among the people equitably, and do not  follow your personal  opinion, lest it diverts you from the way of GOD. Surely, those who stray off the way of GOD incur severe retribution for forgetting the Day of Reckoning.
verses.27: We did not create the heaven and the earth, and everything between them, in vain. Such is the thinking of those  who  disbelieve.  Therefore, woe to those who disbelieve; they will suffer in Hell.
verses.28: Shall we treat those who believe and lead a righteous life as we treat those who commit evil on earth? Shall we treat the righteous as we treat the wicked?
verses.29: This is a scripture that we sent down to you, that is sacred—perhaps they reflect on its verses. Those who possess intelligence will take heed.
verses.30: To David we granted Solomon; a good and obedient servant.
verses.31: One  day  he  became  preoccupied with beautiful horses, until the night fell.
verses.32: He then said, “I enjoyed the material things more than I enjoyed worshiping my Lord, until the sun was gone.*
verses.33: “Bring them back.” (To bid farewell,) he rubbed their legs and necks.
verses.34: We thus put Solomon to the test; we blessed him with vast material wealth, but he steadfastly submitted.*
verses.35: He said, “My Lord, forgive me, and grant me a kingship never attained by anyone else. You are the Grantor.”
verses.36: We (answered his prayer and) committed  the  wind  at  his  disposal, pouring rain wherever he wanted.
verses.37: And the devils, building and diving.
verses.38: Others were placed at his disposal.
verses.39: “This is our provision to you; you may give generously, or withhold, without limits.”

data: *38:24 In this clear example, 99 on one side vs. 1 on the other side, David’s extreme care to render the correct judgment caused him to ask forgiveness. Are we this careful?
*38:32 Solomon missed his afternoon prayer because of his horses. To nullify Satan’s possible claim that Solomon loved his horses more than loving God, he got rid of his horses.
*38:34 & 38:41 Solomon and Job represent both ends of the testing spectrum. We are put to the test through wealth, health, or lack of them, to see if we worship God alone under all circumstances.

verses.40: He has deserved an honorable position with us, and a wonderful abode.
verses.41: Remember  our  servant  Job:  he called upon his Lord, “The devil has afflicted  me  with  hardship  and pain.”
verses.42: “Strike the ground with your foot. A spring will give you healing and a drink.”
verses.43: We  restored  his  family  for  him; twice as many. Such is our mercy; a reminder for those who possess intelligence.
verses.44: “Now, you shall travel the land and preach the message, to fulfill your pledge.” We found him steadfast. What a good servant! He was a submitter.
verses.45: Remember  also our servants  Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. They were resourceful, and possessed vision.
verses.46: We  bestowed  upon  them  a  great blessing: awareness  of  the  Hereafter.
verses.47: They were chosen, for they were among the most righteous.
verses.48: Remember Ismail, Elisha, and ZalKifl; among the most righteous.
verses.49: This is a reminder: The righteous have deserved a wonderful destiny.
verses.50: The gardens of Eden will open up their gates for them.
verses.51: Relaxing therein, they will be given many kinds of fruits and drinks.
verses.52: They will have wonderful spouses.
verses.53: This is what you have deserved on the Day of Reckoning.
verses.54: Our provisions are inexhaustible.
verses.55: As for the transgressors, they have incurred a miserable destiny.
verses.56: Hell  is  where they  burn;  what  a miserable abode!
verses.57: What they taste therein will be hellish drinks and bitter food.
verses.58: And much more of the same kind.
verses.59: “This is a group to be thrown into Hell with you.” They will not be welcomed (by the residents of Hell). They have deserved to burn in the hellfire.
verses.60: The newcomers will respond, “Nor are you welcomed. You are the ones who preceded us and misled us. Therefore,  suffer  this  miserable end.”
verses.61: They will also say, “Our Lord, these are the ones who led us into this; double the retribution of hellfire for them.”
verses.62: They will say, “How come we do not see (in Hell) people we used to count among the wicked?
verses.63: “We used to ridicule them; we used to turn our eyes away from them.”
verses.64: This is a predetermined fact: the people of Hell will feud with one another.
verses.65: Say, “I warn you; there is no other god  beside  GOD,  the  One,  the Supreme.

verses.66: “The  Lord  of  the  heavens  and the earth, and everything between them; the Almighty, the Forgiving.”

verses.1: This is a revelation of the scripture, from GOD, the Almighty, the Wise.
verses.2: We sent down to you this scripture, truthfully; you shall worship GOD, devoting your religion to Him alone.
verses.3: Absolutely,  the  religion  shall  be devoted to GOD alone. Those who set up idols beside Him say, “We idolize them only to bring us closer to GOD; for they are in a better position!” GOD will judge them regarding their disputes. GOD does not guide such liars, disbelievers.
verses.4: If GOD wanted to have a son, He could have chosen whomever He willed from among His creations. Be He glorified; He is GOD, the One, the Supreme.

data: *38:69 The feud in the High Society was triggered by Satan’s challenge to God’s absolute authority. This is definitely the most important event in the history of the human race. We failed to make a firm stand regarding God’s absolute authority. This life represents the third and final chance to redeem ourselves (See the Introduction and Appendix 7).

verses.5: He  created  the  heavens  and  the earth  truthfully.  He  rolls  the  night over  the  day,  and  rolls  the  day  over the  night.*  He  committed  the  sun and  the  moon,  each  running  for  a finite  period.  Absolutely,  He  is  the Almighty, the Forgiving.
verses.6: He  created  you  from  one  person, then  created  from  him  his  mate.  He sent down to you eight kinds of livestock.  He  creates  you  in  your  mothers’  bellies,  creation  after  creation, in  trimesters  of  darkness.  Such  is GOD  your  Lord.  To  Him  belongs  all sovereignty.  There  is  no  other  god beside  Him.  How  could  you  deviate?
verses.7: If  you  disbelieve,  GOD  does  not need  anyone.  But  He  dislikes  to  see His  servants  make  the  wrong  decision.  If  you  decide  to  be  appreciative, He is pleased for you. No soul bears  the  sins  of  any  other  soul.  Ultimately,  to  your  Lord  is  your  return, then  He  will  inform  you  of  everything  you  had  done.  He  is  fully aware of the innermost thoughts.
verses.8: When  the  human  being  is  afflicted, he  implores  his  Lord,  sincerely devoted  to  Him.  But  as  soon  as  He blesses  him,  he  forgets  his  previous imploring,  sets  up  idols  to  rank  with GOD  and  to  divert  others  from  His path.  Say,  “Enjoy  your  disbelief temporarily;  you  have  incurred  the hellfire.”
verses.9: Is  it  not  better  to  be  one  of  those who meditate in the night, prostrating and  staying  up,  being  aware  of  the Hereafter,  and  seeking  the  mercy  of their  Lord?  Say,  “Are  those  who know  equal  to  those  who  do  not know?”  Only  those  who  possess  intelligence will take heed.
verses.10: Say,  “O  My  servants  who  believed, you  shall  reverence  your  Lord.”  For those  who  worked  righteousness  in this  world,  a  good  reward.  GOD’s earth  is  spacious,  and  those  who steadfastly  persevere  will  receive their  recompense  generously,  without limits.
verses.11: Say,  “I  have  been  commanded  to worship  GOD,  devoting  the  religion absolutely to Him alone.
verses.12: “And  I  was  commanded  to  be  the utmost submitter.”
verses.13: Say,  “I  fear,  if  I  disobeyed  my  Lord, the retribution of a great day.”
verses.14: Say,  “GOD  is  the  only  One  I  worship,  devoting  my  religion  absolutely to Him alone.
verses.15: “Therefore,  worship  whatever  you wish  besides  Him.”  Say,  “The  real losers  are  those  who  lose  their  souls, and  their  families,  on  the  Day  of Resurrection.”  Most  certainly,  this is the real loss.
verses.16: They  will  have  masses  of  fire on  top of  them,  and  under  them.  GOD  thus alerts  His  servants:  O  My  servants, you shall reverence Me.

data: *39:5 This verse clearly informs us that the earth is round. The Arabic for “He rolls” (Yukawwir) is derived from the Arabic word for “ball” (Kurah). Since the Earth is not exactly round, a specific reference to its shape is given in 79:30. The Quran is replete with scientific information that became known to us centuries after the revelation of the Quran. See Appendix 20.

verses.17: As  for  those  who  discard  the  worship  of  all  idols,  and  devote  themselves  totally  to  GOD  alone,  they have  deserved  happiness.  Give good news to My servants.
verses.18: They  are  the  ones  who  examine  all words,  then  follow  the  best.  These are  the  ones  whom  GOD  has  guided;  these  are  the  ones  who  possess intelligence.
verses.19: With  regard  to  those  who  have deserved  the  retribution,  can  you save those who are already in Hell?
verses.20: As  for  those  who  reverence  their Lord,  they  will  have  mansions  upon mansions  constructed  for  them, with  flowing  streams.  This  is  GOD’s promise,  and  GOD  never  breaks  His promise.
verses.21: Do  you  not  see  that  GOD  sends down  from  the  sky  water,  then places  it  into  underground  wells, then  produces  with  it  plants  of various  colors,  then  they  grow  until they  turn  yellow,  then  He  turns  them into  hay?  This  should  be  a  reminder for those who possess intelligence.
verses.22: If  GOD  renders  one’s  heart  content with  Submission,  he  will  be  following  a  light  from  his  Lord.  Therefore, woe  to  those  whose  hearts  are  hardened  against  GOD’s  message;  they have gone far astray.
verses.23: GOD  has  revealed  herein  the  best Hadith;  a  book  that  is  consistent, and  points  out  both  ways  (to  Heaven and  Hell).  The  skins  of  those  who reverence  their  Lord  cringe  therefrom, then their skins and their hearts  soften  up  for  GOD’s  message.  Such  is  GOD’s  guidance;  He bestows  it  upon  whomever  He  wills. As  for  those  sent  astray  by  GOD, nothing can guide them.
verses.24: What  is  better  than  saving  one’s face  from  the  terrible  retribution  on the  Day  of  Resurrection?  The  transgressors  will  be  told,  “Taste  the  consequences of what you earned.”
verses.25: Others  before  them  have  disbelieved  and,  consequently,  the  retribution  afflicted  them  whence  they never expected.
verses.26: GOD  has  condemned  them  to  humiliation  in  this  life,  and  the  retribution  in  the  Hereafter  will  be  far worse, if they only knew.
verses.27: We  have  cited  for  the  people  every kind  of  example  in  this  Quran,  that they may take heed.
verses.28: An  Arabic  Quran,  without  any  ambiguity, that they may be righteous.
verses.29: GOD  cites  the  example  of  a  man who  deals  with  disputing  partners (Hadith),  compared  to  a  man  who deals  with  only  one  consistent source  (Quran).  Are  they  the  same? Praise  be  to  GOD;  most  of  them  do not know.
verses.30: You  (Muhammad)  will  surely  die, just like they will die.
verses.31: On  the  Day  of  Resurrection,  before your  Lord,  you  people  will  feud  with one another.
verses.32: Who  is  more  evil  than  one  who  attributes  lies  to  GOD,  while  disbelieving  in  the  truth  that  has  come  to him?  Is  Hell  not  a  just  requital  for the disbelievers?
