verses.33: As for those who promote the truth, and believe therein, they are the righteous.
verses.34: They will get everything they wish, at their Lord. Such is the reward for the righteous.
verses.35: GOD remits their sinful works, and rewards them generously for their good works.
verses.36: Is GOD not sufficient for His servant? They frighten you with the idols  they  set  up  beside  Him. Whomever GOD sends astray, nothing can guide him.
verses.37: And whomever GOD guides, nothing can send him astray. Is GOD not Almighty, Avenger?
verses.38: If you ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will say, “GOD.” Say, “Why then do you set up idols beside GOD? If GOD willed any adversity for me, can they relieve such an adversity? And if He willed a blessing for me, can they prevent  such  a  blessing?”  Say, “GOD is sufficient for me.” In Him the trusters shall trust.
verses.39: Say, “O my people, do your best and I will do my best; you will surely find out.
verses.40: “(You  will  find out)  who  has incurred  shameful  punishment,  and has  deserved  an  eternal  retribution.”
verses.41: We  have  revealed  the  scripture through you for the people, truthfully. Then, whoever is guided is guided for his own good, and whoever goes astray goes astray to his own detriment. You are not their advocate.
verses.42: GOD puts the souls to death when the end of their life comes, and also at the time of sleep. Thus, He takes some back during their sleep, while others are allowed to continue living until the end of their predetermined interim. This should provide lessons for people who reflect.
verses.43: Have  they  invented  intercessors  to mediate between them and GOD? Say, “What if they do not possess any power, nor understanding?”
verses.44: Say,  “All  intercession  belongs  to GOD.”  To  Him  belongs  all  sovereignty  of  the  heavens  and the earth,  then  to  Him  you  will  be returned.
verses.45: When GOD ALONE is  mentioned, the  hearts  of  those  who  do  not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion. But when others are mentioned  beside  Him,  they  become satisfied.*
verses.46: Proclaim: “Our god, Initiator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of all secrets  and  declarations,  You  are the  only  One  who  judges  among Your servants regarding their disputes.”

titles.38:
They Believe in God Yet,
They Are Going to Hell

data: *39:45 Despite the clear commandment in 3:18 that the First Pillar of Islam is proclaiming:  “Ash-hadu  An  Lã  Elãha  Ellã  Allãh  (there  is  no  other  god  beside  God),”  the majority  of  “Muslims”  insist  upon  adding  the  name  of  Muhammad.  This  Greatest Criterion alerts us that rejoicing in adding the name of Muhammad, or any other name, exposes disbelief in the Hereafter. See also Footnote 17:46.

verses.47: If  those  who  transgressed  owned everything on earth, even twice as much, they would readily give it up to avoid the terrible retribution on the Day of Resurrection. They will be shown by GOD what they never expected.
verses.48: The sinful works they had earned will be shown to them, and the very things they used to mock will come back to haunt them.
verses.49: If the human is touched by adversity, he implores us, but as soon as we bestow a blessing upon him, he says, “I attained this because of my cleverness!” Indeed, this is only a test, but most of them do not know.
verses.50: Those before them have uttered the same thing, and their earnings did not help them in the least.
verses.51: They suffered the consequences of their evil works. Similarly, the transgressors among the present generation will suffer the consequences of their evil works; they cannot escape.
verses.52: Do they not realize that GOD is the One who increases the provision for whomever He chooses, and withholds? These are lessons for people who believe.
verses.53: Proclaim: “O My servants who exceeded the limits, never despair of GOD’s mercy. For GOD forgives all sins. He is the Forgiver, Most Merciful.”
verses.54: You shall obey your Lord, and submit to Him totally, before the retribution  overtakes  you,  then  you cannot be helped.
verses.55: And  follow  the  best  path  that  is pointed out for you by your Lord, before the retribution overtakes you suddenly when you least expect it.
verses.56: Lest a soul may say, “How sorry I am for disregarding GOD’s commandments; I was certainly one of the mockers.”
verses.57: Or say, “Had GOD guided me, I would have been with the righteous.”
verses.58: Or say, when it sees the retribution, “If I get another chance, I will work righteousness.”
verses.59: Yes  indeed  (you  did  get  enough chances). My proofs came to you, but you rejected them, turned arrogant, and became a disbeliever.
verses.60: On the Day of Resurrection you will see the faces of those who lied about GOD covered with misery. Is Hell not the right retribution for the arrogant ones?
verses.61: And GOD will save those who have maintained  righteousness;  He  will reward them. No harm will touch them, nor will they have any grief.
verses.62: GOD is the Creator of all things, and He is in full control of all things.
verses.63: To Him belongs all decisions in the heavens and the earth, and those who disbelieve in GOD’s revelations are the real losers.
verses.64: Say, “Is it other than GOD you exhort me to worship, O you ignorant ones?”
verses.65: It has been revealed to you, and to those before you that if you ever commit idol worship, all your works will be nullified, and you will be with the losers.

verses.66: Therefore,  you  shall  worship  GOD alone, and be appreciative.
verses.67: They  can  never  fathom  the  greatness  of  GOD.  The  whole  earth  is within  His  fist  on  the  Day  of  Resurrection.  In  fact,  the  universes  are folded  within  His  right  hand.*  Be He  glorified;  He  is  much  too  high above needing any partners.
verses.68: The  horn  will  be  blown,  whereupon everyone  in  the  heavens  and  the earth  will  be  struck  unconscious,  except  those  who  will  be  spared  by GOD.  Then  it  will  be  blown  another time,  whereupon  they  will  all  rise up, looking.*
verses.69: Then  the  earth  will  shine  with  the light  of  its  Lord.  The  record  will  be proclaimed,  and  the  prophets  and the  witnesses  will  be  brought  forth. Everyone  will  then  be  judged  equitably, without the least injustice.
verses.70: Every  soul  will  be  paid  for  whatever it did, for He is fully aware of everything they have done.
verses.71: Those  who  disbelieved  will  be  led  to Hell  in  throngs.  When  they  get  to  it, and its gates are opened, its guards will  say,  “Did  you  not  receive  messengers  from  among  you,  who recited  to  you  the  revelations  of your  Lord,  and  warned  you  about meeting  this  day?”  They  will  answer, “Yes  indeed.  But  the  word  ‘retribution’ was already stamped upon the disbelievers.”
verses.72: It  will  be  said,  “Enter  the  gates  of Hell,  wherein  you  abide  forever.” What  a  miserable  destiny  for  the arrogant.
verses.73: Those  who  reverenced  their  Lord will  be  led  to  Paradise  in  throngs. When  they  get  to  it,  and  its  gates  are opened,  its  guards  will  say,  “Peace be  upon  you;  you  have  won.  Therefore, you abide herein forever.”
verses.74: They  will  say,  “Praise  be  to  GOD, who  fulfilled  His  promise  to  us,  and made  us  inherit  the  earth,  enjoying Paradise  as  we  please.”  What  a beautiful  recompense  for  the  workers!
verses.75: You  will  see  the  angels  floating around  the  throne,  glorifying  and praising  their  Lord.  After  the  equitable  judgment  is  issued  to  all,  it  will be  proclaimed:  “Praise  be  to  GOD, Lord of the universe.”

data: *39:67  Our  universe,  with  its  billion  galaxies,  a  billion  trillion  stars,  uncountable decillions of heavenly bodies, spanning many billions of light-years, is the smallest and innermost  of  seven  universes.  This  incomprehensible  vastness  of  the  seven  universes  is within God’s hand. Such is the greatness of God. See Appendix 6.

*39:68  The  sequence  of  events  on  the  Day  of  Resurrection  begins  with  the  symbolic blowing  of  the  horn.  The  second  blowing  of  the  horn—by  a  creature  who  was  spared from unconsciousness—marks the resurrection of all people; they will be resurrected on today’s earth. This earth will then be destroyed by the physical coming of God, then a new earth and new heavens will be created (14:48). We will then be stratified according to our degree of development (Appendix 11).

verses.1: H.M.*
verses.2: This  revelation  of  the  scripture  is from  GOD,  the  Almighty,  the  Omniscient.
verses.3: Forgiver  of  sins,  acceptor  of  repentance,  strict  in  enforcing  retribution,  and  possessor  of  all  power. There  is  no  other  god  beside  Him. To Him is the ultimate destiny.
verses.4: None  argues  against  GOD’s  revelations  except  those  who  disbelieve. Do  not  be  impressed  by  their  apparent success.
verses.5: Disbelieving  before  them  were  the people  of  Noah,  and  many  other  opponents  after  them.  Every  community  persecuted  their  messenger to  neutralize  him.  And  they  argued with  falsehood,  to  defeat  the  truth. Consequently,  I  punished  them; how terrible was My retribution!
verses.6: Thus,  the  judgment  of  your  Lord  is already  stamped  upon  those  who disbelieve,  that  they  are  the  dwellers of Hell.
verses.7: Those  who  serve  the  throne  and  all those  around  it  glorify  and  praise their  Lord,  and  believe  in  Him.  And they  ask  forgiveness  for  those  who believe:  “Our  Lord,  Your  mercy and Your knowledge encompass all things.  Forgive  those  who  repent and  follow  Your  path,  and  spare them the retribution of Hell.
verses.8: “Our  Lord,  and  admit  them  into  the gardens  of  Eden  that  You  promised for  them  and  for  the  righteous among  their  parents,  spouses,  and children.  You  are  the  Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.9: “And  protect  them  from  falling  in sin.  Whomever  You  protect  from falling  in  sin,  on  that  day,  has  attained  mercy  from  You.  This  is  the greatest triumph.”
verses.10: Those  who  disbelieve  will  be  told, “GOD’s  abhorrence  towards  you  is even  worse  than  your  own  abhorrence  towards  yourselves.  For  you were  invited  to  believe,  but  you chose to disbelieve.”
verses.11: They  will  say,  “Our  Lord,  you  have put us to death twice, * and You gave us two lives; now we have confessed our sins. Is there any way out?”
verses.12: This  is  because  when  GOD  ALONE  was  advocated,  you  disbelieved,  but  when  others  were mentioned  beside  Him,  you  believed.  Therefore,  GOD’s  judgment  has been  issued;  He  is  the  Most  High, the Great.

data: *40:1 The initials “Hã Mîm” occur in Suras 40-46, The total frequency of occurrence of the letters “Ha” and “Mîm” in the seven suras is 2147, or 19x113 (Appendix 1).

*40:11-12 The disbelievers go through two deaths, while the righteous believers do not taste death, beyond the death we already experienced (44:56). Please see Appendix 17. The reason for going to Hell is obvious; even those who believe in God associate others with Him (see 39:45).

verses.13: He  is  the  One  who  continuously shows you His proofs, and sends down to you from the sky provisions. Only those who totally submit will be able to take heed.
verses.14: Therefore,  you  shall  devote  your worship  absolutely  to  GOD  ALONE, even if the disbelievers dislike it.
verses.15: Possessor of the highest ranks, and Ruler of the whole dominion. He sends inspiration, bearing His commands,  to  whomever  He  chooses from among His servants, to warn about the Day of Summoning.
verses.16: That is the day when everyone will be completely exposed; none of them will hide anything from GOD. To whom belongs all sovereignty on that day? To GOD, the One, the Supreme.
verses.17: On that day, every soul will be requited for whatever it had earned. There will be no injustice on that day. GOD is most efficient in reckoning.
verses.18: Warn them about the imminent day, when the hearts will be terrified, and many will be remorseful. The transgressors will have no friend nor an intercessor to be obeyed.
verses.19: He is fully aware of what the eyes cannot see, and everything that the minds conceal.
verses.20: GOD  judges  equitably,  while  the idols they implore beside Him cannot judge anything. GOD is the One who is the Hearer, the Seer.
verses.21: Did  they  not  roam  the  earth  and note the consequences for those before  them?  They  used  to  be stronger than they, and more productive  on  earth.  But  GOD  punished them for their sins, and nothing could protect them from GOD.
verses.22: That  is  because  their  messengers went to them with clear proofs, but they  disbelieved.  Consequently, GOD punished them. He is Mighty, strict in enforcing retribution.
verses.23: We sent Moses with our signs and a profound authority.
verses.24: To  Pharaoh,  Hãmãn,  and  Qãroon But they said, “A magician; a liar.”
verses.25: And when he showed them the truth from us, they said, “Kill the sons of those who believed with him, and spare their daughters.” Thus, the scheming of the disbelievers is always wicked.
verses.26: Pharaoh said, “Let me kill Moses, and  let  him  implore  his  Lord. I worry lest he corrupts your religion, or  spreads  evil  throughout  the land.”
verses.27: Moses said, “I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.”
verses.28: A believing man among Pharaoh’s people,  who  was  concealing his belief, said, “How can you kill a man just for saying, ‘My Lord is GOD,’ and he has shown you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is a liar, that is his problem, and if he is truthful, you benefit from his promises. Surely, GOD does not guide any transgressor, liar.

verses.29: “O  my  people,  today  you  have kingship  and  the  upperhand.  But who will help us against GOD’s judgment, should it come to us?” Pharaoh said, “You are to follow only what I see fit; I will guide you only in the right path.”
verses.30: The one who believed said, “O my people, I fear for you the same fate as the previous opponents.
verses.31: “The opponents of Noah, and ‘Ãd, Thamoud, and others who came after them. GOD does not wish any injustice for the people.
verses.32: “O my people, I fear for you the Day of Summoning.
verses.33: “That is the day when you may wish to turn around and flee. But nothing will protect you then from GOD. Whomever GOD sends astray, nothing can guide him.”
verses.34: Joseph had come to you before that with clear revelations, but you continued to doubt his message. Then, when he died you said, “GOD will not send any other messenger after him.  (He  was  the  last  messenger)!”** GOD thus sends astray those who are transgressors, doubtful.
verses.35: They argue against GOD’s revelations, without any basis. This is a trait that is most abhorred by GOD and by those who believe. GOD thus seals  the  hearts  of  every  arrogant tyrant.
verses.36: Pharaoh said, “O Hãmãn, build for me a high tower, that I may reach out and discover.
verses.37: “I want to reach the heaven, and take a look at the god of Moses. I believe he is a liar.” Thus were the evil works of Pharaoh adorned in his eyes, and thus was he kept from following (the right) path. Pharaoh’s scheming was truly evil.
verses.38: The one who believed said, “O my people, follow me, and I will guide you in the right way.
verses.39: “O my people, this first life is a temporary illusion, while the Hereafter is the eternal abode.”
verses.40: Whoever commits a sin is requited for just that, and whoever works righteousness—male  or  female— while believing,  these will  enter Paradise wherein they receive provisions without any limits.

data: *40:34 The Jews refused to believe in the Messiah when he came to them, the Christians refused  to  believe  in  Muhammad  when  he  came  to  them,  and  a  majority  of  today’s Muslims believe that Muhammad was the last messenger. On that erroneous basis, they refused to accept God’s Messenger of the Covenant. We learn from 3:81-90 and 33:7 that those  who  fail  to  accept  the  Quranic  injunction  to  “believe  in  and  support  God’s Messenger of the Covenant” are no longer believers. See Appendices 2 & 26.
**40:34 It is noteworthy that we find the name “Rashad” in the Arabic text precisely four verses ahead of the injunction against saying “the last messenger,” and also four verses after it.

verses.42: “You invite me to be unappreciative of  GOD,  and  to  set  up  beside  Him idols  that  I  do  not  recognize.  I  am inviting  you  to  the  Almighty,  the Forgiver.
verses.43: “There  is  no  doubt  that  what  you invite  me  to  do  has  no  basis  in  this world,  nor  in  the  Hereafter,  that  our ultimate  return  is  to  GOD,  and  that the  transgressors  have  incurred  the hellfire.
verses.44: “Some  day  you  will  remember  what I  am  telling  you  now.  I  leave  the judgment  of  this  matter  to  GOD; GOD is the Seer of all the people.”
verses.45: GOD  then  protected  him  from  their evil  schemes,  while  the  people  of Pharaoh  have  incurred  the  worst retribution.
verses.46: The  Hell  will  be  shown  to  them  day and  night,  and  on  the  Day  of  Resurrection:  “Admit  Pharaoh’s  people into the worst retribution.”
verses.47: As  they  argue  in  Hell,  the  followers will  say  to  their  leaders,  “We  used  to be  your  followers,  can  you  spare  us any part of this Hell?”
verses.48: The  leaders  will  say,  “We  are  all  in this  together.  GOD  has  judged among the people.”
verses.49: Those  in  the  hellfire  will  say  to  the guardians  of  Hell,  “Call  upon  your Lord  to  reduce  the  retribution  for us, for even one day.”
verses.50: They  will  say,  “Did  you  not  receive your  messengers  who  delivered  to you  clear  messages?”  They  will reply,  “Yes  we  did.”  They  will  say, “Then implore (as much as you wish);  the  imploring  of  the  disbelievers is always in vain.”
verses.51: Most  assuredly,  we  will  give  victory to  our  messengers  and  to  those  who believe,  both  in  this  world  and  on the  day  the  witnesses  are  summoned.
verses.52: On  that  day,  the  apologies  of  the disbelievers  will  not  benefit  them. They  have  incurred  condemnation; they  have  incurred  the  worst  destiny.
verses.53: We  have  given  Moses  the  guidance, and  made  the  Children  of  Israel  inherit the scripture.
verses.54: (Their  history)  is  a  lesson  and  a reminder  for  those  who  possess  intelligence.
verses.55: Therefore,  be  patient,  for  GOD’s promise  is  true,  and  ask  forgiveness for  your  sin,  and  glorify  and  praise your Lord night and day.
verses.56: Surely,  those  who  argue  against GOD’s  revelations  without  proof are  exposing  the  arrogance  that  is hidden  inside  their  chests,  and  they are  not  even  aware  of  it.  Therefore, seek  refuge  in  GOD;  He  is  the  Hearer, the Seer.
verses.57: The  creation  of  the  heavens  and  the earth  is  even  more  awesome  than the  creation  of  the  human  being,  but most people do not know.
verses.58: Not  equal  are  the  blind  and  the  seer Nor  are  those  who  believe  and  work righteousness  equal  to  the  sinners. Rarely do you take heed.

verses.59: Most  certainly, the Hour (Day  of Judgment)  is  coming,  no  doubt about it, but most people do not believe.
verses.60: Your Lord says, “Implore Me, and I will respond to you. Surely, those who are too arrogant to worship Me will enter Gehenna, forcibly.”
verses.61: GOD is the One who designed the night so you can rest in it, and the day  lighted.  GOD  bestows  many blessings upon the people, but most people are not thankful.
verses.62: Such is GOD your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no god except He. How could you deviate?
verses.63: Deviating  are  those  who  disregard GOD’s revelations.
verses.64: GOD is the One who rendered the earth habitable for you, and the sky a  formidable  structure,  and  He designed  you,  and  designed  you well. He is the One who provides you with good provisions.* Such is GOD your Lord; Most Exalted is GOD, Lord of the universe.
verses.65: He is the Living; there is no god except He. You shall worship Him alone,  devoting  your  religion  absolutely to Him alone. Praise be to GOD, Lord of the universe.
verses.66: Say, “I have been enjoined from worshiping the idols you worship beside GOD, when the clear revelations came to me from my Lord. I was commanded to submit to the Lord of the universe.”*
verses.67: He is the One who created you from dust, and subsequently from a tiny drop, then from a hanging embryo, then He brings you out as a child, then He lets you reach maturity, then you become old—some of you die earlier. You attain a predetermined age, that you  may understand.
verses.68: He is the only One who controls life and death. To have anything done, He simply says to it, “Be,” and it is.
verses.69: Have you noted those who argue against GOD’s proofs, and how they have deviated?
verses.70: They are the ones who have disbelieved in the scripture, and in the messages we have sent with our messengers. Therefore, they  will surely find out.
verses.71: The shackles will be around their necks, and the chains will be used to drag them.

data: *40:60 Supplication, imploring God for anything, even material luxuries, is a form of worship.  Hence  the  commandment  to  implore  God  whenever  we  have  any  need.  An atheist will never implore God for anything.
*40:66 The Arabic word “Nahaa” used in this verse indicates the stopping of something that was going on. See for example the same word in 4:171. See also 93:7.

verses.72: In the Inferno,* then in the Fire, they will burn.
verses.73: They will be asked, “Where are the idols you used to worship,
verses.74: “beside  GOD?”  They  will  say, “They have abandoned us. In fact, when we worshiped them, we were worshiping  nothing.”  Thus  does GOD send the disbelievers astray.
verses.75: This is because you used to rejoice in false doctrines, on earth, and you used to promote them.
verses.76: Enter the gates of Gehenna, wherein you abide forever. What a miserable destiny for the arrogant ones.
verses.77: You shall be patient, for GOD’s promise is truth. Whether we show you some of (the retribution) we have promised  for  them,  or  terminate your life before that, they will be returned to us.
verses.78: We  have  sent  messengers  before you—some  of  them  we  mentioned to you, and some we did not mention to you. No messenger can produce any miracle without GOD’s authorization.* Once GOD’s judgment is issued, the truth dominates, and the falsifiers are exposed and humiliated.
verses.79: GOD is the One who created the livestock for you; some you ride, and some you eat.
verses.80: They also provide you with additional benefits that satisfy many of your needs. On them, as well as on the ships, you are carried.
verses.81: He  thus  shows  you  His  proofs Which of GOD’s proofs can you deny?
verses.82: Have they not roamed the earth and noted the consequences for those who preceded them? They used to be greater  in number, greater  in power, and possessed a greater legacy on earth. Yet, all their achievements did not help them in the least.
verses.83: When  their  messengers  went  to them with clear proofs, they rejoiced in the knowledge they had inherited, and the very things they ridiculed were the cause of their fall.
verses.84: Subsequently,  when they saw our retribution they said, “Now we believe in GOD ALONE, and we now disbelieve in the idol worship that we used to practice.”
verses.85: Their  belief  then  could  not  help them in the least, once they saw our retribution. Such is GOD’s system that has been established to deal with His creatures; the disbelievers are always doomed.

data: *40:72 Those who did not prepare themselves will suffer tremendously in the presence of God, on the Day of Judgment. They cannot stand the closeness to God due to lack of sufficient growth and development of their souls. I am using “Inferno” to describe this particular  situation  (55:44).  Preparation  of  the  soul  is  accomplished  by  the  rites decreed by God, such as the Contact Prayer.

*40:78 We learn from 17:45-46, 18:57, and 56:79 that the unbelievers have no access  to the  Quran;  only  the  believers  and  the  sincere  seekers  are  permitted  by  God  to understand it. The Quran’s mathematical code, “One of the great miracles” (74:30-35), was authorized by God, and revealed through His Messenger of the Covenant (Appendix 2).

verses.1: H.M.*
verses.2: A  revelation  from  the  Most  Gracious, Most Merciful.
verses.3: A  scripture  whose  verses  provide the  complete  details,  in  an  Arabic Quran, for people who know.
verses.4: A bearer of good news, as well as a warner.  However,  most  of  them  turn away; they do not hear.
verses.5: They  said,  “Our  minds  are  made  up, our  ears  are  deaf  to  your  message, and  a  barrier  separates  us  from  you. Do what you want, and so will we.”
verses.6: Say,  “I  am  no  more  than  a  human being  like  you,  who  has  been  inspired  that  your  god  is  one  god.  You shall  be  devoted  to  Him,  and  ask  His forgiveness.  Woe  to  the  idol  worshipers.
verses.7: “Who  do  not  give  the  obligatory charity  (Zakat),  and  with  regard  to the  Hereafter,  they  are  disbelievers.”
verses.8: As  for  those  who  believe  and  lead  a righteous  life,  they  receive  a  well deserved recompense.
verses.9: Say,  “You  disbelieve  in  the  One who  created  the  earth  in  two  days,* and  you  set  up  idols  to  rank  with Him,  though  He  is  Lord  of  the universe.”
verses.10: He  placed  on  it  stabilizers  (mountains),  made  it  productive,  and  He calculated  its  provisions  in  four days,  to  satisfy  the  needs  of  all  its inhabitants.
verses.11: Then  He  turned  to  the  sky,  when  it was still gas, and said to it, and to the earth,  “Come  into  existence,  willingly  or  unwillingly.”  They  said, “We come willingly.”
verses.12: Thus,  He*  completed  the  seven universes  in  two  days,  and  set  up  the laws  for  every  universe.  And  we* adorned  the  lowest  universe  with lamps,  and  placed  guards  around  it. Such  is  the  design  of  the  Almighty, the Omniscient.
verses.13: If  they  turn  away,  then  say,  “I  am warning  you  of  a  disaster  like  the disaster  that  annihilated  ‘Ãd  and Thamoud.”
verses.14: Their  messengers  went  to  them,  as well  as  before  them  and  after  them, saying,  “You  shall  not  worship  except  GOD.”  They  said,  “Had  our Lord  willed,  He  could  have  sent  angels.  We  are  disbelievers  in  what  you say.”

data: *41:1 For the significance of these Quranic Initials, see Footnote 40:1.

*41:9-10 The “days” of creation represent a yardstick. Thus, the physical universe was created in two days, while the calculation of provisions for all the creatures on earth required four. This also teaches us that there is life only on this planet Earth.

*41:12 God alone created the universe (18:51), but the angels participated in handling certain jobs in the lowest universe. Our universe cannot stand the physical presence of God (7:143). The plural tense acknowledges the angels’ role in our universe (Appendix 10).

verses.15: As for ‘Ãd, they turned arrogant on earth, opposed the truth, and said, “Who is more powerful than we?” Did they not realize that GOD, who created them, is more powerful than they? They were unappreciative of our revelations.
verses.16: Consequently,  we  sent  upon  them violent wind, for a few miserable days. We thus afflicted them with humiliating retribution in this life, and the retribution of the Hereafter is more humiliating; they can never win.
verses.17: As for Thamoud, we provided them with guidance, but they preferred blindness over guidance. Consequently, the disastrous and shameful retribution annihilated them, because of what they earned.
verses.18: We always save those who believe and lead a righteous life.
verses.19: The day will come when the enemies of GOD will be summoned to the hellfire, forcibly.
verses.20: Once they get there, their own hearing, eyes, and skins will bear witness to everything they had done.
verses.21: They will say to their skins, “Why did you bear witness against us?” They  will  reply,  “GOD  made  us speak up; He is the One who causes everything to speak. He is the One who created you the first time, and now  you  have  been  returned  to Him.”
verses.22: There is no way you can hide from your own hearing, your eyes, or your skins. In fact, you thought that GOD was unaware of much of what you do.
verses.23: This  kind  of  thinking  about  your Lord will cause you to fall, and then you become losers.
verses.24: If they continue the way they are, Hell will be their destiny, and if they make up excuses, they will not be excused.
verses.25: We assign to them companions who adorn everything they do in their eyes. Thus, they end up incurring the same fate as the previous communities of jinns and humans, who were also losers.
verses.26: Those  who  disbelieved  said,  “Do not listen to this Quran and distort it, that you may win.”
verses.27: We will certainly afflict these disbelievers with a severe retribution. We will certainly requite them for their evil works.
verses.28: Such  is  the  requital  that  awaits GOD’s enemies. Hell will be their eternal abode; a just requital for discarding our revelations.
verses.29: Those  who  disbelieved  will  say, “Our Lord, show us those among the  two  kinds—jinns  and  humans— who misled us, so we can trample them  under  our  feet,  and  render them the lowliest.”
verses.30: Those who proclaim: “Our Lord is GOD,” then lead a righteous life, the angels  descend  upon  them:  “You shall have no fear, nor shall you grieve. Rejoice in the good news that Paradise has been reserved for you.

encrypted.15: فاما عاد فاستكبروا في الارض بغير الحق وقالوا من اشد منا قوة اولم يروا ان الله الذي خلقهم هو اشد منهم قوة وكانوا باياتنا يجحدون
encrypted.16: فارسلنا عليهم ريحا صرصرا في ايام نحسات لنذيقهم عذاب الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ولعذاب الاخرة اخزى وهم لا ينصرون
encrypted.17: واما ثمود فهديناهم فاستحبوا العمى على الهدى فاخذتهم صاعقة العذاب الهون بما كانوا يكسبون
encrypted.18: ونجينا الذين امنوا وكانوا يتقون
encrypted.19: ويوم يحشر اعداء الله الى النار فهم يوزعون
encrypted.20: حتى اذا ما جاءوها شهد عليهم سمعهم وابصارهم وجلودهم بما كانوا يعملون
encrypted.21: وقالوا لجلودهم لم شهدتم علينا قالوا انطقنا الله الذي انطق كل شيء وهو خلقكم اول مرة واليه ترجعون
encrypted.22: وما كنتم تستترون ان يشهد عليكم سمعكم ولا ابصاركم ولا جلودكم ولكن ظننتم ان الله لا يعلم كثيرا مما تعملون
encrypted.23: وذلكم ظنكم الذي ظننتم بربكم ارداكم فاصبحتم من الخاسرين
encrypted.24: فان يصبروا فالنار مثوى لهم وان يستعتبوا فما هم من المعتبين
encrypted.25: وقيضنا لهم قرناء فزينوا لهم ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم وحق عليهم القول في امم قد خلت من قبلهم من الجن والانس انهم كانوا خاسرين
encrypted.26: وقال الذين كفروا لا تسمعوا لهذا القران والغوا فيه لعلكم تغلبون
encrypted.27: فلنذيقن الذين كفروا عذابا شديدا ولنجزينهم اسوا الذي كانوا يعملون
encrypted.28: ذلك جزاء اعداء الله النار لهم فيها دار الخلد جزاء بما كانوا باياتنا يجحدون
encrypted.29: وقال الذين كفروا ربنا ارنا اللذين اضلانا من الجن والانس نجعلهما تحت اقدامنا ليكونا من الاسفلين
encrypted.30: ان الذين قالوا ربنا الله ثم استقاموا تتنزل عليهم الملائكة الا تخافوا ولا تحزنوا وابشروا بالجنة التي كنتم توعدون

verses.31: “We  are  your  allies  in  this  life,  and in  the  Hereafter.  You  will  have  in  it anything  you  wish  for;  you  will  have anything you want.
verses.32: “(Such  is  your)  ultimate  abode, from a Forgiver, Most Merciful.”
verses.33: Who  can  utter  better  words  than one  who  invites  to  GOD,  works righteousness,  and  says,  “I  am  one of the submitters?”
verses.34: Not  equal  is  the  good  response  and the  bad  response.  You  shall  resort to  the  nicest  possible  response. Thus,  the  one  who  used  to  be  your enemy,  may  become  your  best friend.
verses.35: None  can  attain  this  except  those who  steadfastly  persevere.  None can  attain  this  except  those  who  are extremely fortunate.
verses.36: When  the  devil  whispers  an  idea  to you,  you shall  seek  refuge  in  GOD. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.
verses.37: Among  His  proofs  are  the  night  and the  day,  and  the  sun  and  the  moon. Do  not  prostrate  before  the  sun,  nor the  moon;  you  shall  fall  prostrate before  the  GOD  who  created  them, if you truly worship Him alone.
verses.38: If  they  are  too  arrogant  to  do  this, then  those  at  your  Lord  glorify  Him night and day, without ever tiring.
verses.39: Among  His  proofs  is  that  you  see the  land  still,  then,  as  soon  as  we shower  it  with  water,  it  vibrates  with life.  Surely,  the  One  who  revived  it can  revive  the  dead.  He  is  Omnipotent.
verses.40: Surely,  those  who  distort  our  revelations  are  not  hidden  from  us.  Is  one who  gets  thrown  into  Hell  better,  or one who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection?  Do  whatever  you wish;  He  is  Seer  of  everything  you do.
verses.41: Those  who  have  rejected  the  Quran’s  proof*  when  it  came  to  them, have  also  rejected  an  Honorable book.
verses.42: No  falsehood  could  enter  it,  in  the past  or  in  the  future;*  a  revelation from a Most Wise, Praiseworthy.
verses.43: What  is  said  to  you  is  precisely  what was  said  to  the  previous  messengers. Your  Lord  possesses  forgiveness, and  He  also  possesses  painful  retribution.

data: *41:41 The word “Zikr” refers to the Quran’s mathematical code, as made clear in 38:1.
*41:42 One of the major functions of the Quran’s mathematical miracle is to guard every letter and every aspect of the Quran. Thus, any tampering is immediately recognized (Apps. 1 & 24).

*41:43  Mathematical  proof  shows  that  this  verse  refers  to  God’s  Messenger  of  the Covenant. By adding the gematrical value of “Rashad”(505), plus the value of “Khalifa” (725), plus this verse number (43), we get 505 + 725 + 43 = 1273 = 19x67. See Appendix 2.

verses.44: If  we  made  it  a  non-Arabic  Quran they  would  have  said,  “Why  did  it come  down  in  that  language?” Whether  it  is  Arabic  or  non-Arabic, say,  “For  those  who  believe,  it  is  a guide  and  healing.  As  for  those  who disbelieve,  they  will  be  deaf  and blind  to  it,  as  if  they  are  being  addressed from faraway.”
verses.45: We  have  given  Moses  the  scripture and  it  was  also  disputed.  If  it  were not  for  your  Lord’s  predetermined decision,  they  would  have  been judged  immediately.  Indeed,  they harbor too many doubts.
verses.46: Whoever  works  righteousness,  does so  for  his  own  good,  and  whoever works  evil  does  so  to  his  own  detriment.  Your  Lord  is  never  unjust towards the people.
verses.47: With  Him  is  the  knowledge  about the  Hour  (end  of  the  world).*  No fruits  emerge  from  their  sheaths, nor  does  any  female  conceive  or give  birth,  without  His  knowledge. The  day  will  come  when  He  asks them:  “Where  are  those  idols  that you  set  up  beside  Me?”  They  will say,  “We  proclaim  to  You  that  none of us bears witness to that.”
verses.48: The  idols  they  had  idolized  will  disown  them,  and  they  will  realize  that there will be no escape.
verses.49: The  human  being  never  tires  of  imploring for good things. And when adversity  befalls  him,  he  turns  despondent, desperate.
verses.50: And  when  we  bless  him  after  suffering  some  adversity,  he  says,  “This belongs  to  me.  I  do  not  believe  that the  Hour  will  ever  come  to  pass. Even  if  I  am  returned  to  my  Lord,  I will  find  at  Him  better  things.”  Most certainly,  we  will  inform  the  disbelievers  of  all  their  works,  and  will commit them to severe retribution.
verses.51: When  we  bless  the  human  being,  he turns  away,  and  drifts  farther  and farther  away,  and  when  he  suffers any affliction, he implores loudly.
verses.52: Proclaim:  “What  if  this  is  truly  from GOD,  then  you  decide  to  reject  it? Who  are  farther  astray  than  those who decide to oppose this?”
verses.53: We  will  show  them  our  proofs  in  the horizons,  and  within  themselves, until  they  realize  that  this  is  the truth.*  Is  your  Lord  not  sufficient, as a witness of all things?
verses.54: Indeed,  they  are  doubtful  about meeting  their  Lord.  He  is  fully aware of all things.

encrypted.48: وضل عنهم ما كانوا يدعون من قبل وظنوا ما لهم من محيص
encrypted.49: لا يسام الانسان من دعاء الخير وان مسه الشر فيئوس قنوط

encrypted.51: واذا انعمنا على الانسان اعرض وناى بجانبه واذا مسه الشر فذو دعاء عريض

encrypted.53: سنريهم اياتنا في الافاق وفي انفسهم حتى يتبين لهم انه الحق اولم يكف بربك انه على كل شيء شهيد
encrypted.54: الا انهم في مرية من لقاء ربهم الا انه بكل شيء محيط

data: *41:47  God  has  revealed  this  knowledge  through  His  Messenger  of  the  Covenant (Appendix 25).

*41:53 The letters that compose this verse are 19, and their gematrical values add up to 1387, 19x73. This great prophecy, together with 9:33, 48:28, 61:9 & 110:2 inform us that the  whole  world  is  destined  to  accept  the  Quran  as  God’s  unaltered  message  (See Appendix 38).

verses.1: H.M.*
verses.3: Inspiring you, and those before you, is GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.4: To Him belongs everything in the heavens  and everything  on earth, and He is the Most High, the Great.
verses.5: The  heavens  above  them  almost shatter, out of reverence for Him, and the angels praise and glorify their Lord, and they ask forgiveness for those on earth. Absolutely, GOD is the Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.6: Those who set up other lords beside Him, GOD is the One in charge of them; you are not their advocate.
verses.7: We thus  reveal to  you an Arabic Quran to warn the central community and all around it, and to warn about the Day of Summoning that is inevitable.  Some  will  end  up  in Heaven, and some in Hell.
verses.8: Had  GOD  willed,  He  could  have made them one community. But He redeems into His mercy whomever He wills. As for the transgressors, they have no master, nor a helper.
verses.9: Did  they  find  other  lords  beside Him? GOD is the only Lord and Master. He is the One who resurrects the dead, and He is the Omnipotent One.
verses.10: If you dispute any part of this message,  the  judgment  for  doing  this rests with GOD. Such is GOD my Lord. In Him I trust, and to Him I submit.
verses.11: Initiator  of  the  heavens  and  the earth.  He  created  for  you  from among  yourselves  spouses—and also for the animals. He thus provides you with the means to multiply. There is nothing that equals Him. He is the Hearer, the Seer.
verses.12: To Him belongs absolute control of the heavens and the earth. He is the One who increases the provision for whomever He wills, or reduces it. He is fully aware of all things.
verses.13:
He decreed for you the same religion decreed for Noah, and what we inspired to you, and what we decreed for Abraham, Moses, and Jesus: “You shall uphold this one religion, and do not divide it.”

Monotheists  vs.  Idol Worshipers
The  idol  worshipers  will  greatly resent what you invite them to do. GOD  redeems  to  Himself  whomever He wills; He guides to Himself only those who totally submit.
verses.14: Ironically, they broke up into sects only after the knowledge had come to them, due to jealousy and resentment among themselves. If it were not  for  a  predetermined  decision from your Lord to respite them for a definite interim, they would have been  judged  immediately.  Indeed, the later generations who inherited the scripture are full of doubts.

encrypted.3: كذلك يوحي اليك والى الذين من قبلك الله العزيز الحكيم
encrypted.4: له ما في السماوات وما في الارض وهو العلي العظيم
encrypted.5: تكاد السماوات يتفطرن من فوقهن والملائكة يسبحون بحمد ربهم ويستغفرون لمن في الارض الا ان الله هو الغفور الرحيم
encrypted.6: والذين اتخذوا من دونه اولياء الله حفيظ عليهم وما انت عليهم بوكيل
encrypted.7: وكذلك اوحينا اليك قرانا عربيا لتنذر ام القرى ومن حولها وتنذر يوم الجمع لا ريب فيه فريق في الجنة وفريق في السعير
encrypted.8: ولو شاء الله لجعلهم امة واحدة ولكن يدخل من يشاء في رحمته والظالمون ما لهم من ولي ولا نصير
encrypted.9: ام اتخذوا من دونه اولياء فالله هو الولي وهو يحيي الموتى وهو على كل شيء قدير

data: *42:1 These initials constitute a significant part of the Quran’s miracle (Footnote 40:1).

*42:2 This is the only sura where we see the initials ‘A.S.Q. (‘Ayn Seen Qaf), and the total occurrence of these three letters in this sura is 209, 19x11. Also, the letter “Q” occurs in this sura 57 times, 19x3. The only other sura where we see the initial “Q” is Sura 50, and this letter occurs in that sura also 57 times (See Appendix 1).

verses.15: This  is  what  you  shall  preach,  and steadfastly  maintain  what  you  are commanded  to  do,  and  do  not  follow  their  wishes.  And  proclaim:  “I believe  in  all  the  scriptures  sent down  by  GOD.  I  was  commanded  to judge  among  you  equitably.  GOD  is our  Lord  and  your  Lord.  We  have our  deeds  and  you  have  your  deeds. There  is  no  argument  between  us and  you.  GOD  will  gather  us  all together;  to  Him  is  the  ultimate  destiny.”
verses.16: Those  who  argue  about  GOD,  after receiving  His  message,  their  argument  is  nullified  at  their  Lord.  They have  incurred  condemnation,  and have deserved a severe retribution.
verses.17: GOD  is  the  One  who  sent  down  the scripture,  to  deliver  the  truth  and the  law.  For  all  that  you  know,  the Hour  (Day  of  Judgment)  may  be very close.
verses.18: Challenging  it  are  those  who  do  not believe  in  it.  As  for  those  who  believe,  they  are  concerned  about  it, and  they  know  that  it  is  the  truth. Absolutely,  those  who  deny  the Hour have gone far astray.
verses.19: GOD is fully aware of all His creatures; He provides for whomever He  wills.  He  is  the  Powerful,  the Almighty.
verses.20: Whoever  seeks  the  rewards  of  the Hereafter,  we  multiply  the  rewards for  him.  And  whoever  seeks  the materials  of  this  world,  we  give  him therefrom,  then  he  receives  no share in the Hereafter.
verses.21: They  follow  idols  who  decree  for them  religious  laws  never  authorized  by  GOD.  If  it  were  not  for the  predetermined  decision,  they would  have  been  judged  immediately.  Indeed,  the  transgressors have  incurred  a  painful  retribution.*
verses.22: You  will  see  the  transgressors  worried  about  everything  they  had  committed;  everything  will  come  back and  haunt  them.  As  for  those  who believed  and  led  a  righteous  life, they  will  be  in  the  gardens  of  Paradise.  They  will  receive  whatever they  wish  from  their  Lord.  This  is the great blessing.
verses.23: This is the good news from GOD to His servants who believe and lead a righteous life. Say, “I do not ask you for any wage. I do ask each of you to take  care  of  your  own  relatives.” Anyone  who  does  a  righteous  work, we multiply his reward for it. GOD is Forgiver, Appreciative.

data: *42:21 The Islam of today’s Muslim world has been so distorted, it has become a Satanic cult. The Ulama, or religious scholars, have added many extraneous laws, prohibitions, dress codes, dietary regulations, and religious practices never authorized by God. This is one of the main reasons for sending God’s Messenger of the Covenant (9:31, 33:67, and Appendix 33).

verses.24: Are  they  saying,  “He  (Rashad)*  has fabricated  lies  about  GOD!”?  If GOD  willed,  He  could  have  sealed your  mind,  but  GOD  erases  the falsehood  and  affirms  the  truth  with His  words.  He  is  fully  aware  of  the innermost thoughts.
verses.25: He  is  the  One  who  accepts  the  repentance  from  His  servants,  and remits  the  sins.  He  is  fully  aware  of everything you do.
verses.26: Responding  to  Him  are  those  who believe  and  lead  a  righteous  life.  He will  shower  them  with  His  blessings. As  for  the  disbelievers,  they  have incurred a severe retribution.
verses.27: If  GOD  increased  the  provision  for His  servants,  they  would  transgress on  earth.  This  is  why  He  sends  it precisely  measured  to  whomever He  wills.  He  is  fully  Cognizant  and Seer of His servants.
verses.28: He  is  the  One  who  sends  down  the rain  after  they  had  despaired,  and spreads  His  mercy.  He  is  the  only Master, Most Praiseworthy.
verses.29: Among  His  proofs  is  the  creation  of the  heavens  and  the  earth,  and  the creatures  He  spreads  in  them.  He  is able  to  summon  them,  when  He wills.
verses.30: Anything  bad  that  happens  to  you  is a  consequence  of  your  own  deeds, and  He  overlooks  many  (of  your sins).
verses.31: You  can  never  escape,  and  you  have none  beside  GOD  as  a  Lord  and Master.
verses.32: Among  His  proofs  are  the  ships  that sail the sea with sails like flags.
verses.33: If  He  willed,  He  could  have  stilled the  winds,  leaving  them  motionless on  top  of  the  water.  These  are proofs  for  those  who  are  steadfast, appreciative.
verses.34: He  can  annihilate  them,  as  a  consequence  of  their  own  works.  Instead, He overlooks many (of their sins).
verses.35: Those  who  argue  against  our  proofs will find out that they have no basis.
verses.36: Whatever  you  are  given  is  no  more than  temporary  material  of  this  life. What  GOD  possesses  is  far  better and  everlasting,  for  those  who  believe and trust in their Lord.
verses.37: They  avoid  gross  sins  and  vice,  and when angered they forgive.
verses.38: They  respond  to  their  Lord  by  observing  the  Contact  Prayers  (Salat). Their  affairs  are  decided  after  due consultation  among  themselves, and  from  our  provisions  to  them they give (to charity).
verses.39: When  gross  injustice  befalls  them, they stand up for their rights.
verses.40: Although  the  just  requital  for  an injustice  is  an  equivalent  retribution,  those  who  pardon  and  maintain  righteousness  are  rewarded  by GOD. He does not love the unjust.

encrypted.24: ام يقولون افترى على الله كذبا فان يشا الله يختم على قلبك ويمح الله الباطل ويحق الحق بكلماته انه عليم بذات الصدور
encrypted.25: وهو الذي يقبل التوبة عن عباده ويعفو عن السيئات ويعلم ما تفعلون

encrypted.29: ومن اياته خلق السماوات والارض وما بث فيهما من دابة وهو على جمعهم اذا يشاء قدير
encrypted.30: وما اصابكم من مصيبة فبما كسبت ايديكم ويعفو عن كثير
encrypted.31: وما انتم بمعجزين في الارض وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير
encrypted.32: ومن اياته الجوار في البحر كالاعلام
encrypted.33: ان يشا يسكن الريح فيظللن رواكد على ظهره ان في ذلك لايات لكل صبار شكور
encrypted.34: او يوبقهن بما كسبوا ويعف عن كثير
encrypted.35: ويعلم الذين يجادلون في اياتنا ما لهم من محيص
encrypted.36: فما اوتيتم من شيء فمتاع الحياة الدنيا وما عند الله خير وابقى للذين امنوا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون
encrypted.37: والذين يجتنبون كبائر الاثم والفواحش واذا ما غضبوا هم يغفرون
encrypted.38: والذين استجابوا لربهم واقاموا الصلاة وامرهم شورى بينهم ومما رزقناهم ينفقون
encrypted.39: والذين اذا اصابهم البغي هم ينتصرون
encrypted.40: وجزاء سيئة سيئة مثلها فمن عفا واصلح فاجره على الله انه لا يحب الظالمين

data: *42:24 The disbelievers added 2 false statements at the end of Sura 9 to commemorate their idol, the prophet Muhammad. God has revealed overwhelming evidence to erase this  blasphemy  and  establish  the  truth.  By  adding  the  gematrical  value  of  “Rashad Khalifa” (1230), plus the verse number (24), we get 1254, 19x66 (please see Appendices 2 & 24 for the details).

verses.41: Certainly, those who stand up for their rights, when injustice befalls them, are not committing any error.
verses.42: The wrong ones are those who treat the people unjustly, and resort to aggression without provocation. These have incurred a painful retribution.
verses.43: Resorting to patience and forgiveness reflects a true strength of character.
verses.44: Whomever GOD sends astray will never find any other lord, and you will see such transgressors, when they see the retribution, saying, “Can we get another chance?”
verses.45: You will see them facing it, humiliated and debased, and looking, yet trying to avoid looking. Those who believed will proclaim: “The real losers are those who lost their souls and their families on the Day of Resurrection. The transgressors have deserved an everlasting retribution.”
verses.46: There will be no allies to help them against GOD. Whomever GOD sends astray can never be guided.
verses.47: You shall respond to your Lord before a day comes which is decreed inevitable by GOD. There will be no refuge for you on that day, nor an advocate.
verses.48: If they turn away, we did not send you as their guardian. Your sole mission is delivering the message. When we shower the human beings with mercy, they become proud, and when adversity afflicts them, as a consequence of their own deeds, the human beings turn into disbelievers.
verses.49: To GOD belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills, granting daughters to whomever He wills, and granting sons to whomever He wills.
verses.50: Or, He may have the males and the females marry each other, then render whomever He wills sterile. He is Omniscient, Omnipotent.
verses.51: No human being can communicate with GOD except through inspiration, or from behind a barrier, or by sending a messenger through whom He reveals what He wills. He is the Most High, Most Wise.
verses.52: Thus, we inspired to you a revelation proclaiming our commandments. You had no idea about the scripture, or faith. Yet, we made this a beacon to guide whomever we choose from among our servants. Surely, you guide in a straight path.
verses.53: The path of GOD, to whom belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. Absolutely, all matters are controlled by GOD.

encrypted.41: ولمن انتصر بعد ظلمه فاولئك ما عليهم من سبيل

encrypted.46: وما كان لهم من اولياء ينصرونهم من دون الله ومن يضلل الله فما له من سبيل
encrypted.47: استجيبوا لربكم من قبل ان ياتي يوم لا مرد له من الله ما لكم من ملجا يومئذ وما لكم من نكير
encrypted.48: فان اعرضوا فما ارسلناك عليهم حفيظا ان عليك الا البلاغ وانا اذا اذقنا الانسان منا رحمة فرح بها وان تصبهم سيئة بما قدمت ايديهم فان الانسان كفور
encrypted.49: لله ملك السماوات والارض يخلق ما يشاء يهب لمن يشاء اناثا ويهب لمن يشاء الذكور
encrypted.50: او يزوجهم ذكرانا واناثا ويجعل من يشاء عقيما انه عليم قدير
encrypted.51: وما كان لبشر ان يكلمه الله الا وحيا او من وراء حجاب او يرسل رسولا فيوحي باذنه ما يشاء انه علي حكيم
encrypted.52: وكذلك اوحينا اليك روحا من امرنا ما كنت تدري ما الكتاب ولا الايمان ولكن جعلناه نورا نهدي به من نشاء من عبادنا وانك لتهدي الى صراط مستقيم
encrypted.53: صراط الله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الارض الا الى الله تصير الامور

data: *43:1 See Footnote 40:1. The frequency of occurrence of the letters “H” (Hã) and “M” (Meem) in the seven H.M.-initialed suras is 292, and 1855, respectively. This adds up to 2147,  or 19x113.

verses.3: We  have  rendered  it  an  Arabic  Quran, that you may understand.*
verses.4: It  is  preserved  with  us  in  the  original master,  honorable  and  full  of  wisdom.
verses.5: Should  we  just  ignore  the  fact  that you have transgressed the limits?*
verses.6: We  have  sent  many  a  prophet  to  the previous generations.
verses.7: Every  time  a  prophet  went  to  them, they ridiculed him.
verses.8: Consequently,  we  annihilated  people  who  were  even  more  powerful than  these.  We  thus  set  the  examples  from  the  previous  communities.
verses.9: If  you  asked  them,  “Who  created the  heavens  and  the  earth,”  they would  say,  “The  Almighty,  the  Omniscient has created them.”
verses.10: He  is  the  One  who  made  the  earth habitable  for  you,  and  created  for you  roads  therein,  that  you  may  follow the right way.
verses.11: He is the One who sends down from the  sky  water,  in  exact  measure,  to revive  dead  lands  therewith.  Similarly, you will be resurrected.
verses.12: He  is  the  One  who  created  all  kinds, in  pairs  (male  and  female),  and  He created  for  you  ships  and  livestock to ride.
verses.13: As  you rest on top of  them,  you  shall appreciate  such  a  blessing  from your  Lord,  and  say,  “Glory  be  to  the One  who  subdued  this  for  us.  We could  not  have  controlled  them  by ourselves.
verses.14: “We ultimately return to our Lord.”
verses.15: They  even  assigned  for  Him  a  share from  His  own  creation!  Surely,  the human  being  is  profoundly  unappreciative.
verses.16: Has  He  chosen  from  among  His creations  daughters  for  Himself, while blessing you with sons?
verses.17: When one of them is given news (of a  daughter)  as  they  claimed  for  the Most  Gracious,  his  face  is  darkened with misery and anger!
verses.18: (They  say,)  “What  is  good  about  an offspring  that  is  brought  up  to  be beautiful, and cannot help in war?”
verses.19: They  claimed  that  the  angels,  who are  servants  of  the  Most  Gracious, are  females!  Have  they  witnessed their  creation?  Their  claims  are recorded, and they will be asked.
verses.20: They  even  said,  “If  the  Most  Gracious  willed,  we  would  not  have  worshiped  them.”  They  have  no  basis for  such  a  claim;  they  only  conjecture.*
verses.21: Have  we  given  them  a  book  before this, and they are upholding it?

data: *43:3  Arabic  is  the  most  efficient  language,  especially  in  expressing  commandments, statutes and exacting laws. Hence the revelation of the Quran in Arabic for the clear understanding of all peoples, regardless of their tongues. See Appendix 4 for the details.
*43:5 This refers to our original sin as detailed in the Introduction and Appendix 7.
*43:20 The idol worshipers cannot blame God for their idolatry, since we have absolute freedom of choice to worship God alone, or not.

verses.22: The  fact  is:  they  said,  “We  found our  parents  carrying  on  certain practices,  and  we  are  following  in their footsteps.”
verses.23: Invariably,  when  we  sent  a  warner to  any  community,  the  leaders  of that  community  would  say,  “We found  our  parents  following  certain practices,  and  we  will  continue  in their footsteps.”
verses.24: (The  messenger)  would  say,  “What if  I  brought  to  you  better  guidance than  what  you  inherited  from  your parents?”  They  would  say,  “We  are disbelievers  in  the  message  you brought.”
verses.25: Consequently,  we  requited  them Note  the  consequences  for  the  rejectors.
verses.26: Abraham  said  to  his  father  and  his people, “I disown what you worship.
verses.27: “Only  the  One  who  initiated  me  can guide me.”
verses.28: This  example  (of  Abraham)  was rendered  an  everlasting  lesson  for subsequent  generations;  perhaps they redeem their souls.
verses.29: Indeed,  I  have  given  these  people and  their  ancestors  sufficient  chances,  then  the  truth  came  to  them, and a clarifying messenger.
verses.30: When  the  truth  came  to  them,  they said,  “This  is  magic,  and  we  are  disbelievers therein.”
verses.31: They  said,  “If  only  this  Quran  was sent  down  through  another  man from  the  two  communities  (Mecca or Yathrib) who is prominent!”
verses.32: Are  they  the  ones  who  assign  your Lord’s  mercy?  We  have  assigned their  shares  in  this  life,  raising  some of  them  above  others  in  ranks,  in order  to  let  them  serve  one  another. The  mercy  from  your  Lord  is  far better  than  any  material  they  may hoard.
verses.33: If  it  were  not  that  all  the  people might  become  one  (disbelieving) congregation,  we  would  have  granted  everyone  who  disbelieves  in  the Most  Gracious  mansions  with  silver roofs,  and  stairs  upon  which  they could climb.
verses.34: Their  mansions  would  have  impressive  gates,  and  luxurious  furnishings.
verses.35: Also  many  ornaments.  All  these  are the  temporary  materials  of  this lowly  life.  The  Hereafter—at  your Lord—is  far  better  for  the  righteous.
verses.36: Anyone  who  disregards  the  message  of  the  Most  Gracious,  we  appoint  a  devil  to  be  his  constant  companion.*
verses.37: Such  companions  will  divert  them from  the  path,  yet  make  them  believe that they are guided.

titles.33:
Materials of This World:
All That The Disbelievers Get

data: *43:36-39 Each one of us has a representative of Satan as a constant companion (Appendix 7).

verses.38: When  he  comes  before  us  he  will say,  “Oh  I  wish  you  were  as  far  from me  as  the  two  easts.*  What  a  miserable companion!”
verses.39: It  will  not  console  you  on  that  day, as  transgressors,  that  both  of  you will share in the retribution.
verses.40: Can  you  make  the  deaf  hear;  can you  make  the  blind  see,  or  those  who are far astray?
verses.41: Whether  we  let  you  die  before  it  or not, we will surely requite them.
verses.42: Or,  we  may  show  you  (the  retribution)  we  promised  for  them.  We  are in full control over them.
verses.43: You  shall  steadfastly  preach  what  is revealed  to  you;  you  are  in  the  right path.*
verses.44: This  is  a  message  for  you  and  your people; all of you will be questioned.
verses.45: Check  the  messengers  we  sent  before  you:  “Have  we  ever  appointed any  other  gods—beside  the  Most Gracious—to be worshiped?”
verses.46: For  example,  we  sent  Moses  with our  proofs  to  Pharaoh  and  his  elders,  proclaiming:  “I  am  a  messenger from the Lord of the universe.”
verses.47: When  he  showed  them  our  proofs, they laughed at them.
verses.48: Every  sign  we  showed  them  was  bigger than the one before it. We afflicted  them  with  the  plagues,  perhaps they repent.
verses.49: They  said,  “O  you  magician,  implore  your  Lord  on  our  behalf,  since you  have  an  agreement  with  Him  (to relieve this plague); we will then be guided.”
verses.50: But  as  soon  as  we  relieved  their  affliction, they reverted.
verses.51: Pharaoh  announced  to  his  people, “O  my  people,  do  I  not  possess  the kingship  over  Egypt,  and  these  flowing  rivers  belong  to  me?  Do  you  not see?
verses.52: “Which  one  is  better;  me  or  that  one who is lowly and can hardly speak?
verses.53: “How  come  he  does  not  possess  a treasure  of  gold;  how  come  the  angels do not accompany him?”
verses.54: He  thus  fooled  his  people,  and  they obeyed  him;  they  were  wicked  people.
verses.55: When  they  persisted  in  opposing  us, we  punished  them  and  drowned them all.
verses.56: We  rendered  them  a  precedent  and an example for the others.
verses.57: When  the  son  of  Mary  was  cited  as an  example,  your  people  disregarded it.
verses.58: They  said,  “Is  it  better  to  worship our  gods,  or  to  worship  him?”  They said  this  only  to  argue  with  you.  Indeed,  they  are  people  who  have joined the opposition.

data: *43:38 The “easts” imply the locations of sunrise, moonrise, and the rising of heavenly bodies.
*43:43 The sum of the gematrical value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230) plus 43 is 1273, 19x66.

verses.59: He  was  no  more  than  a  servant whom we blessed, and we sent him as an example for the Children of Israel.
verses.60: If we willed, we could have made you angels who colonize and reproduce on earth.
verses.61: He is to serve as a marker for knowing the end of the world, * so you can no longer harbor any doubt about it. You shall follow Me; this is the right path.
verses.62: Let not the devil repel you; he is your most ardent enemy.
verses.63: When Jesus went with the proofs, he said, “I bring to you wisdom, and to clarify some of the matters in which you dispute. You shall reverence GOD and obey me.
verses.64: “GOD is my Lord and your Lord, you shall worship Him alone. This is the right path.”
verses.65: The  opponents  disputed  among themselves.  Woe  to  those  who transgress from the retribution of a painful day.
verses.66: Are they waiting for the Hour (Day of Judgment) to come to them suddenly when they least expect it?
verses.67: The close friends on that day will become enemies of one another, except for the righteous.
verses.68: O My servants, you will have no fear on that day, nor will you grieve.
verses.69: They are the ones who believed in our revelations, and were submitters.
verses.70: Enter Paradise, together with your spouses, and rejoice.
verses.71: Offered to them will be golden trays and cups, and they will find everything the hearts desire and the eyes wish for. You live therein forever.
verses.72: Such is the Paradise that you inherit, in return for your works.
verses.73: You will have in it all kinds of fruits, from which you eat.
verses.74: Surely, the guilty will abide in the retribution of Gehenna forever.
verses.75: Never will the retribution be commuted for them; they will be confined therein.
verses.76: It is not us who wronged them; it is they who wronged their own souls.
verses.77: They will implore: “O Mãlek, let your Lord finish us off.” He will say, “You are staying forever.
verses.78: “We have given you the truth, but most of you hate the truth.”
verses.79: Have they schemed some scheme? We too are scheming.
verses.80: Do they think that we do not hear their secrets and conspiracies? Yes indeed;  our messengers are with them, recording.
verses.81: Proclaim: “If the Most Gracious did have a son, I would still be the foremost worshiper.”

titles.61: Jesus and the End of the World*

data: *43:61 As detailed in Appendix 25, the End of the World is given in the Quran, and the birthdate of Jesus provided one of the significant signs that the calculations are correct. We learn that the world will end in the year 2280 (19x120) after the birth of Jesus (see 47:18). Additionally, both the lunar year (1710) & the solar year (2280) are divisible by 570 (19x30), the number of years from the birth of Jesus to the birth of Muhammad Thus, the birth date of Jesus is a marker.

verses.82: Be  He  glorified;  He  is  the  Lord  of the  heavens  and  the  earth,  the  Lord with  the  great  dominion,  far  above their claims.
verses.83: Let  them  blunder  and  play  until they  meet  their  day  that  is  awaiting them.
verses.84: He is the only One who is a deity in the  heaven  and  a  deity  on  earth.  He is the Most Wise, the Omniscient.
verses.85: Most  Exalted  is  the  One  who  possesses  all  sovereignty  of  the  heavens and  the  earth,  and  everything  between  them.  With  Him  is  the  knowledge  about  the  Hour  (end  of  the world),  and  to  Him  you  will  be returned.
verses.86: None  of  those  whom  they  idolize beside  Him  possess  any  power  to intercede,  unless  their  intercession coincides  with  the  truth,  and  they fully know.
verses.87: If  you  asked  them  who  created them,  they  would  say,  “GOD.”  Why then did they deviate?
verses.88: It  will  be  proclaimed:  “O  my  Lord, these people do not believe.”
verses.89: You  shall  disregard  them  and  say, “Peace;” they will surely find out.

verses.1: H.M.
verses.2: And this enlightening scripture
verses.3: We  have  sent  it  down  in  a  blessed night, for we are to warn.
verses.4: In  it  (the  scripture),  every  matter  of wisdom is clarified.
verses.5: It  is  a  predetermined  command from us that we send messengers.
verses.6: This  is  a  mercy from  your  Lord. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.
verses.7: Lord  of  the  heavens  and  the  earth, and  everything  between  them.  If only you could be certain!
verses.8: There  is  no  other  god  beside  Him. He  controls  life  and  death;  your Lord  and  the  Lord  of  your  ancestors.
verses.9: Indeed, they are doubtful, heedless
verses.10: Therefore,  watch  for  the  day  when the sky brings a profound smoke.*
verses.11: It will envelope the people; this is a painful retribution.
verses.12: “Our  Lord,  relieve  this  retribution for us; we are believers.”
verses.13: Now  that  it  is  too  late,  they  remember!  An  enlightening  messenger  had come to them.*
verses.14: But  they  turned  away  from  him,  saying, “Well educated, but crazy!”
verses.15: We  will  relieve  the  retribution  for awhile; you will soon revert.
verses.16: The  day  we  strike  the  big  stroke,  we will avenge.
verses.17: We  have  tested  before  them  the people  of  Pharaoh;  an  honorable messenger went to them.

data: *44:10 Only two signs are yet to be fulfilled, this smoke and Gog and Magog (Appendix 25).
*44:13 The sum of sura and verse numbers (44 + 13) is 57, 19x3, and this Quranic code was proclaimed by God’s Messenger of the Covenant (Appendices 1, 2, & 26).

verses.18: Proclaiming:  “Listen  to  me,  servants of GOD. I am an honest messenger to you.”
verses.19: And,  “Do  not  transgress  against GOD.  I  bring  to  you  powerful proofs.
verses.20: “I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, if you oppose me.
verses.21: “If you do not wish to believe, then simply leave me alone.”
verses.22: Subsequently,  he  implored  his Lord: “These are wicked people.”
verses.23: (God  said,)  “Travel  with  My  servants during the night; you will be pursued.
verses.24: “Cross the sea quickly; their troops will be drowned.”
verses.25: Thus, they left behind many gardens and springs.
verses.26: Crops and a luxurious life.
verses.27: Blessings that they enjoyed.
verses.28: All these we caused to be inherited by other people.
verses.29: Neither the heaven, nor the earth wept over them, and they were not respited.
verses.30: Meanwhile, we  saved  the Children of Israel from the humiliating persecution.
verses.31: From Pharaoh; he was a tyrant.
verses.32: We have chosen them from among all the people, knowingly.
verses.33: We showed them so many proofs, which constituted a great test.
verses.34: The present generations say,
verses.35: “We only die the first death; we will never be resurrected!
verses.36: “Bring back our forefathers, if you are truthful.”
verses.37: Are they better than the people of Tubba‘ and others before them? We annihilated them for their crimes.
verses.38: We did not create the heavens and the earth, and everything between them, just to play.
verses.39: We created them for a specific purpose, but most of them do not know.
verses.40: The Day of Decision awaits them all.
verses.41: That is the day when no friend can help his friend in any way; no one can be helped.
verses.42: Only those who attain mercy from GOD.  He  is the Almighty,  Most Merciful.
verses.43: Surely, the tree of bitterness—
verses.44: will provide the food for the sinful.
verses.45: Like lye, it will boil in the stomachs.
verses.46: Like the boiling of hellish drinks.
verses.47: Take him and throw him into the center of Hell.
verses.48: Then pour upon his head the retribution of the Inferno.
verses.49: “Taste this; you were so powerful, so honorable.”
verses.50: This is what you used to doubt.
verses.51: The righteous will be in a secure position.
verses.52: Enjoying gardens and springs.
verses.53: Wearing velvet and satin; close to each other.
verses.54: We grant them wonderful spouses.

verses.55: They enjoy  in it all  kinds  of  fruits,  in perfect peace.

verses.1: H.M.
verses.2: The  revelation  of  this  scripture  is from  GOD,  the  Almighty,  Most Wise.
verses.3: The  heavens  and  the  earth  are  full of proofs for the believers.
verses.4: Also  in  your  creation,  and  the  creation  of  all  the  animals,  there  are proofs for people who are certain.
verses.5: Also,  the  alternation  of  the  night and  the  day,  and  the  provisions  that GOD  sends  down  from  the  sky  to revive  dead  lands,  and  the  manipulation  of  the  winds;  all  these  are proofs for people who understand.
verses.6: These  are  GOD’s  revelations  that we  recite  to  you  truthfully.  In  which Hadith  other  than  GOD  and  His revelations do they believe?
verses.7: Woe to every fabricator, guilty
verses.8: The  one  who  hears  GOD’s  revelations  recited  to  him,  then  insists  arrogantly  on  his  way,  as  if  he  never heard  them.  Promise  him  a  painful retribution.
verses.9: When  he  learns  anything  about  our revelations,  he  mocks  them.  These have  incurred  a  shameful  retribution.
verses.10: Awaiting  them  is  Gehenna.  Their earnings  will  not  help  them,  nor  the idols they had set up beside GOD. They  have  incurred  a  terrible  retribution.
verses.11: This  is  a  beacon,  and  those  who disbelieve  in  these  revelations  of their  Lord  have  incurred  condemnation and a painful retribution.
verses.12: GOD  is  the  One  who  committed  the sea  in  your  service,  so  that  the  ships can  roam  it  in  accordance  with  His laws.  You  thus  seek  His  provisions, that you may be appreciative.
verses.13: He  committed  in  your  service  everything  in  the  heavens  and  the earth;  all  from  Him.  These  are proofs for people who reflect.
verses.14: Tell  those  who  believed  to  forgive those  who  do not expect the days of GOD.  He will fully pay everyone  for whatever they have earned.

data: *44:56 As detailed in Appendix 17, the righteous do not really die; they move on directly to the same Paradise where Adam and Eve once lived. Compare this statement with the disbelievers’ statement in 40:11.
*45:6-7  God  condemns  “Hadith”  by  name,  and  informs  us  that  it  is  a  blasphemous fabrication.

verses.15: Whoever  works  righteousness  does so  for  his  own  good,  and  whoever works  evil  does  so  to  his  own  detriment.  To  your  Lord  you  will  be returned.
verses.16: We  have  given  the  Children  of  Israel  the  scripture,  wisdom,  and prophethood,  and  provided  them with  good  provisions;  we  bestowed upon  them  more  blessings  than  any other people.
verses.17: We  have  given  them  herein  clear commandments.  Ironically,  they  did not  dispute  this  until  the  knowledge had  come  to  them.  This  is  due  to jealousy  on  their  part.  Surely,  your Lord  will  judge  them  on  the  Day  of Resurrection regarding  everything they have disputed.
verses.18: We  then  appointed  you  to  establish the  correct  laws;  you  shall  follow this, and do not follow the wishes of those who do not know.
verses.19: They  cannot  help  you  at  all  against GOD.  It  is  the  transgressors  who  ally themselves  with  one  another,  while GOD is the Lord of the righteous.
verses.20: This  provides  enlightenments  for the  people,  and  guidance,  and  mercy for those who are certain.
verses.21: Do  those  who  work  evil  expect  that we  will  treat  them  in  the  same  manner  as  those  who  believe  and  lead  a righteous  life?  Can  their  life  and their  death  be  the  same?*  Wrong indeed is their judgment.
verses.22: GOD  created  the  heavens  and  the earth for a specific purpose, in order  to  pay  each  soul  for  whatever it  earned,  without  the  least  injustice.*
verses.23: Have  you  noted  the  one  whose  god is  his  ego?  Consequently,  GOD sends  him  astray,  despite  his  knowledge,  seals  his  hearing  and  his  mind, and  places  a  veil  on  his  eyes.  Who then  can  guide  him,  after  such  a decision  by  GOD?  Would  you  not take heed?
verses.24: They  said,  “We only live this life; we live  and  die  and  only  time  causes  our death!”  They  have  no  sure  knowledge  about  this;  they  only  conjecture.
verses.25: When  our  revelations  are  recited  to them,  clearly,  their  only  argument  is to  say,  “Bring  back  our  forefathers, if you are truthful.”
verses.26: Say,  “GOD  has  granted  you  life, then  He  puts  you  to  death,  then  He will  summon  you  to  the  Day  of Resurrection,  which  is  inevitable. But most people do not know.”
verses.27: To  GOD  belongs  all  sovereignty  of the  heavens  and  the  earth.  The  day the  Hour  (Judgment)  comes  to  pass, that is when the falsifiers lose.
verses.28: You  will  see  every  community kneeling.  Every  community  will  be called  to  view  their  record.  Today, you  get  paid  for  everything  you  have done.

titles.23: Common Form of Idolatry: The Ego As A god

data: *45:21 We now realize that the righteous do not really die—they go straight to Heaven (16:32)—while the unrighteous are beaten up by the angels of death (8:50 & 47:27).
*45:22 God granted us this life as a precious chance to redeem ourselves, denounce our ancient alliance with Satan, and rejoin God’s kingdom. See Introduction & Appendix 7.

verses.29: This  is  our  record;  it  utters  the  truth about you. We have been recording everything you did.
verses.30: As for those who believe and work righteousness,  their  Lord  will  admit them into His mercy. This is the great triumph.
verses.31: As for those who disbelieve: “Were not My revelations recited to you, but  you  turned  arrogant  and  were wicked people?”
verses.32: When it is proclaimed that GOD’s promise  is  the  truth  and  that  the Hour  (of  Judgment)  is  inevitable, you said, “We do not know what the Hour is! We are full of conjecture about it; we are not certain.”
verses.33: The evils of their works will become evident to them, and the very things they mocked will come back and haunt them.
verses.34: It  will  be  proclaimed:  “Today  we forget you, just as you forgot the meeting of this day. Your abode is the hellfire, and you will have no helpers.
verses.35: “This is because you took GOD’s revelations in vain, and were preoccupied with the  first life.” Consequently, they will never exit therefrom, nor will they be excused.
verses.36: To GOD belongs all praise; Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of the universe.
verses.37: To Him  belongs  all supremacy in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.

verses.1: H.M.
verses.2: The  revelation  of  this  scripture  is from  GOD,  the  Almighty,  Most Wise.
verses.3: We did not create the heavens and the earth, and everything between them except for a specific purpose, and for a finite interim. Those who disbelieve are totally oblivious to the warnings given to them.
verses.4: Say, “Consider the idols you have set up beside GOD. Show me what on earth did they create. Do they own part of the heavens? Show me any other scripture before this one, or any piece of established knowledge that supports your idolatry, if you are truthful.”
verses.5: Who  is  farther  astray  than  those who idolize beside GOD idols that can never respond to them until the Day of Resurrection, and are totally unaware of their worship?
verses.6: And when the people are summoned (on the Day of Judgment), their idols will become their enemies, and will denounce their idolatry.*
verses.7: When  our  revelations  were  recited to them, perfectly clear, those who disbelieved  said  of  the  truth  that came to them, “This is obviously magic!”

data: *46:6 See also Matthew 7:21-23: Jesus clearly disowns those who call him “Lord.”

verses.8: When  they  say,  “He  fabricated this,” say, “If I fabricated this, then you cannot protect me from GOD. He is fully aware of everything you scheme. He suffices as a witness between me and you. He is the Forgiver, Most Merciful.”
verses.9: Say, “I am not different from other messengers. I have no idea what will happen to me or to you. I only follow what is revealed to me. I am no more than a profound warner.”
verses.10: Say, “What if it is from GOD and you disbelieved in it? A witness from  the  Children  of  Israel  has borne witness to a similar phenomenon,* and he has believed, while you have turned arrogant. Surely, GOD  does not guide the wicked people.”
verses.11: Those who disbelieved said about those who believed, “If it were anything good, they would not have accepted it before us.” Because they were not guided to it, they said, “This is an old fabrication!”
verses.12: Before  this,  the  book  of  Moses provided guidance and mercy. This too is a scripture that confirms, in Arabic, to warn those who transgressed, and to give good news to the righteous.
verses.13: Surely, those who say, “Our Lord is GOD,” then lead a righteous life, will have no fear, nor will they grieve.
verses.14: They  have  deserved  Paradise, where they abide forever; a reward for their works.
verses.15: We  enjoined  the  human  being  to honor his parents. His mother bore him arduously, gave birth to him arduously, and took intimate care of him  for  thirty  months.  When  he reaches  maturity, and reaches the age of forty,* he should say, “My Lord, direct me to appreciate the blessings You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to do the  righteous  works  that  please You. Let my children be righteous as well. I have repented to You; I am a submitter.”
verses.16: It is from these that we accept the righteous works, and overlook their sins. They have deserved Paradise. This is the truthful promise that is promised to them.
verses.17: Then there is the one who says to his parents, “Woe to you; are you telling me that (after death) I will come back to life? How come those who died before us never come back?” The parents would cry for GOD’s help and say, “Woe to you; please believe! GOD’s promise is the truth.” He would say, “Tales from the past!”
verses.18: Such are the ones stamped as disbelievers among every generation of jinns and humans; they are losers.
