data: *46:10 This witness is Rabbi Judah the Pious (11th Century A.D.), who discovered the same 19-based mathematical code in intact fragments of the scripture (see Appendix 1).

*46:15 God knows full well who deserves to go to Heaven and who deserves to go to Hell. It is His law that whomever He puts to death before the age of 40 shall go to Heaven. God’s immense mercy is reflected in the fact that most people have difficulty accepting this divine mercy; they argue: “Put them in Hell!” See Appendix 32.

verses.19: They  all  attain  the  ranks  they  have deserved,  in  accordance  with  their works.  He  will  pay  them  for  their works, without the least injustice.
verses.20: The  day  will  come  when  those  who disbelieved  will  be  introduced  to  the hellfire:  “You  have  wasted  the  good chances  given  to  you  during  your worldly  life,  and  you  rejoiced  in them.  Consequently,  today  you incur  a  shameful  retribution  as  a requital  for  the  arrogance  you  committed  on  earth  without  any  basis, and for your evil works.”
verses.21: Recall  that  the  brother  of  ‘Ãd warned  his  people  at  the  dunes— numerous  warnings  were  also  delivered  before  him  and  after  him: “You  shall  not  worship  except GOD.  I  fear  for  you  the  retribution of a great day.”
verses.22: They  said,  “Did  you  come  to  divert us  from  our  gods?  We  challenge  you to  bring  (the  retribution)  you  threaten, if you are truthful.”
verses.23: He  said,  “The  knowledge  about  this is with GOD; I only deliver to you what  I  was  sent  to  deliver.  However, I see that you people are ignorant.”
verses.24: When  they  saw  the  storm  heading their  way,  they  said,  “This  storm  will bring  to  us  much  needed  rain.”  Instead,  this  is  what  you  challenged (Hûd)  to  bring;  violent  wind  wherein there is painful retribution.
verses.25: It  destroyed  everything,  as  commanded  by  its  Lord.  By  morning, nothing was standing except their homes.  We  thus  requite  the  guilty people.
verses.26: We  had  established  them  in  the same  way  as  we  established  you,  and provided  them  with  hearing,  eyes, and  minds.  But  their  hearing,  eyes, and  minds  did  not  help  them  at  all. This  is  because  they  decided  to  disregard  GOD’s  revelations.  Thus,  the prophecies  and  warnings  that  they ridiculed have caused their doom.
verses.27: We  have  annihilated  many  communities  around  you,  after  we  had  explained  the  proofs,  that  they  might repent.
verses.28: Why  then  did  the  idols  they  set  up to  bring  them  closer  to  GOD  fail  to help  them?  Instead,  they  abandoned  them.  Such  were  the  false gods  they  idolized;  such  were  the innovations they fabricated.
verses.29: Recall  that  we  directed  a  number  of jinns  to  you,  in  order  to  let  them hear  the  Quran.  When  they  got there,  they  said,  “Listen.”  As  soon as  it  was  over,  they  rushed  to  their people, warning.*
verses.30: They  said,  “O  our  people,  we  have heard  a  book  that  was  revealed  after Moses,  and  confirms  the  previous scriptures.  It  guides  to  the  truth;  to the right path.
verses.31: “O  our  people,  respond  to  the  call of GOD, and believe in Him. He will then  forgive  your  sins,  and  spare  you a painful retribution.”

encrypted.19: ولكل درجات مما عملوا وليوفيهم اعمالهم وهم لا يظلمون
encrypted.20: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار اذهبتم طيباتكم في حياتكم الدنيا واستمتعتم بها فاليوم تجزون عذاب الهون بما كنتم تستكبرون في الارض بغير الحق وبما كنتم تفسقون
encrypted.21: واذكر اخا عاد اذ انذر قومه بالاحقاف وقد خلت النذر من بين يديه ومن خلفه الا تعبدوا الا الله اني اخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم
encrypted.22: قالوا اجئتنا لتافكنا عن الهتنا فاتنا بما تعدنا ان كنت من الصادقين
encrypted.23: قال انما العلم عند الله وابلغكم ما ارسلت به ولكني اراكم قوما تجهلون
encrypted.24: فلما راوه عارضا مستقبل اوديتهم قالوا هذا عارض ممطرنا بل هو ما استعجلتم به ريح فيها عذاب اليم
encrypted.25: تدمر كل شيء بامر ربها فاصبحوا لا يرى الا مساكنهم كذلك نجزي القوم المجرمين
encrypted.26: ولقد مكناهم فيما ان مكناكم فيه وجعلنا لهم سمعا وابصارا وافئدة فما اغنى عنهم سمعهم ولا ابصارهم ولا افئدتهم من شيء اذ كانوا يجحدون بايات الله وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون
encrypted.27: ولقد اهلكنا ما حولكم من القرى وصرفنا الايات لعلهم يرجعون
encrypted.28: فلولا نصرهم الذين اتخذوا من دون الله قربانا الهة بل ضلوا عنهم وذلك افكهم وما كانوا يفترون
encrypted.29: واذ صرفنا اليك نفرا من الجن يستمعون القران فلما حضروه قالوا انصتوا فلما قضي ولوا الى قومهم منذرين
encrypted.30: قالوا يا قومنا انا سمعنا كتابا انزل من بعد موسى مصدقا لما بين يديه يهدي الى الحق والى طريق مستقيم
encrypted.31: يا قومنا اجيبوا داعي الله وامنوا به يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويجركم من عذاب اليم

data: *46:29 Jinns are the creatures who fully agreed with Satan when he initiated his famous blasphemy  billions  of  years  ago.  They  are  brought  into  this  world  as  descendants  of Satan. One jinn is born every time a human being is born. The newly born jinn is assigned to the same body as the newly born human, and constantly pushes Satan’s point of view (Appendix 7).

verses.32: Those who fail to respond to GOD’s call cannot escape, and will have no Lord other than Him; they have gone far astray.
verses.33: Do they not realize that GOD, who created the heavens and the earth without the least effort is able to revive the dead? Yes indeed; He is Omnipotent.
verses.34: The day the disbelievers are introduced to the Hellfire, they will be asked, “Is this not the truth?” They will answer, “Yes indeed, by our Lord.” He will say, “Then suffer the retribution for your disbelief.”
verses.35: Therefore, be patient like the messengers before you who possessed strength  and resorted  to  patience. Do not be in a hurry to see the retribution that will inevitably come to them. The day they see it, it will seem as if they lasted one hour of the day. This is a proclamation: Is it not the wicked who are consistently annihilated?

encrypted.32: ومن لا يجب داعي الله فليس بمعجز في الارض وليس له من دونه اولياء اولئك في ضلال مبين
encrypted.33: اولم يروا ان الله الذي خلق السماوات والارض ولم يعي بخلقهن بقادر على ان يحيي الموتى بلى انه على كل شيء قدير
encrypted.34: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار اليس هذا بالحق قالوا بلى وربنا قال فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون
encrypted.35: فاصبر كما صبر اولو العزم من الرسل ولا تستعجل لهم كانهم يوم يرون ما يوعدون لم يلبثوا الا ساعة من نهار بلاغ فهل يهلك الا القوم الفاسقون

verses.1: Those  who  disbelieve  and  repel from the path of GOD, He nullifies their works.
verses.2: Those who believe and work righteousness, and believe in what was sent  down  to  Muhammad—which  is the truth from their Lord—He remits their sins, and blesses them with contentment.
verses.3: This  is  because  those  who  disbelieve are following falsehood, while those who believe are following the truth from their Lord. GOD thus cites for the people, their examples.
verses.4: If you encounter (in war)  those who disbelieve, you may strike the necks. If you take them as captives you may set them free or ransom them, until the war ends. Had GOD willed, He could  have  granted  you  victory, without war. But He thus tests you by one another. As for those who get killed in the cause of GOD, He will never put their sacrifice to waste.
verses.5: He will guide them, and bless them with contentment.
verses.6: He  will  admit  them  into  Paradise, that He described to them.
verses.7: O you who believe, if you support GOD,  He  will  support  you,  and strengthen your foothold.
verses.8: Those  who  disbelieve  incur  misery; He causes their works to be utterly in vain.
verses.9: That  is  because  they  hated  what GOD  revealed  and  consequently, He nullifies their works.
verses.10: Did they not roam the earth and see the consequences for those before them? GOD destroyed their works; all disbelievers will suffer the same fate.
verses.11: This is because GOD is the Lord of those who believe, while the disbelievers have no lord.

encrypted.1: الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله اضل اعمالهم
encrypted.2: والذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات وامنوا بما نزل على محمد وهو الحق من ربهم كفر عنهم سيئاتهم واصلح بالهم
encrypted.3: ذلك بان الذين كفروا اتبعوا الباطل وان الذين امنوا اتبعوا الحق من ربهم كذلك يضرب الله للناس امثالهم
encrypted.4: فاذا لقيتم الذين كفروا فضرب الرقاب حتى اذا اثخنتموهم فشدوا الوثاق فاما منا بعد واما فداء حتى تضع الحرب اوزارها ذلك ولو يشاء الله لانتصر منهم ولكن ليبلو بعضكم ببعض والذين قتلوا في سبيل الله فلن يضل اعمالهم
encrypted.5: سيهديهم ويصلح بالهم
encrypted.6: ويدخلهم الجنة عرفها لهم
encrypted.7: يا ايها الذين امنوا ان تنصروا الله ينصركم ويثبت اقدامكم
encrypted.8: والذين كفروا فتعسا لهم واضل اعمالهم
encrypted.9: ذلك بانهم كرهوا ما انزل الله فاحبط اعمالهم
encrypted.10: افلم يسيروا في الارض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم دمر الله عليهم وللكافرين امثالها
encrypted.11: ذلك بان الله مولى الذين امنوا وان الكافرين لا مولى لهم

data: *46:35 Quranic and mathematical evidence proves that the messenger addressed here is Rashad Khalifa. By adding the gematrical value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230), plus the sura number (46), plus the verse number (35), we get 1311, or 19x69. This conforms with the Quran’s code (Appendix 2).

verses.12: GOD admits those who believe and lead a righteous life into gardens with flowing streams. As for those who disbelieve, they live and eat like the animals eat, then end up in the hellfire.
verses.13: Many  a  community  was  much stronger than the community that evicted you from your town; when we annihilated them, no one could help them.
verses.14: Are those enlightened by their Lord the same as those whose evil works are adorned in their eyes, and they follow their own opinions?
verses.15: The  allegory  of  Paradise  that  is promised for the righteous is this: it has rivers of unpolluted water, and rivers of fresh milk, and rivers of wine—delicious  for  the  drinkers— and rivers of strained honey. They have all kinds of fruits therein, and forgiveness from their Lord. (Are they better) or those who abide forever in the hellfire, and drink hellish water that tears up their intestines?
verses.16: Some of them listen to you, then as soon as they leave they ask those who were enlightened, “What did he just say?” GOD thus seals their hearts and, consequently, they follow only their opinions.
verses.17: As for those who are guided, He augments their guidance, and grants them their righteousness.
verses.18: Are  they  waiting  until  the  Hour comes to them suddenly? All the signs thereof have already come.* Once the Hour comes to them, how will they benefit from their message?
verses.19: You shall know that: “There is no other god beside GOD,”* and ask forgiveness of your sins and the sins of  all  believing  men  and  women. GOD is fully aware of your decisions and your ultimate destiny.
verses.20: Those  who believed  said:  “When will a new sura be revealed?” But when a  straightforward sura  was revealed, wherein fighting was mentioned, you would see those who harbored  doubts  in  their  hearts looking at you, as if death had already come to them. They were thus exposed.
verses.21: Obedience  and  righteous  utterances are expected of them. If only they showed confidence in GOD, when mobilization was called for, it would have been better for them.
verses.22: Is it also your intention that as soon as you leave you will commit evil and mistreat your relatives?
verses.23: It  is  those  who  incurred  a  curse from  GOD,  whereby  He  rendered them deaf and blind.

encrypted.12: ان الله يدخل الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار والذين كفروا يتمتعون وياكلون كما تاكل الانعام والنار مثوى لهم
encrypted.13: وكاين من قرية هي اشد قوة من قريتك التي اخرجتك اهلكناهم فلا ناصر لهم
encrypted.14: افمن كان على بينة من ربه كمن زين له سوء عمله واتبعوا اهواءهم
encrypted.15: مثل الجنة التي وعد المتقون فيها انهار من ماء غير اسن وانهار من لبن لم يتغير طعمه وانهار من خمر لذة للشاربين وانهار من عسل مصفى ولهم فيها من كل الثمرات ومغفرة من ربهم كمن هو خالد في النار وسقوا ماء حميما فقطع امعاءهم
encrypted.16: ومنهم من يستمع اليك حتى اذا خرجوا من عندك قالوا للذين اوتوا العلم ماذا قال انفا اولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم واتبعوا اهواءهم
encrypted.17: والذين اهتدوا زادهم هدى واتاهم تقواهم
encrypted.18: فهل ينظرون الا الساعة ان تاتيهم بغتة فقد جاء اشراطها فانى لهم اذا جاءتهم ذكراهم
encrypted.19: فاعلم انه لا اله الا الله واستغفر لذنبك وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات والله يعلم متقلبكم ومثواكم
encrypted.20: ويقول الذين امنوا لولا نزلت سورة فاذا انزلت سورة محكمة وذكر فيها القتال رايت الذين في قلوبهم مرض ينظرون اليك نظر المغشي عليه من الموت فاولى لهم
encrypted.21: طاعة وقول معروف فاذا عزم الامر فلو صدقوا الله لكان خيرا لهم
encrypted.22: فهل عسيتم ان توليتم ان تفسدوا في الارض وتقطعوا ارحامكم
encrypted.23: اولئك الذين لعنهم الله فاصمهم واعمى ابصارهم

data: *47:18 The Quran, being the Final Testament, provides all the signs needed to pinpoint the end of the world; AD 2280. See Appendix 25 for the details.
*47:19 Significantly, the “First Pillar” of religion is stated in the sura entitled Muhammad, and is utterly devoted to God alone. Muhammad’s name was added by his idolizers, against his will.

verses.24: Why do they not study the Quran carefully? Do they have locks on their minds?
verses.25: Surely, those who slide back, after the guidance has been manifested to them, the devil has enticed them and led them on.
verses.26: This is because they said to those who  hated  what  GOD  has  sent down, “We will obey you in certain matters.” GOD fully knows their secret conspiracies.
verses.27: How will it be for them when the angels put them to death? They will beat them on their faces and their rear ends.
verses.28: This is because they followed what angered GOD and hated the things that please Him. Consequently, He has nullified their works.
verses.29: Did  those  who  harbor  doubts  in their hearts think that GOD will not bring out their evil thoughts?
verses.30: If we will, we can expose them for you, so that you can recognize them just by looking at them. However, you can recognize them by the way they talk. GOD is fully aware of all your works.
verses.31: We will certainly put you to the test, in order to distinguish those among you who strive, and steadfastly persevere. We must expose your true qualities.
verses.32: Those  who  disbelieve  and  repel from the path of GOD, and oppose the messenger after the guidance has been manifested for them, will never hurt GOD in the least. Instead, He nullifies their works.
verses.33: O you who believe, you shall obey GOD,  and  obey  the  messenger. Otherwise, all your works will be in vain.
verses.34: Those  who  disbelieve  and  repel from the path of GOD, then die as disbelievers, GOD will never forgive them.
verses.35: Therefore, you shall not waver and surrender in pursuit of peace, for you  are  guaranteed  victory,  and GOD is with you. He will never waste your efforts.
verses.36: This worldly life is no more than play and vanity. But if you believe and lead a righteous life, He will reward you, without asking you for any money.
verses.37: If He asked you for money, to the extent of creating a hardship for you, you might have become stingy, and your hidden evil might be exposed.
verses.38:
You are invited to spend in the cause of GOD, but some of you turn stingy. The stingy are stingy towards their own souls. GOD is Rich, while you are poor.

Warning to the Arabs*
If you turn away, He will substitute other people in your place, and they will not be like you.

encrypted.32: ان الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله وشاقوا الرسول من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى لن يضروا الله شيئا وسيحبط اعمالهم
encrypted.33: يا ايها الذين امنوا اطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول ولا تبطلوا اعمالكم
encrypted.34: ان الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله ثم ماتوا وهم كفار فلن يغفر الله لهم
encrypted.35: فلا تهنوا وتدعوا الى السلم وانتم الاعلون والله معكم ولن يتركم اعمالكم

encrypted.37: ان يسالكموها فيحفكم تبخلوا ويخرج اضغانكم
encrypted.38: ها انتم هؤلاء تدعون لتنفقوا في سبيل الله فمنكم من يبخل ومن يبخل فانما يبخل عن نفسه والله الغني وانتم الفقراء وان تتولوا يستبدل قوما غيركم ثم لا يكونوا امثالكم

data: *47:38 The Quran was given to the Arabs, in their language, for 1400 years, but they clearly rejected it and refused to believe that it is complete; they fabricated Hadith & Sunna.

verses.1: We  have  bestowed  upon  you  (O Messenger) a great victory.
verses.2: Whereby  GOD  forgives  your  past sins, as well as future sins, and perfects His blessings upon you, and guides you in a straight path.
verses.3: Additionally, GOD will support you with an unwavering support.
verses.4: He is the One who places contentment into the hearts of believers to augment more faith, in addition to their faith. To GOD belongs all forces of the heavens and the earth. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.
verses.5: He will certainly admit the believing men and women into gardens with flowing streams, wherein they abide forever.  He  will  remit  their  sins. This is, in the sight of GOD, a great triumph.
verses.6: And  He  will  requite  the  hypocrite men and women and the idol worshiping men and women, for they have harbored evil  thoughts about GOD.  Their  evil  will  backfire  against them. For GOD is angry with them,  condemns  them,  and  has prepared for them Gehenna.  What a miserable destiny!
verses.7: To GOD belongs all the forces in the heavens and the earth. GOD is Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.8: We have sent you as a witness, a bearer of good news, and a warner.
verses.9: That  you  people  may  believe  in GOD and His messenger, and reverence Him, and observe Him, and glorify Him, day and night.
verses.10: Surely, those who pledge allegiance to you, are pledging allegiance to GOD. GOD approves their pledge; He  places  His  hand  above  their hands. Those who violate such a pledge, commit the violation to their own detriment. As for those who fulfill their pledge with GOD, He will grant them a great recompense.
verses.11: The sedentary Arabs who stay behind will say, “We have been preoccupied  with  our  money  and  our families, so ask forgiveness for us!” They utter with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, “Who can protect you from GOD, if He willed any adversity for you, or if He willed any blessing for you?” GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.
verses.12: You secretly believed that the messenger and the believers will be defeated and never come back to their families, and this was firmly established in your hearts. You harbored evil thoughts and turned into wicked people.
verses.13: Anyone who refuses to believe in GOD and His messenger, we have prepared  for  the  disbelievers  a hellfire.

encrypted.2: ليغفر لك الله ما تقدم من ذنبك وما تاخر ويتم نعمته عليك ويهديك صراطا مستقيما
encrypted.3: وينصرك الله نصرا عزيزا
encrypted.4: هو الذي انزل السكينة في قلوب المؤمنين ليزدادوا ايمانا مع ايمانهم ولله جنود السماوات والارض وكان الله عليما حكيما
encrypted.5: ليدخل المؤمنين والمؤمنات جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار خالدين فيها ويكفر عنهم سيئاتهم وكان ذلك عند الله فوزا عظيما
encrypted.6: ويعذب المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات الظانين بالله ظن السوء عليهم دائرة السوء وغضب الله عليهم ولعنهم واعد لهم جهنم وساءت مصيرا
encrypted.7: ولله جنود السماوات والارض وكان الله عزيزا حكيما
encrypted.8: انا ارسلناك شاهدا ومبشرا ونذيرا
encrypted.9: لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتعزروه وتوقروه وتسبحوه بكرة واصيلا
encrypted.10: ان الذين يبايعونك انما يبايعون الله يد الله فوق ايديهم فمن نكث فانما ينكث على نفسه ومن اوفى بما عاهد عليه الله فسيؤتيه اجرا عظيما
encrypted.11: سيقول لك المخلفون من الاعراب شغلتنا اموالنا واهلونا فاستغفر لنا يقولون بالسنتهم ما ليس في قلوبهم قل فمن يملك لكم من الله شيئا ان اراد بكم ضرا او اراد بكم نفعا بل كان الله بما تعملون خبيرا
encrypted.12: بل ظننتم ان لن ينقلب الرسول والمؤمنون الى اهليهم ابدا وزين ذلك في قلوبكم وظننتم ظن السوء وكنتم قوما بورا
encrypted.13: ومن لم يؤمن بالله ورسوله فانا اعتدنا للكافرين سعيرا

data: *48:1 This profound statement consists of 19 letters, indicating that our generation is the  generation  of  victory  for  God’s  purified,  unified,  and  consolidated  religion—Submission (3:19, 3:85). It is our generation that witnessed the revelations of God’s great miracle in the Quran (Appendix 1).

verses.14: To  GOD  belongs  the  sovereignty  of the  heavens  and  the  earth.  He  forgives  whomever  He  wills,  and punishes  whomever  He  wills.  GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.15: The  sedentary  who  stay  behind  will say,  when  you  are  expected  to  collect spoils of war, “Let us follow you to  share  in  this!”  They  thus  wish  to alter  GOD’s  words.  Say,  “You  will not  follow  us.  This  is  GOD’s  decision.”  They  will  then  say,  “You must  be  envious  of  us  (for  staying behind).”  Indeed,  they  rarely  understood anything.
verses.16: Say  to  the  sedentary  Arabs  who  stay behind,  “You  will  be  invited  to  face powerful  people  and  to  fight  them, unless  they  submit.  If  you  obey, GOD  will  reward  you  with  a  generous  recompense.  But  if  you  turn away  again,  as  you  did  in  the  past, He  will  requite  you  with  a  painful retribution.”
verses.17: The  blind  is  not  to  be  blamed,  the crippled  is  not  to  be  blamed,  and  the sick  is  not  to  be  blamed.  Those  who obey  GOD  and  His  messenger,  He will  admit  them  into  gardens  with flowing  streams.  As  for  those  who turn  away,  He  will  requite  them  with a painful retribution.
verses.18: GOD  is  pleased  with  the  believers who  pledged  allegiance  to  you  under  the  tree.  He  knew  what  was  in their  hearts  and,  consequently,  He blessed  them  with  contentment,  and rewarded  them  with  an  immediate victory.
verses.19: Additionally,  they  gained  many spoils.  GOD  is  Almighty,  Most Wise.
verses.20: GOD  has  promised  you  many  spoils that  you  will  gain.  He  thus  advanced some benefits  for  you in this  life, and He  has  withheld  the  people’s  hands of  aggression  against  you,  and  has rendered  this  a  sign  for  the  believers.  He  thus  guides  you  in  a  straight path.
verses.21: As  for  the  group  that  you  could  not possibly  defeat,  GOD  took  care  of them; GOD is Omnipotent.
verses.22: If  the  disbelievers  ever  fought  you, they  would  turn  around  and  flee. They  have  no  Lord  and  Master;  they have no helper.
verses.23: Such  is  GOD’s  system  throughout history,  and  you  will  find  that  GOD’s system is unchangeable.
verses.24: He   is the   One   who   withheld their  hands  of  aggression  against you,  and  withheld  your  hands  of  aggression  against  them  in  the  valley  of Mecca,  after  He  had  granted  you victory  over  them.  GOD  is  Seer  of everything you do.
verses.25: It  is  they  who  disbelieved  and  barred  you  from  the  Sacred  Masjid,  and even  prevented  your  offerings  from reaching  their  destination.  There were  believing  men  and  women (within  the  enemy  camp)  whom  you did  not  know,  and  you  were  about  to hurt  them,  unknowingly.  GOD  thus admits  into  His  mercy  whomever He wills. If they persist, He will requite  those  among  them  who  disbelieve with a painful retribution.

encrypted.14: ولله ملك السماوات والارض يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء وكان الله غفورا رحيما

encrypted.20: وعدكم الله مغانم كثيرة تاخذونها فعجل لكم هذه وكف ايدي الناس عنكم ولتكون اية للمؤمنين ويهديكم صراطا مستقيما
encrypted.21: واخرى لم تقدروا عليها قد احاط الله بها وكان الله على كل شيء قديرا
encrypted.22: ولو قاتلكم الذين كفروا لولوا الادبار ثم لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا
encrypted.23: سنة الله التي قد خلت من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا
encrypted.24: وهو الذي كف ايديهم عنكم وايديكم عنهم ببطن مكة من بعد ان اظفركم عليهم وكان الله بما تعملون بصيرا
encrypted.25: هم الذين كفروا وصدوكم عن المسجد الحرام والهدي معكوفا ان يبلغ محله ولولا رجال مؤمنون ونساء مؤمنات لم تعلموهم ان تطئوهم فتصيبكم منهم معرة بغير علم ليدخل الله في رحمته من يشاء لو تزيلوا لعذبنا الذين كفروا منهم عذابا اليما

verses.26: While  those  who  disbelieved  were enraged, and their hearts were filled with the pride  of  the days of ignorance,  GOD  blessed  His  messenger and the believers with peaceful  contentment,  and  directed  them to  uphold  the  word  of  righteousness.  This  is  what  they  well  deserved. GOD is fully aware of all things.
verses.27: GOD has fulfilled His messenger’s truthful vision: “You will enter the Sacred  Masjid,  GOD  willing,  perfectly secure, and you will cut your hair  or  shorten  it  (as  you  fulfill  the pilgrimage rituals) there. You will not have any fear. Since He knew what  you  did  not  know,  He  has coupled this with an immediate victory.”
verses.28: He is the  One who sent  His  messenger  with  the  guidance  and  the religion of truth, to make it prevail over all other religions. GOD suffices as a witness.*
verses.29: Muhammad—the  messenger  of GOD—and  those  with  him  are harsh and stern against the disbelievers, but kind and compassionate amongst themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating, as they seek GOD blessings and approval. Their marks are on their faces, because of prostrating. This is the same example as in the Torah. Their example in the Gospel is like plants that grow taller and stronger, and please the farmers. He thus enrages the disbelievers.  GOD  promises  those among them who believe and lead a righteous  life  forgiveness  and  a great recompense.

encrypted.26: اذ جعل الذين كفروا في قلوبهم الحمية حمية الجاهلية فانزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين والزمهم كلمة التقوى وكانوا احق بها واهلها وكان الله بكل شيء عليما
encrypted.27: لقد صدق الله رسوله الرؤيا بالحق لتدخلن المسجد الحرام ان شاء الله امنين محلقين رءوسكم ومقصرين لا تخافون فعلم ما لم تعلموا فجعل من دون ذلك فتحا قريبا
encrypted.28: هو الذي ارسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله وكفى بالله شهيدا
encrypted.29: محمد رسول الله والذين معه اشداء على الكفار رحماء بينهم تراهم ركعا سجدا يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضوانا سيماهم في وجوههم من اثر السجود ذلك مثلهم في التوراة ومثلهم في الانجيل كزرع اخرج شطاه فازره فاستغلظ فاستوى على سوقه يعجب الزراع ليغيظ بهم الكفار وعد الله الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات منهم مغفرة واجرا عظيما

verses.1: O you who believe, do not place your opinion above that of GOD and His messenger. You shall reverence GOD. GOD is Hearer, Omniscient.
verses.2: O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet,* nor shall you shout at him as you shout at each other, lest your works become nullified while you do not perceive.
verses.3: Surely, those who lower their voices at the messenger of GOD are the ones whose hearts are prepared by GOD to become righteous.* They have deserved forgiveness and a great recompense.

data: *48:28  This  important  prophecy  informs  us  that  Submission  will  inevitably  dominate the  whole  world.  This,  together  with  Verses  9:33,  41:53,  and  61:9  leave  no  doubt  that God’s mathematical  miracle of  the  Quran  will play a  major  role  in  this  prophecy. Solid Quranic  mathematical  evidence  points  to  God’s  Messenger  of  the  Covenant  as  fulfilling this prophecy. See Appendices 2 & 26 for the evidence and specific details.

*49:2  Whenever  the  word  “prophet”  (Nabi)  is  used  in  reference  to  Muhammad,  it invariably refers to him during his life, not after his death. Obviously, we cannot possibly raise our voices above Muhammad’s voice, now that he is dead. See also 33:56.
*49:3 Respecting the messenger helps outsiders and visitors in coming to God’s message.

verses.4: As for those who call on you from outside the walls, most of them do not understand.
verses.5: Had  they  been  patient  until  you came out to them, it would have been better for them. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.6: O you who believe, if a wicked person brings any news to you, you shall first investigate, lest you commit injustice towards some people, out of ignorance, then become sorry and remorseful for what you have done.
verses.7: And know that GOD’s messenger has come in your midst. Had he listened to you in many things, you would have made things difficult for yourselves. But GOD made you love faith and adorned it in your hearts, and He  made you abhor  disbelief, wickedness,  and  disobedience. These are the guided ones.
verses.8: Such is grace  from GOD and His blessings. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.
verses.9: If  two  groups  of  believers  fought with each other, you shall reconcile them. If one group aggresses against the other, you shall fight the aggressing group until they submit to GOD’s command. Once they submit, you shall reconcile the two groups equitably. You  shall  maintain justice; GOD loves those who are just.
verses.10: The believers are members of one family; you shall keep the peace within your family and reverence GOD, that you may attain mercy.
verses.11: O you who believe, no people shall ridicule other people, for they may be better than they. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than they. Nor shall you mock one another, or make fun of your names. Evil indeed is the reversion to wickedness after attaining faith. Anyone who does not repent after this, these are the transgressors.
verses.12: O you who believe, you shall avoid any suspicion, for even a little bit of suspicion is sinful. You shall not spy on one another, nor shall you backbite one another; this is as abominable as eating the flesh of your dead brother.  You  certainly  abhor  this. You  shall  observe  GOD.  GOD  is Redeemer, Most Merciful.
verses.13: O people, we created you from the same  male  and  female,  and  rendered you distinct peoples and tribes, that you may recognize one another. The best among you in the sight of GOD is the most righteous. GOD is Omniscient, Cognizant.
verses.14: The Arabs said, “We are Mu’mens (believers).” Say, “You have not believed; what you should say is, ‘We are  Muslims  (submitters),’  until  belief is established in your hearts.” If you obey GOD and His messenger, He will not put any of your works to waste. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

verses.15: Mu’mens (believers) are those who believe in GOD and His messenger, then attain the status of having no doubt whatsoever, and strive with their money and their lives in the cause of GOD. These are the truthful ones.
verses.16: Say,  “Are  you  informing  GOD about your religion? GOD knows everything in the heavens and the earth. GOD is Omniscient.”
verses.17: They act as if they are doing you a favor by embracing Submission! Say, “You are not doing me any favors by embracing Submission. GOD is the One who is doing you a great favor by guiding you to the faith, if you are sincere.”
verses.18: GOD knows all the secrets in the heavens and the earth; GOD is Seer of everything you do.

verses.1: Q., and the glorious Quran.*
verses.2: They  found  it  strange  that  a  warner from  among  them  came  to  them! The disbelievers said, “This is really strange.
verses.3: “After we die and become dust; this is impossible.”
verses.4: We  are  fully  aware  of  any  one  of them  who  gets  consumed  by  the earth; we have an accurate record.
verses.5: They  rejected  the  truth  when  it came to them; they are utterly confused.
verses.6: Have they not looked at the sky above them, and how we constructed it and adorned it, without a flaw?
verses.7: And we created the earth, and scattered on it mountains, and grew in it all kinds of beautiful plants.
verses.8: This is an enlightenment, and a reminder for every pious worshiper.
verses.9: And we sent from the sky blessed water, to grow with it gardens and grains to be harvested.
verses.10: Tall date palms, with clustered fruit.
verses.11: Provisions for the people. And we revive with it dead lands; you are similarly resurrected.
verses.12: Disbelieving before them were the people of Noah, the dwellers of Russ, and Thamoud.
verses.13: And ‘Aad, Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot.
verses.14: And the dwellers of the woods, and the people of Tubba‘. All of them disbelieved  the  messengers  and, consequently, My retribution befell them.
verses.15: Were we too burdened by the first creation? Is this why they doubt resurrection?
verses.16: We  created  the  human,  and  we know what he whispers to himself. We are closer to him than his jugular vein.
verses.17: Two recording (angels), at right and at left, are constantly recording.

data: *50:1 See Appendix 1 for the awesome miracles connected with the Initial “Q.”

verses.18: Not  an  utterance  does  he  utter without an alert witness.
verses.19: Finally, the inevitable coma of death comes; this is what you tried to evade.
verses.20: The horn is blown; this is the promised day.
verses.21: Every soul comes with a herder and a witness.
verses.22: You used to be oblivious to this. We now remove your veil; today, your vision is (as strong as) steel.
verses.23: The companion said, “Here is my formidable testimony.*”
verses.24: Throw  into  Gehenna  every  stubborn disbeliever.
verses.25: Forbidder of charity, aggressor, full of doubt.
verses.26: He set up beside GOD another god. Throw him into severe retribution.
verses.27: His companion said, “Our Lord, I did not mislead him; he was far astray.”
verses.28: He said, “Do not feud in front of Me; I have sufficiently warned you.
verses.29: “Nothing can be changed now. I am never unjust towards the people.”
verses.30: That is the day when we ask Hell, “Have you had enough?” It will say, “Give me more.”
verses.31: Paradise will be offered to the righteous, readily.
verses.32: This is what was promised to every repenter, steadfast.
verses.33: They  reverenced  the  Most  Gracious,  in their privacy,  and came wholeheartedly.
verses.34: Enter it in peace; this is the Day of Eternity.
verses.35: They get anything they wish therein, and we have even more.
verses.36: Many  a  generation  before  them, who were  more powerful, we annihilated.  They  searched  the  land; did they find an escape?
verses.37: This should be a lesson for everyone who possesses a mind, or is able to hear and witness.
verses.38: We have created the heavens and the earth, and everything between them in six days, and no fatigue touched us.
verses.39: Therefore, be patient in the face of their  utterances,  and  praise  and glorify  your  Lord  before  sunrise, and before sunset.
verses.40: During the night you shall meditate on His name, and after prostrating.
verses.41: Prepare for the day when the caller calls from a place that is near.
verses.42: When they hear the inevitable cry; that is the day you come out.
verses.43: We are the ones who control life and death; to us is the final destiny.
verses.44: The day will come when the earth cracks in a hurry, giving rise to them. Such summoning is easy for us to do.
verses.45: We are fully aware of everything they utter, while you have no power over them. Therefore, remind with this Quran, those who reverence My warnings.

encrypted.31: وازلفت الجنة للمتقين غير بعيد
encrypted.32: هذا ما توعدون لكل اواب حفيظ

data: *50:23-28 Your life-time companion witnesses everything you do. See Appendix 7.

verses.1: The blowing winds.
verses.2: Bearing rain.
verses.3: Bringing provisions.
verses.4: Distributing them as commanded.
verses.5: What is promised to you will surely come to pass.
verses.6: The Day of Judgment is inevitable.
verses.7: Despite the perfectly created sky.
verses.8: You continue to dispute the truth.
verses.9: Deviating  therefrom  are  the  deviators.
verses.10: Woe to the falsifiers.
verses.11: In  their  blundering,  they  are  totally heedless.
verses.12: They question the Day of Judgment.
verses.13: The  day  they  are  presented  to  the fire.
verses.14: Taste  the  retribution;  this  is  what you used to challenge.
verses.15: The  righteous  have  deserved  gardens and springs.
verses.16: They  receive  their  Lord’s  rewards, for they used to be pious.
verses.17: Rarely  did  they  sleep  the  whole night.
verses.18: At  dawn,  they  prayed  for  forgiveness.
verses.19: A  portion  of  their  money  was  set aside for the beggar and the needy.
verses.20: The earth is full of signs for those who are certain.
verses.21: And within yourselves; can you see?
verses.22: In  the  heaven  is  your  provision,  and everything that is promised to you.
verses.23: By  the  Lord  of  the  heaven  and  the earth,  this  is  as  true  as  the  fact  that you speak.
verses.24: Have  you  noted  the  history  of Abraham’s honorable guests?
verses.25: They  visited  him,  saying,  “Peace.” He said, “Peace to you, strangers!”
verses.26: He  asked  his  family  to  prepare  a  fat calf.
verses.27: When  he  offered  it  to  them,  he remarked, “Do you not eat?”
verses.28: He  harbored  fear  of  them.  They said,  “Have  no  fear,”  and  they  gave good news of a knowledgeable son.
verses.29: His  wife  was  astonished.  Noting  her wrinkled  face:  “I  am  a  sterile  old woman.”
verses.30: They  said,  “Thus  said  your  Lord.  He is the Most Wise, the Omniscient.”
verses.31: He  said,  “What  are  you  up  to,  O messengers?”
verses.32: They  said,  “We  have  been  dispatched to criminal people.
verses.33: “We will shower them with rocks of clay.
verses.34: “Marked  by  your  Lord  for  the  transgressors.”
verses.35: We then delivered all the believers.
verses.36: We did  not  find  in  it except one house of submitters.
verses.37: We set it up as a lesson for those who fear the painful retribution.
verses.38: In Moses (there is a lesson). We sent him  to  Pharaoh  with  manifest proofs.
verses.39: But  he  turned  away,  in  arrogance, and said, “Magician, or crazy.”

page: Drivers of the Winds (Al-Dhãreyãt) 51:40-60 & Mt. Sinai (Al-Toor) 52:1-10

verses.40: Consequently, we punished him and his troops. We threw them into the sea, and he is the one to blame.
verses.41: In ‘Aad (there is a lesson). We sent upon them disastrous wind.
verses.42: Anything that it came upon was utterly destroyed.
verses.43: In Thamoud (there is a lesson). They were told, “Enjoy temporarily.”
verses.44: They rebelled against the command of  their  Lord.  Consequently,  the lightning struck them as they looked.
verses.45: They could never get up, nor were they helped.
verses.46: And the people of Noah before that; they were wicked people.
verses.47: We constructed the sky with our hands, and we will continue to expand it.
verses.48: And we made the earth habitable; a perfect design.
verses.49: We created a pair (male and female) of everything, that you may take heed.
verses.50: You shall escape to GOD. I am sent by Him to you as a manifest warner.
verses.51: Do not set up beside GOD any other god. I am sent by Him to you as a manifest warner.
verses.52: Consistently,  when  a  messenger went to the previous generations, they said, “Magician,” or, “Crazy.”
verses.53: Did they make an agreement with each other? Indeed, they are transgressors.
verses.54: You may disregard them; you cannot be blamed.
verses.55: And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers.
verses.56: I did not create the jinns and the humans  except  to  worship  Me alone.
verses.57: I need no provisions from them, nor do I need them to feed Me.
verses.58: GOD is the Provider, the Possessor of all power, the Supreme.
verses.59: The transgressors have incurred the same fate as their previous counterparts; they should not challenge.
verses.60: Woe to those who disbelieved from the day that is awaiting them.

encrypted.40: فاخذناه وجنوده فنبذناهم في اليم وهو مليم

encrypted.45: فما استطاعوا من قيام وما كانوا منتصرين

encrypted.47: والسماء بنيناها بايد وانا لموسعون

encrypted.54: فتول عنهم فما انت بملوم

verses.2: The recorded scripture
verses.3: Published in books
verses.4: The frequented Shrine
verses.5: The exalted ceiling
verses.6: The sea that is set aflame
verses.7: Your Lord’s requital is unavoidable.
verses.8: No force in the universe can stop it.
verses.9: The day will come when the sky will violently thunder.
verses.10: The mountains will be wiped out.

verses.11: Woe  on  that  day  to  the  disbelievers—
verses.12: who are in their blundering, heedless.
verses.13: They will be herded into Gehenna, forcibly.
verses.14: This is the Fire in which you used to disbelieve.
verses.15: Is this magic, or do you not see?
verses.16: Suffer the burning. Whether you are patient or impatient, it will be the same for you. This is the just requital for what you did.
verses.17: The righteous  have deserved gardens and bliss.
verses.18: They  enjoy  what  their  Lord  has reserved for them; their Lord has spared them the retribution of Hell.
verses.19: Eat and drink happily, in return for your works.
verses.20: They relax on luxurious furnishings, and we match them with beautiful spouses.
verses.21: For those who believed, and their children  also  followed  them  in belief, we will have their children join them. We never fail to reward them for any work. Every person is paid for what he did.
verses.22: We will supply them with fruits and meats that they love.
verses.23: They will enjoy drinks that are never polluted, and never sinful to drink.
verses.24: Serving them will be servants like protected pearls.
verses.25: They will meet each other and reminisce among themselves.
verses.26: They will say, “We used to be kind and humble among our people.
verses.27: “GOD has blessed us, and has spared us the agony of ill winds.
verses.28: “We used to implore Him; He is the Most Kind, Most Merciful.”
verses.29: You shall remind the people. With your Lord’s blessing’s upon you, you are neither a soothsayer, nor crazy.
verses.30: They may say, “He is a poet; let us just wait until he is dead.”
verses.31: Say, “Go on waiting; I will wait along with you.”
verses.32: Is it their dreams that dictate their behavior, or are they naturally wicked?
verses.33: Do they say, “He made it all up?” Instead,  they are simply  disbelievers.
verses.34: Let them produce a Hadith like this, if they are truthful.
verses.35: Were  they  created  from  nothing? Are they the creators?
verses.36: Did they create the heavens and the earth? Indeed, they have no certainty.
verses.37: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord? Are they in control?
verses.38: Do they climb a ladder that enables them  to  listen?  Let  their  listeners show their proof.
verses.39: Does He have daughters, while you have sons?
verses.40: Are you asking them for any wage, and they are burdened thereby?
verses.41: Do they know the future, and have it recorded?

verses.42: Are  they  plotting  and  scheming? The  disbelievers’  schemes  backfire against them.
verses.43: Do  they  have  another  god  besides GOD?  GOD  be  glorified,  far  above having partners.
verses.44: When  they  see  masses  falling  from the sky, they will say, “Piled clouds!”
verses.45: Disregard  them  until  they  meet  the day in which they are struck.
verses.46: On  that  day,  their  schemes  will  not protect  them,  nor  will  they  be  helped.
verses.47: Those  who  transgress  suffer  retribution  here,  but  most  of  them  do  not know.
verses.48: You  shall  steadfastly  persevere  in carrying  out  your  Lord’s  command—you  are  in  our  eyes—and glorify  and  praise  your  Lord  when you get up.
verses.49: Also  during  the  night  glorify  Him, and at dawn as the stars fade away.

verses.1: As the stars fell away.*
verses.2: Your  friend  (Muhammad)  was  not astray, nor was he deceived.
verses.3: Nor  was  he  speaking  out  of  a  personal desire.
verses.4: It was divine inspiration
verses.5: Dictated by the Most Powerful
verses.6: Possessor  of  all  authority.  From  His highest height.
verses.7: At the highest horizon
verses.8: He drew nearer by moving down
verses.9: Until  He  became  as  close  as  possible.
verses.10: He  then  revealed  to  His  servant what was to be revealed.
verses.11: The  mind  never  made  up  what  it saw.
verses.12: Are you doubting what he saw?
verses.13: He saw him in another descent
verses.14: At the ultimate point
verses.15: Where  the  eternal  Paradise  is  located.
verses.16: The whole place was overwhelmed
verses.17: The  eyes  did  not  waver,  nor  go blind.
verses.18: He saw great signs of his Lord.
verses.19: Compare  this  with  the  female  idols Allaat and Al-‘Uzzah.
verses.20: And Manaat, the third one
verses.21: Do  you  have  sons,  while  He  has these as daughters?
verses.22: What a disgraceful distribution!
verses.23: These  are  but  names  that  you  made up,  you  and  your  forefathers.  GOD never  authorized  such  a  blasphemy. They  follow  conjecture,  and  personal  desire,  when  the  true  guidance  has  come  to  them  herein  from their Lord.

data: *53:1-18 Muhammad was summoned to the highest universe to receive this Quran into his heart. The stars fell away as he traveled through them at millions of times the speed of  light.  Subsequently,  the  Quran  was  gradually  released  to  his  memory.  Please  see Appendix 28.

verses.24: What is it that the human being desires?
verses.25: To  GOD  belongs  both  the  Hereafter, and this world.
verses.26: Not even the angels in heaven possess authority to intercede. The only ones permitted by GOD are those who act in accordance with His will and His approval.
verses.27: Those who disbelieve in the Hereafter have given the angels feminine names.
verses.28: They had no knowledge about this; they only conjectured. Conjecture is no substitute for the truth.
verses.29: You shall disregard those who turn away  from our message, and become preoccupied with this worldly life.
verses.30: This is the extent of their knowledge. Your Lord is fully aware of those who strayed away from His path, and He is fully aware of those who are guided.
verses.31: To GOD belongs everything in the heavens  and  everything  on  earth. He will requite those who commit evil for their works, and will reward the  righteous  for  their  righteousness.
verses.32: They avoid gross sins and transgressions,  except  for  minor  offenses. Your Lord’s forgiveness is immense. He has been fully aware of you since He initiated you from the earth, and while you were embryos in your mothers’ bellies. Therefore, do not exalt yourselves; He is fully aware of the righteous.
verses.33: Have you noted the one who turned away?
verses.34: Rarely did he give to charity, and then very little.
verses.35: Did he possess knowledge of the future? Could he see it?
verses.36: Was he not informed of the teachings in the scripture of Moses?
verses.37: And Abraham who fulfilled?
verses.38: No soul bears the sins of another soul.
verses.39: Every human being is responsible for his own works.
verses.40: And  everyone’s  works  will  be shown.
verses.41: Then they will be paid fully for such works.
verses.42: To your Lord is the final destiny.
verses.43: He is the One who makes you laugh or cry.
verses.44: He is the One who controls death and life.
verses.45: He is the One who created the two kinds, male and female—
verses.46: from a tiny drop of semen.
verses.47: He will effect the recreation.
verses.48: He is the One who makes you rich or poor.
verses.49: He is the Lord of the galaxies.
verses.50: He is the One who annihilated ancient ‘Aad.
verses.51: And wiped out Thamoud.
verses.52: Also  the  people  of  Noah  before that; they were evil transgressors.
verses.53: The  evil  communities  (of  Sodom and Gomorrah) were the lowliest.

verses.1: The Hour has come closer, and the moon has split.*
verses.2: Then they saw a miracle; but they turned away and said, “Old magic.”
verses.3: They  disbelieved,  followed  their opinions, and adhered to their old traditions.
verses.4: Sufficient warnings have been delivered to alert them.
verses.5: Great wisdom; but all the warnings have been in vain.
verses.6: Ignore  them;  the  day  will  come when  the  caller  will  announce  a terrible disaster.
verses.7: With  their  eyes  humiliated,  they come out of the graves like scattered locusts.
verses.8: As they respond to the caller, the disbelievers will say, “This is a difficult day.”
verses.9: The  people  of  Noah  disbelieved before them. They disbelieved our servant and said, “Crazy!” He was persecuted.
verses.10: He implored his Lord, “I am oppressed; grant me victory.”
verses.11: We then opened the gates of the sky, pouring water.
verses.12: And we caused springs to gush out of the earth. The waters met to effect a predetermined decision.
verses.13: We  carried  him  on  a  watercraft made of logs and ropes.
verses.14: It ran under our watchful eyes; a reward for one who was rejected.
verses.15: We have set it up as a lesson. Does any of you wish to learn?
verses.16: How terrible was  My retribution after the warnings!
verses.17: We made the Quran easy to learn. Does any of you wish to learn?
verses.18: ‘Aad disbelieved. Consequently, how terrible was My retribution after the warnings.

data: *54:1 This important sign of the approaching end of the world came to pass in 1969 when humans landed on the moon and brought pieces of the moon to earth. At the same time, God’s mathematical Miracle of the Quran was being gradually unveiled. Traditional Muslims opposed it, since it exposed the fallacy of their practices (Appendix 25).

verses.19: We  sent  upon  them  violent  winds, on a day of continuous misery.
verses.20: It  tossed  the  people  around  as  if they were decayed palm tree trunks.
verses.21: How  terrible  was  My  retribution after the warnings!
verses.22: We  made  the  Quran  easy  to  learn Does any of you wish to learn?
verses.23: Thamoud rejected the warnings.
verses.24: They  said,  “Shall  we  follow  one  of us;  a  human  being?  We  will  then  go astray, then end up in Hell.
verses.25: “Did  the  message  come  down  to him,  instead  of  us?  He  is  a  flagrant liar.”
verses.26: They  will  find  out  tomorrow  who  the flagrant liar is.
verses.27: We  are  sending  the  camel  as  a  test for  them.  Watch  them  and  be  patient.
verses.28: Inform  them  that  the  water  shall  be divided  among  them;  (the  camel) shall  be  allowed  to  drink  on  her designated day.
verses.29: But  they  persuaded  their  friend  to kill (the camel), and he obliged.
verses.30: Consequently,  how  terrible  was  My retribution!  They  have  been  warned.
verses.31: We  sent  upon  them  one  blow, whereupon  they  became  like  harvested hay.
verses.32: We  made  the  Quran  easy  to  learn Does any of you wish to learn?
verses.33: The  people  of  Lot  rejected  the warnings.
verses.34: We  showered  them  with  rocks.  Only Lot’s family was saved at dawn.
verses.35: We  blessed  him  and  his  family;  we thus reward the appreciative.
verses.36: He  warned  them  about  our  requital, but they ridiculed the warnings.
verses.37: They  negotiated  with  him  about  his guests;  we  blinded  them.  Suffer  My retribution; you have been warned.
verses.38: Early  the  next  morning,  a  devastating retribution struck them.
verses.39: Suffer  My  retribution;  you  have been warned.
verses.40: We  made  the  Quran  easy  to  learn Does any of you wish to learn?
verses.41: Pharaoh’s people were warned.
verses.42: They  rejected  all  our  signs.  Consequently,  we  requited  them  as  an  Almighty, Omnipotent should.
verses.43: Are  your  disbelievers  better  than those  disbelievers?  Have  you  been absolved by the scripture?
verses.44: Perhaps they think, “We will be the winners.”
verses.45: All  of  them  will  be  defeated;  they will turn around and flee.
verses.46: The  Hour  is  awaiting  them,  and the  Hour  is  far  worse  and  more painful.
verses.47: Certainly,  the  guilty  are  astray,  and will end up in Hell.
verses.48: They  will  be  dragged  into  the  hellfire,  forcibly.  Suffer  the  agony  of retribution.
verses.49: Everything  we  created  is  precisely measured.
verses.50: Our  commands  are  done  within  the blink of an eye.
verses.51: We  annihilated  your  counterparts Does any of you wish to learn?

data: *56:13-40  People  who  believe  and  nourish  their  souls  through  worshiping  God  alone are  destined  for  the  High  Heaven.  The  contemporary  followers  of  each  messenger invariably  suffer  persecution  from  the  traditionalists  and  adherents  of  the  corrupted religion. Thus, they have a special place reserved for them in the High Heaven. All people who die before the age of 40 go to the Lower Heaven, at least (46:15).

verses.47: They  said,  “After  we  die  and  turn  to dust  and  bones,  we  get  resurrected?

verses.49: Say,  “The  early  generations  and  the later generations.
verses.50: “Will  be  summoned  to  a  meeting  on  a predetermined day.
verses.51: “Then you, O disbelieving strayers.
verses.52: “Will  eat  from  the  trees  of  bitterness.
verses.53: “Filling your bellies therefrom.
verses.54: “Then  drinking  on  top  of  it  hellish drinks.
verses.55: “Then adding drinks of sand.
verses.56: Such  is  their  share  on  the  Day  of Judgment.
verses.57: We  have  created  you,  if  you  could only believe!
verses.58: Have  you  noted  the  semen  that  you produce?
verses.59: Did you create it, or did we?
verses.60: We  have  predetermined  death  for you. Nothing can stop us—
verses.61: from  substituting  new  generations in  your  place,  and  establishing  what you do not know.

verses.1: Glorifying GOD is everything in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.2: To Him belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth. He controls life and death. He is Omnipotent.
verses.3: He is the Alpha and the Omega. He is the Outermost and the Innermost. He is fully aware of all things.

data: *56:75-76  Our  universe,  the  smallest  and  innermost  of  seven  universes,  contains  a billion  galaxies,  a  billion  trillion  stars,  spanning  billions  of  light  years.  These  uncountable  decillions  of  heavenly  bodies  maintain  their  orbits  in  a  divinely  controlled precision.  The  more  we  learn,  the  more  we  realize  how  awesome  this  oath  is.  See Appendix 6.

*56:79 The insincere who are not satisfied  with the Quran alone are divinely prevented from  understanding  the  Quran.  This  concept  is  repeated  throughout  the  Quran  (17:45, 18:57).  Consequently,  they  cannot  understand  this  verse.  For  example,  compare  this translation of 7:3, 17:46, 41:44, & 56:79 with other translations.

verses.4: He is the One who created the heavens and the earth in six days,* then assumed all authority. He knows everything that enters into the earth, and everything that comes out of it, and everything that comes down from the sky, and everything that climbs into it. He is with you wherever you may be. GOD is Seer of everything you do.
verses.5: To Him belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth. All matters are controlled by GOD.
verses.6: He merges the night into the day, and merges the day into the night. He is fully aware of the innermost thoughts.
verses.7: Believe in GOD and His messenger, and give from what He has bestowed upon you. Those among you who believe and give (to charity) have deserved a great recompense.
verses.8: Why should you not believe in GOD when the messenger is inviting you to believe in your Lord? He has taken a pledge from you, if you are believers.
verses.9: He is the One who sends down to His servant clear revelations, in order to lead you out of the darkness into the light. GOD is Compassionate towards you, Most Merciful.
verses.10:
Why do you not spend in the cause of GOD, when GOD possesses all wealth in the heavens and the earth?

Special Honor
Distinguished  from  the  rest  are those among you who spend before the victory and strive. They attain a greater rank than those who spend after  the  victory  and  strive.  For each,  GOD  promises  salvation. GOD is Cognizant of everything you do.
verses.11: Who would like to loan GOD a loan of righteousness, to have it multiplied for him manifold, and end up with a generous recompense?
verses.12: The day will come when you see the believing men and women with their lights radiating ahead of them and to their right. Good news is yours that, on that day, you will have gardens with flowing streams. You will abide therein forever. This is the great triumph.
verses.13: On that day, the hypocrite men and women will say to those who believed, “Please allow us to absorb some of your light.” It will be said, “Go back behind you, and seek light.” A barrier will be set up between them, whose gate separates mercy on the inner side, from retribution on the outer side.
verses.14: They will call upon them, “Were we not with you?” They will answer, “Yes, but you cheated your souls, hesitated, doubted, and became misled by wishful thinking, until GOD’s judgment came. You were diverted from GOD by illusions.
verses.15: “Therefore, today no ransom can be taken from you, nor from those who disbelieved. Your abode is the fire; it is your lord, and miserable abode.

data: *57:4  The  six  days  of  creation  are  simply  a  yardstick  to  inform  us  of  the  relative importance of various components, to emphasize the significance of the planet Earth, and to let us know that the Earth is the only inhabited planet. See Footnote 41:9-10.

verses.16: Is  it  not  time  for  those  who  believed to  open  up  their  hearts  for  GOD’s message,  and  the  truth  that  is  revealed  herein?  They  should  not  be  like the  followers  of  previous  scriptures whose  hearts  became  hardened with  time  and,  consequently,  many of them turned wicked.
verses.17: Know  that  GOD  revives  the  land after  it  had  died.  We  thus  explain the  revelations  for  you,  that  you  may understand.
verses.18: Surely,  the  charitable  men  and women, have loaned GOD a loan of goodness.  They  will  receive  their reward  multiplied  manifold;  they have  deserved  a  generous  recompense.
verses.19: Those  who  believed  in  GOD  and His  messengers  are  the  saints  and martyrs.  Reserved  for  them  at  their Lord  are  their  rewards  and  their light.  As  for  those  who  disbelieved and  rejected  our  revelations,  they have incurred Hell.
verses.20: Know  that  this  worldly  life  is  no more  than  play  and  games,  and boasting  among  you,  and  hoarding of  money  and  children.  It  is  like abundant  rain  that  produces  plants and  pleases  the  disbelievers.  But then  the  plants  turn  into  useless  hay, and  are  blown  away  by  the  wind.  In the  Hereafter  there  is  either  severe retribution,  or  forgiveness  from GOD and approval. This worldly life is  no  more  than  a  temporary  illusion.
verses.21: Therefore,  you  shall  race  towards forgiveness  from  your  Lord,  and  a Paradise  whose  width  encompasses the  heaven  and  the  earth.  It  awaits those  who  believed  in  GOD  and  His messengers.  Such  is  GOD’s  grace that  He  bestows  upon  whomever  He wills.  GOD  is  Possessor  of  Infinite Grace.
verses.22: Anything  that  happens  on  earth,  or to  you,  has  already  been  recorded, even  before  the  creation.  This  is easy for GOD to do.
verses.23: Thus,  you  should  not  grieve  over anything  you  miss,  nor  be  proud  of anything  He  has  bestowed  upon you. GOD does not love those who are boastful, proud.
verses.24: They  are  stingy,  and  enjoin  the  people  to  be  stingy.  If  one  turns  away, then  GOD  is  the  Rich,  the  Praiseworthy.
verses.25: We  sent  our  messengers  supported by  clear  proofs,  and  we  sent  down  to them  the  scripture  and  the  law,  that the  people  may  uphold  justice.  And we  sent  down  the  iron,  wherein there  is  strength,  and  many  benefits for  the  people.  All  this  in  order for  GOD  to  distinguish  those  who would  support  Him  and  His  messengers,  on  faith.  GOD  is  Powerful, Almighty.

encrypted.18: ان المصدقين والمصدقات واقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضاعف لهم ولهم اجر كريم
encrypted.19: والذين امنوا بالله ورسله اولئك هم الصديقون والشهداء عند ربهم لهم اجرهم ونورهم والذين كفروا وكذبوا باياتنا اولئك اصحاب الجحيم
encrypted.20: اعلموا انما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وزينة وتفاخر بينكم وتكاثر في الاموال والاولاد كمثل غيث اعجب الكفار نباته ثم يهيج فتراه مصفرا ثم يكون حطاما وفي الاخرة عذاب شديد ومغفرة من الله ورضوان وما الحياة الدنيا الا متاع الغرور
encrypted.21: سابقوا الى مغفرة من ربكم وجنة عرضها كعرض السماء والارض اعدت للذين امنوا بالله ورسله ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم
encrypted.22: ما اصاب من مصيبة في الارض ولا في انفسكم الا في كتاب من قبل ان نبراها ان ذلك على الله يسير
encrypted.23: لكيلا تاسوا على ما فاتكم ولا تفرحوا بما اتاكم والله لا يحب كل مختال فخور
encrypted.24: الذين يبخلون ويامرون الناس بالبخل ومن يتول فان الله هو الغني الحميد
encrypted.25: لقد ارسلنا رسلنا بالبينات وانزلنا معهم الكتاب والميزان ليقوم الناس بالقسط وانزلنا الحديد فيه باس شديد ومنافع للناس وليعلم الله من ينصره ورسله بالغيب ان الله قوي عزيز

data: *57:22 We are absolutely free to side with God, or with Satan. God happens to know precisely what kind of decision each of us will make. The video tape of your life, from birth to death, is already recorded. See Appendix 14.

verses.26: We sent Noah and Abraham, and we granted their descendants prophethood and the scripture. Some of them were guided, while many were wicked.
verses.27: Subsequent to them, we sent our messengers. We sent Jesus the son of Mary, and we gave him the Injeel (Gospel),  and  we  placed  in  the hearts of his followers kindness and mercy. But they invented hermitism which we never decreed for them. All we asked them to do was to uphold  the  commandments  approved by GOD. But they did not uphold the message as they should have. Consequently, we gave those who  believed  among  them  their recompense, while  many of them were wicked.
verses.28: O you who believe, you shall reverence GOD and believe in His messenger.  He  will  then  grant  you double the reward from His mercy, endow you with light to guide you, and forgive you. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.29: Thus,  the  followers  of  previous scripture  should  know  that  they have not monopolized GOD’s mercy and grace, and that all grace is in GOD’s hand. He bestows it upon whomever He wills. GOD is Possessor of Infinite Grace.

encrypted.26: ولقد ارسلنا نوحا وابراهيم وجعلنا في ذريتهما النبوة والكتاب فمنهم مهتد وكثير منهم فاسقون
encrypted.27: ثم قفينا على اثارهم برسلنا وقفينا بعيسى ابن مريم واتيناه الانجيل وجعلنا في قلوب الذين اتبعوه رافة ورحمة ورهبانية ابتدعوها ما كتبناها عليهم الا ابتغاء رضوان الله فما رعوها حق رعايتها فاتينا الذين امنوا منهم اجرهم وكثير منهم فاسقون
encrypted.28: يا ايها الذين امنوا اتقوا الله وامنوا برسوله يؤتكم كفلين من رحمته ويجعل لكم نورا تمشون به ويغفر لكم والله غفور رحيم
encrypted.29: لئلا يعلم اهل الكتاب الا يقدرون على شيء من فضل الله وان الفضل بيد الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

verses.1: GOD has heard the woman who debated with you about her husband, and complained to GOD. GOD heard everything the two of you discussed. GOD is Hearer, Seer.
verses.2: Those among you who estrange their wives (by declaring them as forbidden in sex) as their mothers know full well that they are not their mothers.* Their mothers are the women who gave birth to them. Indeed, they are committing a blasphemy and a falsehood. GOD is Pardoner, Forgiver.
verses.3: Those who estrange their wives in this manner, then reconcile thereafter, shall atone by freeing a slave before resuming their sexual relations. This is to enlighten you. GOD is Cognizant of everything you do.
verses.4: If you cannot find a slave to free, you shall fast two consecutive months before resuming sexual relations. If you cannot fast, then you shall feed sixty poor people. You shall believe in GOD and His messenger. These are GOD’s laws. The disbelievers have incurred a painful retribution.
verses.5: Surely, those who fight GOD and His messenger are committed to defeat, like their previous counterparts were committed to defeat. We have sent down clear proofs, and the rejectors have incurred a shameful retribution.
verses.6: The day will come when GOD will resurrect them all, then inform them of everything they had done. GOD has recorded everything, while they have forgotten it. GOD witnesses all things.

titles.1:
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sura 58: The Debate
(Al-Mujaadalah)
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

encrypted.1: قد سمع الله قول التي تجادلك في زوجها وتشتكي الى الله والله يسمع تحاوركما ان الله سميع بصير
encrypted.2: الذين يظاهرون منكم من نسائهم ما هن امهاتهم ان امهاتهم الا اللائي ولدنهم وانهم ليقولون منكرا من القول وزورا وان الله لعفو غفور
encrypted.3: والذين يظاهرون من نسائهم ثم يعودون لما قالوا فتحرير رقبة من قبل ان يتماسا ذلكم توعظون به والله بما تعملون خبير
encrypted.4: فمن لم يجد فصيام شهرين متتابعين من قبل ان يتماسا فمن لم يستطع فاطعام ستين مسكينا ذلك لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتلك حدود الله وللكافرين عذاب اليم
encrypted.5: ان الذين يحادون الله ورسوله كبتوا كما كبت الذين من قبلهم وقد انزلنا ايات بينات وللكافرين عذاب مهين
encrypted.6: يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فينبئهم بما عملوا احصاه الله ونسوه والله على كل شيء شهيد

data: *58:2 Estranging a wife by declaring that she is like one’s mother was an ancient tradition in Arabia. This is the only sura where the word “Allah” occurs in every verse.

verses.7: Do  you  not  realize  that  GOD  knows everything  in  the  heavens  and  everything  on  earth?  No  three  people  can conspire  secretly  without  Him  being their  fourth,  nor  five  without  Him being  the  sixth,  nor  less  than  that, nor  more,  without  Him  being  there with  them  wherever  they  may  be. Then,  on  the  Day  of  Resurrection, He  will  inform  them  of  everything they  had  done.  GOD  is  fully  aware of all things.
verses.8: Have  you  noted  those  who  were  enjoined  from  conspiring  secretly, then  insist  on  conspiring?  They  conspire  to  commit  sin,  transgression, and  disobedience  of  the  messenger. When  they  come  to  you,  they  greet you  with  a  greeting  other  than  that decreed  by  GOD.  They  say  inside themselves,  “GOD  will  not  punish us  for  our  utterances.”  Their  only requital  is  Gehenna,  wherein  they burn; what a miserable destiny.
verses.9: O  you  who  believe,  if  you  have  to confer  secretly,  you  shall  not  confer to  commit  sin,  transgression,  and  to disobey  the  messenger.  You  shall confer  to  work  righteousness  and piety.  You  shall  reverence  GOD, before  whom  you  will  be  summoned.
verses.10: Secret  conspiracy  is  the  devil’s  idea, through  which  he  seeks  to  hurt  those who  believed.  However,  he  cannot hurt  them  against  GOD’s  will.  In GOD the believers shall trust.
verses.11: O you who believe, if you  are told, “Please  make  room,”  you  shall make  room  for  each  other  to  sit. GOD  will  then  make  room  for  you. If you are asked to get up and move, get  up  and  move.  GOD  raises  those among  you  who  believe,  and  those who  acquire  knowledge  to  higher ranks.  GOD  is  fully  Cognizant  of everything you do.
verses.12: O  you  who  believe,  when  you  wish to  confer  with  the  messenger,  you shall  offer  a  charity  (to  the  poor) before  you  do  so.  This  is  better  for you,  and  purer.  If  you  cannot  afford it,  then  GOD  is  Forgiver,  Most  Merciful.
verses.13: If  you  failed  to  give  to  charity  before conferring,  then  repented  thereafter,  GOD  accepts  your  repentance.  You  shall  observe  the  contact prayers  (Salat),  give  the  obligatory charity  (Zakat),  and  obey  GOD  and His  messenger.  GOD  is  fully  Cognizant of everything you do.
verses.14: Have  you  noted  those  who  befriended  people  with  whom  GOD  is angry?  They  neither  belong  with you,  nor  with  them.  They  deliberately swear lies!
verses.15: GOD  has  prepared  for  them  a  severe  retribution.  Miserable  indeed is what they used to do.
verses.16: They  used  their  oaths  as  a  means  of repelling  from  the  path  of  GOD. Consequently,  they  have  incurred  a shameful retribution.
verses.17: Neither  their  money,  nor  their  children  will  help  them  against  GOD. They  have  incurred  the  hellfire, wherein they abide forever.
verses.18: The  Day  will  come  when  GOD  resurrects  them  all.  They  will  swear  to Him  then,  just  as  they  swear  to  you now,  thinking  that  they  really  are right! Indeed, they are the real liars.

encrypted.7: الم تر ان الله يعلم ما في السماوات وما في الارض ما يكون من نجوى ثلاثة الا هو رابعهم ولا خمسة الا هو سادسهم ولا ادنى من ذلك ولا اكثر الا هو معهم اين ما كانوا ثم ينبئهم بما عملوا يوم القيامة ان الله بكل شيء عليم
encrypted.8: الم تر الى الذين نهوا عن النجوى ثم يعودون لما نهوا عنه ويتناجون بالاثم والعدوان ومعصيت الرسول واذا جاءوك حيوك بما لم يحيك به الله ويقولون في انفسهم لولا يعذبنا الله بما نقول حسبهم جهنم يصلونها فبئس المصير
encrypted.9: يا ايها الذين امنوا اذا تناجيتم فلا تتناجوا بالاثم والعدوان ومعصيت الرسول وتناجوا بالبر والتقوى واتقوا الله الذي اليه تحشرون
encrypted.10: انما النجوى من الشيطان ليحزن الذين امنوا وليس بضارهم شيئا الا باذن الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون
encrypted.11: يا ايها الذين امنوا اذا قيل لكم تفسحوا في المجالس فافسحوا يفسح الله لكم واذا قيل انشزوا فانشزوا يرفع الله الذين امنوا منكم والذين اوتوا العلم درجات والله بما تعملون خبير
encrypted.12: يا ايها الذين امنوا اذا ناجيتم الرسول فقدموا بين يدي نجواكم صدقة ذلك خير لكم واطهر فان لم تجدوا فان الله غفور رحيم
encrypted.13: ااشفقتم ان تقدموا بين يدي نجواكم صدقات فاذ لم تفعلوا وتاب الله عليكم فاقيموا الصلاة واتوا الزكاة واطيعوا الله ورسوله والله خبير بما تعملون
encrypted.14: الم تر الى الذين تولوا قوما غضب الله عليهم ما هم منكم ولا منهم ويحلفون على الكذب وهم يعلمون
encrypted.15: اعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا انهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون
encrypted.16: اتخذوا ايمانهم جنة فصدوا عن سبيل الله فلهم عذاب مهين
encrypted.17: لن تغني عنهم اموالهم ولا اولادهم من الله شيئا اولئك اصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون
encrypted.18: يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فيحلفون له كما يحلفون لكم ويحسبون انهم على شيء الا انهم هم الكاذبون

verses.19: The devil has possessed them, and has  caused  them  to  disregard GOD’s message. These are the party of the devil. Absolutely, the party of the devil are the losers.
verses.20: Surely, those who oppose GOD and His  messenger  will  be  with  the lowliest.
verses.21: GOD has decreed: “I and My messengers will most assuredly win.” GOD is Powerful, Almighty.
verses.22: You will not find people who believe in GOD and the Last Day befriending those who oppose GOD and His messenger, even if they were their parents, or their children, or their siblings, or their tribe. For these, He decrees faith into their hearts, and supports them with inspiration from Him, and admits them into gardens with flowing streams wherein they abide forever. GOD is pleased with them,  and  they  are  pleased  with Him. These are the party of GOD. Most assuredly, GOD’s party are the winners.

encrypted.19: استحوذ عليهم الشيطان فانساهم ذكر الله اولئك حزب الشيطان الا ان حزب الشيطان هم الخاسرون
encrypted.20: ان الذين يحادون الله ورسوله اولئك في الاذلين
encrypted.21: كتب الله لاغلبن انا ورسلي ان الله قوي عزيز
encrypted.22: لا تجد قوما يؤمنون بالله واليوم الاخر يوادون من حاد الله ورسوله ولو كانوا اباءهم او ابناءهم او اخوانهم او عشيرتهم اولئك كتب في قلوبهم الايمان وايدهم بروح منه ويدخلهم جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار خالدين فيها رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه اولئك حزب الله الا ان حزب الله هم المفلحون

verses.1: Glorifying GOD is everything in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.2: He is the One who evicted those who disbelieved among the people of the scripture from their homes in a mass exodus. You never thought that they would leave, and they thought  that  their  preparations would protect them from GOD. But then  GOD  came  to  them  whence they never expected, and threw terror  into  their  hearts.  Thus,  they abandoned  their  homes  on  their own volition, in addition to pressure from  the  believers.  You  should learn from this, O you who possess vision.
verses.3: If GOD did not force them to leave, He would have requited them in this life (even worse than forcing them to leave). In  the Hereafter He  will commit them to the retribution of Hell.
verses.4: This is because they opposed GOD and His messenger. For those who oppose  GOD  and  His  messenger, GOD is  most strict in enforcing retribution.
verses.5: Whether you chop a tree, or leave it standing on its trunk, is in accordance with GOD’s will. He will surely humiliate the wicked.
verses.6: Whatever  GOD  restored  for  His messenger was not the result of your war efforts, whether you fought on horses or on foot. GOD is the One who sends His messengers against whomever He wills. GOD is Omnipotent.
verses.7: Whatever GOD restored to His messenger from the (defeated) communities shall go to GOD and His messenger (in the form of a charity). You shall give it to the relatives, the orphans, the poor, and the traveling alien. Thus, it will not remain monopolized by the strong among you. You may keep the spoils given to you by the messenger, but do not take what he enjoins you from taking. You shall reverence GOD. GOD is strict in enforcing retribution.

titles.1:
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sura 59: Exodus
(Al-Hashr)
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

encrypted.1: سبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الارض وهو العزيز الحكيم
encrypted.2: هو الذي اخرج الذين كفروا من اهل الكتاب من ديارهم لاول الحشر ما ظننتم ان يخرجوا وظنوا انهم مانعتهم حصونهم من الله فاتاهم الله من حيث لم يحتسبوا وقذف في قلوبهم الرعب يخربون بيوتهم بايديهم وايدي المؤمنين فاعتبروا يا اولي الابصار
encrypted.3: ولولا ان كتب الله عليهم الجلاء لعذبهم في الدنيا ولهم في الاخرة عذاب النار
encrypted.4: ذلك بانهم شاقوا الله ورسوله ومن يشاق الله فان الله شديد العقاب
encrypted.5: ما قطعتم من لينة او تركتموها قائمة على اصولها فباذن الله وليخزي الفاسقين
encrypted.6: وما افاء الله على رسوله منهم فما اوجفتم عليه من خيل ولا ركاب ولكن الله يسلط رسله على من يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير
encrypted.7: ما افاء الله على رسوله من اهل القرى فلله وللرسول ولذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل كي لا يكون دولة بين الاغنياء منكم وما اتاكم الرسول فخذوه وما نهاكم عنه فانتهوا واتقوا الله ان الله شديد العقاب

verses.8: (You  shall  give) to  the  needy  who immigrated.  They  were  evicted from  their  homes  and  deprived  of their  properties,  because  they sought  GOD’s  grace  and  pleasure, and  because  they  supported  GOD and  His  messenger.  They  are  the truthful.
verses.9: As  for  those  who  provided  them with  a  home  and  a  refuge,  and  were believers  before  them,  they  love those  who  immigrated  to  them,  and find  no  hesitation  in  their  hearts  in helping  them.  In  fact,  they  readily give  them  priority  over  themselves, even  when  they  themselves  need what  they  give  away.  Indeed,  those who  overcome  their  natural  stinginess are the successful ones.
verses.10: Those  who  became  believers  after them  say,  “Our  Lord,  forgive  us  and our  brethren  who  preceded  us  to  the faith,  and  keep  our  hearts  from  harboring  any  hatred  towards  those who  believed.  Our  Lord,  You  are Compassionate, Most Merciful.”
verses.11: Have  you  noted  those  who  are plagued  with  hypocrisy,  and  how they  said  to  their  companions  in  disbelief  among  the  people  of  the scripture,  “If  you  are  evicted  we  will go out with you, and will never obey anyone  who  opposes  you.  If  anyone fights  you,  we  will  fight  on  your side.”  GOD  bears  witness  that  they are liars.
verses.12: In  fact,  if  they  were  evicted,  they would  not  have  gone  out  with  them, and  if  anyone  fought  them,  they would  not  have  supported  them. Even  if  they  supported  them,  they would  have  turned  around  and  fled. They could never win.
verses.13: Indeed,  you  strike  more  terror  in their  hearts  than  their  fear  of  GOD. This  is  because  they  are  people  who do not comprehend.
verses.14: They  do  not  get  together  to  fight  you unless  they  are  in  well-shielded buildings,  or  behind  walls.  Their might  appears  formidable  among themselves.  You  would  think  that they  are  united,  when  in  fact  their hearts  are  divided.  This  is  because they  are  people  who  do  not  understand.
verses.15: Their  fate  is  the  same  as  their counterparts  who  preceded  them. They  suffered  the  consequences  of their  decisions.  They  have  incurred a painful retribution.
verses.16: They  are  like  the  devil:  he  says  to  the human  being,  “Disbelieve,”  then  as soon  as  he  disbelieves,  he  says,  “I disown  you.  I  fear  GOD,  Lord  of  the universe.”
verses.17: The  destiny  for  both  of  them  is  the Hellfire,  wherein  they  abide  forever.  This  is  the  requital  for  the transgressors.
verses.18: O  you  who  believe,  you  shall  reverence  GOD,  and  let  every  soul  examine  what  it  has  sent  ahead  for tomorrow.  You  shall  reverence GOD;  GOD  is  fully  Cognizant  of everything you do.
verses.19: Do  not  be  like  those  who  forgot GOD,  so  He  made  them  forget themselves. These are the wicked.
verses.20: Not  equal  are  the  dwellers  of  the Hellfire  and  the  dwellers  of  Paradise;  the  dwellers  of  Paradise  are the winners.

encrypted.8: للفقراء المهاجرين الذين اخرجوا من ديارهم واموالهم يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضوانا وينصرون الله ورسوله اولئك هم الصادقون
encrypted.9: والذين تبوءوا الدار والايمان من قبلهم يحبون من هاجر اليهم ولا يجدون في صدورهم حاجة مما اوتوا ويؤثرون على انفسهم ولو كان بهم خصاصة ومن يوق شح نفسه فاولئك هم المفلحون
encrypted.10: والذين جاءوا من بعدهم يقولون ربنا اغفر لنا ولاخواننا الذين سبقونا بالايمان ولا تجعل في قلوبنا غلا للذين امنوا ربنا انك رءوف رحيم
encrypted.11: الم تر الى الذين نافقوا يقولون لاخوانهم الذين كفروا من اهل الكتاب لئن اخرجتم لنخرجن معكم ولا نطيع فيكم احدا ابدا وان قوتلتم لننصرنكم والله يشهد انهم لكاذبون
encrypted.12: لئن اخرجوا لا يخرجون معهم ولئن قوتلوا لا ينصرونهم ولئن نصروهم ليولن الادبار ثم لا ينصرون
encrypted.13: لانتم اشد رهبة في صدورهم من الله ذلك بانهم قوم لا يفقهون
encrypted.14: لا يقاتلونكم جميعا الا في قرى محصنة او من وراء جدر باسهم بينهم شديد تحسبهم جميعا وقلوبهم شتى ذلك بانهم قوم لا يعقلون
encrypted.15: كمثل الذين من قبلهم قريبا ذاقوا وبال امرهم ولهم عذاب اليم

verses.21: If we revealed this Quran to a mountain, you would see it trembling, crumbling,  out  of  reverence  for GOD. We cite these examples for the people, that they may reflect.
verses.22: He is the One GOD; there is no other god besides Him. Knower of all secrets and declarations. He is the Most Gracious, Most Merciful.
verses.23: He is the One GOD; there is no other god besides Him. The King, the  Most  Sacred,  the  Peace,  the Most Faithful, the Supreme, the Almighty,  the  Most  Powerful,  the Most Dignified. GOD be glorified; far above having partners.
verses.24: He is the One GOD; the Creator, the Initiator, the Designer. To Him belong the most beautiful names. Glorifying Him is everything in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.

encrypted.23: هو الله الذي لا اله الا هو الملك القدوس السلام المؤمن المهيمن العزيز الجبار المتكبر سبحان الله عما يشركون
