verses.1: O  you  who  believe,  you  shall  not befriend My enemies and your enemies, extending love and friendship to them, even though they have disbelieved in the truth that has come to  you.  They  persecute  the  messenger,  and  you,  just  because  you believe in GOD, your Lord. If you mobilize  to  struggle  in  My  cause, seeking My blessings, how can you secretly love them? I am fully aware of everything you conceal, and everything you declare. Those among you who do this have indeed strayed off the right path.
verses.2: Whenever they encounter you, they treat you as enemies, and hurt you with their hands and tongues. They want you to disbelieve.
verses.3: Your relatives and your money can never help  you.  On  the  Day  of Resurrection, He will judge among you. GOD is Seer of everything you do.
verses.4: A good example has been set for you by Abraham and those with him. They said to their people, “We disown you and the idols that you worship besides GOD. We denounce you, and you will see nothing from us except animosity and hatred until you believe in GOD ALONE.”* However, a mistake was committed by Abraham when he said to his father, “I will pray for your forgiveness,** but I possess no power to protect you from GOD.” “Our Lord, we trust in You, and submit to You; to You is the final destiny.

data: *60:4 The Arabic word for “ALONE” (WAHDAHU) occurs only six times in the Quran, one  of  them  refers  to  upholding  the  Quran  ALONE  (17:46).  The  reference  to  God ALONE  occurs  in  7:70,  39:45,  40:12  &  40:84,  and  60:4.  The  sum  of  these  numbers (7+70+39+45+40+12+84+60+4)  equals  361,  or  19x19.  This  emphasizes  that the main theme of the Quran is “Worship God ALONE.” See Appendix 1.
**60:4 We can pray for guidance for the idolaters, not forgiveness, since God’s law is that idolatry is the only unforgivable offense (4:48 & 4:116).

verses.5: “Our  Lord,  let  us  not  be  oppressed by  those  who  disbelieved,  and  forgive  us.  You  are  the  Almighty,  Most Wise.”
verses.6: A  good  example  has  been  set  by them  for  those  who  seek  GOD  and the  Last  Day.  As  for  those  who  turn away,  GOD  is  in  no  need  (of  them), Most Praiseworthy.
verses.7: GOD  may  change  the  animosity  between  you  and  them  into  love.  GOD is  Omnipotent.  GOD  is  Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.8: GOD  does  not  enjoin  you  from befriending  those  who  do  not  fight you  because  of  religion,  and  do  not evict  you  from  your  homes.  You  may befriend  them  and  be  equitable towards  them.  GOD  loves  the  equitable.
verses.9: GOD  enjoins  you  only  from  befriending  those  who  fight  you  because  of  religion,  evict  you  from your  homes,  and  band  together  with others  to  banish  you.  You  shall  not befriend  them.  Those  who  befriend them are the transgressors.
verses.10: O  you  who  believe,  when  believing women  (abandon  the  enemy  and) ask  for  asylum  with  you,  you  shall test  them.  GOD  is  fully  aware  of their  belief.  Once  you  establish  that they  are  believers,  you  shall  not return  them  to  the  disbelievers. They are not lawful to remain married  to  them,  nor  shall  the  disbelievers  be  allowed  to  marry  them. Give  back  the  dowries  that the  disbelievers have paid.  You  commit  no error by marrying them, so long as you pay them their due dowries. Do not  keep  disbelieving  wives  (if  they wish to join the enemy). You may ask them  for  the  dowry  you  had  paid, and they may ask for what they paid. This is GOD’s rule; He rules among you.  GOD  is  Omniscient,  Most Wise.
verses.11: If any of your wives join the enemies’ camp,  and  you  are  forced  to  fight, you  shall  force  the  enemy  to  compensate  the  men  who  lost  their wives,  by  giving  them  what  they spent  on  their  wives.  You  shall  reverence GOD, in whom you believe.
verses.12: O  you  prophet,  when  the  believing women  (who  abandoned  the  disbelievers)  to  seek  asylum  with  you pledge  to  you  that  they  will  not  set up  any  idols  besides  GOD,  nor  steal, nor  commit  adultery,  nor  kill  their children,  nor  fabricate  any  falsehood,  nor  disobey  your  righteous orders,  you  shall  accept  their pledge,  and  pray  to  GOD  to  forgive them.  GOD  is  Forgiver,  Most  Merciful.
verses.13: O  you  who  believe,  do  not  befriend people  with  whom  GOD  is  angry, and  who  are  hopelessly  stuck  in  disbelief;  they  are  just  as  hopeless  as the  disbelievers  who  are  already  in the graves.

verses.2: O you who believe, why do you say what you do not do?
verses.3: Most  abominable  in  the  sight  of GOD is that you say what you do not do.
verses.4: GOD  loves  those  who  fight  in  His cause  united  in  one  column,  like  the bricks in one wall.
verses.5: Recall  that  Moses  said  to  his  people,  “O  my  people,  why  do  you  hurt me,  even  though  you  know  that  I  am GOD’s  messenger  to  you?”  When they  deviated,  GOD  diverted  their hearts.  For  GOD  does  not  guide  the wicked people.
verses.6: Recall  that  Jesus,  son  of  Mary,  said, “O  Children  of  Israel,  I  am  GOD’s messenger  to  you,  confirming  the Torah  and  bringing  good  news  of  a messenger  to  come  after  me  whose name  will  be  even  more  praised (Ahmad).”  Then,  when  he  showed them  the  clear  proofs,  they  said, “This is profound magic.”
verses.7: Who  is  more  evil  than  one  who fabricates  lies  about  GOD,  and  he  is being  invited  to  Submission?  GOD does not guide the evil people.
verses.8: They  wish  to  put  out  GOD’s  light with  their  mouths.  But  GOD  insists upon  perfecting  His  light,  in  spite  of the disbelievers.
verses.9: He  has  sent  His  messenger*  with the  guidance  and  the  true  religion, and  will  make  it  dominate  all  religions,  in  spite  of  the  idol  worshipers.
verses.10: O  you  who  believe,  let  Me  inform you of a trade that will save you from painful retribution.
verses.11: Believe  in  GOD  and  His  messenger and  strive  in  the  cause  of  GOD  with your  money  and  your  lives.  This  is the  best  deal  for  you,  if  you  only knew.
verses.12: In  return,  He  forgives  your  sins,  and admits  you  into  gardens  with  flowing  streams,  with  beautiful  mansions in  the  gardens  of  Eden.  This  is  the greatest triumph.
verses.13: Additionally,  you  get  something  you truly  love:  support  from  GOD  and guaranteed  victory.  Give  good  news to the believers.
verses.14: O you who believe, be GOD’s supporters,  like  the  disciples  of  Jesus, son  of  Mary.  When  he  said  to  them, “Who  are  my  supporters  towards GOD,”  they  said,  “We  are  GOD’s supporters.”  Thus,  a  group  from  the Children  of  Israel  believed,  and another  group  disbelieved.  We helped  those  who  believed  against their enemy, until they won.

data: *61:9 The specific name of this messenger is spelled out mathematically (Appendix 2).

verses.2: He is the One who sent to the gentiles  a  messenger  from  among  them, to  recite  to  them  His  revelations, purify  them,  and  teach  them  the scripture  and  wisdom.  Before  this, they had gone far astray.
verses.3: And  to  many  generations  subsequent  to  them.  He  is  the  Almighty, Most Wise.
verses.4: Such  is  GOD’s  grace  that  He  bestows  upon  whomever  He  wills. GOD is Possessor of Infinite Grace.
verses.5: The  example  of  those  who  were  given  the  Torah,  then  failed  to  uphold it,  is  like  the  donkey  carrying  great works  of  literature.  Miserable  indeed  is  the  example  of  people  who rejected  GOD’s  revelations.  GOD does not guide the wicked people.
verses.6: Say,  “O  you  who  are  Jewish,  if  you claim  that  you  are  GOD’s  chosen,  to the  exclusion  of  all  other  people, then  you  should  long  for  death  if  you are truthful!”
verses.7: They  will  never  long  for  it,  because of  what  they  have  committed.  GOD is fully aware of the wicked.
verses.8: Say,  “The  death  that  you  are  trying to  evade  will  catch  up  with  you sooner  or  later.  Then  you  will  be returned  to  the  Knower  of  all  secrets  and  declarations,  then  He  will inform  you  of  everything  you  had done.”
verses.9: O  you  who  believe,  when  the  Congregational  Prayer  (Salat  Al-Jumu’ah)  is  announced  on  Friday,  you shall  hasten  to  the  commemoration of  GOD,  and  drop  all  business.  This is better for you, if you only knew.
verses.10: Once  the  prayer  is  completed,  you may  spread  through  the  land  to  seek GOD’s  bounties,  and  continue  to remember  GOD  frequently,  that you may succeed.
verses.11: When  some  of  them  come  across  a business  deal,  or  some  entertainment,  they  rush  to  it  and  leave  you standing!  Say,  “What  GOD  possesses  is  far  better  than  the  entertainment  or  the  business.  GOD  is  the best Provider.”

verses.1: When  the  hypocrites  come  to  you they  say,  “We  bear  witness  that  you are  the  messenger  of  GOD.”*  GOD knows  that  you  are  His  messenger, and  GOD  bears  witness  that  the hypocrites are liars.
verses.2: Under  the  guise  of  their  apparent faith,  they  repel  the  people  from  the path  of  GOD.  Miserable  indeed  is what they do.

data: *63:1 The “first pillar of Islam,” as stated in 3:18 is to bear witness that God is the only god. But the corrupted “Muslim” scholars add “Muhammad is God’s messenger,” and this violates a number of commandments (see 2:285). Verse 63:1 is the only place in the Quran where such a statement is made. Only the hypocrites make such a statement.

verses.3: This  is  because  they  believed,  then disbelieved.  Hence,  their  minds  are blocked; they do not understand.
verses.4: When  you  see  them,  you  may  be impressed  by  their  looks.  And  when they speak, you may listen to their eloquence.  They  are  like  standing logs.  They  think  that  every  call  is intended  against  them.  These  are the  real  enemies;  beware  of  them. GOD  condemns  them;  they  have deviated.
verses.5: When  they  are  told,  “Come  let  the messenger  of  GOD  pray  for  your forgiveness,”  they  mockingly  turn their  heads,  and  you  see  them  repel others and act arrogantly.
verses.6: It  is  the  same  for  them,  whether  you pray  for  their  forgiveness,  or  not pray  for  their  forgiveness;  GOD  will not  forgive  them.  For  GOD  does  not guide the wicked people.
verses.7: They  are  the  ones  who  say,  “Do  not give  any  money  to  those  who  followed  the  messenger  of  GOD,  perhaps  they  abandon  him!”  However, GOD  possesses  the  treasures  of  the heavens  and  the  earth,  but  the hypocrites do not comprehend.
verses.8: They say, “If we go back to the city, the  powerful  therein  will  evict  the weak  (and  we  will  be  victimized).” (They  should  know  that)  all  dignity belongs  to  GOD  and  His  messenger, and  the  believers.  However,  the hypocrites do not know.
verses.9: O  you  who  believe,  do  not  be  distracted  by  your  money  and  your children  from  remembering  GOD. Those who do this are the losers.
verses.10: You  shall  give  from  our  provisions to  you  before  death  comes  to  you, then  you say, “My  Lord,  if only You could  delay  this  for  a  short  while!  I would  then  be  charitable  and  join the righteous!”
verses.11: GOD  never  delays  the  appointed time  of  death  for  any  soul.  GOD  is fully  Cognizant  of  everything  you do.

encrypted.7: هم الذين يقولون لا تنفقوا على من عند رسول الله حتى ينفضوا ولله خزائن السماوات والارض ولكن المنافقين لا يفقهون
encrypted.8: يقولون لئن رجعنا الى المدينة ليخرجن الاعز منها الاذل ولله العزة ولرسوله وللمؤمنين ولكن المنافقين لا يعلمون

encrypted.10: وانفقوا من ما رزقناكم من قبل ان ياتي احدكم الموت فيقول رب لولا اخرتني الى اجل قريب فاصدق واكن من الصالحين
encrypted.11: ولن يؤخر الله نفسا اذا جاء اجلها والله خبير بما تعملون

verses.1: Glorifying  GOD  is  everything  in  the heavens  and  everything  on  earth.  To Him  belongs  all  kingship,  and  to Him  belongs  all  praise,  and  He  is Omnipotent.
verses.2: He  is  the  One  who created you,  then among  you  there  is  the  disbeliever, and  the  believer.  GOD  is  fully  Seer of everything you do.
verses.3: He  created  the  heavens  and  the earth  for  a  specific  purpose,*  designed  you  and  perfected  your  design, then to Him is the final destiny.
verses.4: He  knows  everything  in  the  heavens and  the  earth,  and  He  knows  everything  you  conceal  and  everything you  declare.  GOD is  fully  aware  of the innermost thoughts.

Sura 64: Mutual Blaming
(Al-Taghaabun)
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

encrypted.1: يسبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الارض له الملك وله الحمد وهو على كل شيء قدير
encrypted.2: هو الذي خلقكم فمنكم كافر ومنكم مؤمن والله بما تعملون بصير
encrypted.3: خلق السماوات والارض بالحق وصوركم فاحسن صوركم واليه المصير
encrypted.4: يعلم ما في السماوات والارض ويعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون والله عليم بذات الصدور

data: *63:6 Millions of people idolize their prophets because of this myth (Appendix 8).
*64:3 We are in this world due to God’s immense mercy. The Most Gracious has given us a chance to redeem ourselves. See the Introduction and Appendix 7.

verses.5: Have  you  noted  those  who  disbelieved  in  the  past,  then  suffered the  consequences  of  their  decision? They incurred a painful retribution.
verses.6: This  is  because  their  messengers went  to  them  with  clear  proofs,  but they  said,  “Shall  we  follow  humans like  us?”  They  disbelieved  and  turned  away.  GOD  does  not  need  them; GOD is in no need, Praiseworthy.
verses.7: Those  who  disbelieved  claim  that they  will  not  be  resurrected!  Yes indeed,  by  my  Lord,  you  will  be resurrected,  and  you  will  be  held accountable  for  everything  you  have done. This is easy for GOD to do.
verses.8: Therefore,  you  shall  believe  in  GOD and  His  messenger,  and  the  light that  we  have  revealed  herein.  GOD is  fully  Cognizant  of  everything  you do.
verses.9: The  day  will  come  when  He  summons  you  to  the  Day  of  Summoning. That  is  the  Day  of  Mutual  Blaming. Anyone  who  believes  in  GOD  and leads  a  righteous  life,  He  will  remit his  sins,  and  will  admit  him  into  gardens  with  flowing  streams.  They abide  therein  forever.  This  is  the greatest triumph.
verses.10: As  for  those  who  disbelieve  and reject  our  revelations,  they  are  the dwellers  of  the  Hell-fire;  they  abide therein  forever.  What  a  miserable destiny!
verses.11: Nothing  happens  to  you  except  in accordance with GOD’s will. Anyone who believes  in GOD, He  will guide  his  heart.  GOD  is  fully  aware of all things.
verses.12: You  shall  obey  GOD  and  you  shall obey  the  messenger.  If  you  turn away,  then  the  sole  mission  of  our messenger is to deliver the message.
verses.13: GOD:  there  is  no  other  god  besides Him.  In  GOD  the  believers  shall trust.
verses.14: O  you  who  believe,  your  spouses and  your  children  can  be  your enemies;  beware.  If  you  pardon,  forget,  and  forgive,  then  GOD  is  Forgiver, Most Merciful.
verses.15: Your  money  and  children  are  a  test, and  GOD  possesses  a  great  recompense.
verses.16: Therefore,  you  shall  reverence GOD as much as you can, and listen, and  obey,  and  give  (to  charity)  for your  own  good.  Anyone  who  is protected  from  his  own  stinginess, these are the successful ones.
verses.17: If you lend GOD a loan of righteousness,  He  will  multiply  the  reward  for you  manifold,  and  forgive  you.  GOD is Appreciative, Clement.
verses.18: The  Knower  of  all  secrets  and  declarations; the Almighty, Most Wise.

encrypted.12: واطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول فان توليتم فانما على رسولنا البلاغ المبين
encrypted.13: الله لا اله الا هو وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

encrypted.18: عالم الغيب والشهادة العزيز الحكيم

verses.1: O  you  prophet,  when  you  people divorce  the  women,  you  shall  ensure that  a  divorce  interim  is  fulfilled. You  shall  measure  such  an  interim precisely.*  You  shall  reverence GOD  your  Lord.  Do  not  evict  them from  their  homes,  nor  shall  you make  life  miserable  for  them,  to force  them  to  leave  on  their  own, unless  they  commit  a  proven  adultery.  These  are  GOD’s  laws.  Anyone who  transgresses  GOD’s  laws  commits  an  injustice  against  himself. You  never  know;  maybe  GOD  wills something good to come out of this.
verses.2: Once  the  interim  is  fulfilled,  you may  reconcile  with  them  equitably, or  go  through  with  the  separation equitably.  You  shall  have  two  equitable  witnesses  witness  the  divorce before  GOD.  This  is  to  enlighten those  who  believe  in  GOD  and  the Last  Day.  Anyone  who  reverences GOD, He will create an exit for him.
verses.3: And  will  provide  for  him  whence  he never  expected.  Anyone  who  trusts in GOD, He suffices him. GOD’s commands  are  done.  GOD  has decreed for everything its fate.
verses.4: As for the women who have reached menopause,  if  you  have  any  doubts, their  interim  shall  be  three  months. As for those who do not menstruate, and  discover  that  they  are  pregnant, their  interim  ends  upon  giving  birth. Anyone  who  reverences  GOD,  He makes everything easy for him.
verses.5: This  is  GOD’s  command  that  He sends  down  to  you.  Anyone  who reverences  GOD,  He  remits  his  sins, and rewards him generously.
verses.6: You  shall  allow  them  to  live  in  the same  home  in  which  they  lived  with you,  and  do  not  make  life  so  miserable  for  them  that  they  leave  on their  own.  If  they  are  pregnant,  you shall  spend  on  them  until  they  give birth.  If  they  nurse  the  infant,  you shall  pay  them  for  this  service.  You shall  maintain  the  amicable  relations  among  you.  If  you  disagree, you  may  hire  another  woman  to nurse the child.
verses.7: The  rich  husband  shall  provide  support  in  accordance  with  his  means, and  the  poor  shall  provide  according  to  the  means  that  GOD  bestowed  upon  him.  GOD  does  not impose  on  any  soul  more  than  He has  given  it.  GOD  will  provide  ease after difficulty.
verses.8: Many  a  community  rebelled  against the  commands  of  its  Lord  and against  His  messengers.  Consequently,  we  held  them  strictly  accountable,  and  requited  them  a  terrible requital.
verses.9: They  suffered  the  consequences  of their decisions; a profound loss.
verses.10: GOD  has  prepared  for  them  severe retribution.  Therefore,  you  shall reverence GOD,  O you who possess intelligence  and  believed.  GOD  has sent down to you a message −*

data: *65:1 The divorcee’s interim, before becoming eligible for remarriage, is a waiting period of three menstruations. This ensures that the divorcee was not pregnant (2:228).
*65:10-11 The “Messenger” here is clearly the Quran. Verse 10 talks about “sending down a message,” and this points to the Quran as the messenger in 65:11 (Appendix 20).

verses.11: a messenger* who recites to you GOD’s revelations, clearly, to lead those who believe and work righteousness out of the darkness into the light. Anyone who believes in GOD and leads a righteous life, He will admit him into gardens with flowing streams; they abide therein forever. GOD will generously reward him.
verses.12: GOD created seven universes and the same number of earths. The commands flow among them. This is to let you know that GOD is Omnipotent, and that GOD is fully aware of all things.

encrypted.11: رسولا يتلو عليكم ايات الله مبينات ليخرج الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات من الظلمات الى النور ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صالحا يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار خالدين فيها ابدا قد احسن الله له رزقا
encrypted.12: الله الذي خلق سبع سماوات ومن الارض مثلهن يتنزل الامر بينهن لتعلموا ان الله على كل شيء قدير وان الله قد احاط بكل شيء علما

verses.1: O you prophet, why do you prohibit what GOD has made lawful for you, just to please your wives? GOD is Forgiver, Merciful.*
verses.2: GOD has decreed for you the laws dealing with your oaths. GOD is your Lord, and He is the Omniscient, Most Wise.
verses.3: The prophet had trusted some of his wives with a certain statement, then one of them spread it, and GOD let him know about  it. He then informed his wife of part of the issue, and disregarded part. She asked him, “Who informed you of this?” He said, “I was informed by the Omniscient, Most Cognizant.”
verses.4: If the two of you repent to GOD, then your hearts have listened. But if you band together against him, then GOD is his ally, and so is Gabriel and the righteous believers. Also, the angels are his helpers.
verses.5: If he divorces you, his Lord will substitute other wives in your place who are better than you; submitters (Muslims), believers (Mu’mens), obedient,  repentant,  worshipers, pious, either previously married, or virgins.
verses.6: O you who believe, protect yourselves and your families from the Hellfire whose fuel is people and rocks. Guarding it are stern  and powerful angels who never disobey GOD; they do whatever they are commanded to do.
verses.7: O  you  who  disbelieved,  do  not apologize today. You are being requited only for what you did.
verses.8: O you who believe, you shall repent to GOD a firm repentance. Your Lord will then remit your sins and admit you into gardens with flowing streams. On that day, GOD will not disappoint the prophet  and those who believed with him. Their light will radiate in front of them and to their right. They will say, “Our Lord, perfect our light for us, and forgive us; You are Omnipotent.”

encrypted.7: يا ايها الذين كفروا لا تعتذروا اليوم انما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون
encrypted.8: يا ايها الذين امنوا توبوا الى الله توبة نصوحا عسى ربكم ان يكفر عنكم سيئاتكم ويدخلكم جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار يوم لا يخزي الله النبي والذين امنوا معه نورهم يسعى بين ايديهم وبايمانهم يقولون ربنا اتمم لنا نورنا واغفر لنا انك على كل شيء قدير

data: *65:11 See footnote for 65:10-11.

*65:12 Although God created six other planets that are identical to our Earth, there is life only on our planet. Thus, the evolutionists will be shown on the Day of Judgment that life did not just “evolve” on the planet because of its particular circumstances.
*66:1 Mohammedans around the world believe that Muhammad was infallible. This verse teaches us that he was indeed a fallible human being (18:110, 33:37, 40:66, 80:1).

verses.9: O prophet, struggle against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be stern  with  them.  Their  abode  is Gehenna, and a miserable destiny.
verses.10: GOD cites as examples of those who disbelieved the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were married to two of our righteous servants, but they betrayed them and, consequently, they could not help them at all against GOD. The two of them were told, “Enter the Hellfire with those who deserved it.”
verses.11: And GOD cites as an example of those who believed the wife of Pharaoh. She said, “My Lord, build a home for me at You in Paradise, and save me from Pharaoh and his works; save me from the transgressing people.”
verses.12: Also  Mary,  the  Amramite.  She maintained her chastity, then we blew into her from our spirit. She believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures; she was obedient.

titles.11: Examples of the Believers: Pharaoh’s Wife

encrypted.9: يا ايها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم وماواهم جهنم وبئس المصير
encrypted.10: ضرب الله مثلا للذين كفروا امرات نوح وامرات لوط كانتا تحت عبدين من عبادنا صالحين فخانتاهما فلم يغنيا عنهما من الله شيئا وقيل ادخلا النار مع الداخلين
encrypted.11: وضرب الله مثلا للذين امنوا امرات فرعون اذ قالت رب ابن لي عندك بيتا في الجنة ونجني من فرعون وعمله ونجني من القوم الظالمين
encrypted.12: ومريم ابنت عمران التي احصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيه من روحنا وصدقت بكلمات ربها وكتبه وكانت من القانتين

verses.1: Most exalted is the One in whose hands is all kingship, and He is Omnipotent.
verses.2: The One who created death and life for the purpose of distinguishing those among you who would do better.* He is the Almighty, the Forgiving.
verses.3: He created seven universes in layers. You do not see any imperfection in the creation by the Most Gracious. Keep looking; do you see any flaw?
verses.4: Look again and again; your eyes will come  back  stumped  and  conquered.
verses.5: We  adorned  the  lowest  universe with lamps, and guarded its borders with projectiles  against the devils; we prepared for them a retribution in Hell.
verses.6: For those who disbelieved in their Lord, the retribution of Gehenna. What a miserable destiny.
verses.7: When they get thrown therein, they hear its furor as it fumes.
verses.8: It  almost  explodes  from  rage. Whenever a group is thrown therein, its guards would ask them, “Did you not receive a warner?”
verses.9: They would answer, “Yes indeed; a warner did come to us, but we disbelieved  and  said,  ‘GOD  did  not reveal  anything.  You are totally astray.’ ”
verses.10: They also say, “If we heard or understood, we would not be among the dwellers of Hell!”
verses.11: Thus, they confessed their sins. Woe to the dwellers of Hell.
verses.12: As for those who reverence their Lord, when alone in their privacy, they have attained forgiveness and a great recompense.

verses.13: Whether  you  keep  your  utterances secret,  or  declare  them,  He  is  fully aware of the innermost thoughts.
verses.14: Should  He  not  know  what  He  created?  He  is  the  Sublime,  Most  Cognizant.
verses.15: He  is  the  One  who  put  the  Earth  at your  service.  Roam  its  corners,  and eat  from  His  provisions.  To  Him  is the final summoning.
verses.16: Have  you  guaranteed  that  the  One in  heaven  will  not  strike  the  earth and cause it to tumble?
verses.17: Have  you  guaranteed  that  the  One in  heaven  will  not  send  upon  you  a violent  storm?  Will  you  then  appreciate the value of My warning?
verses.18: Others  before  them  have  disbelieved;  how  terrible  was  My  requital!
verses.19: Have  they  not  seen  the  birds  above them  lined  up  in  columns  and spreading  their  wings?  The  Most Gracious  is  the  One  who  holds  them in the air. He is Seer of all things.
verses.20: Where  are  those  soldiers  who  can help  you  against  the  Most  Gracious?  Indeed,  the  disbelievers  are deceived.
verses.21: Who  is  there  to  provide  for  you,  if He  withholds  His  provisions?  Indeed,  they  have  plunged  deep  into transgression and aversion.
verses.22: Is  one  who  walks  while  slumped over  on  his  face  better  guided,  or one  who  walks  straight  on  the  right path?
verses.23: Say,  “He  is  the  One  who  initiated you, and granted you the hearing, the  eyes,  and  the  brains.  Rarely  are you appreciative.”
verses.24: Say,  “He  is  the  One  who  placed  you on  earth,  and  before  Him  you  will  be summoned.”
verses.25: They  challenge:  “When  will  that prophecy  come  to  pass,  if  you  are truthful?”
verses.26: Say,  “Such  knowledge  is  with  GOD; I  am  no  more  than  a  manifest  warner.”
verses.27: When  they  see  it  happening,  the faces  of  those  who  disbelieved  will turn  miserable,  and  it  will  be  proclaimed:  “This  is  what  you  used  to mock.”
verses.28: Say,  “Whether  GOD  decides  to  annihilate  me  and  those  with  me,  or  to shower  us  with  His  mercy,  who  is there  to  protect  the  disbelievers from a painful retribution?”
verses.29: Say,  “He  is  the  Most  Gracious;  we believe  in  Him,  and  we  trust  in  Him. You  will surely  find out who is really far astray.”
verses.30: Say,  “What  if  your  water  sinks  away, who  will  provide  you  with  pure water?”

data: *68:1 “NuN” is unique among the Quran’s miraculous initials. See Appendix 1.

verses.3: You  have attained  a recompense that is well deserved.
verses.4: You are blessed with a great moral character.
verses.5: You will see, and they will see.
verses.6: Which of you are condemned.
verses.7: Your Lord is fully aware of those who strayed off His path, and He is fully aware of those who are guided.
verses.8: Do not obey the rejectors.
verses.9: They wish that you compromise, so they too can compromise.
verses.10: Do not obey every lowly swearer.
verses.11: A slanderer, a backbiter.
verses.12: Forbidder of charity, a transgressor, a sinner.
verses.13: Unappreciative, and greedy.
verses.14: Even though he possessed enough money and children.
verses.15: When our revelations are recited to him,   he   says,   “Tales  from  the past!”
verses.16: We will mark his face.
verses.17: We have tested them like we tested the owners of the garden who swore that they will harvest it in the morning.
verses.18: They were so absolutely sure.
verses.19: A passing (storm) from your Lord passed by it while they were asleep.
verses.20: By morning, it was barren.
verses.21: They called on each other in the morning.
verses.22: “Let us harvest the crop.”
verses.23: On their way, they confided to each other.
verses.24: That from then on, none of them would be poor.
verses.25: They were so absolutely sure of their harvest.
verses.26: But when they saw it, they said, “We were so wrong!
verses.27: “Now, we have nothing!”
verses.28: The righteous among them said, “If only you had glorified (God)!”
verses.29: They said, “Glory be to our Lord We have transgressed.”
verses.30: They started to blame each other.
verses.31: They said, “Woe to us. We sinned.
verses.32: “May our Lord grant us a better one. We repent to our Lord.”
verses.33: Such was the requital. But the retribution of the Hereafter is far worse, if they only knew.
verses.34: The  righteous  have  deserved,  at their Lord, gardens of bliss.
verses.35: Shall we treat the Submitters like the criminals?
verses.36: What is wrong with your logic?
verses.37: Do you have another book to uphold?
verses.38: In  it,  do  you  find  anything  you want?
verses.39: Or, have you received solemn assurances  from  us  that  grant  you whatever you wish on the Day of Resurrection?
verses.40: Ask them, “Who guarantees this for you?”
verses.41: Do they have idols? Let their idols help them, if they are truthful.

verses.42: The day will come when they will be exposed, and they will be required to fall prostrate, but they will be unable to.
verses.43: With their eyes subdued, humiliation will cover them. They were invited to fall prostrate when they were whole and able.
verses.44: Therefore, let Me deal with those who reject this Hadith; we will lead them on whence they never perceive.
verses.45: I will give them enough rope; My scheming is formidable.
verses.46: Are you asking them for money, so they are burdened by the fine?
verses.47: Do they know the future? Do they have it recorded?
verses.48: You shall steadfastly persevere in carrying out the commands of your Lord. Do not be like (Jonah) who called from inside the fish.
verses.49: If it were not for his Lord’s grace, he would have been ejected into the desert as a sinner.
verses.50: But his Lord blessed him, and made him righteous.
verses.51: Those who disbelieved show their ridicule in their eyes when they hear the message and say, “He is crazy!”
verses.52: It is in fact a message to the world.

verses.1: The incontestable (event)
verses.2: What an incontestable (event)!
verses.3: It is truly incontestable
verses.4: Thamoud and ‘Aad disbelieved in the Shocker.
verses.5: As for Thamoud, they were annihilated by the devastating (quake).
verses.6: As for ‘Aad, they were annihilated by a persistent, violent storm.
verses.7: He  unleashed  it  upon  them  for seven  nights  and  eight  days,  violently.  You  could  see  the  people  tossed around like decayed palm trunks.
verses.8: Can you find any trace of them?
verses.9: Pharaoh,  others  before  him,  and  the sinners (of Sodom) were wicked.
verses.10: They  disobeyed  the  messenger  of their  Lord.  Consequently,  He  requited them a devastating requital.
verses.11: The  flood  was  devastating,  so  we carried you on the floating (ark).
verses.12: We rendered it a lesson for you, that any listening ear may understand.
verses.13: When the horn is blown once.
verses.14: The earth and the mountains will be carried  off  and  crushed;  utterly crushed.
verses.15: That is the day when the inevitable event will come to pass.
verses.16: The  heaven  will  crack,  and  fall apart.
verses.17: The  angels  will  be  all  around,  and Your Lord’s dominion will then encompass eight (universes).*

data: *69:17 This earth is full of misery because of its physical distance from God, since it is in the seventh universe (7:143). In the Hereafter, an eighth universe will be created that will be even farther than our seventh universe; it will be called “Hell” (89:23).

verses.18: On  that  day,  you  will  be  exposed, nothing of you can be hidden.

verses.20: “I  did  believe  that  I  was  going  to  be held accountable.”
verses.21: He has deserved a happy life.
verses.22: In an exalted Paradise.
verses.23: Its fruits are within reach.
verses.24: Eat  and  drink  happily  in  return  for your works in days past.
verses.25: As for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, “Oh, I wish I never received my record.
verses.26: “I wish I never knew my account.
verses.27: “I wish my death was eternal.
verses.28: “My money cannot help me.
verses.29: “All my power is gone.”
verses.30: Take him and shackle him.
verses.31: Burn him in Hell.

verses.33: For he did not believe in GOD, Most Great.
verses.34: Nor  did  he  advocate  the  feeding  of the poor.
verses.35: Consequently,  he  has  no  friend here.
verses.36: Nor  any  food,  except  the  bitter variety.
verses.37: Food for the sinners.

verses.39: And what you do not see.

verses.41: Not  the  utterance  of  a  poet; rarely do you believe.
verses.42: Nor  the  utterance  of  a  soothsayer; rarely do you take heed.
verses.43: A  revelation  from  the  Lord  of the  universe.
verses.44: Had  he  uttered  any  other  teachings.

verses.48: This  is  a  reminder  for  the  righteous.

verses.50: It  is  but  sorrow  for  the  disbelievers.

verses.17: It calls on those who turned away.
verses.18: Those who hoarded and counted.
verses.19: Indeed, the human being is anxious.
verses.20: If  touched  by  adversity,  despondent.
verses.21: If blessed by wealth, stingy.
verses.22: Except for the worshipers.
verses.23: Who  always  observe  their  contact prayers (Salat).
verses.24: Part of their money is set aside.
verses.25: For the poor and the needy.
verses.26: They  believe  in  the  Day  of  Judgment.
verses.27: They  reverence  their  Lord’s  requital.
verses.28: Their  Lord’s  requital  is  not  taken for granted.
verses.29: They keep their chastity.
verses.30: (They  have  relations)  only  with  their spouses, or what is legally theirs—
verses.31: anyone  who  transgresses  these  limits is a sinner.
verses.32: And  the  believers  keep  their  word; they are trustworthy.
verses.33: Their testimony is truthful.
verses.34: They  consistently  observe  their  contact prayers (Salat) on time.
verses.35: They  have  deserved  a  position  of honor in Paradise.
verses.36: What  is  keeping  those  who  disbelieved from joining you?
verses.37: To  the  right,  and  to  the  left,  they flee.
verses.38: How  can  any  of  them  expect  to  enter the blissful Paradise?
verses.39: Never;  we  created  them,  and  they know from what.
verses.40: I  solemnly  swear  by  the  Lord  of  the easts and the wests; we are able—
verses.41: to  substitute  better  people  in  your place; we can never be defeated.
verses.42: Therefore,  let  them  blunder  and play,  until  they  meet  the  day  that  is awaiting them.
verses.43: That  is  the  day  they  come  out  of  the graves  in  a  hurry,  as  if  herded  to  the (sacrificial) altars.
verses.44: With  their  eyes  subdued,  shame  will cover  them.  That  is  the  day  that  is awaiting them.

verses.1: We sent Noah to his people: “You shall warn your people before a painful retribution afflicts them.”
verses.2: He  said,  “O  my  people,  I  am  a manifest warner to you.
verses.3: “To alert you that you shall worship GOD, reverence Him, and obey me.
verses.4: “He will then forgive you your sins and respite you for a predetermined period. Most assuredly, GOD’s appointment  can  never  be  delayed, once it is due, if you only knew.”
verses.5: He said, “My Lord, I have invited my people night and day.
verses.6: “But my invitation only increased their aversion.
verses.7: “Whenever I invited them to be forgiven  by  You, they  placed  their fingers in their ears, covered themselves  with  their  clothes,  insisted, and turned arrogant.
verses.8: “Then I invited them publicly.
verses.9: “Then I proclaimed to them loudly, and I spoke to them privately.
verses.10: “I said, ‘Implore your Lord for forgiveness; He is Forgiving.
verses.11: “ ‘He will then shower you generously with rain.
verses.12: “ ‘And provide you with money and children, and orchards, and streams.’ ”
verses.13: Why should you not strive to reverence GOD?
verses.14: He is the One who created you in stages.
verses.15: Do you not realize that GOD created seven universes in layers?
verses.16: He designed the moon therein to be a light, and placed the sun to be a lamp.
verses.17: And GOD germinated you from the earth like plants.
verses.18: Then He returns you into it, and He will surely bring you out.
verses.19: GOD made the earth habitable for you.
verses.20: That you may build roads therein.
verses.21: Noah  said,  “My  Lord,  they  disobeyed me, and followed those who were  even  more  corrupted  when blessed with money and children.
verses.22: “They schemed terrible schemes.
verses.23: “They said, ‘Do not abandon your gods. Do not abandon Wadd, Suwaa‘, Yaghouth, Ya‘ooq, and Nasr.
verses.24: “They misled many. Therefore, let the wicked plunge deeper into loss.”
verses.25: Because  of  their  sins  they  were drowned and assigned to the hellfire. They found no helpers to protect them from GOD.
verses.26: Noah also said, “My Lord, do not leave a single disbeliever on earth.
verses.27: “For if you let them, they will only mislead your servants and give birth to nothing but wicked disbelievers.
verses.28: “My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and anyone who enters my home  as  a  believer,  and  all  the believing men and women. But do not give the disbelievers anything but annihilation.”

encrypted.27: انك ان تذرهم يضلوا عبادك ولا يلدوا الا فاجرا كفارا
encrypted.28: رب اغفر لي ولوالدي ولمن دخل بيتي مؤمنا وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات ولا تزد الظالمين الا تبارا

verses.1: Say, “I was inspired that a group of jinns listened, then said, ‘We have heard a wonderful Quran.*
verses.2: “ ‘It guides to righteousness, and we have believed in it; we will never set up any idols beside our Lord.
verses.3: “ ‘The Most High is our only Lord He never had a mate, nor a son.
verses.4: “ ‘It is the foolish among us who used to utter such nonsense about GOD.
verses.5: “  ‘We  thought  that  neither  the humans, nor the jinns, could possibly utter lies about GOD.
verses.6: “ ‘Human beings used to seek power through jinn beings, but they only afflicted them with a lot of adversity.
verses.7: “  ‘They  thought,  just  like  you thought, that GOD would not send another (messenger).
verses.8: “ ‘We touched the heaven and found it filled with formidable guards and projectiles.
verses.9: “ ‘We used to sit there in order to spy. Anyone who listens is pursued by a powerful projectile.
verses.10: “ ‘We have no idea if something bad is  intended  for  the  inhabitants  of Earth,  or  if  their  Lord  wills  to redeem them.
verses.11: “ ‘Some of us are righteous, and some are less than righteous; we follow various paths.
verses.12: “ ‘We knew full well that we can never run away from GOD on Earth; we can never run away and escape.
verses.13: “ ‘When we heard the guidance, we believed therein. Anyone who believes in his Lord will never fear any injustice, nor any affliction.
verses.14: “ ‘Among us are the submitters, and among us are the compromisers.’ ” As for those who submitted, they are on the right path.
verses.15: As for the compromisers, they will be fuel for Gehenna.
verses.16: If they remain on the right path, we will bless them with abundant water.
verses.17: We will surely test them all. As for him who disregards the message of his Lord, He will direct him to ever increasing retribution.
verses.18: The  places  of  worship  belong  to GOD; do not call on anyone else beside GOD.
verses.19: When GOD’s servant* advocated Him  alone,  almost  all  of  them banded together to oppose him.
verses.20: Say, “I worship only my Lord; I never set up any idols beside Him.”
verses.21: Say, “I possess no power to harm you, nor to guide you.”

data: *72:1-28  The  messenger  here  is  named,  mathematically,  as  “Rashad  Khalifa,”  to  whom God  revealed  the  end  of  the  world  (Appendix  25).  The  number  of  verses  from  1:1  to 72:27, where the messenger is mentioned, is 5472, 19x72x4. The word “Rashada” occurs 4 times in Sura 72. The value of “Rashada” is 504, and 504 + 28 (verses of Sura 72) is 532, 19x28. The value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230) + 72 + 28 = 1330 = 19x70. The digits of Sura 72 and its number of verses (28) add up to 7 + 2 + 2 + 8 = 19. Also, the crucial expression, “only to a messenger that He chooses” has a value of 1919, 19x101.

verses.22: Say,  “No  one  can  protect  me  from GOD,  nor  can  I  find  any  other refuge beside Him.
verses.23: “I  deliver  GOD’s  proclamations  and messages.”  Those  who  disobey GOD  and  His  messenger  incur  the fire  of  Hell,  wherein  they  abide forever.
verses.24: Once  they  see  what  is  awaiting them, they will find out who is really weaker  in  power,  and  fewer  in  number.
verses.25: Say,  “I  do  not  know  if  what  is promised  to  you  will  happen  soon, or  if  my  Lord  will  delay  it  for awhile.”
verses.26: He  is  the  Knower  of  the  future;  He does  not  reveal  the  future  to  anyone.
verses.27: Only  to  a  messenger  that  He  chooses,*  does  He  reveal  from  the  past and the future, specific news.*
verses.28: This  is  to  ascertain  that  they  have delivered  their  Lord’s  messages.  He is  fully  aware  of  what  they  have.  He has  counted  the  numbers  of  all things.

verses.1: O you cloaked one
verses.2: Meditate  during  the  night,  except rarely.
verses.3: Half of it, or a little less.
verses.4: Or  a  little  more.  And  read  the Quran from cover to cover.
verses.5: We will give you a heavy message.
verses.6: The  meditation  at  night  is  more  effective, and more righteous.
verses.7: You have a lot of time during the day for other matters.
verses.8: You  shall  commemorate  the  name of  your  Lord,  to  come  ever  closer and closer to Him.
verses.9: Lord  of  the  east  and  the  west;  there is  no  other  god  besides  Him.  You should  choose  Him  as  your  advocate.
verses.10: And  remain  steadfast  in  the  face of  their  utterances,  and  disregard them in a nice manner.
verses.11: And  let  Me  deal  with  the  rejectors, who  have  been  generously  blessed; just give them a little time.
verses.12: We  have  severe  punishments,  and Hell.
verses.13: Food  that  can  hardly  be  swallowed, and painful retribution.
verses.14: The  day  will  come  when  the  earth and  the  mountains  will  quake, and  the  mountains  will  turn  into  a weightless pile.
verses.15: We  have  sent  to  you  a  messenger, just  as  we  sent  to  Pharaoh  a  messenger.
verses.16: Pharaoh  disobeyed  the  messenger and,  consequently,  we  punished  him severely.
verses.17: If you disbelieve, how can you evade a  day  so  terrible  that  it  makes  the infants gray-haired?
verses.18: The  heaven  will  shatter  therefrom His promise is true.

data: *72:27 See footnote for 72:1-28.

verses.19: This is a reminder; whoever wills, let him choose the path to his Lord.
verses.20: Your  Lord  knows  that  you  meditate during  two-thirds  of  the  night,  or half of it, or one-third of it, and so do some of those who believed with you.  GOD  has  designed  the  night and the day, and He knows that you cannot  always  do  this.  He  has  pardoned  you.  Instead,  you  shall  read what  you  can  of  the  Quran.  He knows that some of you may be ill, others  may  be  traveling  in  pursuit  of GOD’s  provisions,  and  others  may be striving in the cause of GOD. You shall  read  what  you  can  of  it,  and observe  the  contact  prayers  (Salat), give  the  obligatory  charity  (Zakat), and lend GOD a loan of righteousness.  Whatever  good  you  send ahead  on  behalf  of  your  souls,  you will  find  it  at  GOD  far  better  and generously  rewarded.  And  implore GOD for forgiveness. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

data: *74:1 God’s infinite wisdom willed to reveal the Quran through Muhammad, while the Quran’s awesome 19-based mathematical miracle was revealed through God’s Messenger of the Covenant 1406 lunar years after revelation of the Quran (1406 = 19x74 & 1974 AD was the Solar Year of discovery). In retrospect, we realize that the whole sura refers to the Quran’s 19-based miracle (Appendices 1 & 2).
*74:4 Quran is the garment containing the secret code. This refers to removing 9:128-129.

verses.30: Over it is nineteen.*
verses.31: We appointed angels to be guardians of Hell, and we assigned their number (19) (1) to disturb the disbelievers, (2)  to  convince the  Christians and Jews (that this is a divine scripture), (3) to  strengthen  the  faith  of  the faithful, (4) to  remove  all  traces  of  doubt from the hearts of Christians, Jews, as well as the believers, and (5)  to  expose  those  who  harbor doubt in their hearts, and the disbelievers; they will say, “What did GOD mean by this allegory?” GOD thus  sends  astray  whomever  He wills,  and  guides  whomever  He wills. None knows the soldiers of your Lord except He. This is a reminder for the people.

verses.2: We created the human from a liquid mixture,  from  two  parents,  in  order to  test  him.  Thus,  we  made  him  a hearer and a seer.
verses.3: We  showed  him  the  two  paths,  then, he  is  either  appreciative,  or  unappreciative.
verses.4: We  prepared  for  the  disbelievers chains, shackles, and a blazing Hell.
verses.5: As  for  the  virtuous,  they  will  drink from cups spiced with nectar.
verses.6: A  spring  that  is  reserved  for  GOD’s servants; it will gush out as they will.
verses.7: They  fulfill  their  pledges,  and  reverence  a  day  that  is  extremely  difficult.
verses.8: They  donate  their  favorite  food  to the  poor,  the  orphan,  and  the  captive.
verses.9: “We  feed  you  for  the  sake  of  GOD; we  expect  no  reward  from  you,  nor thanks.
verses.10: “We  fear  from  our  Lord  a  day  that is full of misery and trouble.”
verses.11: Consequently,  GOD  protects  them from  the  evils  of  that  day,  and rewards  them  with  joy  and  contentment.
verses.12: He  rewards  them  for  their  steadfastness with Paradise, and silk.
verses.13: They  relax  therein  on  luxurious  furnishings.  They  suffer  neither  the heat of the sun, nor any cold.
verses.14: The  shade  covers  them  therein,  and the fruits are brought within reach.
verses.15: They  are  served  drinks  in  silver  containers  and  cups  that  are  translucent.
verses.16: Translucent  cups,  though  made  of silver; they rightly deserved all this.
verses.17: They  enjoy  drinks  of  delicious  flavors.
verses.18: From  a  spring  therein  known  as “Salsabeel.”
verses.19: Serving  them  will  be  immortal  servants.  When  you  see  them,  they  will look like scattered pearls.
verses.20: Wherever  you  look,  you  will  see bliss, and a wonderful dominion.
verses.21: On  them  will  be  clothes  of  green velvet,  satin,  and  silver  ornaments. Their  Lord  will  provide  them  with pure drinks.
verses.22: This  is  the  reward  that  awaits  you, for  your  efforts  have  been  appreciated.
verses.23: We  have  revealed  to  you  this  Quran; a special revelation from us.
verses.24: You  shall  steadfastly  carry  out  your Lord’s  commandments,  and  do  not obey  any  sinful  disbeliever  among them.
verses.25: And  commemorate  the  name  of your Lord day and night.
verses.26: During  the  night,  fall  prostrate before  Him,  and  glorify  Him  many a long night.
verses.27: These  people  are  preoccupied  with this  fleeting  life,  while  disregarding—just  ahead  of  them—a  heavy day.
verses.28: We  created  them,  and  established them,  and,  whenever  we  will,  we  can substitute others in their place.
verses.29: This  is  a  reminder:  whoever  wills shall choose the path to his Lord.

verses.1: What are they questioning?
verses.2: The great event
verses.3: That is disputed by them
verses.4: Indeed, they will find out.
verses.5: Most assuredly, they will find out.
verses.6: Did we not make the earth habitable?
verses.7: And the mountains stabilizers?
verses.8: We created you as mates (for one another).
verses.9: We  created  sleeping  so  you  can rest.
verses.10: We made the night a cover
verses.11: And the day to seek provisions
verses.12: We  built  above  you  seven  universes.
verses.13: We created a bright lamp
verses.14: We  send  down  from  the  clouds pouring water.
verses.15: To  produce  with  it  grains  and plants.
verses.16: And various orchards
verses.17: The Day of Decision is appointed
verses.18: The  day  the  horn  is  blown,  and  you come in throngs.
verses.19: The  heaven  will  be  opened  like gates.
verses.20: The  mountains  will  be  removed,  as if they were a mirage.
verses.21: Gehenna is inevitable
verses.22: For  the  transgressors;  it  will  be  their abode.
verses.23: They stay in it for ages
verses.24: They  never  taste  in  it  coolness,  nor a drink.
verses.25: Only an inferno, and bitter food.
verses.26: A just requital
verses.27: They  never  expected  to  be  held  accountable.
verses.28: And utterly rejected our signs
verses.29: We    counted  everything  in    a  record.
verses.30: Suffer  the  consequences;  we  will only increase your retribution.
verses.31: The  righteous  have  deserved  a reward.

verses.1: The (angels who) snatch (the souls of the disbelievers) forcibly.

verses.9: Their eyes will be subdued
verses.10: They will say, “We have been recreated from the grave!

verses.12: They had said, “This is an impossible recurrence.”
verses.13: All it takes is one nudge
verses.14: Whereupon they get up
verses.15: Have you known about the history of Moses?
verses.16: His Lord called him at the holy valley of Tuwaa.
verses.17: “Go to Pharaoh; he has transgressed.”
verses.18: Tell him, “Would you not reform?
verses.19: “Let me guide you to your Lord, that you may turn reverent.”
verses.20: He  then  showed  him  the  great miracle.
verses.21: But he disbelieved and rebelled
verses.22: Then he turned away in a hurry
verses.23: He summoned and proclaimed
verses.24: He  said,  “I  am  your Lord;  most high.”
verses.25: Consequently,  GOD  committed him to the retribution in the Hereafter, as well as in the first life.
verses.26: This is a lesson for the reverent
verses.27: Are  you  more  difficult  to  create than the  heaven? He constructed it.
verses.28: He raised its masses, and perfected it.

data: *81:19 By adding the sura number, plus the verse number, plus the gematrical value of the name “Rashad” (505), plus the value of “Khalifa” (725), we get 1330, 19x70. This provides Quranic mathematical proof that this messenger is Rashad Khalifa.
*81:23 Rashad Khalifa was summoned to the high horizon as detailed in Appendix 2.

verses.1: The time will come when the sky is ruptured.

data: *95:1-3 The fig,  olive, Sinai, and Mecca possibly  symbolize Adam, Jesus,  Moses, Abraham and Muhammad, respectively. Thus, all major religions are represented.
*96:1-19 From 96 to 114 is 19 suras. The first revelation (96:1-5) is 19 Arabic words, 76 letters (19x4). The sura consists of 19 verses and 304 Arabic letters (Appendices 1 & 23).

verses.1: Those  who  disbelieved  among  the people  of  the  scripture,  as  well  as the  idol  worshipers,  insist  on  their ways,  despite  the  proof  given  to them.*
verses.2: A messenger from GOD is reciting to them sacred instructions.*
verses.3: In  them  there  are  valuable  teachings.
verses.4: In  fact,  those  who  received  the scripture  did  not  dispute  until  the proof was given to them.
verses.5: All that was asked of them was to worship  GOD,  devoting  the  religion absolutely  to  Him  alone,  observe the  contact  prayers  (Salat),  and  give the  obligatory  charity  (Zakat).  Such is the perfect religion.
verses.6: Those  who  disbelieved  among  the people  of  the  scripture,  and  the  idol worshipers,  have  incurred  the  fire of  Gehenna  forever.  They  are  the worst creatures.
verses.7: Those who believed and led a righteous life are the best creatures.
verses.8: Their  reward  at  their  Lord  is  the gardens  of  Eden  with  flowing streams,  wherein  they  abide  forever. GOD is pleased with them, and they are  pleased  with  Him.  Such  is  the reward  for  those  who  reverence their Lord.

data: *97:1 The Quran was placed into Muhammad’s soul on the 27th night of Ramadan, 13 B.H. (Before Hijrah). See also 17:1, 44:3, 53:1-18, and Appendix 28.

*98:1-2 The proof is the Quran’s mathematical code (Appendix 1) and the messenger is  Rashad  Khalifa.  The  number  of  the  sura  (98),  plus  the  verse  number  (2),  plus  the numerical value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230) add up to 1330 (19x70), the same total as in 81:19 (Appendix 2).

data: *110:1-3 This last sura, chronologically, consists of 19 Arabic words (see 96:1), and the first verse consists of 19 letters. This indicates that this generation of believers shall attain the promised victory. Submission (true Islam) will prevail throughout the world (48:28).

*111:1 Abee Lahab was Muhammad’s uncle and the leader of the opposition. His wife carried out a campaign of persecution against Muhammad and the believers. Like all descriptions of Heaven and Hell, the rope of thorns is an allegory.

data: *Thus, the total occurrence of the crucial word “God” (Allah) throughout the Quran is 2698,19x142. The reader can ascertain the accuracy of this total by randomly checking the numbers of the word “God” at the bottom of any page in this book. Additionally, if one adds the verse numbers wherever the word “God” occurs, the total comes to 118123, also a multiple of 19 (118123 = 19x6217). Details of  the Quran’s unique mathematical composition are given in Appendices 1, 2, 24, 25, 26, and 29.
